functions.name: create
functions.description:
Creates an alarm. Near the time(s) specified by alarmInfo, the onAlarm event is fired. If there is another alarm with the same name (or no name if none is specified), it will be cancelled and replaced by this alarm.

In order to reduce the load on the user's machine, Chrome limits alarms to at most once every 30 seconds but may delay them an arbitrary amount more. That is, setting delayInMinutes or periodInMinutes to less than 0.5 will not be honored and will cause a warning. when can be set to less than 30 seconds after "now" without warning but won't actually cause the alarm to fire for at least 30 seconds.

To help you debug your app or extension, when you've loaded it unpacked, there's no limit to how often the alarm can fire.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Optional name to identify this alarm. Defaults to the empty string.

parameters.name: alarmInfo
parameters.description: Describes when the alarm should fire.  The initial time must be specified by either <var>when</var> or <var>delayInMinutes</var> (but not both).  If <var>periodInMinutes</var> is set, the alarm will repeat every <var>periodInMinutes</var> minutes after the initial event.  If neither <var>when</var> or <var>delayInMinutes</var> is set for a repeating alarm, <var>periodInMinutes</var> is used as the default for <var>delayInMinutes</var>.

returns_async.description: Invoked when the alarm has been created.
returns_async.name: callback

functions.name: get
functions.description: Retrieves details about the specified alarm.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the alarm to get. Defaults to the empty string.

functions.name: getAll
functions.description: Gets an array of all the alarms.

functions.name: clear
functions.description: Clears the alarm with the given name.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the alarm to clear. Defaults to the empty string.

functions.name: clearAll
functions.description: Clears all alarms.

name.name: name
name.description: Name of this alarm.

scheduledTime.name: scheduledTime
scheduledTime.description: Time at which this alarm was scheduled to fire, in milliseconds past the epoch (e.g. Date.now() + n). For performance reasons, the alarm may have been delayed an arbitrary amount beyond this.

periodInMinutes.name: periodInMinutes
periodInMinutes.description: If not null, the alarm is a repeating alarm and will fire again in <var>periodInMinutes</var> minutes.

when.name: when
when.description: Time at which the alarm should fire, in milliseconds past the epoch (e.g. Date.now() + n).

delayInMinutes.name: delayInMinutes
delayInMinutes.description: Length of time in minutes after which the onAlarm event should fire.

periodInMinutes.name: periodInMinutes
periodInMinutes.description: If set, the onAlarm event should fire every periodInMinutes minutes after the initial event specified by when or delayInMinutes. If not set, the alarm will only fire once.

type.description:
Frame type: none or chrome (defaults to chrome).

For none, the -webkit-app-region CSS property can be used to apply draggability to the app's window.

-webkit-app-region: drag can be used to mark regions draggable. no-drag can be used to disable this style on nested elements.
type.name: type

color.description:
Allows the frame color to be set. Frame coloring is only available if the frame type is chrome.

Frame coloring is new in Chrome 36.
color.name: color

activeColor.description:
Allows the frame color of the window when active to be set. Frame coloring is only available if the frame type is chrome.

Frame coloring is only available if the frame type is chrome.

Frame coloring is new in Chrome 36.
activeColor.name: activeColor

inactiveColor.description:
Allows the frame color of the window when inactive to be set differently to the active color. Frame coloring is only available if the frame type is chrome.

inactiveColor must be used in conjunction with color.

Frame coloring is new in Chrome 36.
inactiveColor.name: inactiveColor

types.description: State of a window: normal, fullscreen, maximized, minimized.
Specifies the type of window to create.

enum.name: shell
enum.description: Default window type.

enum.name: panel
enum.description: OS managed window (Deprecated).

id.description: Id to identify the window. This will be used to remember the size and position of the window and restore that geometry when a window with the same id is later opened. If a window with a given id is created while another window with the same id already exists, the currently opened window will be focused instead of creating a new window.
id.name: id

innerBounds.description:
Used to specify the initial position, initial size and constraints of the window's content (excluding window decorations). If an id is also specified and a window with a matching id has been shown before, the remembered bounds will be used instead.

Note that the padding between the inner and outer bounds is determined by the OS. Therefore setting the same bounds property for both the innerBounds and outerBounds will result in an error.

This property is new in Chrome 36.
innerBounds.name: innerBounds

outerBounds.description:
Used to specify the initial position, initial size and constraints of the window (including window decorations such as the title bar and frame). If an id is also specified and a window with a matching id has been shown before, the remembered bounds will be used instead.

Note that the padding between the inner and outer bounds is determined by the OS. Therefore setting the same bounds property for both the innerBounds and outerBounds will result in an error.

This property is new in Chrome 36.
outerBounds.name: outerBounds

Use of FrameOptions is new in M36.

hidden.description: If true, the window will be created in a hidden state. Call show() on the window to show it once it has been created. Defaults to false.

resizable.description: If true, the window will be resizable by the user. Defaults to true.

singleton.deprecated: Multiple windows with the same id is no longer supported.
singleton.description: By default if you specify an id for the window, the window will only be created if another window with the same id doesn't already exist. If a window with the same id already exists that window is activated instead. If you do want to create multiple windows with the same id, you can set this property to false.
singleton.name: singleton

alwaysOnTop.description:
If true, the window will stay above most other windows. If there are multiple windows of this kind, the currently focused window will be in the foreground. Requires the alwaysOnTopWindows permission. Defaults to false.

Call setAlwaysOnTop() on the window to change this property after creation.
alwaysOnTop.name: alwaysOnTop

focused.description: If true, the window will be focused when created. Defaults to true.
focused.name: focused

visibleOnAllWorkspaces.description: If true, and supported by the platform, the window will be visible on all workspaces.
visibleOnAllWorkspaces.name: visibleOnAllWorkspaces

fullscreen.description:
Fullscreens the window.

The user will be able to restore the window by pressing ESC. An application can prevent the fullscreen state to be left when ESC is pressed by requesting the app.window.fullscreen.overrideEsc permission and canceling the event by calling .preventDefault(), in the keydown and keyup handlers, like this:

window.onkeydown = window.onkeyup = function(e) { if (e.keyCode == 27 /* ESC */) { e.preventDefault(); } };

Note window.fullscreen() will cause the entire window to become fullscreen and does not require a user gesture. The HTML5 fullscreen API can also be used to enter fullscreen mode (see Web APIs for more details).
fullscreen.name: fullscreen

isFullscreen.description: Is the window fullscreen? This will be true if the window has been created fullscreen or was made fullscreen via the AppWindow or HTML5 fullscreen APIs.
isFullscreen.name: isFullscreen

restore.description: Restore the window, exiting a maximized, minimized, or fullscreen state.
restore.name: restore

moveTo.name: moveTo

resizeTo.description: Resize the window to |width|x|height| pixels in size.
resizeTo.name: resizeTo

show.description: Show the window. Does nothing if the window is already visible. Focus the window if |focused| is set to true or omitted.
show.name: show

hide.description: Hide the window. Does nothing if the window is already hidden.
hide.name: hide

setIcon.name: setIcon

innerBounds.description: The position, size and constraints of the window's content, which does not include window decorations. This property is new in Chrome 36.
innerBounds.name: innerBounds

outerBounds.description: The position, size and constraints of the window, which includes window decorations, such as the title bar and frame. This property is new in Chrome 36.
outerBounds.name: outerBounds

functions.description:
The size and position of a window can be specified in a number of different ways. The most simple option is not specifying anything at all, in which case a default size and platform dependent position will be used.

To set the position, size and constraints of the window, use the innerBounds or outerBounds properties. Inner bounds do not include window decorations. Outer bounds include the window's title bar and frame. Note that the padding between the inner and outer bounds is determined by the OS. Therefore setting the same property for both inner and outer bounds is considered an error (for example, setting both innerBounds.left and outerBounds.left).

To automatically remember the positions of windows you can give them ids. If a window has an id, This id is used to remember the size and position of the window whenever it is moved or resized. This size and position is then used instead of the specified bounds on subsequent opening of a window with the same id. If you need to open a window with an id at a location other than the remembered default, you can create it hidden, move it to the desired location, then show it.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description:
Called in the creating window (parent) before the load event is called in the created window (child). The parent can set fields or functions on the child usable from onload. E.g. background.js:

function(createdWindow) { createdWindow.contentWindow.foo = function () { }; };

window.js:

window.onload = function () { foo(); }

Specifies IDs of devices that should be active. If either the input or output list is not set, devices in that category are unaffected.

It is an error to pass in a non-existent device ID.

If used with audio input device, represents audio device gain.

automation.description: The chrome.automation API allows developers to access the automation (accessibility) tree for the browser. The tree resembles the DOM tree, but only exposes the semantic structure of a page. It can be used to programmatically interact with a page by examining names, roles, and states, listening for events, and performing actions on nodes.

types.description: Describes characteristics of an $(ref:automation.AutomationNode).
All possible actions that can be performed on automation nodes.

Possible changes to the automation tree. For any given atomic change to the tree, each node that's added, removed, or changed, will appear in exactly one TreeChange, with one of these types.

nodeCreated means that this node was added to the tree and its parent is new as well, so it's just one node in a new subtree that was added.

enum.name: nodeCreated
enum.description: * This node was added to the tree and its parent is new as well, so it's just one node in a new subtree that was added.

enum.name: subtreeCreated
enum.description: * This node was added to the tree but its parent was already in the tree, so it's possibly the root of a new subtree - it does not mean that it necessarily has children.

enum.name: nodeChanged
enum.description: * This node changed.

enum.name: textChanged
enum.description: * This node's text (name) changed.

enum.name: nodeRemoved
enum.description: * This node was removed.

enum.name: subtreeUpdateEnd
enum.description: * This subtree has finished an update.

A map of attribute name to expected value, for example { name: 'Root directory', checkbox_mixed: true }. String attribute values may be specified as a regex, for example { name: /stralia$/ }. Unless specifying a regex, the expected value must be an exact match in type and value for the actual value. Thus, the type of expected value must be one of:

  • integer

sentenceEnds.description:
The end indexes of each sentence within the node's name. For most nodes, the size of sentenceStarts array should be equal to the size of sentenceEnds array. Two exceptions are (1) node at the begining of a paragraph but the end of the node's sentences is in its following node. Such a node has one more start index. (2) Node at the end of a paragraph but the start of the node's sentences is in its previous node. Such a node has one more end index. For example,

Hello world.

has two nodes. The first one has one start index (i.e., 0) but no end index. The second node has one end index (i.e., 7) but no start index.
sentenceEnds.name: sentenceEnds

nonInlineTextWordStarts.description: The start index of each word within the node's name. This is different from wordStarts because it is not restricted to inline text boxes and can be used for any type of element.

nonInlineTextWordEnds.description: The end index of each word within the node's name. This is different from wordEnds because it is not restricted to inline text boxes and can be used for any type of element.
nonInlineTextWordEnds.name: nonInlineTextWordEnds

functions.description: Add a tree change observer. Tree change observers are static/global, they listen to changes across all trees. Pass a filter to determine what specific tree changes to listen to, and note that listnening to all tree changes can be expensive.

parameters.name: observer
parameters.description: A listener for changes on the AutomationNode tree.

functions.description: Remove a tree change observer.

parameters.name: observer
parameters.description: A listener for changes on the AutomationNode tree.

functions.name: removeTreeChangeObserver

functions.description: Sets the selection in a tree. This creates a selection in a single tree (anchorObject and focusObject must have the same root). Everything in the tree between the two node/offset pairs gets included in the selection. The anchor is where the user started the selection, while the focus is the point at which the selection gets extended e.g. when dragging with a mouse or using the keyboard. For nodes with the role staticText, the offset gives the character offset within the value where the selection starts or ends, respectively.
functions.name: setDocumentSelection

automationInternal.description: This is the implementation layer of the chrome.automation API, and is essentially a translation of the internal accessibility tree update system into an extension API.

functions.name: getAdapterState
functions.description: Get information about the Bluetooth adapter.

parameters.name: adapterInfo
parameters.description: Object containing the adapter information.

returns_async.description: Called with an AdapterState object describing the adapter state.
returns_async.name: callback

functions.name: getDevice
functions.description: Get information about a Bluetooth device known to the system.

parameters.name: deviceAddress
parameters.description: Address of device to get.

parameters.name: deviceInfo
parameters.description: Object containing the device information.

returns_async.description: Called with the Device object describing the device.
returns_async.name: callback

functions.name: getDevices
functions.description: Get a list of Bluetooth devices known to the system, including paired and recently discovered devices.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Some criteria to filter the list of returned bluetooth devices. If the filter is not set or set to {}, returned device list will contain all bluetooth devices. Right now this is only supported in ChromeOS, for other platforms, a full list is returned.

parameters.name: deviceInfos
parameters.description: Array of object containing device information.

returns_async.description: Called when the search is completed.
returns_async.name: callback

functions.name: startDiscovery
functions.description:
Start discovery. Newly discovered devices will be returned via the onDeviceAdded event. Previously discovered devices already known to the adapter must be obtained using getDevices and will only be updated using the |onDeviceChanged| event if information about them changes.

Discovery will fail to start if this application has already called startDiscovery. Discovery can be resource intensive: stopDiscovery should be called as soon as possible.

returns_async.description: Called to indicate success or failure.
returns_async.name: callback

functions.name: stopDiscovery
functions.description: Stop discovery.

returns_async.description: Called to indicate success or failure.
returns_async.name: callback

Common device types recognized by Chrome.
Types for filtering bluetooth devices.
Transport type of the bluetooth device.

address.name: address
address.description: The address of the adapter, in the format 'XX:XX:XX:XX:XX:XX'.

name.name: name
name.description: The human-readable name of the adapter.

powered.name: powered
powered.description: Indicates whether or not the adapter has power.

available.name: available
available.description: Indicates whether or not the adapter is available (i.e. enabled).

discovering.name: discovering
discovering.description: Indicates whether or not the adapter is currently discovering.

address.name: address
address.description: The address of the device, in the format 'XX:XX:XX:XX:XX:XX'.

name.name: name
name.description: The human-readable name of the device.

deviceClass.name: deviceClass
deviceClass.description: The class of the device, a bit-field defined by http://www.bluetooth.org/en-us/specification/assigned-numbers/baseband.

vendorIdSource.name: vendorIdSource
vendorIdSource.description: The Device ID record of the device, where available.

type.name: type
type.description: The type of the device, if recognized by Chrome. This is obtained from the |deviceClass| field and only represents a small fraction of the possible device types. When in doubt you should use the |deviceClass| field directly.

paired.name: paired
paired.description: Indicates whether or not the device is paired with the system.

connected.name: connected
connected.description: Indicates whether the device is currently connected to the system.

connecting.name: connecting
connecting.description: Indicates whether the device is currently connecting to the system.

connectable.name: connectable
connectable.description: Indicates whether the device is connectable.

uuids.name: uuids
uuids.description: UUIDs of protocols, profiles and services advertised by the device. For classic Bluetooth devices, this list is obtained from EIR data and SDP tables. For Low Energy devices, this list is obtained from AD and GATT primary services. For dual mode devices this may be obtained from both.

inquiryRssi.name: inquiryRssi
inquiryRssi.description: The received signal strength, in dBm. This field is avaliable and valid only during discovery. Outside of discovery it's value is not specified.

inquiryTxPower.name: inquiryTxPower
inquiryTxPower.description: The transmitted power level. This field is avaliable only for LE devices that include this field in AD. It is avaliable and valid only during discovery.

transport.name: transport
transport.description: The transport type of the bluetooth device.

batteryPercentage.name: batteryPercentage
batteryPercentage.description: The remaining battery of the device.

filterType.name: filterType
filterType.description: Type of filter to apply to the device list. Default is all.

limit.name: limit
limit.description: Maximum number of bluetooth devices to return. Default is 0 (no limit) if unspecified.

events.name: onAdapterStateChanged
events.description: Fired when the state of the Bluetooth adapter changes.

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: The new state of the adapter.

events.name: onDeviceAdded
events.description: Fired when information about a new Bluetooth device is available.

events.name: onDeviceChanged
events.description: Fired when information about a known Bluetooth device has changed.

events.name: onDeviceRemoved
events.description: Fired when a Bluetooth device that was previously discovered has been out of range for long enough to be considered unavailable again, and when a paired device is removed.

bluetooth.description: Use the chrome.bluetooth API to connect to a Bluetooth device. All functions report failures via chrome.runtime.lastError.

functions.name: connect
functions.description: Establishes a connection between the application and the device with the given address. A device may be already connected and its GATT services available without calling connect, however, an app that wants to access GATT services of a device should call this function to make sure that a connection to the device is maintained. If the device is not connected, all GATT services of the device will be discovered after a successful call to connect.

parameters.name: deviceAddress
parameters.description: The Bluetooth address of the remote device to which a GATT connection should be opened.

parameters.name: properties
parameters.description: Connection properties (optional).

returns_async.description: Called when the connect request has completed.
returns_async.name: callback

functions.name: disconnect
functions.description: Closes the app's connection to the device with the given address. Note that this will not always destroy the physical link itself, since there may be other apps with open connections.

parameters.name: deviceAddress
parameters.description: The Bluetooth address of the remote device.

returns_async.description: Called when the disconnect request has completed.
returns_async.name: callback

functions.name: getService
functions.description: Get the GATT service with the given instance ID.

parameters.name: serviceId
parameters.description: The instance ID of the requested GATT service.

returns_async.description: Called with the requested Service object.
returns_async.name: callback

functions.name: createService
functions.description: Create a locally hosted GATT service. This service can be registered to be available on a local GATT server. This function is only available if the app has both the bluetooth:low_energy and the bluetooth:peripheral permissions set to true. The peripheral permission may not be available to all apps.

parameters.name: service
parameters.description: The service to create.

returns_async.description: Called with the created services's unique ID.
returns_async.name: callback

functions.name: getServices
functions.description:
Get all the GATT services that were discovered on the remote device with the given device address.

Note: If service discovery is not yet complete on the device, this API will return a subset (possibly empty) of services. A work around is to add a time based delay and/or call repeatedly until the expected number of services is returned.

parameters.name: deviceAddress
parameters.description: The Bluetooth address of the remote device whose GATT services should be returned.

returns_async.description: Called with the list of requested Service objects.
returns_async.name: callback

functions.name: getCharacteristic
functions.description: Get the GATT characteristic with the given instance ID that belongs to the given GATT service, if the characteristic exists.

parameters.name: characteristicId
parameters.description: The instance ID of the requested GATT characteristic.

returns_async.description: Called with the requested Characteristic object.
returns_async.name: callback

functions.name: createCharacteristic
functions.description: Create a locally hosted GATT characteristic. This characteristic must be hosted under a valid service. If the service ID is not valid, the lastError will be set. This function is only available if the app has both the bluetooth:low_energy and the bluetooth:peripheral permissions set to true. The peripheral permission may not be available to all apps.

parameters.name: characteristic
parameters.description: The characteristic to create.

parameters.name: serviceId
parameters.description: ID of the service to create this characteristic for.

returns_async.description: Called with the created characteristic's unique ID.
returns_async.name: callback

functions.name: getCharacteristics
functions.description: Get a list of all discovered GATT characteristics that belong to the given service.

parameters.name: serviceId
parameters.description: The instance ID of the GATT service whose characteristics should be returned.

returns_async.description: Called with the list of characteristics that belong to the given service.
returns_async.name: callback

functions.name: getIncludedServices
functions.description: Get a list of GATT services that are included by the given service.

parameters.name: serviceId
parameters.description: The instance ID of the GATT service whose included services should be returned.

returns_async.description: Called with the list of GATT services included from the given service.
returns_async.name: callback

functions.name: getDescriptor
functions.description: Get the GATT characteristic descriptor with the given instance ID.

parameters.name: descriptorId
parameters.description: The instance ID of the requested GATT characteristic descriptor.

returns_async.description: Called with the requested Descriptor object.
returns_async.name: callback

functions.name: createDescriptor
functions.description: Create a locally hosted GATT descriptor. This descriptor must be hosted under a valid characteristic. If the characteristic ID is not valid, the lastError will be set. This function is only available if the app has both the bluetooth:low_energy and the bluetooth:peripheral permissions set to true. The peripheral permission may not be available to all apps.

parameters.name: descriptor
parameters.description: The descriptor to create.

parameters.name: characteristicId
parameters.description: ID of the characteristic to create this descriptor for.

returns_async.description: Called with the created descriptor's unique ID.
returns_async.name: callback

functions.name: getDescriptors
functions.description: Get a list of GATT characteristic descriptors that belong to the given characteristic.

parameters.name: characteristicId
parameters.description: The instance ID of the GATT characteristic whose descriptors should be returned.

returns_async.description: Called with the list of descriptors that belong to the given characteristic.
returns_async.name: callback

functions.name: readCharacteristicValue
functions.description: Retrieve the value of a specified characteristic from a remote peripheral.

parameters.name: characteristicId
parameters.description: The instance ID of the GATT characteristic whose value should be read from the remote device.

returns_async.description: Called with the Characteristic object whose value was requested. The value field of the returned Characteristic object contains the result of the read request.
returns_async.name: callback

functions.name: writeCharacteristicValue
functions.description: Write the value of a specified characteristic from a remote peripheral.

parameters.name: characteristicId
parameters.description: The instance ID of the GATT characteristic whose value should be written to.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The value that should be sent to the remote characteristic as part of the write request.

returns_async.description: Called when the write request has completed.
returns_async.name: callback

functions.name: startCharacteristicNotifications
functions.description: Enable value notifications/indications from the specified characteristic. Once enabled, an application can listen to notifications using the $(ref:onCharacteristicValueChanged) event.

parameters.name: characteristicId
parameters.description: The instance ID of the GATT characteristic that notifications should be enabled on.

parameters.name: properties
parameters.description: Notification session properties (optional).

returns_async.description: Called when the request has completed.
returns_async.name: callback

functions.name: stopCharacteristicNotifications
functions.description: Disable value notifications/indications from the specified characteristic. After a successful call, the application will stop receiving notifications/indications from this characteristic.

parameters.name: characteristicId
parameters.description: The instance ID of the GATT characteristic on which this app's notification session should be stopped.

returns_async.description: Called when the request has completed (optional).
returns_async.name: callback

functions.name: notifyCharacteristicValueChanged
functions.description: Notify a remote device of a new value for a characteristic. If the shouldIndicate flag in the notification object is true, an indication will be sent instead of a notification. Note, the characteristic needs to correctly set the 'notify' or 'indicate' property during creation for this call to succeed. This function is only available if the app has both the bluetooth:low_energy and the bluetooth:peripheral permissions set to true. The peripheral permission may not be available to all apps.

parameters.name: characteristicId
parameters.description: The characteristic to send the notication for.

returns_async.description: Callback called once the notification or indication has been sent successfully.
returns_async.name: callback

functions.name: readDescriptorValue
functions.description: Retrieve the value of a specified characteristic descriptor from a remote peripheral.

parameters.name: descriptorId
parameters.description: The instance ID of the GATT characteristic descriptor whose value should be read from the remote device.

returns_async.description: Called with the Descriptor object whose value was requested. The value field of the returned Descriptor object contains the result of the read request.
returns_async.name: callback

functions.name: writeDescriptorValue
functions.description: Write the value of a specified characteristic descriptor from a remote peripheral.

parameters.name: descriptorId
parameters.description: The instance ID of the GATT characteristic descriptor whose value should be written to.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The value that should be sent to the remote descriptor as part of the write request.

returns_async.description: Called when the write request has completed.
returns_async.name: callback

functions.name: registerService
functions.description: Register the given service with the local GATT server. If the service ID is invalid, the lastError will be set. This function is only available if the app has both the bluetooth:low_energy and the bluetooth:peripheral permissions set to true. The peripheral permission may not be available to all apps.

parameters.name: serviceId
parameters.description: Unique ID of a created service.

returns_async.description: Callback with the result of the register operation.
returns_async.name: callback

functions.name: unregisterService
functions.description: Unregister the given service with the local GATT server. If the service ID is invalid, the lastError will be set. This function is only available if the app has both the bluetooth:low_energy and the bluetooth:peripheral permissions set to true. The peripheral permission may not be available to all apps.

parameters.name: serviceId
parameters.description: Unique ID of a current registered service.

returns_async.description: Callback with the result of the register operation.
returns_async.name: callback

functions.name: removeService
functions.description: Remove the specified service, unregistering it if it was registered. If the service ID is invalid, the lastError will be set. This function is only available if the app has both the bluetooth:low_energy and the bluetooth:peripheral permissions set to true. The peripheral permission may not be available to all apps.

parameters.name: serviceId
parameters.description: Unique ID of a current registered service.

returns_async.description: Callback called once the service is removed.
returns_async.name: callback

functions.name: registerAdvertisement
functions.description: Create an advertisement and register it for advertising. To call this function, the app must have the bluetooth:low_energy and bluetooth:peripheral permissions set to true. Additionally this API is only available to auto launched apps in Kiosk Mode or by setting the '--enable-ble-advertising-in-apps' command-line switch. See https://developer.chrome.com/apps/manifest/bluetooth Note: On some hardware, central and peripheral modes at the same time is supported but on hardware that doesn't support this, making this call will switch the device to peripheral mode. In the case of hardware which does not support both central and peripheral mode, attempting to use the device in both modes will lead to undefined behavior or prevent other central-role applications from behaving correctly (including the discovery of Bluetooth Low Energy devices).

parameters.name: advertisement
parameters.description: The advertisement to advertise.

returns_async.description: Called once the registeration is done and we've started advertising. Returns the id of the created advertisement.
returns_async.name: callback

functions.name: unregisterAdvertisement
functions.description: Unregisters an advertisement and stops its advertising. If the advertisement fails to unregister the only way to stop advertising might be to restart the device.

parameters.name: advertisementId
parameters.description: Id of the advertisement to unregister.

returns_async.description: Called once the advertisement is unregistered and is no longer being advertised.
returns_async.name: callback

functions.name: resetAdvertising
functions.description: Resets advertising on the current device. It will unregister and stop all existing advertisements.

returns_async.description: Called once the advertisements are reset.
returns_async.name: callback

functions.name: setAdvertisingInterval
functions.description: Set's the interval betweeen two consecutive advertisements. Note: This is a best effort. The actual interval may vary non-trivially from the requested intervals. On some hardware, there is a minimum interval of 100ms. The minimum and maximum values cannot exceed the the range allowed by the Bluetooth 4.2 specification.

parameters.name: minInterval
parameters.description: Minimum interval between advertisments (in milliseconds). This cannot be lower than 20ms (as per the spec).

parameters.name: maxInterval
parameters.description: Maximum interval between advertisments (in milliseconds). This cannot be more than 10240ms (as per the spec).

returns_async.description: Called once the interval has been set.
returns_async.name: callback

functions.name: sendRequestResponse
functions.description: Sends a response for a characteristic or descriptor read/write request. This function is only available if the app has both the bluetooth:low_energy and the bluetooth:peripheral permissions set to true. The peripheral permission may not be available to all apps.

parameters.name: response
parameters.description: The response to the request.

types.description: Values representing the possible properties of a characteristic. Characteristic permissions are inferred from these properties. Please see the Bluetooth 4.x spec to see the meaning of each individual property.
Values representing possible permissions for a descriptor. Please see the Bluetooth 4.x spec to see the meaning of each individual permission.

Type of advertisement. If 'broadcast' is chosen, the sent advertisement type will be ADV_NONCONN_IND and the device will broadcast with a random MAC Address. If set to 'peripheral', the advertisement type will be ADV_IND or ADV_SCAN_IND and the device will broadcast with real Bluetooth Adapter's MAC Address.

address.name: address
address.description: The address of the device, in the format 'XX:XX:XX:XX:XX:XX'.

name.name: name
name.description: The human-readable name of the device.

deviceClass.name: deviceClass
deviceClass.description: The class of the device, a bit-field defined by http://www.bluetooth.org/en-us/specification/assigned-numbers/baseband.

uuid.name: uuid
uuid.description: The UUID of the service, e.g. 0000180d-0000-1000-8000-00805f9b34fb.

isPrimary.name: isPrimary
isPrimary.description: Indicates whether the type of this service is primary or secondary.

instanceId.name: instanceId
instanceId.description: Returns the identifier assigned to this service. Use the instance ID to distinguish between services from a peripheral with the same UUID and to make function calls that take in a service identifier. Present, if this instance represents a remote service.

deviceAddress.name: deviceAddress
deviceAddress.description: The device address of the remote peripheral that the GATT service belongs to. Present, if this instance represents a remote service.

uuid.name: uuid
uuid.description: The UUID of the characteristic, e.g. 00002a37-0000-1000-8000-00805f9b34fb.

service.name: service
service.description: The GATT service this characteristic belongs to.

instanceId.name: instanceId
instanceId.description: Returns the identifier assigned to this characteristic. Use the instance ID to distinguish between characteristics from a peripheral with the same UUID and to make function calls that take in a characteristic identifier. Present, if this instance represents a remote characteristic.

value.name: value
value.description: The currently cached characteristic value. This value gets updated when the value of the characteristic is read or updated via a notification or indication.

uuid.name: uuid
uuid.description: The UUID of the characteristic descriptor, e.g. 00002902-0000-1000-8000-00805f9b34fb.

characteristic.name: characteristic
characteristic.description: The GATT characteristic this descriptor belongs to.

instanceId.name: instanceId
instanceId.description: Returns the identifier assigned to this descriptor. Use the instance ID to distinguish between descriptors from a peripheral with the same UUID and to make function calls that take in a descriptor identifier. Present, if this instance represents a remote characteristic.

value.name: value
value.description: The currently cached descriptor value. This value gets updated when the value of the descriptor is read.

persistent.name: persistent
persistent.description: Flag indicating whether a connection to the device is left open when the event page of the application is unloaded (see Manage App Lifecycle). The default value is false.

persistent.name: persistent
persistent.description: Flag indicating whether the app should receive notifications when the event page of the application is unloaded (see Manage App Lifecycle). The default value is false.

type.name: type
type.description: Type of advertisement.

serviceUuids.name: serviceUuids
serviceUuids.description: List of UUIDs to include in the "Service UUIDs" field of the Advertising Data. These UUIDs can be of the 16bit, 32bit or 128 formats.

manufacturerData.name: manufacturerData
manufacturerData.description: List of manufacturer specific data to be included in "Manufacturer Specific Data" fields of the advertising data.

solicitUuids.name: solicitUuids
solicitUuids.description: List of UUIDs to include in the "Solicit UUIDs" field of the Advertising Data. These UUIDs can be of the 16bit, 32bit or 128 formats.

serviceData.name: serviceData
serviceData.description: List of service data to be included in "Service Data" fields of the advertising data.

requestId.name: requestId
requestId.description: Unique ID for this request. Use this ID when responding to this request.

value.name: value
value.description: Value to write (if this is a write request).

requestId.name: requestId
requestId.description: Id of the request this is a response to.

isError.name: isError
isError.description: If this is an error response, this should be true.

value.name: value
value.description: Response value. Write requests and error responses will ignore this parameter.

value.name: value
value.description: New value of the characteristic.

shouldIndicate.name: shouldIndicate
shouldIndicate.description: Optional flag for sending an indication instead of a notification.

events.name: onServiceAdded
events.description: Fired whan a new GATT service has been discovered on a remote device.

parameters.name: service
parameters.description: The GATT service that was added.

events.name: onServiceChanged
events.description: Fired when the state of a remote GATT service changes. This involves any characteristics and/or descriptors that get added or removed from the service, as well as "ServiceChanged" notifications from the remote device.

parameters.name: service
parameters.description: The GATT service whose state has changed.

events.name: onServiceRemoved
events.description: Fired when a GATT service that was previously discovered on a remote device has been removed.

parameters.name: service
parameters.description: The GATT service that was removed.

events.name: onCharacteristicValueChanged
events.description: Fired when the value of a remote GATT characteristic changes, either as a result of a read request, or a value change notification/indication This event will only be sent if the app has enabled notifications by calling $(ref:startCharacteristicNotifications).

parameters.name: characteristic
parameters.description: The GATT characteristic whose value has changed.

events.name: onDescriptorValueChanged
events.description: Fired when the value of a remote GATT characteristic descriptor changes, usually as a result of a read request. This event exists mostly for convenience and will always be sent after a successful call to $(ref:readDescriptorValue).

parameters.name: descriptor
parameters.description: The GATT characteristic descriptor whose value has changed.

events.name: onCharacteristicReadRequest
events.description: Fired when a connected central device requests to read the value of a characteristic registered on the local GATT server. Not responding to this request for a long time may lead to a disconnection. This event is only available if the app has both the bluetooth:low_energy and the bluetooth:peripheral permissions set to true. The peripheral permission may not be available to all apps.

parameters.name: request
parameters.description: Request data for this request.

parameters.name: characteristicId
parameters.description: The instance ID of the GATT characteristic whose value is requested.

events.name: onCharacteristicWriteRequest
events.description: Fired when a connected central device requests to write the value of a characteristic registered on the local GATT server. Not responding to this request for a long time may lead to a disconnection. This event is only available if the app has both the bluetooth:low_energy and the bluetooth:peripheral permissions set to true. The peripheral permission may not be available to all apps.

parameters.name: request
parameters.description: Request data for this request.

parameters.name: characteristicId
parameters.description: The instance ID of the GATT characteristic whose value is being written.

events.name: onDescriptorReadRequest
events.description: Fired when a connected central device requests to read the value of a descriptor registered on the local GATT server. Not responding to this request for a long time may lead to a disconnection. This event is only available if the app has both the bluetooth:low_energy and the bluetooth:peripheral permissions set to true. The peripheral permission may not be available to all apps.

parameters.name: request
parameters.description: Request data for this request.

parameters.name: descriptorId
parameters.description: The instance ID of the GATT descriptor whose value is requested.

events.name: onDescriptorWriteRequest
events.description: Fired when a connected central device requests to write the value of a descriptor registered on the local GATT server. Not responding to this request for a long time may lead to a disconnection. This event is only available if the app has both the bluetooth:low_energy and the bluetooth:peripheral permissions set to true. The peripheral permission may not be available to all apps.

parameters.name: request
parameters.description: Request data for this request.

parameters.name: descriptorId
parameters.description: The instance ID of the GATT descriptor whose value is being written.

bluetoothLowEnergy.description: The chrome.bluetoothLowEnergy API is used to communicate with Bluetooth Smart (Low Energy) devices using the Generic Attribute Profile (GATT).

bluetoothPrivate.description: Use the chrome.bluetoothPrivate API to control the Bluetooth adapter state and handle device pairing. NOTE: This IDL is dependent on bluetooth.idl.

types.description: Events that can occur during pairing. The method used for pairing varies depending on the capability of the two devices.

enum.name: requestPincode
enum.description: An alphanumeric PIN code is required to be entered by the user.

enum.name: displayPincode
enum.description: Display a PIN code to the user.

enum.name: requestPasskey
enum.description: A numeric passkey is required to be entered by the user.

enum.name: displayPasskey
enum.description: Display a zero padded 6 digit numeric passkey that the user entered on the remote device. This event may occur multiple times during pairing to update the entered passkey.

enum.name: keysEntered
enum.description: The number of keys inputted by the user on the remote device when entering a passkey. This event may be called multiple times during pairing to update the number of keys inputted.

enum.name: confirmPasskey
enum.description: Requests that a 6 digit passkey be displayed and the user confirms that both devies show the same passkey.

enum.name: requestAuthorization
enum.description: Requests authorization for a pairing under the just-works model. It is up to the app to ask for user confirmation.

enum.name: complete
enum.description: Pairing is completed.

types.description: Results for connect(). See function declaration for details.
Valid pairing responses.

name.description: The human-readable name of the adapter.
name.name: name

powered.description: Whether or not the adapter has power.
powered.name: powered

discoverable.description: Whether the adapter is discoverable by other devices.
discoverable.name: discoverable

device.description: The remote device to send the pairing response.
device.name: device

pincode.description: A 1-16 character alphanumeric set in response to requestPincode.
pincode.name: pincode

passkey.description: An integer between 0-999999 set in response to requestPasskey.
passkey.name: passkey

uuids.description: uuid of service or array of uuids
uuids.name: uuids

rssi.description: RSSI ranging value. Only devices with RSSI higher than this value will be reported.
rssi.name: rssi

pathloss.description: Pathloss ranging value. Only devices with pathloss lower than this value will be reported.
pathloss.name: pathloss

functions.description: Connects to the given device. This will only throw an error if the device address is invalid or the device is already connected. Otherwise this will succeed and invoke |callback| with ConnectResultType.
