functions.name: create
functions.description: Creates a Bluetooth socket.

parameters.name: properties
parameters.description: The socket properties (optional).

parameters.name: createInfo
parameters.description: The result of the socket creation.

returns_async.description: Called when the socket has been created.
returns_async.name: callback

functions.name: update
functions.description: Updates the socket properties.

parameters.name: socketId
parameters.description: The socket identifier.

parameters.name: properties
parameters.description: The properties to update.

returns_async.description: Called when the properties are updated.
returns_async.name: callback

functions.name: setPaused
functions.description: Enables or disables a connected socket from receiving messages from its peer, or a listening socket from accepting new connections. The default value is "false". Pausing a connected socket is typically used by an application to throttle data sent by its peer. When a connected socket is paused, no onReceiveevent is raised. When a socket is connected and un-paused, onReceive events are raised again when messages are received. When a listening socket is paused, new connections are accepted until its backlog is full then additional connection requests are refused. onAccept events are raised only when the socket is un-paused.

returns_async.description: Callback from the setPaused method.
returns_async.name: callback

functions.name: listenUsingRfcomm
functions.description: Listen for connections using the RFCOMM protocol.

parameters.name: socketId
parameters.description: The socket identifier.

parameters.name: uuid
parameters.description: Service UUID to listen on.

parameters.name: options
parameters.description: Optional additional options for the service.

returns_async.description: Called when listen operation completes.
returns_async.name: callback

functions.name: listenUsingL2cap
functions.description: Listen for connections using the L2CAP protocol.

parameters.name: socketId
parameters.description: The socket identifier.

parameters.name: uuid
parameters.description: Service UUID to listen on.

parameters.name: options
parameters.description: Optional additional options for the service.

returns_async.description: Called when listen operation completes.
returns_async.name: callback

functions.name: connect
functions.description: Connects the socket to a remote Bluetooth device. When the connect operation completes successfully, onReceive events are raised when data is received from the peer. If a network error occur while the runtime is receiving packets, a onReceiveError event is raised, at which point no more onReceive event will be raised for this socket until the setPaused(false) method is called.

parameters.name: socketId
parameters.description: The socket identifier.

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: The address of the Bluetooth device.

parameters.name: uuid
parameters.description: The UUID of the service to connect to.

returns_async.description: Called when the connect attempt is complete.
returns_async.name: callback

functions.name: disconnect
functions.description: Disconnects the socket. The socket identifier remains valid.

parameters.name: socketId
parameters.description: The socket identifier.

returns_async.description: Called when the disconnect attempt is complete.
returns_async.name: callback

functions.name: close
functions.description: Disconnects and destroys the socket. Each socket created should be closed after use. The socket id is no longer valid as soon at the function is called. However, the socket is guaranteed to be closed only when the callback is invoked.

parameters.name: socketId
parameters.description: The socket identifier.

returns_async.description: Called when the close operation completes.
returns_async.name: callback

functions.name: send
functions.description: Sends data on the given Bluetooth socket.

parameters.name: socketId
parameters.description: The socket identifier.

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: The data to send.

parameters.name: bytesSent
parameters.description: The number of bytes sent.

returns_async.description: Called with the number of bytes sent.
returns_async.name: callback

functions.name: getInfo
functions.description: Retrieves the state of the given socket.

parameters.name: socketId
parameters.description: The socket identifier.

parameters.name: socketInfo
parameters.description: Object containing the socket information.

returns_async.description: Called when the socket state is available.
returns_async.name: callback

functions.name: getSockets
functions.description: Retrieves the list of currently opened sockets owned by the application.

parameters.name: sockets
parameters.description: Array of object containing socket information.

returns_async.description: Called when the list of sockets is available.
returns_async.name: callback

persistent.name: persistent
persistent.description: Flag indicating whether the socket is left open when the event page of the application is unloaded (see Manage App Lifecycle). The default value is false. When the application is loaded, any sockets previously opened with persistent=true can be fetched with $ref:getSockets.

name.name: name
name.description: An application-defined string associated with the socket.

bufferSize.name: bufferSize
bufferSize.description: The size of the buffer used to receive data. The default value is 4096.

socketId.name: socketId
socketId.description: The ID of the newly created socket. Note that socket IDs created from this API are not compatible with socket IDs created from other APIs, such as the $(ref:sockets.tcp) API.

channel.name: channel
channel.description: The RFCOMM Channel used by listenUsingRfcomm. If specified, this channel must not be previously in use or the method call will fail. When not specified, an unused channel will be automatically allocated.

psm.name: psm
psm.description: The L2CAP PSM used by listenUsingL2cap. If specified, this PSM must not be previously in use or the method call with fail. When not specified, an unused PSM will be automatically allocated.

backlog.name: backlog
backlog.description: Length of the socket's listen queue. The default value depends on the operating system's host subsystem.

persistent.name: persistent
persistent.description: Flag indicating if the socket remains open when the event page of the application is unloaded (see SocketProperties.persistent). The default value is "false".

name.name: name
name.description: Application-defined string associated with the socket.

bufferSize.name: bufferSize
bufferSize.description: The size of the buffer used to receive data. If no buffer size has been specified explictly, the value is not provided.

paused.name: paused
paused.description: Flag indicating whether a connected socket blocks its peer from sending more data, or whether connection requests on a listening socket are dispatched through the onAccept event or queued up in the listen queue backlog. See setPaused. The default value is "false".

connected.name: connected
connected.description: Flag indicating whether the socket is connected to a remote peer.

address.name: address
address.description: If the underlying socket is connected, contains the Bluetooth address of the device it is connected to.

uuid.name: uuid
uuid.description: If the underlying socket is connected, contains information about the service UUID it is connected to, otherwise if the underlying socket is listening, contains information about the service UUID it is listening on.

clientSocketId.name: clientSocketId
clientSocketId.description: The client socket identifier, i.e. the socket identifier of the newly established connection. This socket identifier should be used only with functions from the chrome.bluetoothSocket namespace. Note the client socket is initially paused and must be explictly un-paused by the application to start receiving data.

enum.name: system_error
enum.description: A system error occurred and the connection may be unrecoverable.

enum.name: not_listening
enum.description: The socket is not listening.

error.name: error
error.description: An error code indicating what went wrong.

data.name: data
data.description: The data received, with a maxium size of bufferSize.

enum.name: disconnected
enum.description: The connection was disconnected.

enum.name: system_error
enum.description: A system error occurred and the connection may be unrecoverable.

enum.name: not_connected
enum.description: The socket has not been connected.

error.name: error
error.description: An error code indicating what went wrong.

events.name: onAccept
events.description: Event raised when a connection has been established for a given socket.

parameters.name: info
parameters.description: The event data.

events.name: onAcceptError
events.description: Event raised when a network error occurred while the runtime was waiting for new connections on the given socket. Once this event is raised, the socket is set to paused and no more onAccept events are raised for this socket.

parameters.name: info
parameters.description: The event data.

events.name: onReceive
events.description: Event raised when data has been received for a given socket.

parameters.name: info
parameters.description: The event data.

events.name: onReceiveError
events.description: Event raised when a network error occured while the runtime was waiting for data on the socket. Once this event is raised, the socket is set to paused and no more onReceive events are raised for this socket.

parameters.name: info
parameters.description: The event data.

bluetoothSocket.description: Use the chrome.bluetoothSocket API to send and receive data to Bluetooth devices using RFCOMM and L2CAP connections.

functions.name: sendStandBy
functions.description:
Attempt to put all HDMI CEC compatible devices in standby.

This is not guaranteed to have any effect on the connected displays. Displays that do not support HDMI CEC will not be affected.

returns_async.description: will be run as soon as all displays have been requested to change their power state.
returns_async.name: callback

functions.name: sendWakeUp
functions.description: Attempt to announce this device as the active input source towards all HDMI CEC enabled displays connected, waking them from standby if necessary.

returns_async.description: will be run as soon as all displays have been requested to change their power state.
returns_async.name: callback

functions.name: queryDisplayCecPowerState
functions.description: Queries all HDMI CEC capable displays for their current power state.

enum.name: error
enum.description: There was an error querying the power state of the display.

enum.name: adapterNotConfigured
enum.description: The kernel adapter for the CEC endpoint isn't configured (no EDID set).

enum.name: noDevice
enum.description: No device ACKed the request on the CEC bus.

enum.name: on
enum.description: The display is a powered on state.

enum.name: standby
enum.description: The display is in standby mode.

enum.name: transitioningToOn
enum.description: The display is currently transitioning to an awake state. It can't be relied on to show any output yet.

enum.name: transitioningToStandby
enum.description: The display is currently transitioning to standby.

enum.name: unknown
enum.description: Found a CEC endpoint but unable to determine the power state.

cecPrivate.description: Private API for HDMI CEC functionality.

chrome_url_overrides.name: chrome_url_overrides
chrome_url_overrides.description: Chrome url overrides. Note that an extension can override only one page.
Stub namespace for the "chrome_url_overrides" manifest key.

functions.name: setImageData
functions.description: Sets image data to clipboard.

parameters.name: imageData
parameters.description: The encoded image data.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The type of image being passed.

parameters.name: additionalItems
parameters.description: Additional data items for describing image data. The callback is called with chrome.runtime.lastError set to error code if there is an error. Requires clipboard and clipboardWrite permissions.

types.description: Supported image types.

type.name: type
type.description: Type of the additional data item.

data.name: data
data.description: Content of the additional data item. Either the plain text string if |type| is "textPlain" or markup string if |type| is "textHtml". The data can not exceed 2MB.

events.name: onClipboardDataChanged
events.description: Fired when clipboard data changes. Requires clipboard and clipboardRead permissions for adding listener to chrome.clipboard.onClipboardDataChanged event. After this event fires, the clipboard data is available by calling document.execCommand('paste').

clipboard.description: The chrome.clipboard API is provided to allow users to access data of the clipboard. This is a temporary solution for chromeos platform apps until open-web alternative is available. It will be deprecated once open-web solution is available, which could be in 2017 Q4.

contentScripts.description: Stub namespace for the "content_scripts" manifest key.

matches.description: Specifies which pages this content script will be injected into. See Match Patterns for more details on the syntax of these strings.
matches.name: matches

exclude_matches.description: Excludes pages that this content script would otherwise be injected into. See Match Patterns for more details on the syntax of these strings.
exclude_matches.name: exclude_matches

css.description: The list of CSS files to be injected into matching pages. These are injected in the order they appear in this array, before any DOM is constructed or displayed for the page.
css.name: css

js.description: The list of JavaScript files to be injected into matching pages. These are injected in the order they appear in this array.
js.name: js

all_frames.description: If specified true, it will inject into all frames, even if the frame is not the top-most frame in the tab. Each frame is checked independently for URL requirements; it will not inject into child frames if the URL requirements are not met. Defaults to false, meaning that only the top frame is matched.
all_frames.name: all_frames

match_origin_as_fallback.description: Whether the script should inject into any frames where the URL belongs to a scheme that would never match a specified Match Pattern, including about:, data:, blob:, and filesystem: schemes. In these cases, in order to determine if the script should inject, the origin of the URL is checked. If the origin is `null` (as is the case for data: URLs), then the "initiator" or "creator" origin is used (i.e., the origin of the frame that created or navigated this frame). Note that this may not be the parent frame, if the frame was navigated by another frame in the document hierarchy.
match_origin_as_fallback.name: match_origin_as_fallback

match_about_blank.description: Whether the script should inject into an about:blank frame where the parent or opener frame matches one of the patterns declared in matches. Defaults to false.
match_about_blank.name: match_about_blank

include_globs.description: Applied after matches to include only those URLs that also match this glob. Intended to emulate the @include Greasemonkey keyword.
include_globs.name: include_globs

exclude_globs.description: Applied after matches to exclude URLs that match this glob. Intended to emulate the @exclude Greasemonkey keyword.
exclude_globs.name: exclude_globs

run_at.description: Specifies when JavaScript files are injected into the web page. The preferred and default value is document_idle.
run_at.name: run_at

world.description: The JavaScript "world" to run the script in. Defaults to ISOLATED. Only available in Manifest V3 extensions.
world.name: world

crossOriginIsolation.description: Stub namespace for manifest keys relating to the cross origin isolation response headers.

declarativeNetRequest.description: The chrome.declarativeNetRequest API is used to block or modify network requests by specifying declarative rules. This lets extensions modify network requests without intercepting them and viewing their content, thus providing more privacy.

types.description: This describes the resource type of the network request.
This describes the HTTP request method of a network request.

This describes whether the request is first or third party to the frame in which it originated. A request is said to be first party if it has the same domain (eTLD+1) as the frame in which the request originated.

enum.name: firstParty
enum.description: The network request is first party to the frame in which it originated.

enum.name: thirdParty
enum.description: The network request is third party to the frame in which it originated.

types.description: This describes the possible operations for a "modifyHeaders" rule.

enum.name: append
enum.description: Adds a new entry for the specified header. When modifying the headers of a request, this operation is only supported for specific headers.

enum.name: set
enum.description: Sets a new value for the specified header, removing any existing headers with the same name.

enum.name: remove
enum.description: Removes all entries for the specified header.

types.description: Describes the kind of action to take if a given RuleCondition matches.

enum.name: block
enum.description: Block the network request.

enum.name: redirect
enum.description: Redirect the network request.

enum.name: allow
enum.description: Allow the network request. The request won't be intercepted if there is an allow rule which matches it.

enum.name: upgradeScheme
enum.description: Upgrade the network request url's scheme to https if the request is http or ftp.

enum.name: modifyHeaders
enum.description: Modify request/response headers from the network request.

enum.name: allowAllRequests
enum.description: Allow all requests within a frame hierarchy, including the frame request itself.

types.description: Describes the reason why a given regular expression isn't supported.

enum.name: syntaxError
enum.description: The regular expression is syntactically incorrect, or uses features not available in the RE2 syntax.

enum.name: memoryLimitExceeded
enum.description: The regular expression exceeds the memory limit.

types.description: <!-- Lists the types of condition currently supported by RuleCondition, to aid feature detection. Must be kept consistent with the RuleCondition dictionary. -->

id.description: A non-empty string uniquely identifying the ruleset. IDs beginning with '_' are reserved for internal use.
id.name: id

path.description: The path of the JSON ruleset relative to the extension directory.
path.name: path

enabled.description: Whether the ruleset is enabled by default.
enabled.name: enabled

replaceOnly.description: If true, the query key is replaced only if it's already present. Otherwise, the key is also added if it's missing. Defaults to false.
replaceOnly.name: replaceOnly

removeParams.description: The list of query keys to be removed.
removeParams.name: removeParams

addOrReplaceParams.description: The list of query key-value pairs to be added or replaced.
addOrReplaceParams.name: addOrReplaceParams

scheme.description: The new scheme for the request. Allowed values are "http", "https", "ftp" and "chrome-extension".
scheme.name: scheme

host.description: The new host for the request.
host.name: host

port.description: The new port for the request. If empty, the existing port is cleared.
port.name: port

path.description: The new path for the request. If empty, the existing path is cleared.
path.name: path

query.description: The new query for the request. Should be either empty, in which case the existing query is cleared; or should begin with '?'.
query.name: query

queryTransform.description: Add, remove or replace query key-value pairs.
queryTransform.name: queryTransform

fragment.description: The new fragment for the request. Should be either empty, in which case the existing fragment is cleared; or should begin with '#'.
fragment.name: fragment

username.description: The new username for the request.
username.name: username

password.description: The new password for the request.
password.name: password

extensionPath.description: Path relative to the extension directory. Should start with '/'.
extensionPath.name: extensionPath

url.description: The redirect url. Redirects to JavaScript urls are not allowed.
url.name: url

regexSubstitution.description: Substitution pattern for rules which specify a regexFilter. The first match of regexFilter within the url will be replaced with this pattern. Within regexSubstitution, backslash-escaped digits (\1 to \9) can be used to insert the corresponding capture groups. \0 refers to the entire matching text.
regexSubstitution.name: regexSubstitution

header.description: The name of the header. This condition matches on the name only if both `values` and `excludedValues` are not specified.
header.name: header

values.description:
If specified, this condition matches if the header's value matches at least one pattern in this list. This supports case-insensitive header value matching plus the following constructs:

'*' : Matches any number of characters.

'?' : Matches zero or one character(s).

'*' and '?' can be escaped with a backslash, e.g. '\*' and '\?'
values.name: values

excludedValues.description: If specified, this condition is not matched if the header exists but its value contains at least one element in this list. This uses the same match pattern syntax as `values`.
excludedValues.name: excludedValues

urlFilter.description:
The pattern which is matched against the network request url. Supported constructs:

'*' : Wildcard: Matches any number of characters.

'|' : Left/right anchor: If used at either end of the pattern, specifies the beginning/end of the url respectively.

'||' : Domain name anchor: If used at the beginning of the pattern, specifies the start of a (sub-)domain of the URL.

'^' : Separator character: This matches anything except a letter, a digit, or one of the following: _, -, ., or %. This also match the end of the URL.

Therefore urlFilter is composed of the following parts: (optional Left/Domain name anchor) + pattern + (optional Right anchor).

If omitted, all urls are matched. An empty string is not allowed.

A pattern beginning with ||* is not allowed. Use * instead.

Note: Only one of urlFilter or regexFilter can be specified.

Note: The urlFilter must be composed of only ASCII characters. This is matched against a url where the host is encoded in the punycode format (in case of internationalized domains) and any other non-ascii characters are url encoded in utf-8. For example, when the request url is http://abc.рф?q=ф, the urlFilter will be matched against the url http://abc.xn--p1ai/?q=%D1%84.
urlFilter.name: urlFilter

regexFilter.description:
Regular expression to match against the network request url. This follows the RE2 syntax.

Note: Only one of urlFilter or regexFilter can be specified.

Note: The regexFilter must be composed of only ASCII characters. This is matched against a url where the host is encoded in the punycode format (in case of internationalized domains) and any other non-ascii characters are url encoded in utf-8.
regexFilter.name: regexFilter

isUrlFilterCaseSensitive.description: Whether the urlFilter or regexFilter (whichever is specified) is case sensitive. Default is false.
isUrlFilterCaseSensitive.name: isUrlFilterCaseSensitive

initiatorDomains.description:
The rule will only match network requests originating from the list of initiatorDomains. If the list is omitted, the rule is applied to requests from all domains. An empty list is not allowed.

Notes:

  • Sub-domains like "a.example.com" are also allowed.
  • The entries must consist of only ascii characters.
  • Use punycode encoding for internationalized domains.
  • This matches against the request initiator and not the request url.
  • Sub-domains of the listed domains are also matched.
initiatorDomains.name: initiatorDomains

excludedInitiatorDomains.description:
The rule will not match network requests originating from the list of excludedInitiatorDomains. If the list is empty or omitted, no domains are excluded. This takes precedence over initiatorDomains.

Notes:

  • Sub-domains like "a.example.com" are also allowed.
  • The entries must consist of only ascii characters.
  • Use punycode encoding for internationalized domains.
  • This matches against the request initiator and not the request url.
  • Sub-domains of the listed domains are also excluded.
excludedInitiatorDomains.name: excludedInitiatorDomains

requestDomains.description:
The rule will only match network requests when the domain matches one from the list of requestDomains. If the list is omitted, the rule is applied to requests from all domains. An empty list is not allowed.

Notes:

  • Sub-domains like "a.example.com" are also allowed.
  • The entries must consist of only ascii characters.
  • Use punycode encoding for internationalized domains.
  • Sub-domains of the listed domains are also matched.
requestDomains.name: requestDomains

excludedRequestDomains.description:
The rule will not match network requests when the domains matches one from the list of excludedRequestDomains. If the list is empty or omitted, no domains are excluded. This takes precedence over requestDomains.

Notes:

  • Sub-domains like "a.example.com" are also allowed.
  • The entries must consist of only ascii characters.
  • Use punycode encoding for internationalized domains.
  • Sub-domains of the listed domains are also excluded.
excludedRequestDomains.name: excludedRequestDomains

topDomains.description:
The rule will only match network requests when the associated top-level frame's domain matches one from the list of topDomains. If the list is omitted, the rule is applied to requests associated with all top-level frame domains. An empty list is not allowed.

Notes:

  • Sub-domains like "a.example.com" are also allowed.
  • The entries must consist of only ascii characters.
  • Use punycode encoding for internationalized domains.
  • Sub-domains of the listed domains are also matched.
  • For requests with no associated top-level frame (e.g. ServiceWorker initiated requests, the request initiator's domain is considered instead.
topDomains.name: topDomains

excludedTopDomains.description:
The rule will not match network requests when the associated top-level frame's domain matches one from the list of excludedTopDomains. If the list is empty or omitted, no domains are excluded. This takes precedence over topDomains.

Notes:

  • Sub-domains like "a.example.com" are also allowed.
  • The entries must consist of only ascii characters.
  • Use punycode encoding for internationalized domains.
  • Sub-domains of the listed domains are also excluded.
  • For requests with no associated top-level frame (e.g. ServiceWorker initiated requests, the request initiator's domain is considered instead.
excludedTopDomains.name: excludedTopDomains

domains.description: The rule will only match network requests originating from the list of domains.
domains.name: domains

excludedDomains.description: The rule will not match network requests originating from the list of excludedDomains.
excludedDomains.name: excludedDomains

resourceTypes.description:
List of resource types which the rule can match. An empty list is not allowed.

Note: this must be specified for allowAllRequests rules and may only include the sub_frame and main_frame resource types.
resourceTypes.name: resourceTypes

excludedResourceTypes.description: List of resource types which the rule won't match. Only one of resourceTypes and excludedResourceTypes should be specified. If neither of them is specified, all resource types except "main_frame" are blocked.
excludedResourceTypes.name: excludedResourceTypes

requestMethods.description:
List of HTTP request methods which the rule can match. An empty list is not allowed.

Note: Specifying a requestMethods rule condition will also exclude non-HTTP(s) requests, whereas specifying excludedRequestMethods will not.
requestMethods.name: requestMethods

excludedRequestMethods.description: List of request methods which the rule won't match. Only one of requestMethods and excludedRequestMethods should be specified. If neither of them is specified, all request methods are matched.
excludedRequestMethods.name: excludedRequestMethods

domainType.description: Specifies whether the network request is first-party or third-party to the domain from which it originated. If omitted, all requests are accepted.
domainType.name: domainType

tabIds.description: List of $(ref:tabs.Tab.id) which the rule should match. An ID of $(ref:tabs.TAB_ID_NONE) matches requests which don't originate from a tab. An empty list is not allowed. Only supported for session-scoped rules.
tabIds.name: tabIds

excludedTabIds.description: List of $(ref:tabs.Tab.id) which the rule should not match. An ID of $(ref:tabs.TAB_ID_NONE) excludes requests which don't originate from a tab. Only supported for session-scoped rules.
excludedTabIds.name: excludedTabIds

responseHeaders.description: Rule matches if the request matches any response header condition in this list (if specified).
responseHeaders.name: responseHeaders

excludedResponseHeaders.description: Rule does not match if the request matches any response header condition in this list (if specified). If both `excludedResponseHeaders` and `responseHeaders` are specified, then the `excludedResponseHeaders` property takes precedence.
excludedResponseHeaders.name: excludedResponseHeaders

matchAll.description: Whether the regex should match all groups for the value. This is only relevant if a regex substitution is present and would thus need to be applied onto all matching groups. Equivalent to the "g" flag. Defaults to false.
matchAll.name: matchAll

header.description: The name of the header to be modified.
header.name: header

operation.description: The operation to be performed on a header. <!-- TODO(crbug.com/352093575): Make this field optional: It is ignored if `regexSubstitution` is specified but is required otherwise. -->
operation.name: operation

value.description: The new value for the header. Must be specified for append and set operations.
value.name: value

regexFilter.description: A regular expression to match against the header value. This follows the RE2 syntax for consistency with the rest of the API.
regexFilter.name: regexFilter

regexSubstitution.description: Substitution pattern for the response header. `regexFilter` must be specified for this to be valid. Takes precedence over `value` and `operation` if specified and valid.
regexSubstitution.name: regexSubstitution

regexOptions.description: Options for the regex filter. If not specified, all options will be default.
regexOptions.name: regexOptions

type.description: The type of action to perform.
type.name: type

redirect.description: Describes how the redirect should be performed. Only valid for redirect rules.
redirect.name: redirect

requestHeaders.description: The request headers to modify for the request. Only valid if RuleActionType is "modifyHeaders".
requestHeaders.name: requestHeaders

responseHeaders.description: The response headers to modify for the request. Only valid if RuleActionType is "modifyHeaders".
responseHeaders.name: responseHeaders

id.description: An id which uniquely identifies a rule. Mandatory and should be >= 1.
id.name: id

priority.description: Rule priority. Defaults to 1. When specified, should be >= 1.
priority.name: priority

condition.description: The condition under which this rule is triggered.
condition.name: condition

action.description: The action to take if this rule is matched.
action.name: action

rulesetId.description: ID of the $(ref:Ruleset) this rule belongs to. For a rule originating from the set of dynamic rules, this will be equal to $(ref:DYNAMIC_RULESET_ID).
rulesetId.name: rulesetId

ruleIds.description: If specified, only rules with matching IDs are included.
ruleIds.name: ruleIds

timeStamp.description: The time the rule was matched. Timestamps will correspond to the Javascript convention for times, i.e. number of milliseconds since the epoch.
timeStamp.name: timeStamp

tabId.description: The tabId of the tab from which the request originated if the tab is still active. Else -1.
tabId.name: tabId

tabId.description: If specified, only matches rules for the given tab. Matches rules not associated with any active tab if set to -1.
tabId.name: tabId

minTimeStamp.description: If specified, only matches rules after the given timestamp.
minTimeStamp.name: minTimeStamp

requestId.description: The ID of the request. Request IDs are unique within a browser session.
requestId.name: requestId

url.description: The URL of the request.
url.name: url

initiator.description: The origin where the request was initiated. This does not change through redirects. If this is an opaque origin, the string 'null' will be used.
initiator.name: initiator

frameId.description: The value 0 indicates that the request happens in the main frame; a positive value indicates the ID of a subframe in which the request happens. If the document of a (sub-)frame is loaded (type is main_frame or sub_frame), frameId indicates the ID of this frame, not the ID of the outer frame. Frame IDs are unique within a tab.
frameId.name: frameId

documentId.description: The unique identifier for the frame's document, if this request is for a frame.
documentId.name: documentId

frameType.description: The type of the frame, if this request is for a frame.
frameType.name: frameType

documentLifecycle.description: The lifecycle of the frame's document, if this request is for a frame.
documentLifecycle.name: documentLifecycle

parentFrameId.description: ID of frame that wraps the frame which sent the request. Set to -1 if no parent frame exists.
parentFrameId.name: parentFrameId

parentDocumentId.description: The unique identifier for the frame's parent document, if this request is for a frame and has a parent.
parentDocumentId.name: parentDocumentId

tabId.description: The ID of the tab in which the request takes place. Set to -1 if the request isn't related to a tab.
tabId.name: tabId

type.description: The resource type of the request.
type.name: type

url.description: The URL of the hypothetical request.
url.name: url

initiator.description: The initiator URL (if any) for the hypothetical request.
initiator.name: initiator

method.description: Standard HTTP method of the hypothetical request. Defaults to "get" for HTTP requests and is ignored for non-HTTP requests.
method.name: method

type.description: The resource type of the hypothetical request.
type.name: type

tabId.description: The ID of the tab in which the hypothetical request takes place. Does not need to correspond to a real tab ID. Default is -1, meaning that the request isn't related to a tab.
tabId.name: tabId

topUrl.description: The associated top-level frame URL (if any) for the request.
topUrl.name: topUrl

responseHeaders.description: The headers provided by a hypothetical response if the request does not get blocked or redirected before it is sent. Represented as an object which maps a header name to a list of string values. If not specified, the hypothetical response would return empty response headers, which can match rules which match on the non-existence of headers. E.g. {"content-type": ["text/html; charset=utf-8", "multipart/form-data"]}
responseHeaders.name: responseHeaders

request.description: Details about the request for which the rule was matched.
request.name: request

isCaseSensitive.description: Whether the regex specified is case sensitive. Default is true.
isCaseSensitive.name: isCaseSensitive

requireCapturing.description: Whether the regex specified requires capturing. Capturing is only required for redirect rules which specify a regexSubstition action. The default is false.
requireCapturing.name: requireCapturing

reason.description: Specifies the reason why the regular expression is not supported. Only provided if isSupported is false.
reason.name: reason

matchedRules.description: The rules (if any) that match the hypothetical request.
matchedRules.name: matchedRules

removeRuleIds.description: IDs of the rules to remove. Any invalid IDs will be ignored.
removeRuleIds.name: removeRuleIds

disableRulesetIds.description: The set of ids corresponding to a static $(ref:Ruleset) that should be disabled.
disableRulesetIds.name: disableRulesetIds

enableRulesetIds.description: The set of ids corresponding to a static $(ref:Ruleset) that should be enabled.
enableRulesetIds.name: enableRulesetIds

rulesetId.description: The id corresponding to a static $(ref:Ruleset).
rulesetId.name: rulesetId

disableRuleIds.description: Set of ids corresponding to rules in the $(ref:Ruleset) to disable.
disableRuleIds.name: disableRuleIds

enableRuleIds.description: Set of ids corresponding to rules in the $(ref:Ruleset) to enable.
enableRuleIds.name: enableRuleIds

rulesetId.description: The id corresponding to a static $(ref:Ruleset).
rulesetId.name: rulesetId

tabId.description: The tab for which to update the action count.
tabId.name: tabId

increment.description: The amount to increment the tab's action count by. Negative values will decrement the count.
increment.name: increment

displayActionCountAsBadgeText.description: Whether to automatically display the action count for a page as the extension's badge text. This preference is persisted across sessions.
displayActionCountAsBadgeText.name: displayActionCountAsBadgeText

tabUpdate.description: Details of how the tab's action count should be adjusted.
tabUpdate.name: tabUpdate

functions.description:
Modifies the current set of dynamic rules for the extension. The rules with IDs listed in options.removeRuleIds are first removed, and then the rules given in options.addRules are added. Notes:
  • This update happens as a single atomic operation: either all specified rules are added and removed, or an error is returned.
  • These rules are persisted across browser sessions and across extension updates.
  • Static rules specified as part of the extension package can not be removed using this function.
  • $(ref:MAX_NUMBER_OF_DYNAMIC_RULES) is the maximum number of dynamic rules an extension can add. The number of unsafe rules must not exceed $(ref:MAX_NUMBER_OF_UNSAFE_DYNAMIC_RULES).

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Called once the update is complete or has failed. In case of an error, $(ref:runtime.lastError) will be set and no change will be made to the rule set. This can happen for multiple reasons, such as invalid rule format, duplicate rule ID, rule count limit exceeded, internal errors, and others.

functions.name: updateDynamicRules

functions.description: Returns the current set of dynamic rules for the extension. Callers can optionally filter the list of fetched rules by specifying a filter.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: An object to filter the list of fetched rules.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Called with the set of dynamic rules. An error might be raised in case of transient internal errors.

functions.name: getDynamicRules

functions.description:
Modifies the current set of session scoped rules for the extension. The rules with IDs listed in options.removeRuleIds are first removed, and then the rules given in options.addRules are added. Notes:
  • This update happens as a single atomic operation: either all specified rules are added and removed, or an error is returned.
  • These rules are not persisted across sessions and are backed in memory.
  • $(ref:MAX_NUMBER_OF_SESSION_RULES) is the maximum number of session rules an extension can add.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Called once the update is complete or has failed. In case of an error, $(ref:runtime.lastError) will be set and no change will be made to the rule set. This can happen for multiple reasons, such as invalid rule format, duplicate rule ID, rule count limit exceeded, and others.

functions.name: updateSessionRules

functions.description: Returns the current set of session scoped rules for the extension. Callers can optionally filter the list of fetched rules by specifying a filter.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: An object to filter the list of fetched rules.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Called with the set of session scoped rules.

functions.name: getSessionRules

functions.description:
Updates the set of enabled static rulesets for the extension. The rulesets with IDs listed in options.disableRulesetIds are first removed, and then the rulesets listed in options.enableRulesetIds are added.
Note that the set of enabled static rulesets is persisted across sessions but not across extension updates, i.e. the rule_resources manifest key will determine the set of enabled static rulesets on each extension update.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Called once the update is complete. In case of an error, $(ref:runtime.lastError) will be set and no change will be made to set of enabled rulesets. This can happen for multiple reasons, such as invalid ruleset IDs, rule count limit exceeded, or internal errors.

functions.name: updateEnabledRulesets

functions.description: Returns the ids for the current set of enabled static rulesets.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Called with a list of ids, where each id corresponds to an enabled static $(ref:Ruleset).

functions.name: getEnabledRulesets

functions.description: Disables and enables individual static rules in a $(ref:Ruleset). Changes to rules belonging to a disabled $(ref:Ruleset) will take effect the next time that it becomes enabled.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Called once the update is complete. In case of an error, $(ref:runtime.lastError) will be set and no change will be made to the enabled static rules.

functions.name: updateStaticRules

functions.description: Returns the list of static rules in the given $(ref:Ruleset) that are currently disabled.

parameters.name: options
parameters.description: Specifies the ruleset to query.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Called with a list of ids that correspond to the disabled rules in that ruleset.

functions.name: getDisabledRuleIds

functions.description: Returns all rules matched for the extension. Callers can optionally filter the list of matched rules by specifying a filter. This method is only available to extensions with the "declarativeNetRequestFeedback" permission or having the "activeTab" permission granted for the tabId specified in filter. Note: Rules not associated with an active document that were matched more than five minutes ago will not be returned.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: An object to filter the list of matched rules.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Called once the list of matched rules has been fetched. In case of an error, $(ref:runtime.lastError) will be set and no rules will be returned. This can happen for multiple reasons, such as insufficient permissions, or exceeding the quota.

functions.name: getMatchedRules

functions.description: Configures if the action count for tabs should be displayed as the extension action's badge text and provides a way for that action count to be incremented.
functions.name: setExtensionActionOptions

functions.description: Checks if the given regular expression will be supported as a regexFilter rule condition.

parameters.name: regexOptions
parameters.description: The regular expression to check.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Called with details consisting of whether the regular expression is supported and the reason if not.

incremental.description: For file-based log sources, read from source without closing the file handle. The next time $(ref:readLogSource) is called, the file read will continue where it left off. $(ref:readLogSource) can be called with incremental=true repeatedly. To subsequently close the file handle, pass in incremental=false.
incremental.name: incremental

readerId.description: To read from an existing file handle, set this to a valid readerId value that was returned from a previous $(ref:readLogSource) call. The reader must previously have been created for the same value of source. If no readerId is provided, $(ref:readLogSource) will attempt to open a new log source reader handle.
readerId.name: readerId

readerId.description: The ID of the log source reader that was created to read from the log source. If the reader was destroyed at the end of a read by passing in incremental=false, this is always set to 0. If the call was to use an existing reader with an existing ID, this will be set to the same readerId that was passed into $(ref:readLogSource).
readerId.name: readerId

parameters.description: Optional flag when present and is true, the backend should load system information before sending the report. This is added to reduce user's wait time when sending reports because loading system information is slow.

parameters.name: formOpenTime
parameters.description: The epoch time when the feedback form was opened. This is used for metrics.

functions.name: sendFeedback

functions.description:
Reads from a log source indicated by source.

If incremental is false:

  • Returns the entire contents of the log file.
  • Returns readerId value of 0 to callback.
If incremental is true, and no readerId is provided:
  • Returns the entire contents of the log file.
  • Starts tracking the file read handle, which is returned as a nonzero readerId value in the callback.
  • If can't create a new file handle, returns readerId value of 0 in the callback.
If incremental is true, and a valid non-zero readerId is provided:
  • Returns new lines written to the file since the last time this function was called for the same file and readerId.
  • Returns the same readerId value to the callback.
functions.name: readLogSource

mediaPerceptionPrivate.description: Private API for receiving real-time media perception information.

enum.name: UNINITIALIZED
enum.description: The media analytics process is waiting to be launched.

enum.name: STARTED
enum.description: The analytics process is running and the media processing pipeline is started, but it is not yet receiving image frames. This is a transitional state between SUSPENDED and RUNNING for the time it takes to warm up the media processing pipeline, which can take anywhere from a few seconds to a minute. Note: STARTED is the initial reply to SetState RUNNING.

enum.name: RUNNING
enum.description: The analytics process is running and the media processing pipeling is injesting image frames. At this point, MediaPerception signals should be coming over D-Bus.

enum.name: SUSPENDED
enum.description: Analytics process is running and the media processing pipeline is ready to be set to state RUNNING. The D-Bus communications are enabled but the media processing pipeline is suspended.

enum.name: RESTARTING
enum.description: Enum for restarting the media analytics process using Upstart. Calling setState RESTARTING will restart the media process to the SUSPENDED state. The app has to set the state to RUNNING in order to start receiving media perception information again.

enum.name: STOPPED
enum.description: Stops the media analytics process via Upstart.

enum.name: SERVICE_ERROR
enum.description: Indicates that a ServiceError has occurred.

enum.name: SERVICE_UNREACHABLE
enum.description: The media analytics process could not be reached. This is likely due to a faulty comms configuration or that the process crashed.

enum.name: SERVICE_NOT_RUNNING
enum.description: The media analytics process is not running. The MPP API knows that the process has not been started yet.

enum.name: SERVICE_BUSY_LAUNCHING
enum.description: The media analytics process is busy launching. Wait for setState RUNNING or setState RESTARTING callback.

enum.name: SERVICE_NOT_INSTALLED
enum.description: The component is not installed properly.

enum.name: MOJO_CONNECTION_FAILURE
enum.description: Failed to establish a Mojo connection to the service.

enum.name: LIGHT
enum.description: The smaller component with limited functionality (smaller size and limited models).

enum.name: FULL
enum.description: The fully-featured component with more functionality (larger size and more models).

types.description: The status of the media analytics process component on the device.

enum.name: INSTALLED
enum.description: The component is successfully installed and the image is mounted.

enum.name: FAILED_TO_INSTALL
enum.description: The component failed to download, install or load.

types.description: Error code associated with a failure to install the media analytics component.

enum.name: UNKNOWN_COMPONENT
enum.description: Component requested does not exist.

enum.name: INSTALL_FAILURE
enum.description: The update engine fails to install component.

enum.name: MOUNT_FAILURE
enum.description: Component can not be mounted.

enum.name: COMPATIBILITY_CHECK_FAILED
enum.description: The component is not compatible with the device.

enum.name: NOT_FOUND
enum.description: The component was not found - reported for load requests with kSkip update policy.

version.description: The version string for the current component.
version.name: version

installationErrorCode.description: If the component installation failed, the encountered installation error. Not set if the component installation succeeded.
installationErrorCode.name: installationErrorCode

types.description: ------------------- Start of process management definitions. ------------ New interface for managing the process state of the media perception service with the intention of eventually phasing out the setState() call.

enum.name: UNKNOWN
enum.description: The component process state is unknown, for example, if the process is waiting to be launched. This is the initial state before $(ref:setComponentProcessState) is first called.

enum.name: STARTED
enum.description: The component process has been started. This value can only be passed to $(ref:setComponentProcessState) if the process is currently in state STOPPED or UNKNOWN.

enum.name: STOPPED
enum.description: The component process has been stopped. This value can only be passed to $(ref:setComponentProcessState) if the process is currently in state STARTED. Note: the process is automatically stopped when the Chrome process is closed.

enum.name: SERVICE_ERROR
enum.description: Indicates that a ServiceError has occurred.

serviceError.description: Return parameter for $(ref:setComponentProcessState) that specifies the error type for failure cases.
serviceError.name: serviceError

aspectRatio.name: aspectRatio

deviceContext.name: deviceContext

serviceError.name: serviceError

units.description: This field provides flexibility to report depths or distances of different entity types with different units.

id.description: A unique id associated with the detected entity, which can be used to track the entity over time.
id.name: id

boundingBox.description: Minimum box which captures entire detected entity.
boundingBox.name: boundingBox

confidence.description: A value for the quality of this detection.
confidence.name: confidence

depth.description: The estimated depth of the entity from the camera.
depth.name: depth

types.description: Type of lighting conditions.

enum.name: NO_CHANGE
enum.description: No noticeable change occurred.

enum.name: TURNED_ON
enum.description: Light was switched on in the room.

enum.name: TURNED_OFF
enum.description: Light was switched off in the room.

enum.name: DIMMER
enum.description: Light gradually got dimmer (for example, due to a sunset).

enum.name: BRIGHTER
enum.description: Light gradually got brighter (for example, due to a sunrise).

enum.name: BLACK_FRAME
enum.description: Black frame was detected - the current frame contains only noise.

humanPresenceLikelihood.description: Indicates a probability in [0, 1] interval that a human is present in the video frame.
humanPresenceLikelihood.name: humanPresenceLikelihood

motionDetectedLikelihood.description: Indicates a probability in [0, 1] that motion has been detected in the video frame.
motionDetectedLikelihood.name: motionDetectedLikelihood

lightCondition.description: Indicates lighting condition in the video frame.
lightCondition.name: lightCondition

lightConditionLikelihood.description: Indicates a probablity in [0, 1] interval that lightCondition value is correct.
lightConditionLikelihood.name: lightConditionLikelihood

timestamp.description: The timestamp associated with the frame (when its recieved by the analytics process).
timestamp.name: timestamp

entities.description: The list of entities detected in this frame.
entities.name: entities

packetLatency.description: Processing latency for a list of packets.
packetLatency.name: packetLatency

videoHumanPresenceDetection.description: Human presence detection results for a video frame.
videoHumanPresenceDetection.name: videoHumanPresenceDetection

framePerceptionTypes.description: Indicates what types of frame perception were run.
framePerceptionTypes.name: framePerceptionTypes

azimuthRadians.description: An angle in radians in the horizontal plane. It roughly points to the peak in the probability distribution of azimuth defined below.
azimuthRadians.name: azimuthRadians

azimuthScores.description: A probability distribution for the current snapshot in time that shows the likelihood of a sound source being at a particular azimuth. For example, azimuthScores = [0.1, 0.2, 0.3, 0.4] means that the probability that the sound is coming from an azimuth of 0, pi/2, pi, 3*pi/2 is 0.1, 0.2, 0.3 and 0.4, respectively.
azimuthScores.name: azimuthScores

humanPresenceLikelihood.description: Indicates a probability in [0, 1] interval that a human has caused a sound close to the microphone.
humanPresenceLikelihood.name: humanPresenceLikelihood

id.description: Unique identifier for the hotword instance. Note that a single hotword instance can span more than one audio frame. In that case a single hotword instance can be reported in multiple Hotword or HotwordDetection results. Hotword results associated with the same hotword instance will have the same id.
id.name: id

type.description: Indicates the type of this hotword.
type.name: type

frameId.description: Id of the audio frame in which the hotword was detected.
frameId.name: frameId

startTimestampMs.description: Indicates the start time of this hotword in the audio frame.
startTimestampMs.name: startTimestampMs

endTimestampMs.description: Indicates the end time of this hotword in the audio frame.
endTimestampMs.name: endTimestampMs

confidence.description: Indicates a probability in [0, 1] interval that this hotword is present in the audio frame.
confidence.name: confidence

timestampUs.description: A timestamp in microseconds attached when this message was generated.
timestampUs.name: timestampUs

audioLocalization.description: Audio localization results for an audio frame.
audioLocalization.name: audioLocalization

audioHumanPresenceDetection.description: Audio human presence detection results for an audio frame.
audioHumanPresenceDetection.name: audioHumanPresenceDetection

humanPresenceLikelihood.description: Indicates a probability in [0, 1] interval that a human is present.
humanPresenceLikelihood.name: humanPresenceLikelihood

timestampUs.description: A timestamp in microseconds attached when this message was generated.
timestampUs.name: timestampUs

timestamp.description: The time the media perception data was emitted by the media processing pipeline. This value will be greater than the timestamp stored within the FramePerception dictionary and the difference between them can be viewed as the processing time for a single frame.
timestamp.name: timestamp

metadata.description: Stores metadata such as version of media perception features.
metadata.name: metadata

enum.name: RAW
enum.description: Image represented by RGB data channels.

frame.description: The bytes of the image frame.
frame.name: frame

framePerception.description: The video analytics FramePerception for the associated image frame data.
framePerception.name: framePerception

imageFrame.description: The image frame data for the associated FramePerception object.
imageFrame.name: imageFrame

audioPerception.description: The audio perception results for an audio frame.
audioPerception.name: audioPerception

audioVisualPerception.description: Perception results based on both audio and video inputs.
audioVisualPerception.name: audioVisualPerception

metadata.description: Stores metadata such as version of media perception features.
metadata.name: metadata

serviceError.description: Return parameter for $(ref:getDiagnostics) that specifies the error type for failure cases.
serviceError.name: serviceError

perceptionSamples.description: A buffer of image frames and the associated video analytics information that can be used to diagnose a malfunction.
perceptionSamples.name: perceptionSamples

functions.description: Gets the status of the media perception process.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: The current state of the system.

functions.name: getState

functions.description: Sets the desired state of the system.

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: A dictionary with the desired new state. The only settable states are RUNNING, SUSPENDED, and RESTARTING.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Invoked with the State of the system after setting it. Can be used to verify the state was set as desired.

functions.name: setState

functions.description: Get a diagnostics buffer out of the video analytics process.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Returns a Diagnostics dictionary object.

functions.name: getDiagnostics

functions.description: Attempts to download and load the media analytics component. This function should be called every time a client starts using this API. If the component is already loaded, the callback will simply return that information. The process must be STOPPED for this function to succeed. Note: If a different component type is desired, this function can be called with the new desired type and the new component will be downloaded and installed.

parameters.name: component
parameters.description: The desired component to install and load.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Returns the state of the component.

functions.name: setAnalyticsComponent

functions.description: Manages the lifetime of the component process. This function should only be used if the component is installed. It will fail if the component is not installed.

parameters.name: processState
parameters.description: The desired state for the component process.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Reports the new state of the process, which is expected to be the same as the desired state, unless something goes wrong.

functions.name: setComponentProcessState

events.description: Fired when media perception information is received from the media analytics process.

parameters.name: mediaPerception
parameters.description: The dictionary which contains a dump of everything the analytics process has detected or determined from the incoming media streams.

events.name: onMediaPerception

mimeType.description: The MIME type of the intercepted URL request.
mimeType.name: mimeType

originalUrl.description: The original URL that was intercepted.
originalUrl.name: originalUrl

streamUrl.description: The URL that the stream can be read from.
streamUrl.name: streamUrl

tabId.description: The ID of the tab that opened the stream. If the stream is not opened in a tab, it will be -1.
tabId.name: tabId

responseHeaders.description: The HTTP response headers of the intercepted request stored as a dictionary mapping header name to header value. If a header name appears multiple times, the header values are merged in the dictionary and separated by a ", ". Non-ASCII headers are dropped.
responseHeaders.name: responseHeaders

embedded.description: Whether the stream is embedded within another document.
embedded.name: embedded

backgroundColor.description: The background color in ARGB format for painting. Since the background color is an unsigned 32-bit integer which can be outside the range of "long" type, define it as a "double" type here.
backgroundColor.name: backgroundColor

allowJavascript.description: Indicates whether the plugin allows to execute JavaScript and maybe XFA. Loading XFA for PDF forms will automatically be disabled if this flag is false.
allowJavascript.name: allowJavascript

functions.description: Returns the StreamInfo for the stream for this context if there is one.
functions.name: getStreamInfo

functions.description: Sets PDF plugin attributes in the stream for this context if there is one.
functions.name: setPdfPluginAttributes

functions.description: Instructs the PluginDocument, if running in one, to show a dialog in response to beforeunload events.
functions.name: setShowBeforeUnloadDialog

events.description: Fired when the browser wants the listener to perform a save.

parameters.name: streamUrl
parameters.description: Unique ID for the instance that should perform the save.

functions.name: requireAsync

networking.onc.description:
The chrome.networking.onc API is used for configuring network connections (Cellular, Ethernet, VPN or WiFi). This API is available in auto-launched Chrome OS kiosk sessions.

Network connection configurations are specified following Open Network Configuration (ONC) specification.

NOTE: Most dictionary properties and enum values use UpperCamelCase to match the ONC specification instead of the JavaScript lowerCamelCase convention.

enum.name: Uninitialized
enum.description: Device is available but not initialized.

enum.name: Disabled
enum.description: Device is initialized but not enabled.

enum.name: Enabling
enum.description: Enabled state has been requested but has not completed.

enum.name: Enabled
enum.description: Device is enabled.

enum.name: Prohibited
enum.description: Device is prohibited.

Active.description: The active value currently used by the network configuration manager (e.g. Shill).
Active.name: Active

Effective.description: The source from which the effective property value was determined.
Effective.name: Effective

UserPolicy.description: The property value provided by the user policy.
UserPolicy.name: UserPolicy

DevicePolicy.description: The property value provided by the device policy.
DevicePolicy.name: DevicePolicy

UserSetting.description: The property value set by the logged in user. Only provided if |UserEditable| is true.
UserSetting.name: UserSetting

SharedSetting.description: The value set for all users of the device. Only provided if |DeviceEditiable| is true.
SharedSetting.name: SharedSetting

UserEditable.description: Whether a UserPolicy for the property exists and allows the property to be edited (i.e. the policy set recommended property value). Defaults to false.
UserEditable.name: UserEditable

Code.description: Cellular network ID as a simple concatenation of the network's MCC (Mobile Country Code) and MNC (Mobile Network Code).
Code.name: Code

CommonName.description: If set, the value against which to match the certificate subject's common name.
CommonName.name: CommonName

Locality.description: If set, the value against which to match the certificate subject's common location.
Locality.name: Locality

Organization.description: If set, the value against which to match the certificate subject's organizations. At least one organization should match the value.
Organization.name: Organization

OrganizationalUnit.description: If set, the value against which to match the certificate subject's organizational units. At least one organizational unit should match the value.
OrganizationalUnit.name: OrganizationalUnit

EnrollmentURI.description: List of URIs to which the user can be directed in case no certificates that match this pattern are found.
EnrollmentURI.name: EnrollmentURI

Issuer.description: If set, pattern against which X.509 issuer settings should be matched.
Issuer.name: Issuer

IssuerCARef.description: List of certificate issuer CA certificates. A certificate must be signed by one of them in order to match this pattern.
IssuerCARef.name: IssuerCARef

Subject.description: If set, pattern against which X.509 subject settings should be matched.
Subject.name: Subject

Outer.description: The outer EAP type. Required by ONC, but may not be provided when translating from Shill.
Outer.name: Outer

Technology.description: Access technology used by the network.
Technology.name: Technology

Gateway.description: Gateway address used for the IP configuration.
Gateway.name: Gateway

IPAddress.description: The IP address for a connection. Can be IPv4 or IPv6 address, depending on value of Type.
IPAddress.name: IPAddress

ExcludedRoutes.description: Array of IP blocks in CIDR notation, see onc_spec.md for details.
ExcludedRoutes.name: ExcludedRoutes

IncludedRoutes.description: Array of IP blocks in CIDR notation, see onc_spec.md for details.
IncludedRoutes.name: IncludedRoutes

NameServers.description: Array of addresses used for name servers.
NameServers.name: NameServers

SearchDomains.description: Array of strings for name resolution, see onc_spec.md for details.
SearchDomains.name: SearchDomains

Type.description: The IP configuration type. Can be IPv4 or IPv6.
Type.name: Type

WebProxyAutoDiscoveryUrl.description: The URL for WEb Proxy Auto-Discovery, as reported over DHCP.
WebProxyAutoDiscoveryUrl.name: WebProxyAutoDiscoveryUrl

Method.description: The HTTP method to use for the payment portal.
Method.name: Method

PostData.description: The post data to send to the payment portal. Ignored unless Method is POST.
PostData.name: PostData

Port.description: The port to use for the proxy.
Port.name: Port

Manual.description: Manual proxy settings - used only for Manual proxy settings.
Manual.name: Manual

ExcludeDomains.description: Domains and hosts for which manual proxy settings are excluded.
ExcludeDomains.name: ExcludeDomains

LockType.description: The status of SIM lock - possible values are 'sim-pin', 'sim-puk' and ''.
LockType.name: LockType

RetriesLeft.description: Number of PIN lock tries allowed before PUK is required to unlock the SIM.
RetriesLeft.name: RetriesLeft

ExtensionID.description: ID of the third-party VPN provider extension.
ExtensionID.name: ExtensionID

AutoConnect.description: Whether the cellular network should be connected automatically (when in range).
AutoConnect.name: AutoConnect

AllowRoaming.description: Whether roaming is allowed for the network.
AllowRoaming.name: AllowRoaming

FirmwareRevision.description: The firmware revision loaded in the cellular modem.
FirmwareRevision.name: FirmwareRevision

FoundNetworks.description: The list of networks found during the most recent network scan.
FoundNetworks.name: FoundNetworks

HomeProvider.description: Information about the operator that issued the SIM card currently installed in the modem.
HomeProvider.name: HomeProvider

NetworkTechnology.description: If the modem is registered on a network, the network technology currently in use.
NetworkTechnology.name: NetworkTechnology

PaymentPortal.description: Online payment portal a user can use to sign-up for or modify a mobile data plan.
PaymentPortal.name: PaymentPortal

RoamingState.description: The roaming state of the cellular modem on the current network.
RoamingState.name: RoamingState

Scanning.description: True when a cellular network scan is in progress.
Scanning.name: Scanning

ServingOperator.description: Information about the operator on whose network the modem is currently registered.
ServingOperator.name: ServingOperator

SIMLockStatus.description: The state of SIM lock for GSM family networks.
SIMLockStatus.name: SIMLockStatus

SIMPresent.description: Whether a SIM card is present.
SIMPresent.name: SIMPresent

SupportNetworkScan.description: Whether the cellular network supports scanning.
SupportNetworkScan.name: SupportNetworkScan

AutoConnect.description: Whether the Ethernet network should be connected automatically.
AutoConnect.name: AutoConnect

Authentication.description: The authentication used by the Ethernet network. Possible values are None and 8021X.
Authentication.name: Authentication

EAP.description: Network's EAP settings. Required for 8021X authentication.
EAP.name: EAP

AutoConnect.description: Whether the VPN network should be connected automatically.
AutoConnect.name: AutoConnect

Type.description: The VPN type. This cannot be an enum because of 'L2TP-IPSec'. This is optional for NetworkConfigProperties which is passed to setProperties which may be used to set only specific properties.
Type.name: Type

AllowGatewayARPPolling.deprecated: Removed in M131. There is no active ARP polling now.
AllowGatewayARPPolling.name: AllowGatewayARPPolling

AutoConnect.description: Whether the WiFi network should be connected automatically when in range.
AutoConnect.name: AutoConnect

BSSID.description: The BSSID of the associated access point..
BSSID.name: BSSID

EAP.description: The network EAP properties. Required for WEP-8021X and WPA-EAP networks.
EAP.name: EAP

Frequency.description: The WiFi service operating frequency in MHz. For connected networks, the current frequency on which the network is connected. Otherwise, the frequency of the best available BSS.
Frequency.name: Frequency

FrequencyList.description: Contains all operating frequency recently seen for the WiFi network.
FrequencyList.name: FrequencyList

HexSSID.description: HEX-encoded copy of the network SSID.
HexSSID.name: HexSSID

HiddenSSID.description: Whether the network SSID will be broadcast.
HiddenSSID.name: HiddenSSID

Passphrase.description: The passphrase for WEP/WPA/WPA2 connections. This property can only be set - properties returned by $(ref:getProperties) will not contain this value.
Passphrase.name: Passphrase

AutoConnect.description: Whether the network should be connected automatically.
AutoConnect.name: AutoConnect

Cellular.description: For cellular networks, cellular network properties.
Cellular.name: Cellular

ErrorState.description: The last recorded network error state.
ErrorState.name: ErrorState

Ethernet.description: For Ethernet networks, the Ethernet network properties.
Ethernet.name: Ethernet

IPAddressConfigType.description: The network's IP address configuration type.
IPAddressConfigType.name: IPAddressConfigType

NameServersConfigType.description: The IP configuration type for the name servers used by the network.
NameServersConfigType.name: NameServersConfigType

RestrictedConnectivity.description: For a connected network, whether the network connectivity to the Internet is limited, e.g. if the network is behind a portal, or a cellular network is not activated.
RestrictedConnectivity.name: RestrictedConnectivity

SavedIPConfig.description: IP configuration that was received from the DHCP server before applying static IP configuration.
SavedIPConfig.name: SavedIPConfig

Source.description:
Indicates whether and how the network is configured. Possible values are:
  • Device
  • DevicePolicy
  • User
  • UserPolicy
  • None
'None' conflicts with extension code generation so we must use a string for 'Source' instead of a SourceType enum.
Source.name: Source

TrafficCounterResetTime.description: When traffic counters were last reset.
TrafficCounterResetTime.name: TrafficCounterResetTime

VPN.description: For VPN networks, the network VPN properties.
VPN.name: VPN

WiFi.description: For WiFi networks, the network WiFi properties.
WiFi.name: WiFi

Scanning.description: Set if the device is enabled. True if the device is currently scanning.
Scanning.name: Scanning

SIMLockStatus.description: The SIM lock status if Type = Cellular and SIMPresent = True.
SIMLockStatus.name: SIMLockStatus

SIMPresent.description: Set to the SIM present state if the device type is Cellular.
SIMPresent.name: SIMPresent

State.description: The current state of the device.
State.name: State

Type.description: The network type associated with the device (Cellular, Ethernet or WiFi).
Type.name: Type

networkType.description: The type of networks to return.
networkType.name: networkType

visible.description: If true, only include visible (physically connected or in-range) networks. Defaults to 'false'.
visible.name: visible

configured.description: If true, only include configured (saved) networks. Defaults to 'false'.
configured.name: configured

limit.description: Maximum number of networks to return. Defaults to 1000 if unspecified. Use 0 for no limit.
limit.name: limit

AllowOnlyPolicyNetworksToAutoconnect.description: If true, only policy networks may auto connect. Defaults to false.
AllowOnlyPolicyNetworksToAutoconnect.name: AllowOnlyPolicyNetworksToAutoconnect

AllowOnlyPolicyNetworksToConnect.description: If true, only policy networks may be connected to and no new networks may be added or configured. Defaults to false.
AllowOnlyPolicyNetworksToConnect.name: AllowOnlyPolicyNetworksToConnect

AllowOnlyPolicyNetworksToConnectIfAvaila.description: If true and a managed network is available in the visible network list, only policy networks may be connected to and no new networks may be added or configured. Defaults to false.
AllowOnlyPolicyNetworksToConnectIfAvaila.name: AllowOnlyPolicyNetworksToConnectIfAvailable

BlockedHexSSIDs.description: List of blocked networks. Connections to blocked networks are prohibited. Networks can be unblocked again by specifying an explicit network configuration. Defaults to an empty list.
BlockedHexSSIDs.name: BlockedHexSSIDs

functions.description: Gets all the properties of the network with id networkGuid. Includes all properties of the network (read-only and read/write values).

parameters.name: networkGuid
parameters.description: The GUID of the network to get properties for.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Called with the network properties when received.

functions.name: getProperties

functions.description: Gets the merged properties of the network with id networkGuid from the sources: User settings, shared settings, user policy, device policy and the currently active settings.

parameters.name: networkGuid
parameters.description: The GUID of the network to get properties for.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Called with the managed network properties when received.

functions.name: getManagedProperties

functions.description: Gets the cached read-only properties of the network with id networkGuid. This is meant to be a higher performance function than $(ref:getProperties), which requires a round trip to query the networking subsystem. The following properties are returned for all networks: GUID, Type, Name, WiFi.Security. Additional properties are provided for visible networks: ConnectionState, ErrorState, WiFi.SignalStrength, Cellular.NetworkTechnology, Cellular.ActivationState, Cellular.RoamingState.

parameters.name: networkGuid
parameters.description: The GUID of the network to get properties for.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Called immediately with the network state properties.

functions.name: getState

functions.description: Sets the properties of the network with id |networkGuid|. This is only valid for configured networks (Source != None). Unconfigured visible networks should use $(ref:createNetwork) instead. In kiosk sessions, calling this method on a shared network will fail.

parameters.name: networkGuid
parameters.description: The GUID of the network to set properties for.

parameters.name: properties
parameters.description: The properties to set.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Called when the operation has completed.

functions.name: setProperties

functions.description: Creates a new network configuration from properties. If a matching configured network already exists, this will fail. Otherwise returns the GUID of the new network.

parameters.name: shared
parameters.description:
If true, share this network configuration with other users.

This option is exposed only to Chrome's Web UI. When called by apps, false is the only allowed value.

parameters.name: properties
parameters.description: The properties to configure the new network with.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Called with the GUID for the new network configuration once     the network has been created.

functions.name: createNetwork

functions.description:
Forgets a network configuration by clearing any configured properties for the network with GUID networkGuid. This may also include any other networks with matching identifiers (e.g. WiFi SSID and Security). If no such configuration exists, an error will be set and the operation will fail.

In kiosk sessions, this method will not be able to forget shared network configurations.

parameters.name: networkGuid
parameters.description: The GUID of the network to forget.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Called when the operation has completed.

functions.name: forgetNetwork

functions.description: Returns a list of network objects with the same properties provided by $(ref:getState). A filter is provided to specify the type of networks returned and to limit the number of networks. Networks are ordered by the system based on their priority, with connected or connecting networks listed first.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Describes which networks to return.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Called with a dictionary of networks and their state     properties when received.

functions.name: getNetworks

functions.description: Returns states of available networking devices.

returns_async.name: callback
