networkingPrivate.description:
The chrome.networkingPrivate API is used for configuring network connections (Cellular, Ethernet, VPN or WiFi). This private API is only valid if called from a browser or app associated with the primary user. See the Open Network Configuration (ONC) documentation for descriptions of properties: src/components/onc/docs/onc_spec.html, or the Open Network Configuration page at chromium.org.

NOTE: Most dictionary properties and enum values use UpperCamelCase to match the ONC spec instead of the JavaScript lowerCamelCase convention.

"State" properties describe just the ONC properties returned by $(ref:networkingPrivate.getState) and $(ref:networkingPrivate.getNetworks).

"Config" properties describe just the ONC properties that can be configured through this API. NOTE: Not all configuration properties are exposed at this time, only those currently required by the Chrome Settings UI. TODO(stevenjb): Provide all configuration properties and types, crbug.com/380937.

TODO(stevenjb/pneubeck): Merge the ONC documentation with this document and use it as the ONC specification.

enum.name: Uninitialized
enum.description: Device is available but not initialized.

enum.name: Disabled
enum.description: Device is initialized but not enabled.

enum.name: Enabling
enum.description: Enabled state has been requested but has not completed.

enum.name: Enabled
enum.description: Device is enabled.

enum.name: Prohibited
enum.description: Device is prohibited.

requirePin.description: Whether or not a PIN should be required.
requirePin.name: requirePin

currentPin.description: The current PIN (required for any change, even when the SIM is unlocked).
currentPin.name: currentPin

newPin.description: If provided, change the PIN to |newPin|. |requirePin| must be true.
newPin.name: newPin

Outer.description: The outer EAP type. Required by ONC, but may not be provided when translating from Shill.
Outer.name: Outer

Outer.description: The outer EAP type. Required by ONC, but may not be provided when translating from Shill.
Outer.name: Outer

Type.description: The VPN type. This cannot be an enum because of 'L2TP-IPSec'. This is optional for NetworkConfigProperties which is passed to setProperties which may be used to set only specific properties.
Type.name: Type

Source.description: Indicates whether and how the network is configured. 'Source' can be Device, DevicePolicy, User, UserPolicy or None. 'None' conflicts with extension code generation so we must use a string for 'Source' instead of a SourceType enum.
Source.name: Source

Scanning.description: Set if the device is enabled. True if the device is currently scanning.
Scanning.name: Scanning

SIMLockStatus.description: The SIM lock status if Type = Cellular and SIMPresent = True.
SIMLockStatus.name: SIMLockStatus

SIMPresent.description: Set to the SIM present state if the device type is Cellular.
SIMPresent.name: SIMPresent

State.description: The current state of the device.
State.name: State

Type.description: The network type associated with the device (Cellular, Ethernet or WiFi).
Type.name: Type

ManagedNetworkAvailable.description: Whether or not any managed networks are available/visible.
ManagedNetworkAvailable.name: ManagedNetworkAvailable

networkType.description: The type of networks to return.
networkType.name: networkType

visible.description: If true, only include visible (physically connected or in-range) networks. Defaults to 'false'.
visible.name: visible

configured.description: If true, only include configured (saved) networks. Defaults to 'false'.
configured.name: configured

limit.description: Maximum number of networks to return. Defaults to 1000 if unspecified. Use 0 for no limit.
limit.name: limit

AllowOnlyPolicyNetworksToAutoconnect.description: If true, only policy networks may auto connect. Defaults to false.
AllowOnlyPolicyNetworksToAutoconnect.name: AllowOnlyPolicyNetworksToAutoconnect

AllowOnlyPolicyNetworksToConnect.description: If true, only policy networks may be connected to and no new networks may be added or configured. Defaults to false.
AllowOnlyPolicyNetworksToConnect.name: AllowOnlyPolicyNetworksToConnect

AllowOnlyPolicyNetworksToConnectIfAvaila.description: If true and a managed network is available in the visible network list, only policy networks may be connected to and no new networks may be added or configured. Defaults to false.
AllowOnlyPolicyNetworksToConnectIfAvaila.name: AllowOnlyPolicyNetworksToConnectIfAvailable

BlockedHexSSIDs.description: List of blocked networks. Connections to blocked networks are prohibited. Networks can be allowed again by specifying an explicit network configuration. Defaults to an empty list.
BlockedHexSSIDs.name: BlockedHexSSIDs

hardwareBacked.description: Whether or not the certificate is hardware backed.
hardwareBacked.name: hardwareBacked

deviceWide.description: Whether or not the certificate is device wide.
deviceWide.name: deviceWide

serverCaCertificates.description: List of avaliable server CA certificates.
serverCaCertificates.name: serverCaCertificates

functions.description: Unlocks a Cellular SIM card. * If the SIM is PIN locked, |pin| will be used to unlock the SIM and   the |puk| argument will be ignored if provided. * If the SIM is PUK locked, |puk| and |pin| must be provided. If the   operation succeeds (|puk| is valid), the PIN will be set to |pin|.   (If |pin| is empty or invalid the operation will fail).

parameters.name: networkGuid
parameters.description: The GUID of the cellular network to unlock.     If empty, the default cellular device will be used.

parameters.name: pin
parameters.description: The current SIM PIN, or the new PIN if PUK is provided.

parameters.name: puk
parameters.description: The operator provided PUK for unblocking a blocked SIM.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Called when the operation has completed.

functions.name: unlockCellularSim

functions.description: Sets whether or not SIM locking is enabled (i.e a PIN will be required when the device is powered) and changes the PIN if a new PIN is specified. If the new PIN is provided but not valid (e.g. too short) the operation will fail. This will not lock the SIM; that is handled automatically by the device. NOTE: If the SIM is locked, it must first be unlocked with unlockCellularSim() before this can be called (otherwise it will fail and $(ref:runtime.lastError) will be set to Error.SimLocked).

parameters.name: networkGuid
parameters.description: The GUID of the cellular network to set the SIM state of.     If empty, the default cellular device will be used.

parameters.name: simState
parameters.description: The SIM state to set.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Called when the operation has completed.

offscreen.description: Use the offscreen API to create and manage offscreen documents.

enum.name: TESTING
enum.description: A reason used for testing purposes only.

enum.name: AUDIO_PLAYBACK
enum.description: Specifies that the offscreen document is responsible for playing audio.

enum.name: IFRAME_SCRIPTING
enum.description: Specifies that the offscreen document needs to embed and script an iframe in order to modify the iframe's content.

enum.name: DOM_SCRAPING
enum.description: Specifies that the offscreen document needs to embed an iframe and scrape its DOM to extract information.

enum.name: BLOBS
enum.description: Specifies that the offscreen document needs to interact with Blob objects (including URL.createObjectURL()).

enum.name: DOM_PARSER
enum.description: Specifies that the offscreen document needs to use the DOMParser API.

enum.name: USER_MEDIA
enum.description: Specifies that the offscreen document needs to interact with media streams from user media (e.g. getUserMedia()).

enum.name: DISPLAY_MEDIA
enum.description: Specifies that the offscreen document needs to interact with media streams from display media (e.g. getDisplayMedia()).

enum.name: WEB_RTC
enum.description: Specifies that the offscreen document needs to use WebRTC APIs.

enum.name: CLIPBOARD
enum.description: Specifies that the offscreen document needs to interact with the Clipboard API.

enum.name: LOCAL_STORAGE
enum.description: Specifies that the offscreen document needs access to localStorage.

enum.name: WORKERS
enum.description: Specifies that the offscreen document needs to spawn workers.

enum.name: BATTERY_STATUS
enum.description: Specifies that the offscreen document needs to use navigator.getBattery.

enum.name: MATCH_MEDIA
enum.description: Specifies that the offscreen document needs to use window.matchMedia.

enum.name: GEOLOCATION
enum.description: Specifies that the offscreen document needs to use navigator.geolocation.

reasons.description: The reason(s) the extension is creating the offscreen document.
reasons.name: reasons

url.description: The (relative) URL to load in the document.
url.name: url

justification.description: A developer-provided string that explains, in more detail, the need for the background context. The user agent _may_ use this in display to the user.
justification.name: justification

returns_async.description: Invoked when the offscreen document is created and has completed its initial page load.

Instead of this, we should integrate offscreen documents into a service worker-compatible getViews() alternative. But this is pretty useful in testing environments.

printerProvider.description: The chrome.printerProvider API exposes events used by print manager to query printers controlled by extensions, to query their capabilities and to submit print jobs to these printers.

types.description: Error codes returned in response to $(ref:onPrintRequested) event.

enum.name: OK
enum.description: Specifies that the operation was completed successfully.

enum.name: FAILED
enum.description: Specifies that a general failure occured.

enum.name: INVALID_TICKET
enum.description: Specifies that the print ticket is invalid. For example, the ticket is inconsistent with some capabilities, or the extension is not able to handle all settings from the ticket.

enum.name: INVALID_DATA
enum.description: Specifies that the document is invalid. For example, data may be corrupted or the format is incompatible with the extension.

id.description: Unique printer ID.
id.name: id

name.description: Printer's human readable name.
name.name: name

printerId.description: ID of the printer which should handle the job.
printerId.name: printerId

title.description: The print job title.
title.name: title

ticket.description:
Print ticket in CJT format.
The CJT reference is marked as deprecated. It is deprecated for Google Cloud Print only. is not deprecated for ChromeOS printing.
ticket.name: ticket

contentType.description: The document content type. Supported formats are "application/pdf" and "image/pwg-raster".
contentType.name: contentType

document.description: Blob containing the document data to print. Format must match |contentType|.
document.name: document

parameters.description: Callback to return printer list. Every listener must call callback exactly once.

events.name: onGetPrintersRequested

events.description:
Event fired when print manager requests information about a USB device that may be a printer.

Note: An application should not rely on this event being fired more than once per device. If a connected device is supported it should be returned in the $(ref:onGetPrintersRequested) event.

parameters.name: device
parameters.description: The USB device.

parameters.name: resultCallback
parameters.description: Callback to return printer info. The receiving listener must call callback exactly once. If the parameter to this callback is undefined that indicates that the application has determined that the device is not supported.

events.name: onGetUsbPrinterInfoRequested

events.description: Event fired when print manager requests printer capabilities.

parameters.name: printerId
parameters.description: Unique ID of the printer whose capabilities are requested.

parameters.name: resultCallback
parameters.description: Callback to return device capabilities in CDD format. The receiving listener must call callback exectly once.

parameters.name: capabilities
parameters.description: Device capabilities in CDD format.

events.name: onGetCapabilityRequested

events.description: Event fired when print manager requests printing.

parameters.name: printJob
parameters.description: The printing request parameters.

parameters.name: resultCallback
parameters.description: Callback that should be called when the printing request is completed.

events.name: onPrintRequested

printerProviderInternal.description: printerProviderInternal Internal API used to run callbacks passed to chrome.printerProvider API events. When dispatching a chrome.printerProvider API event, its arguments will be massaged in custom bindings so a callback is added. The callback uses chrome.printerProviderInternal API to report the event results. In order to identify the event for which the callback is called, the event is internally dispatched having a requestId argument (which is removed from the argument list before the event actually reaches the event listeners). The requestId is forwarded to the chrome.printerProviderInternal API functions.

types.description: Same as in printerProvider.PrintError enum API.

functions.description: Runs callback to printerProvider.onGetPrintersRequested event.

parameters.name: requestId
parameters.description: Parameter identifying the event instance for which the     callback is run.

parameters.description: List of printers reported by the extension.

parameters.name: printerInfo
parameters.description: Printer information reported by the extension.

protocol.name: protocol

protocolHandlers.description: `protocol_handlers` manifest key defintion. Protocol Handlers allow developers to let extensions register Custom Handlers for URL's schemes unknown to the Browser. This manifest key provides a similar behavior than the Web API implementing the Custom Handlers section of the HTML specification. https://html.spec.whatwg.org/#custom-handlers

scriptsInternal.description: Internal namespace for representing content scripts.

types.description: The source of the user script. This will also determine certain capabilities of the script (such as whether it can use globs, raw strings for code, etc).

code.description: A string containing the JavaScript code to inject. Exactly one of file or code must be specified.
code.name: code

file.description: The path of the JavaScript file to inject relative to the extension's root directory. Exactly one of file or code must be specified.
file.name: file

allFrames.description: Whether the script will inject into all frames, regardless if it is not the top-most frame in the tab.
allFrames.name: allFrames

css.description: The list of CSS files to be injected into matching pages. Note that, today, we only expect these to contain files. It is represented as a ScriptSource for compatibility and consistency with `js`.
css.name: css

excludeMatches.description: Excludes pages that this user script would otherwise be injected into.
excludeMatches.name: excludeMatches

excludeGlobs.description: Specifies wildcard patterns for pages this user script will NOT be injected into.
excludeGlobs.name: excludeGlobs

id.description: The ID of the script.
id.name: id

includeGlobs.description: Specifies wildcard patterns for pages this user script will be injected into.
includeGlobs.name: includeGlobs

js.description: The list of sources of javascript to be injected into matching pages.
js.name: js

matches.description: Specifies which pages this user script will be injected into.
matches.name: matches

matchOriginAsFallback.description: Whether the script should inject into any frames where the URL belongs to a scheme that would never match a specified Match Pattern, including about:, data:, blob:, and filesystem: schemes.
matchOriginAsFallback.name: matchOriginAsFallback

runAt.description: Specifies when JavaScript files are injected into the web page.
runAt.name: runAt

world.description: The JavaScript "world" to run the script in.

worldId.description: The ID of the world into which to inject. If omitted, uses the default world.
worldId.name: worldId

serial.description: Use the chrome.serial API to read from and write to a device connected to a serial port.

path.description: The device's system path. This should be passed as the path argument to chrome.serial.connect in order to connect to this device.
path.name: path

vendorId.description: A PCI or USB vendor ID if one can be determined for the underlying device.
vendorId.name: vendorId

productId.description: A USB product ID if one can be determined for the underlying device.
productId.name: productId

displayName.description: A human-readable display name for the underlying device if one can be queried from the host driver.
displayName.name: displayName

persistent.description: Flag indicating whether or not the connection should be left open when the application is suspended (see Manage App Lifecycle). The default value is "false." When the application is loaded, any serial connections previously opened with persistent=true can be fetched with getConnections.
persistent.name: persistent

name.description: An application-defined string to associate with the connection.
name.name: name

bufferSize.description: The size of the buffer used to receive data. The default value is 4096.

bitrate.description: The requested bitrate of the connection to be opened. For compatibility with the widest range of hardware, this number should match one of commonly-available bitrates, such as 110, 300, 1200, 2400, 4800, 9600, 14400, 19200, 38400, 57600, 115200. There is no guarantee, of course, that the device connected to the serial port will support the requested bitrate, even if the port itself supports that bitrate. 9600 will be passed by default.
bitrate.name: bitrate

ctsFlowControl.description: Flag indicating whether or not to enable RTS/CTS hardware flow control. Defaults to false.
ctsFlowControl.name: ctsFlowControl

receiveTimeout.description: The maximum amount of time (in milliseconds) to wait for new data before raising an onReceiveError event with a "timeout" error. If zero, receive timeout errors will not be raised for the connection. Defaults to 0.
receiveTimeout.name: receiveTimeout

sendTimeout.description: The maximum amount of time (in milliseconds) to wait for a send operation to complete before calling the callback with a "timeout" error. If zero, send timeout errors will not be triggered. Defaults to 0.
sendTimeout.name: sendTimeout

socket.description: Use the chrome.socket API to send and receive data over the network using TCP and UDP connections. Note: Starting with Chrome 33, this API is deprecated in favor of the $(ref:sockets.udp), $(ref:sockets.tcp) and $(ref:sockets.tcpServer) APIs.

socketId.description: The id of the newly created socket.

socketId.description: The id of the accepted socket.
socketId.name: socketId

resultCode.description: The resultCode returned from the underlying read() call.
resultCode.name: resultCode

bytesWritten.description: The number of bytes sent, or a negative error code.
bytesWritten.name: bytesWritten

resultCode.description: The resultCode returned from the underlying recvfrom() call.
resultCode.name: resultCode

address.description: The address of the remote machine.
address.name: address

socketType.description: The type of the passed socket. This will be tcp or udp.
socketType.name: socketType

connected.description:
Whether or not the underlying socket is connected.

For tcp sockets, this will remain true even if the remote peer has disconnected. Reading or writing to the socket may then result in an error, hinting that this socket should be disconnected via disconnect().

For udp sockets, this just represents whether a default remote address has been specified for reading and writing packets.
connected.name: connected

peerAddress.description: If the underlying socket is connected, contains the IPv4/6 address of the peer.
peerAddress.name: peerAddress

peerPort.description: If the underlying socket is connected, contains the port of the connected peer.
peerPort.name: peerPort

localAddress.description: If the underlying socket is bound or connected, contains its local IPv4/6 address.
localAddress.name: localAddress

localPort.description: If the underlying socket is bound or connected, contains its local port.
localPort.name: localPort

name.description: The underlying name of the adapter. On *nix, this will typically be "eth0", "lo", etc.
name.name: name

min.description:
The minimum and maximum acceptable versions of TLS. Supported values are tls1.2 or tls1.3.

The values tls1 and tls1.1 are no longer supported. If |min| is set to one of these values, it will be silently clamped to tls1.2. If |max| is set to one of those values, or any other unrecognized value, it will be silently ignored.
min.name: min

functions.description:
Leave the multicast group previously joined using joinGroup. It's not necessary to leave the multicast group before destroying the socket or exiting. This is automatically called by the OS.

Leaving the group will prevent the router from sending multicast datagrams to the local host, presuming no other process on the host is still joined to the group.

functions.name: setMulticastTimeToLive

functions.description:
Set whether multicast packets sent from the host to the multicast group will be looped back to the host.

Note: the behavior of setMulticastLoopbackMode is slightly different between Windows and Unix-like systems. The inconsistency happens only when there is more than one application on the same host joined to the same multicast group while having different settings on multicast loopback mode. On Windows, the applications with loopback off will not RECEIVE the loopback packets; while on Unix-like systems, the applications with loopback off will not SEND the loopback packets to other applications on the same host. See MSDN: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/winsock/ip-multicast-2

Calling this method does not require multicast permissions.

parameters.name: socketId
parameters.description: The socketId.

parameters.name: enabled
parameters.description: Indicate whether to enable loopback mode.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Called when the configuration operation is done.
returns_async.does_not_support_promises: Sets error along with callback arguments crbug.com/1504372

sockets.tcp.description: Use the chrome.sockets.tcp API to send and receive data over the network using TCP connections. This API supersedes the TCP functionality previously found in the chrome.socket API.

persistent.description: Flag indicating if the socket is left open when the event page of the application is unloaded (see Manage App Lifecycle). The default value is "false." When the application is loaded, any sockets previously opened with persistent=true can be fetched with getSockets.

name.description: An application-defined string associated with the socket.

bufferSize.description: The size of the buffer used to receive data. The default value is 4096.

types.description: DNS resolution preferences. The default is any and uses the current OS config which may return IPv4 or IPv6. ipv4 forces IPv4, and ipv6 forces IPv6.

resultCode.description: The result code returned from the underlying network call. A negative value indicates an error.

bytesSent.description: The number of bytes sent (if result == 0)

The minimum and maximum acceptable versions of TLS. Supported values are tls1.2 or tls1.3.

The values tls1 and tls1.1 are no longer supported. If |min| is set to one of these values, it will be silently clamped to tls1.2. If |max| is set to one of those values, or any other unrecognized value, it will be silently ignored.

persistent.description: Flag indicating whether the socket is left open when the application is suspended (see SocketProperties.persistent).
persistent.name: persistent

functions.description:
Binds the local address and port for the socket. For a client socket, it is recommended to use port 0 to let the platform pick a free port.

Once the bind operation completes successfully, onReceive events are raised when UDP packets arrive on the address/port specified -- unless the socket is paused.

parameters.description: The port of the local machine. Use "0" to bind to a free port.

functions.name: joinGroup

functions.description:
Leaves the multicast group previously joined using joinGroup. This is only necessary to call if you plan to keep using the socketafterwards, since it will be done automatically by the OS when the socket is closed.

Leaving the group will prevent the router from sending multicast datagrams to the local host, presuming no other process on the host is still joined to the group.

parameters.name: socketId
parameters.description: The socket ID.

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: The group address to leave. Domain names are not supported.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Called when the leaveGroup operation completes.

parameters.name: result
parameters.description: The result code returned from the underlying network call. A negative value indicates an error.

returns_async.does_not_support_promises: Sets error along with callback arguments crbug.com/1504372

functions.name: setMulticastTimeToLive

functions.description:
Sets whether multicast packets sent from the host to the multicast group will be looped back to the host.

Note: the behavior of setMulticastLoopbackMode is slightly different between Windows and Unix-like systems. The inconsistency happens only when there is more than one application on the same host joined to the same multicast group while having different settings on multicast loopback mode. On Windows, the applications with loopback off will not RECEIVE the loopback packets; while on Unix-like systems, the applications with loopback off will not SEND the loopback packets to other applications on the same host. See MSDN: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/winsock/ip-multicast-2

Calling this method does not require multicast permissions.

parameters.name: socketId
parameters.description: The socket ID.

parameters.name: enabled
parameters.description: Indicate whether to enable loopback mode.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Called when the configuration operation completes.

parameters.name: result
parameters.description: The result code returned from the underlying network call. A negative value indicates an error.

returns_async.does_not_support_promises: Sets error along with callback arguments crbug.com/1504372

functions.name: getInfo
functions.description: Queries basic CPU information of the system.

user.name: user
user.description: The cumulative time used by userspace programs on this processor.

kernel.name: kernel
kernel.description: The cumulative time used by kernel programs on this processor.

idle.name: idle
idle.description: The cumulative time spent idle by this processor.

total.name: total
total.description: The total cumulative time for this processor.  This value is equal to user + kernel + idle.

usage.name: usage
usage.description: Cumulative usage info for this logical processor.

archName.name: archName
archName.description: The architecture name of the processors.

modelName.name: modelName
modelName.description: The model name of the processors.

features.name: features
features.description: A set of feature codes indicating some of the processor's capabilities. The currently supported codes are "mmx", "sse", "sse2", "sse3", "ssse3", "sse4_1", "sse4_2", and "avx".

temperatures.name: temperatures
temperatures.description:
List of CPU temperature readings from each thermal zone of the CPU. Temperatures are in degrees Celsius.

Currently supported on Chrome OS only.

system.cpu.description: Use the system.cpu API to query CPU metadata.

functions.description: Requests the information for all attached display devices.

parameters.name: flags
parameters.description: Options affecting how the information is returned.

returns_async.description: The callback to invoke with the results.
returns_async.name: callback

functions.name: getDisplayLayout
functions.description: Requests the layout info for all displays. NOTE: This is only available to ChromeOS Kiosk apps and Web UI.

returns_async.description: The callback to invoke with the results.
returns_async.name: callback

functions.name: setDisplayProperties
functions.description: Updates the properties for the display specified by |id|, according to the information provided in |info|. On failure, $(ref:runtime.lastError) will be set. NOTE: This is only available to ChromeOS Kiosk apps and Web UI.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The display's unique identifier.

parameters.name: info
parameters.description: The information about display properties that should be changed.     A property will be changed only if a new value for it is specified in     |info|.

returns_async.description: Empty function called when the function finishes. To find out     whether the function succeeded, $(ref:runtime.lastError) should be     queried.
returns_async.name: callback

functions.name: setDisplayLayout
functions.description: Set the layout for all displays. Any display not included will use the default layout. If a layout would overlap or be otherwise invalid it will be adjusted to a valid layout. After layout is resolved, an onDisplayChanged event will be triggered. NOTE: This is only available to ChromeOS Kiosk apps and Web UI.

parameters.name: layouts
parameters.description: The layout information, required for all displays except     the primary display.

returns_async.description: Empty function called when the function finishes. To find out     whether the function succeeded, $(ref:runtime.lastError) should be     queried.
returns_async.name: callback

functions.name: enableUnifiedDesktop
functions.description: Enables/disables the unified desktop feature. If enabled while mirroring is active, the desktop mode will not change until mirroring is turned off. Otherwise, the desktop mode will switch to unified immediately. NOTE: This is only available to ChromeOS Kiosk apps and Web UI.

parameters.name: enabled
parameters.description: True if unified desktop should be enabled.

functions.name: overscanCalibrationStart
functions.description: Starts overscan calibration for a display. This will show an overlay on the screen indicating the current overscan insets. If overscan calibration for display |id| is in progress this will reset calibration.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The display's unique identifier.

functions.name: overscanCalibrationAdjust
functions.description: Adjusts the current overscan insets for a display. Typically this should either move the display along an axis (e.g. left+right have the same value) or scale it along an axis (e.g. top+bottom have opposite values). Each Adjust call is cumulative with previous calls since Start.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The display's unique identifier.

parameters.name: delta
parameters.description: The amount to change the overscan insets.

functions.name: overscanCalibrationReset
functions.description: Resets the overscan insets for a display to the last saved value (i.e before Start was called).

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The display's unique identifier.

functions.name: overscanCalibrationComplete
functions.description: Complete overscan adjustments for a display  by saving the current values and hiding the overlay.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The display's unique identifier.

functions.name: showNativeTouchCalibration
functions.description: Displays the native touch calibration UX for the display with |id| as display id. This will show an overlay on the screen with required instructions on how to proceed. The callback will be invoked in case of successful calibration only. If the calibration fails, this will throw an error.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The display's unique identifier.

returns_async.description: Optional callback to inform the caller that the touch      calibration has ended. The argument of the callback informs if the      calibration was a success or not.
returns_async.name: callback

functions.name: startCustomTouchCalibration
functions.description: Starts custom touch calibration for a display. This should be called when using a custom UX for collecting calibration data. If another touch calibration is already in progress this will throw an error.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The display's unique identifier.

functions.name: completeCustomTouchCalibration
functions.description: Sets the touch calibration pairs for a display. These |pairs| would be used to calibrate the touch screen for display with |id| called in startCustomTouchCalibration(). Always call |startCustomTouchCalibration| before calling this method. If another touch calibration is already in progress this will throw an error.

parameters.name: pairs
parameters.description: The pairs of point used to calibrate the display.

parameters.name: bounds
parameters.description: Bounds of the display when the touch calibration was performed.     |bounds.left| and |bounds.top| values are ignored.

functions.name: clearTouchCalibration
functions.description: Resets the touch calibration for the display and brings it back to its default state by clearing any touch calibration data associated with the display.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The display's unique identifier.

functions.name: setMirrorMode
functions.description: Sets the display mode to the specified mirror mode. Each call resets the state from previous calls. Calling setDisplayProperties() will fail for the mirroring destination displays. NOTE: This is only available to ChromeOS Kiosk apps and Web UI.

parameters.name: info
parameters.description: The information of the mirror mode that should be applied to the     display mode.

returns_async.description: Empty function called when the function finishes. To find out     whether the function succeeded, $(ref:runtime.lastError) should be     queried.
returns_async.name: callback

types.description: An enum to tell if the display is detected and used by the system. The display is considered 'inactive', if it is not detected by the system (maybe disconnected, or considered disconnected due to sleep mode, etc). This state is used to keep existing display when the all displays are disconnected, for example.

id.name: id
id.description: The unique identifier of the display.

name.name: name
name.description: The user-friendly name (e.g. "HP LCD monitor").

edid.name: edid
edid.description: NOTE: This is only available to ChromeOS Kiosk apps and Web UI.

mirroringSourceId.name: mirroringSourceId
mirroringSourceId.description: ChromeOS only. Identifier of the display that is being mirrored if mirroring is enabled, otherwise empty. This will be set for all displays (including the display being mirrored).

mirroringDestinationIds.name: mirroringDestinationIds
mirroringDestinationIds.description: ChromeOS only. Identifiers of the displays to which the source display is being mirrored. Empty if no displays are being mirrored. This will be set to the same value for all displays. This must not include |mirroringSourceId|.

isPrimary.name: isPrimary
isPrimary.description: True if this is the primary display.

isInternal.name: isInternal
isInternal.description: True if this is an internal display.

isEnabled.name: isEnabled
isEnabled.description: True if this display is enabled.

activeState.name: activeState
activeState.description: Active if the display is detected and used by the system.

isUnified.name: isUnified
isUnified.description: True for all displays when in unified desktop mode. See documentation for $(ref:enableUnifiedDesktop).

isAutoRotationAllowed.name: isAutoRotationAllowed
isAutoRotationAllowed.description: True when the auto-rotation is allowed. It happens when the device is in a tablet physical state or kSupportsClamshellAutoRotation is set. Provided for ChromeOS Settings UI only. TODO(stevenjb): Remove when Settings switches to a mojo API.

dpiX.name: dpiX
dpiX.description: The number of pixels per inch along the x-axis.

dpiY.name: dpiY
dpiY.description: The number of pixels per inch along the y-axis.

rotation.name: rotation
rotation.description: The display's clockwise rotation in degrees relative to the vertical position. Currently exposed only on ChromeOS. Will be set to 0 on other platforms. A value of -1 will be interpreted as auto-rotate when the device is in a physical tablet state.

overscan.name: overscan
overscan.description: The display's insets within its screen's bounds. Currently exposed only on ChromeOS. Will be set to empty insets on other platforms.

workArea.name: workArea
workArea.description: The usable work area of the display within the display bounds. The work area excludes areas of the display reserved for OS, for example taskbar and launcher.

modes.name: modes
modes.description: The list of available display modes. The current mode will have isSelected=true. Only available on ChromeOS. Will be set to an empty array on other platforms.

hasTouchSupport.name: hasTouchSupport
hasTouchSupport.description: True if this display has a touch input device associated with it.

hasAccelerometerSupport.name: hasAccelerometerSupport
hasAccelerometerSupport.description: True if this display has an accelerometer associated with it. Provided for ChromeOS Settings UI only. TODO(stevenjb): Remove when Settings switches to a mojo API. NOTE: The name of this may change.

availableDisplayZoomFactors.name: availableDisplayZoomFactors
availableDisplayZoomFactors.description: A list of zoom factor values that can be set for the display.

displayZoomFactor.name: displayZoomFactor
displayZoomFactor.description: The ratio between the display's current and default zoom. For example, value 1 is equivalent to 100% zoom, and value 1.5 is equivalent to 150% zoom.

isUnified.name: isUnified
isUnified.description: ChromeOS only. If set to true, changes the display mode to unified desktop (see $(ref:enableUnifiedDesktop) for details). If set to false, unified desktop mode will be disabled. This is only valid for the primary display. If provided, mirroringSourceId must not be provided and other properties will be ignored. This is has no effect if not provided.

mirroringSourceId.name: mirroringSourceId
mirroringSourceId.description: ChromeOS only. If set and not empty, enables mirroring for this display only. Otherwise disables mirroring for all displays. This value should indicate the id of the source display to mirror, which must not be the same as the id passed to setDisplayProperties. If set, no other property may be set.

isPrimary.name: isPrimary
isPrimary.description: If set to true, makes the display primary. No-op if set to false. Note: If set, the display is considered primary for all other properties (i.e. $(ref:isUnified) may be set and bounds origin may not).

overscan.name: overscan
overscan.description: If set, sets the display's overscan insets to the provided values. Note that overscan values may not be negative or larger than a half of the screen's size. Overscan cannot be changed on the internal monitor.

rotation.name: rotation
rotation.description: If set, updates the display's rotation. Legal values are [0, 90, 180, 270]. The rotation is set clockwise, relative to the display's vertical position.

boundsOriginX.name: boundsOriginX
boundsOriginX.description: If set, updates the display's logical bounds origin along the x-axis. Applied together with $(ref:boundsOriginY). Defaults to the current value if not set and $(ref:boundsOriginY) is set. Note that when updating the display origin, some constraints will be applied, so the final bounds origin may be different than the one set. The final bounds can be retrieved using $(ref:getInfo). The bounds origin cannot be changed on the primary display.

boundsOriginY.name: boundsOriginY
boundsOriginY.description: If set, updates the display's logical bounds origin along the y-axis. See documentation for $(ref:boundsOriginX) parameter.

displayMode.name: displayMode
displayMode.description: If set, updates the display mode to the mode matching this value. If other parameters are invalid, this will not be applied. If the display mode is invalid, it will not be applied and an error will be set, but other properties will still be applied.

displayZoomFactor.name: displayZoomFactor
displayZoomFactor.description: If set, updates the zoom associated with the display. This zoom performs re-layout and repaint thus resulting in a better quality zoom than just performing a pixel by pixel stretch enlargement.

singleUnified.name: singleUnified
singleUnified.description: If set to true, only a single $(ref:DisplayUnitInfo) will be returned by $(ref:getInfo) when in unified desktop mode (see $(ref:enableUnifiedDesktop)). Defaults to false.

types.description: Mirror mode, i.e. different ways of how a display is mirrored to other displays.

enum.name: off
enum.description: Specifies the default mode (extended or unified desktop).

enum.name: normal
enum.description: Specifies that the default source display will be mirrored to all other displays.

enum.name: mixed
enum.description: Specifies that the specified source display will be mirrored to the provided destination displays. All other connected displays will be  extended.

mode.name: mode
mode.description: The mirror mode that should be set.

mirroringSourceId.name: mirroringSourceId
mirroringSourceId.description: The id of the mirroring source display. This is only valid for 'mixed'.

mirroringDestinationIds.name: mirroringDestinationIds
mirroringDestinationIds.description: The ids of the mirroring destination displays. This is only valid for 'mixed'.

events.name: onDisplayChanged
events.description: Fired when anything changes to the display configuration.

system.display.description: Use the system.display API to query display metadata.

functions.name: getInfo
functions.description: Get physical memory information.

capacity.name: capacity
capacity.description: The total amount of physical memory capacity, in bytes.

availableCapacity.name: availableCapacity
availableCapacity.description: The amount of available capacity, in bytes.

functions.name: getNetworkInterfaces
functions.description: Retrieves information about local adapters on this system.

parameters.name: networkInterfaces
parameters.description: Array of object containing network interfaces information.

returns_async.description: Called when local adapter information is available.
returns_async.name: callback

name.name: name
name.description: The underlying name of the adapter. On *nix, this will typically be "eth0", "wlan0", etc.

functions.name: getInfo
functions.description: Get the storage information from the system. The argument passed to the callback is an array of StorageUnitInfo objects.

functions.name: ejectDevice
functions.description: Ejects a removable storage device.

functions.name: getAvailableCapacity
functions.description: Get the available capacity of a specified |id| storage device. The |id| is the transient device ID from StorageUnitInfo.

enum.name: fixed
enum.description: The storage has fixed media, e.g. hard disk or SSD.

enum.name: removable
enum.description: The storage is removable, e.g. USB flash drive.

enum.name: unknown
enum.description: The storage type is unknown.

id.name: id
id.description: The transient ID that uniquely identifies the storage device. This ID will be persistent within the same run of a single application. It will not be a persistent identifier between different runs of an application, or between different applications.

name.name: name
name.description: The name of the storage unit.

type.name: type
type.description: The media type of the storage unit.

capacity.name: capacity
capacity.description: The total amount of the storage space, in bytes.

id.name: id
id.description: A copied |id| of getAvailableCapacity function parameter |id|.

availableCapacity.name: availableCapacity
availableCapacity.description: The available capacity of the storage device, in bytes.

enum.name: success
enum.description: The ejection command is successful -- the application can prompt the user to remove the device.

enum.name: in_use
enum.description: The device is in use by another application. The ejection did not succeed; the user should not remove the device until the other application is done with the device.

enum.name: no_such_device
enum.description: There is no such device known.

enum.name: failure
enum.description: The ejection command failed.

events.name: onAttached
events.description: Fired when a new removable storage is attached to the system.

events.name: onDetached
events.description: Fired when a removable storage is detached from the system.

system.storage.description: Use the chrome.system.storage API to query storage device information and be notified when a removable storage device is attached and detached.

functions.name: getDevices
functions.description: Enumerates connected USB devices.

parameters.name: options
parameters.description: The properties to search for on target devices.

functions.name: getUserSelectedDevices
functions.description: Presents a device picker to the user and returns the $(ref:Device)s selected. If the user cancels the picker devices will be empty. A user gesture is required for the dialog to display. Without a user gesture, the callback will run as though the user cancelled.

parameters.name: options

returns_async.description: Invoked with a list of chosen $(ref:Device)s.

functions.name: findDevices
functions.description:
Finds USB devices specified by the vendor, product and (optionally) interface IDs and if permissions allow opens them for use.

If the access request is rejected or the device fails to be opened a connection handle will not be created or returned.

Calling this method is equivalent to calling $(ref:getDevices) followed by $(ref:openDevice) for each device.

parameters.name: options
parameters.description: The properties to search for on target devices.

functions.description: Closes a connection handle. Invoking operations on a handle after it has been closed is a safe operation but causes no action to be taken.

parameters.name: handle
parameters.description: The $(ref:ConnectionHandle) to close.

functions.name: setConfiguration
functions.description:
Select a device configuration.

This function effectively resets the device by selecting one of the device's available configurations. Only configuration values greater than 0 are valid however some buggy devices have a working configuration 0 and so this value is allowed.

parameters.name: handle
parameters.description: An open connection to the device.

functions.name: getConfiguration
functions.description: Gets the configuration descriptor for the currently selected configuration.

parameters.name: handle
parameters.description: An open connection to the device.

functions.name: listInterfaces
functions.description: Lists all interfaces on a USB device.

parameters.name: handle
parameters.description: An open connection to the device.

functions.name: claimInterface
functions.description:
Claims an interface on a USB device. Before data can be transfered to an interface or associated endpoints the interface must be claimed. Only one connection handle can claim an interface at any given time. If the interface is already claimed, this call will fail.

$(ref:releaseInterface) should be called when the interface is no longer needed.

parameters.name: handle
parameters.description: An open connection to the device.

parameters.name: interfaceNumber
parameters.description: The interface to be claimed.

functions.name: releaseInterface
functions.description: Releases a claimed interface.

parameters.name: handle
parameters.description: An open connection to the device.

parameters.name: interfaceNumber
parameters.description: The interface to be released.

functions.name: setInterfaceAlternateSetting
functions.description: Selects an alternate setting on a previously claimed interface.

parameters.name: handle
parameters.description: An open connection to the device where this interface has been     claimed.

parameters.name: interfaceNumber
parameters.description: The interface to configure.

parameters.name: alternateSetting
parameters.description: The alternate setting to configure.

functions.name: controlTransfer
functions.description:
Performs a control transfer on the specified device.

Control transfers refer to either the device, an interface or an endpoint. Transfers to an interface or endpoint require the interface to be claimed.

parameters.name: handle
parameters.description: An open connection to the device.

functions.name: bulkTransfer
functions.description: Performs a bulk transfer on the specified device.

parameters.name: handle
parameters.description: An open connection to the device.

parameters.name: transferInfo
parameters.description: The transfer parameters.

functions.name: interruptTransfer
functions.description: Performs an interrupt transfer on the specified device.

parameters.name: handle
parameters.description: An open connection to the device.

parameters.name: transferInfo
parameters.description: The transfer parameters.

functions.name: isochronousTransfer
functions.description: Performs an isochronous transfer on the specific device.

parameters.name: handle
parameters.description: An open connection to the device.

functions.name: resetDevice
functions.description: Tries to reset the USB device. If the reset fails, the given connection handle will be closed and the USB device will appear to be disconnected then reconnected. In this case $(ref:getDevices) or $(ref:findDevices) must be called again to acquire the device.

parameters.name: handle
parameters.description: A connection handle to reset.

types.description: Direction, Recipient, RequestType, and TransferType all map to their namesakes within the USB specification.
For interrupt and isochronous modes, SynchronizationType and UsageType map to their namesakes within the USB specification.

device.name: device
device.description: An opaque ID for the USB device. It remains unchanged until the device is unplugged.

productName.name: productName
productName.description: The iProduct string read from the device, if available.

manufacturerName.name: manufacturerName
manufacturerName.description: The iManufacturer string read from the device, if available.

serialNumber.name: serialNumber
serialNumber.description: The iSerialNumber string read from the device, if available.

handle.name: handle
handle.description: An opaque handle representing this connection to the USB device and all associated claimed interfaces and pending transfers. A new handle is created each time the device is opened. The connection handle is different from $(ref:Device.device).

type.name: type
type.description: Transfer type.

extra_data.name: extra_data
extra_data.description: Extra descriptor data associated with this endpoint.

alternateSetting.name: alternateSetting
alternateSetting.description: The interface alternate setting number (defaults to <code>0</code).

extra_data.name: extra_data
extra_data.description: Extra descriptor data associated with this interface.

maxPower.name: maxPower
maxPower.description: The maximum power needed by this device in milliamps (mA).

extra_data.name: extra_data
extra_data.description: Extra descriptor data associated with this configuration.

recipient.name: recipient
recipient.description: The transfer target. The target given by index must be claimed if "interface" or "endpoint".

request.name: request
request.description: The bRequest field, see Universal Serial Bus Specification Revision 1.1 § 9.3.

value.name: value
value.description: The wValue field, see Ibid.

length.name: length
length.description: The maximum number of bytes to receive (required only by input transfers).

data.name: data
data.description: The data to transmit (required only by output transfers).

timeout.name: timeout
timeout.description: Request timeout (in milliseconds). The default value 0 indicates no timeout.

endpoint.name: endpoint
endpoint.description: The target endpoint address. The interface containing this endpoint must be claimed.

length.name: length
length.description: The maximum number of bytes to receive (required only by input transfers).

data.name: data
data.description: The data to transmit (required only by output transfers).

timeout.name: timeout
timeout.description: Request timeout (in milliseconds). The default value 0 indicates no timeout.

transferInfo.name: transferInfo
transferInfo.description: Transfer parameters. The transfer length or data buffer specified in this parameter block is split along packetLength boundaries to form the individual packets of the transfer.

packets.name: packets
packets.description: The total number of packets in this transfer.

packetLength.name: packetLength
packetLength.description: The length of each of the packets in this transfer.

resultCode.name: resultCode
resultCode.description: A value of 0 indicates that the transfer was a success. Other values indicate failure.

data.name: data
data.description: The data returned by an input transfer. undefined for output transfers.

productId.name: productId
productId.description: Device product ID, checked only if the vendor ID matches.

interfaceClass.name: interfaceClass
interfaceClass.description: USB interface class, matches any interface on the device.

interfaceSubclass.name: interfaceSubclass
interfaceSubclass.description: USB interface sub-class, checked only if the interface class matches.

interfaceProtocol.name: interfaceProtocol
interfaceProtocol.description: USB interface protocol, checked only if the interface sub-class matches.

filters.name: filters
filters.description: A device matching any given filter will be returned. An empty filter list will return all devices the app has permission for.

interfaceId.name: interfaceId
interfaceId.description: The interface ID to request access to. Only available on Chrome OS. It has no effect on other platforms.

multiple.name: multiple
multiple.description: Allow the user to select multiple devices.

filters.name: filters
filters.description: Filter the list of devices presented to the user. If multiple filters are provided devices matching any filter will be displayed.

events.name: onDeviceAdded
events.description: Event generated when a device is added to the system. Events are only broadcast to apps and extensions that have permission to access the device. Permission may have been granted at install time, when the user accepted an optional permission (see $(ref:permissions.request)), or through $(ref:getUserSelectedDevices).

events.name: onDeviceRemoved
events.description: Event generated when a device is removed from the system. See $(ref:onDeviceAdded) for which events are delivered.

usb.description: Use the chrome.usb API to interact with connected USB devices. This API provides access to USB operations from within the context of an app. Using this API, apps can function as drivers for hardware devices. Errors generated by this API are reported by setting $(ref:runtime.lastError) and executing the function's regular callback. The callback's regular parameters will be undefined in this case.

userScripts.description: Use the userScripts API to execute user scripts in the User Scripts context.

types.description: The JavaScript world for a user script to execute within.

enum.name: MAIN
enum.description: Specifies the execution environment of the DOM, which is the execution environment shared with the host page's JavaScript.

enum.name: USER_SCRIPT
enum.description: Specifies the execution environment that is specific to user scripts and is exempt from the page's CSP.

code.description: A string containing the JavaScript code to inject. Exactly one of file or code must be specified.
code.name: code

file.description: The path of the JavaScript file to inject relative to the extension's root directory. Exactly one of file or code must be specified.
file.name: file

allFrames.description: If true, it will inject into all frames, even if the frame is not the top-most frame in the tab. Each frame is checked independently for URL requirements; it will not inject into child frames if the URL requirements are not met. Defaults to false, meaning that only the top frame is matched.
allFrames.name: allFrames

excludeMatches.description: Excludes pages that this user script would otherwise be injected into. See Match Patterns for more details on the syntax of these strings.
excludeMatches.name: excludeMatches

id.description: The ID of the user script specified in the API call. This property must not start with a '_' as it's reserved as a prefix for generated script IDs.
id.name: id

includeGlobs.description: Specifies wildcard patterns for pages this user script will be injected into.
includeGlobs.name: includeGlobs

excludeGlobs.description: Specifies wildcard patterns for pages this user script will NOT be injected into.
excludeGlobs.name: excludeGlobs

js.description: The list of ScriptSource objects defining sources of scripts to be injected into matching pages. This property must be specified for  ${ref:register}, and when specified it must be a non-empty array.
js.name: js

matches.description: Specifies which pages this user script will be injected into. See Match Patterns for more details on the syntax of these strings. This property must be specified for ${ref:register}.
matches.name: matches

runAt.description: Specifies when JavaScript files are injected into the web page. The preferred and default value is document_idle.
runAt.name: runAt

world.description: The JavaScript execution environment to run the script in. The default is `USER_SCRIPT`.
world.name: world

worldId.description: Specifies the user script world ID to execute in. If omitted, the script will execute in the default user script world. Only valid if `world` is omitted or is `USER_SCRIPT`. Values with leading underscores (`_`) are reserved.
worldId.name: worldId

ids.description: $(ref:getScripts) only returns scripts with the IDs specified in this list.
ids.name: ids

allFrames.description: Whether the script should inject into all frames within the tab. Defaults to false. This must not be true if frameIds is specified.
allFrames.name: allFrames

documentIds.description: The IDs of specific documentIds to inject into. This must not be set if frameIds is set.
documentIds.name: documentIds

frameIds.description: The IDs of specific frames to inject into.
frameIds.name: frameIds

tabId.description: The ID of the tab into which to inject.
tabId.name: tabId

documentId.description: The document associated with the injection.
documentId.name: documentId

frameId.description: The frame associated with the injection.
frameId.name: frameId

result.description: The result of the script execution.
result.name: result

error.description: The error, if any. error and result are mutually exclusive.
error.name: error

injectImmediately.description: Whether the injection should be triggered in the target as soon as possible. Note that this is not a guarantee that injection will occur prior to page load, as the page may have already loaded by the time the script reaches the target.
injectImmediately.name: injectImmediately

js.description: The list of ScriptSource objects defining sources of scripts to be injected into the target.
js.name: js

target.description: Details specifying the target into which to inject the script.
target.name: target

world.description: The JavaScript "world" to run the script in. The default is USER_SCRIPT.
world.name: world

worldId.description: Specifies the user script world ID to execute in. If omitted, the script will execute in the default user script world. Only valid if `world` is omitted or is `USER_SCRIPT`. Values with leading underscores (`_`) are reserved.
worldId.name: worldId

worldId.description: Specifies the ID of the specific user script world to update. If not provided, updates the properties of the default user script world. Values with leading underscores (`_`) are reserved.
worldId.name: worldId

csp.description: Specifies the world csp. The default is the `ISOLATED` world csp.
csp.name: csp

messaging.description: Specifies whether messaging APIs are exposed. The default is false.
messaging.name: messaging

If there are errors during script parsing/file validation, or if the IDs specified do not correspond to a fully registered script, then no scripts are updated.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Called once scripts have been fully updated or if an error occurs.

functions.name: update

functions.description: Injects a script into a target context. By default, the script will be run at document_idle, or immediately if the page has already loaded. If the injectImmediately property is set, the script will inject without waiting, even if the page has not finished loading. If the script evaluates to a promise, the browser will wait for the promise to settle and return the resulting value.

functions.name: openSerialWebcam
functions.description: Open a serial port that controls a webcam.

functions.name: closeWebcam
functions.description: Close a serial port connection to a webcam.

functions.name: get
functions.description: Retrieve webcam parameters. Will respond with a config holding the requested values that are available, or default values for those that aren't. If none of the requests succeed, will respond with an error.

functions.name: set
functions.description: A callback is included here which is invoked when the function responds. No configuration is returned through it.

functions.name: reset
functions.description: Reset a webcam. Note: the value of the parameter have no effect, it's the presence of the parameter that matters. E.g.: reset(webcamId, {pan: 0, tilt: 1}); will reset pan & tilt, but not zoom. A callback is included here which is invoked when the function responds. No configuration is returned through it.

functions.name: setHome
functions.description: Set home preset for a webcam. A callback is included here which is invoked when the function responds.

functions.name: restoreCameraPreset
functions.description: Restore the camera's position to that of the specified preset. A callback is included here which is invoked when the function responds.

functions.name: setCameraPreset
functions.description: Set the current camera's position to be stored for the specified preset. A callback is included here which is invoked when the function responds.

panRange.name: panRange
panRange.description: Supported range of pan, tilt and zoom values.

types.description: A copy of FieldType from components/autofill/core/browser/field_types.h.
The address record type. Describes where the address is stored.

enum.name: LOCAL_OR_SYNCABLE
enum.description: The address is stored in the Chrome infrastructure (locally and possibly synced between devices).

enum.name: ACCOUNT
enum.description: The address is stored in a third party service that is tied to user's account.

enum.name: ACCOUNT_NAME_EMAIL
enum.description: The address is stored locally. Not synced at all.

types.description: The type of data that can be stored for an attribute type.

summaryLabel.description: Short summary of the address/credit card which is displayed in the UI; an undefined value means that this entry has just been created on the client and has not yet been given a summary.
summaryLabel.name: summaryLabel

summarySublabel.description: Short, secondary summary of the address/credit card which is displayed in the UI; an undefined value means that this entry has just been created on the client and has not yet been given a summary.
summarySublabel.name: summarySublabel

recordType.description: For addresses. Describes where the address is stored.
recordType.name: recordType

isLocal.description: For credit cards, whether the entry is locally owned by Chrome (as opposed to being synced down from the server). Non-local entries may not be editable.
isLocal.name: isLocal

isMigratable.description: For credit cards, whether this is migratable (both the card number and expiration date valid and does not have the duplicated server card).

types.description: Braille display keyboard command.

displayPosition.description: 0-based display position for commands that involve a routing key.
displayPosition.name: displayPosition

brailleDots.description: Braille dot keys that were pressed, stored in the low-order bits. Dot 1 is stored in bit 0, dot2 in bit 1, etc.
brailleDots.name: brailleDots

standardKeyCode.description: DOM keyboard event code.  This is present when command is standard_key and the braille display event represents a non-alphanumeric key such as an arrow key or function key. The value is as defined by the |code| property in http://www.w3.org/TR/uievents/#keyboard-event-interface
standardKeyCode.name: standardKeyCode

standardKeyChar.description: DOM keyboard event character value.  This is present if the braille key event corresponds to a character.
standardKeyChar.name: standardKeyChar

spaceKey.description: Whether the space key was pressed.
spaceKey.name: spaceKey

altKey.description: Whether the alt key was pressed.
altKey.name: altKey

shiftKey.description: Whether the shift key was pressed.
shiftKey.name: shiftKey

ctrlKey.description: Whether the ctrl key was pressed.
ctrlKey.name: ctrlKey

available.description: Whether a braille display is currently available.
available.name: available

textRowCount.description: Number of rows of braille cells on the currently connected display.
textRowCount.name: textRowCount

textColumnCount.description: Number of columns of braille cells on the currently connected display.
textColumnCount.name: textColumnCount

cellSize.description: The number of dots in a braille cell on the currently connected display.
cellSize.name: cellSize

functions.description: Gets the current display state.
functions.name: getDisplayState

functions.description: Write the given dot patterns to the display.  The buffer contains one byte for each braille cell on the display, starting from the leftmost cell. Each byte contains a bit pattern indicating which dots should be raised in the corresponding cell with the low-order bit representing dot 1 and so on until bit 7 which corresponds to dot 8.  If the number of bytes in the buffer is not equal to the display size, the buffer will either be clipped or padded with blank cells on the right. The buffer is a 2D array compressed into 1D. The |columns| and |rows| parameters give the original 2D dimensions of the buffer. To access an element cells[r][c], simply access cells[r * columns + c].
functions.name: writeDots

functions.description: Updates the single user-preferred braille device with the given bluetooth device address and starts or restarts the Brltty daemon.
functions.name: updateBluetoothBrailleDisplayAddress

events.name: onDisplayStateChanged

certificateProvider.description: Use this API to expose certificates to the platform which can use these certificates for TLS authentications.

types.description: Types of supported cryptographic signature algorithms.

enum.name: RSASSA_PKCS1_v1_5_MD5_SHA1
enum.description: Specifies the RSASSA PKCS#1 v1.5 signature algorithm with the MD5-SHA-1 hashing. The extension must not prepend a DigestInfo prefix but only add PKCS#1 padding. This algorithm is deprecated and will never be requested  by Chrome as of version 109.

enum.name: RSASSA_PKCS1_v1_5_SHA1
enum.description: Specifies the RSASSA PKCS#1 v1.5 signature algorithm with the SHA-1 hash function.

enum.name: RSASSA_PKCS1_v1_5_SHA256
enum.description: Specifies the RSASSA PKCS#1 v1.5 signature algorithm with the SHA-256 hashing function.

enum.name: RSASSA_PKCS1_v1_5_SHA384
enum.description: Specifies the RSASSA PKCS#1 v1.5 signature algorithm with the SHA-384 hashing function.

enum.name: RSASSA_PKCS1_v1_5_SHA512
enum.description: Specifies the RSASSA PKCS#1 v1.5 signature algorithm with the SHA-512 hashing function.

enum.name: RSASSA_PSS_SHA256
enum.description: Specifies the RSASSA PSS signature algorithm with the SHA-256 hashing function, MGF1 mask generation function and the salt of the same size as the hash.

enum.name: RSASSA_PSS_SHA384
enum.description: Specifies the RSASSA PSS signature algorithm with the SHA-384 hashing function, MGF1 mask generation function and the salt of the same size as the hash.

enum.name: RSASSA_PSS_SHA512
enum.description: Specifies the RSASSA PSS signature algorithm with the SHA-512 hashing function, MGF1 mask generation function and the salt of the same size as the hash.

types.description: Types of errors that the extension can report.

enum.name: GENERAL_ERROR
enum.description: General error that cannot be represented by other more specific error codes.

certificateChain.description:
The array must contain the DER encoding of the X.509 client certificate as its first element.

This must include exactly one certificate.
certificateChain.name: certificateChain

supportedAlgorithms.description: All algorithms supported for this certificate. The extension will only be asked for signatures using one of these algorithms.
supportedAlgorithms.name: supportedAlgorithms

certificatesRequestId.description: When called in response to $(ref:onCertificatesUpdateRequested), should contain the received certificatesRequestId value. Otherwise, should be unset.
certificatesRequestId.name: certificatesRequestId

error.description: Error that occurred while extracting the certificates, if any. This error will be surfaced to the user when appropriate.
error.name: error

clientCertificates.description: List of currently available client certificates.
clientCertificates.name: clientCertificates

certificatesRequestId.description: Request identifier to be passed to $(ref:setCertificates).
certificatesRequestId.name: certificatesRequestId

signRequestId.description: Request identifier to be passed to $(ref:reportSignature).
signRequestId.name: signRequestId

input.description: Data to be signed. Note that the data is not hashed.
input.name: input

certificate.description: The DER encoding of a X.509 certificate. The extension must sign input using the associated private key.
certificate.name: certificate

signRequestId.description: Request identifier that was received via the $(ref:onSignatureRequested) event.
signRequestId.name: signRequestId

error.description: Error that occurred while generating the signature, if any.
error.name: error

types.description: Deprecated. Replaced by $(ref:Algorithm).

enum.name: MD5_SHA1
enum.description: Specifies the MD5 and SHA1 hashing algorithms.

enum.name: SHA1
enum.description: Specifies the SHA1 hashing algorithm.

enum.name: SHA256
enum.description: Specifies the SHA256 hashing algorithm.

enum.name: SHA384
enum.description: Specifies the SHA384 hashing algorithm.

enum.name: SHA512
enum.description: Specifies the SHA512 hashing algorithm.

types.description: The type of code being requested by the extension with requestPin function.

enum.name: PIN
enum.description: Specifies the requested code is a PIN.

enum.name: PUK
enum.description: Specifies the requested code is a PUK.

types.description: The types of errors that can be presented to the user through the requestPin function.

enum.name: INVALID_PIN
enum.description: Specifies the PIN is invalid.

enum.name: INVALID_PUK
enum.description: Specifies the PUK is invalid.

enum.name: MAX_ATTEMPTS_EXCEEDED
enum.description: Specifies the maximum attempt number has been exceeded.

enum.name: UNKNOWN_ERROR
enum.description: Specifies that the error cannot be represented by the above types.

certificate.description: Must be the DER encoding of a X.509 certificate. Currently, only certificates of RSA keys are supported.
certificate.name: certificate

supportedHashes.description: Must be set to all hashes supported for this certificate. This extension will only be asked for signatures of digests calculated with one of these hash algorithms. This should be in order of decreasing hash preference.
supportedHashes.name: supportedHashes

signRequestId.description: The unique ID to be used by the extension should it need to call a method that requires it, e.g. requestPin.
signRequestId.name: signRequestId

digest.description: The digest that must be signed.
digest.name: digest

hash.description: Refers to the hash algorithm that was used to create digest.
hash.name: hash

certificate.description: The DER encoding of a X.509 certificate. The extension must sign digest using the associated private key.
certificate.name: certificate

signRequestId.description: The ID given by Chrome in SignRequest.
signRequestId.name: signRequestId

requestType.description: The type of code requested. Default is PIN.
requestType.name: requestType

errorType.description: The error template displayed to the user. This should be set if the previous request failed, to notify the user of the failure reason.
errorType.name: errorType

attemptsLeft.description: The number of attempts left. This is provided so that any UI can present this information to the user. Chrome is not expected to enforce this, instead stopPinRequest should be called by the extension with errorType = MAX_ATTEMPTS_EXCEEDED when the number of pin requests is exceeded.
attemptsLeft.name: attemptsLeft

signRequestId.description: The ID given by Chrome in SignRequest.
signRequestId.name: signRequestId

errorType.description: The error template. If present it is displayed to user. Intended to contain the reason for stopping the flow if it was caused by an error, e.g. MAX_ATTEMPTS_EXCEEDED.
errorType.name: errorType

userInput.description: The code provided by the user. Empty if user closed the dialog or some other error occurred.
userInput.name: userInput

functions.description:
Should be called as a response to $(ref:onSignatureRequested).

The extension must eventually call this function for every $(ref:onSignatureRequested) event; the API implementation will stop waiting for this call after some time and respond with a timeout error when this function is called.
functions.name: reportSignature

events.description: This event fires if the certificates set via $(ref:setCertificates) are insufficient or the browser requests updated information. The extension must call $(ref:setCertificates) with the updated list of certificates and the received certificatesRequestId.
events.name: onCertificatesUpdateRequested

events.description:
This event fires every time the browser needs to sign a message using a certificate provided by this extension via $(ref:setCertificates).

The extension must sign the input data from request using the appropriate algorithm and private key and return it by calling $(ref:reportSignature) with the received signRequestId.
events.name: onSignatureRequested

events.description: This event fires every time the browser requests the current list of certificates provided by this extension. The extension must call reportCallback exactly once with the current list of certificates.

parameters.name: reportCallback
parameters.description: Call this exactly once with the list of certificates that this extension is providing. The list must only contain certificates for which the extension can sign data using the associated private key. If the list contains invalid certificates, these will be ignored. All valid certificates are still registered for the extension. Chrome will call back with the list of rejected certificates, which might be empty.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: The callback provided by the extension that Chrome uses to report back rejected certificates. See CertificatesCallback.

events.name: onCertificatesRequested

events.description: This event fires every time the browser needs to sign a message using a certificate provided by this extension in reply to an $(ref:onCertificatesRequested) event. The extension must sign the data in request using the appropriate algorithm and private key and return it by calling reportCallback. reportCallback must be called exactly once.

parameters.name: request
parameters.description: Contains the details about the sign request.

parameters.name: reportCallback
parameters.description: If no error occurred, this function must be called with the signature of the digest using the private key of the requested certificate. For an RSA key, the signature must be a PKCS#1 signature. The extension is responsible for prepending the DigestInfo prefix and adding PKCS#1 padding. If an error occurred, this callback should be called without signature.

events.name: onSignDigestRequested

certificateProviderInternal.description: Internal API backing the chrome.certificateProvider API events. The internal API associates events with replies to these events using request IDs. A custom binding is used to hide these IDs from the public API. Before an event hits the extension, the request ID is removed and instead a callback is added to the event arguments. On the way back, when the extension runs the callback to report its results, the callback magically prepends the request ID to the results and calls the respective internal report function (reportSignature or reportCertificates).

functions.description: Matches certificateProvider.SignCallback. Must be called without the signature to report an error.
functions.name: reportSignature

functions.description: Matches certificateProvider.CertificatesCallback. Must be called without the certificates argument to report an error.
functions.name: reportCertificates

lineNumber.description: Line number where the error occurred.

columnNumber.description: Column number where the error occurred.

debugId.name: debugId

stackTrace.description: String containing the stack trace for the error. Defaults to the empty string.
stackTrace.name: stackTrace

types.description: Describes which set of sites a given url/string is associated with. Note that a site can belong to multiple sets at the same time.

enum.name: USER_PERMITTED
enum.description: The site is specified by the user to automatically grant access to all extensions with matching host permissions. Mutually exclusive with USER_RESTRICTED but takes precedence over EXTENSION_SPECIFIED.

enum.name: USER_RESTRICTED
enum.description: The site is specified by the user to disallow all extensions from running on it. Mutually exclusive with USER_PERMITTED but takes precedence over EXTENSION_SPECIFIED.

enum.name: EXTENSION_SPECIFIED
enum.description: The site is specified by one or more extensions' set of host permissions.

siteSet.description: Specifies which set of user specified sites that the host will be added to or removed from.

permittedSites.description: The list of origins where the user has allowed all extensions to run on.

restrictedSites.description: The list of origins where the user has blocked all extensions from running on.

siteSet.description: The site set that `site` belongs to.
