numExtensions.description: The number of extensions with access to `site`. TODO(crbug.com/40227416): A tricky edge case is when one extension specifies something like *.foo.com and another specifies foo.com. Patterns which match all subdomains should be represented differently.

site.description: The site itself. This could either be a user specified site or an extension host permission pattern.

etldPlusOne.description: The common effective top level domain plus one (eTLD+1) for all sites in `sites`.

id.description: The id of the matching extension.

siteAccess.description: Describes the extension's access to the queried site from getMatchingExtensionsForSite. Note that the meaning is different from the original enum: - ON_CLICK: The extension requested access to the site but its access is   withheld. - ON_SPECIFIC_SITES: the extension is permitted to run on at least one   site specified by the queried site but it does not request access to   all sites or it has its access withheld on at least one site in its   host permissions. - ON_ALL_SITES: the extension is permitted to run on all sites.
siteAccess.name: siteAccess

canRequestAllSites.description: Whether the matching extension requests access to all sites in its host permissions.
canRequestAllSites.name: canRequestAllSites

id.description: The id of the extension to update its site access settings for.
id.name: id

siteAccess.description: Describes the update made to the extension's site access for a given site Note that this has a different meaning from the original enum: - ON_CLICK: Withholds the extension's access to the given site, - ON_SPECIFIC_SITES: Grants the extension access to the intersection of   (given site, extension's specified host permissions.) - ON_ALL_SITES: Grants access to all of the extension's specified host   permissions.
siteAccess.name: siteAccess

types.description: An enum that indicates the result of each operation.

enum.name: UNKNOWN
enum.description: An unknown or generic failure occurred.

enum.name: SUCCESS
enum.description: The operation succeeded.

enum.name: UNSUPPORTED
enum.description: The operation is not supported.

enum.name: CANCELLED
enum.description: The operation was cancelled.

enum.name: DEVICE_BUSY
enum.description: The device is busy.

enum.name: INVALID
enum.description: Either the data or an argument passed to the method is not valid.

enum.name: WRONG_TYPE
enum.description: The supplied value is the wrong data type for the underlying option.

enum.name: EOF
enum.description: No more data is available.

enum.name: ADF_JAMMED
enum.description: The document feeder is jammed.

enum.name: ADF_EMPTY
enum.description: The document feeder is empty.

enum.name: COVER_OPEN
enum.description: The flatbed cover is open.

enum.name: IO_ERROR
enum.description: An error occurred while communicating with the device.

enum.name: ACCESS_DENIED
enum.description: The device requires authentication.

enum.name: NO_MEMORY
enum.description: Not enough memory is available on the Chromebook to complete the operation.

enum.name: UNREACHABLE
enum.description: The device is not reachable.

enum.name: MISSING
enum.description: The device is disconnected.

enum.name: INTERNAL_ERROR
enum.description: An error has occurred somewhere other than the calling application.

types.description: Indicates how the scanner is connected to the computer.

scannerId.description: The ID of a specific scanner.

name.description: A human-readable name for the scanner to display in the UI.
name.name: name

model.description: The scanner model if it is available, or a generic description.
model.name: model

deviceUuid.description: For matching against other ScannerInfo entries that point to the same physical device.
deviceUuid.name: deviceUuid

connectionType.description: Indicates how the scanner is connected to the computer.
connectionType.name: connectionType

secure.description: If true, the scanner connection's transport cannot be intercepted by a passive listener, such as TLS or USB.
secure.name: secure

imageFormats.description: An array of MIME types that can be requested for returned scans.
imageFormats.name: imageFormats

protocolType.description: A human-readable description of the protocol or driver used to access the scanner, such as Mopria, WSD, or epsonds. This is primarily useful for allowing a user to choose between protocols if a device supports multiple protocols.
protocolType.name: protocolType

types.description: The data type of an option.

enum.name: UNKNOWN
enum.description: The option's data type is unknown. The value property will be unset.

enum.name: BOOL
enum.description: The value property will be one of truefalse.

enum.name: INT
enum.description: A signed 32-bit integer. The value property will be long or long[], depending on whether the option takes more than one value.

enum.name: FIXED
enum.description: A double in the range -32768-32767.9999 with a resolution of 1/65535. The value property will be double or double[] depending on whether the option takes more than one value. Double values that can't be exactly represented will be rounded to the available range and precision.

enum.name: STRING
enum.description: A sequence of any bytes except NUL ('\0'). The value property will be a DOMString.

enum.name: BUTTON
enum.description: An option of this type has no value. Instead, setting an option of this type causes an option-specific side effect in the scanner driver. For example, a button-typed option could be used by a scanner driver to provide a means to select default values or to tell an automatic document feeder to advance to the next sheet of paper.

enum.name: GROUP
enum.description: Grouping option. No value. This is included for compatibility, but will not normally be returned in ScannerOption values. Use getOptionGroups() to retrieve the list of groups with their member options.

types.description: Indicates the data type for $(ref:ScannerOption.unit).

enum.name: UNITLESS
enum.description: The value is a unitless number. For example, it can be a threshold.

enum.name: PIXEL
enum.description: The value is a number of pixels, for example, scan dimensions.

enum.name: BIT
enum.description: The value is the number of bits, for example, color depth.

enum.name: MM
enum.description: The value is measured in millimeters, for example, scan dimensions.

enum.name: DPI
enum.description: The value is measured in dots per inch, for example, resolution.

enum.name: PERCENT
enum.description: The value is a percent, for example, brightness.

enum.name: MICROSECOND
enum.description: The value is measured in microseconds, for example, exposure time.

types.description: The data type of constraint represented by an $(ref:OptionConstraint).

enum.name: INT_RANGE
enum.description: The constraint on a range of OptionType.INT values. The min, max, and quant properties of OptionConstraint will be long, and its list propety will be unset.

enum.name: FIXED_RANGE
enum.description: The constraint on a range of OptionType.FIXED values. The min, max, and quant properties of OptionConstraint will be double, and its list property will be unset.

enum.name: INT_LIST
enum.description: The constraint on a specific list of OptionType.INT values. The OptionConstraint.list property will contain long values, and the other properties will be unset.

enum.name: FIXED_LIST
enum.description: The constraint on a specific list of OptionType.FIXED values. The OptionConstraint.list property will contain double values, and the other properties will be unset.

enum.name: STRING_LIST
enum.description: The constraint on a specific list of OptionType.STRING values. The OptionConstraint.list property will contain DOMString values, and the other properties will be unset.

types.description: How an option can be changed.

enum.name: NOT_CONFIGURABLE
enum.description: The option is read-only.

enum.name: SOFTWARE_CONFIGURABLE
enum.description: The option can be set in software.

enum.name: HARDWARE_CONFIGURABLE
enum.description: The option can be set by the user toggling or pushing a button on the scanner.

options.description:
An updated key-value mapping from option names to $(ref:ScannerOption) values containing the new configuration after attempting to set all supplied options. This has the same structure as the options property in $(ref:OpenScannerResponse).

This property will be set even if some options were not set successfully, but will be unset if retrieving the updated configuration fails (for example, if the scanner is disconnected in the middle of scanning).
options.name: options

format.description: Specifies the MIME type to return scanned data in.
format.name: format

maxReadSize.description: If a non-zero value is specified, limits the maximum scanned bytes returned in a single $(ref:readScanData) response to that value.  The smallest allowed value is 32768 (32 KB).  If this property is not specified, the size of a returned chunk may be as large as the entire scanned image.
maxReadSize.name: maxReadSize

scannerHandle.description: Provides the same scanner handle that was passed to startScan().
scannerHandle.name: scannerHandle

result.description: The result of starting a scan. If the value of this is SUCCESS, the job property will be populated.
result.name: result

job.description: If result is SUCCESS, provides a handle that can be used to read scan data or cancel the job.
job.name: job

job.description: Provides the same job handle that was passed to cancelScan().
job.name: job

result.description: The backend's cancel scan result. If the result is OperationResult.SUCCESS or OperationResult.CANCELLED, the scan has been cancelled and the scanner is ready to start a new scan. If the result is OperationResult.DEVICE_BUSY , the scanner is still processing the requested cancellation; the caller should wait a short time and try the request again. Other result values indicate a permanent error that should not be retried.
result.name: result

job.description: Provides the job handle passed to readScanData().
job.name: job

result.description: The result of reading data. If its value is SUCCESS, then data contains the next (possibly zero-length) chunk of image data that is ready for reading. If its value is EOF, the data contains the last chunk of image data.
result.name: result

data.description: If result is SUCCESS, contains the next chunk of scanned image data. If result is EOF, contains the last chunk of scanned image data.
data.name: data

estimatedCompletion.description: If result is SUCCESS, an estimate of how much of the total scan data has been delivered so far, in the range 0 to 100.
estimatedCompletion.name: estimatedCompletion

functions.description: Performs a document scan and returns a Promise that resolves with a $(ref:ScanResults) object. If a callback is passed to this function, the returned data is passed to it instead.

parameters.name: options
parameters.description: An object containing scan parameters.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Called with the result and data from the scan.

functions.name: scan

functions.description: Gets the list of available scanners and returns a Promise that resolves with a $(ref:GetScannerListResponse) object. If a callback is passed to this function, returned data is passed to it instead.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: A $(ref:DeviceFilter) indicating which types of scanners should be returned.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Called with the result and list of scanners.

functions.name: getScannerList

functions.description: Opens a scanner for exclusive access and returns a Promise that resolves with an $(ref:OpenScannerResponse) object. If a callback is passed to this function, returned data is passed to it instead.

parameters.name: scannerId
parameters.description: The ID of a scanner to be opened. This value is one returned from a previous call to $(ref:getScannerList).

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Called with the result.

functions.name: openScanner

functions.description: Gets the group names and member options from a scanner previously opened by $(ref:openScanner). This method returns a Promise that resolves with a $(ref:GetOptionGroupsResponse) object. If a callback is passed to this function, returned data is passed to it instead.

parameters.name: scannerHandle
parameters.description: The handle of an open scanner returned from a call to $(ref:openScanner).

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Called with the result.

functions.name: getOptionGroups

functions.description: Closes the scanner with the passed in handle and returns a Promise that resolves with a $(ref:CloseScannerResponse) object. If a callback is used, the object is passed to it instead. Even if the response is not a success, the supplied handle becomes invalid and should not be used for further operations.

parameters.name: scannerHandle
parameters.description: Specifies the handle of an open scanner that was previously returned from a call to $(ref:openScanner).

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Called with the result.

functions.name: closeScanner

functions.description: Sets options on the specified scanner and returns a Promise that resolves with a $(ref:SetOptionsResponse) object containing the result of trying to set every value in the order of the passed-in $(ref:OptionSetting) object. If a callback is used, the object is passed to it instead.

parameters.name: scannerHandle
parameters.description: The handle of the scanner to set options on. This should be a value previously returned from a call to $(ref:openScanner).

parameters.name: options
parameters.description: A list of OptionSetting objects to be applied to the scanner.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Called with the result.

functions.name: setOptions

functions.description: Starts a scan on the specified scanner and returns a Promise that resolves with a $(ref:StartScanResponse). If a callback is used, the object is passed to it instead. If the call was successful, the response includes a job handle that can be used in subsequent calls to read scan data or cancel a scan.

parameters.name: scannerHandle
parameters.description: The handle of an open scanner. This should be a value previously returned from a call to $(ref:openScanner).

parameters.name: options
parameters.description: A $(ref:StartScanOptions) object indicating the options to be used for the scan. The StartScanOptions.format property must match one of the entries returned in the scanner's ScannerInfo.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Called with the result.

functions.name: startScan

functions.description: Cancels a started scan and returns a Promise that resolves with a $(ref:CancelScanResponse) object. If a callback is used, the object is passed to it instead.

parameters.name: job
parameters.description: The handle of an active scan job previously returned from a call to $(ref:startScan).

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Called with the result.

functions.name: cancelScan

functions.description:
Reads the next chunk of available image data from an active job handle, and returns a Promise that resolves with a $(ref:ReadScanDataResponse) object. If a callback is used, the object is passed to it instead.

Note:It is valid for a response result to be SUCCESS with a zero-length data member. This means the scanner is still working but does not yet have additional data ready. The caller should wait a short time and try again.

When the scan job completes, the response will have the result value of EOF. This response may contain a final non-zero data member.

parameters.name: job
parameters.description: Active job handle previously returned from $(ref:startScan).

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Called with the result.

functions.name: readScanData

downloads.description: Use the chrome.downloads API to programmatically initiate, monitor, manipulate, and search for downloads.

name.description: Name of the HTTP header.
name.name: name

value.description: Value of the HTTP header.
value.name: value

types.description:
uniquify
To avoid duplication, the filename is changed to include a counter before the filename extension.
overwrite
The existing file will be overwritten with the new file.
prompt
The user will be prompted with a file chooser dialog.

filename.description: The $(ref:DownloadItem)'s new target $(ref:DownloadItem.filename), as a path relative to the user's default Downloads directory, possibly containing subdirectories. Absolute paths, empty paths, and paths containing back-references ".." will be ignored. filename is ignored if there are any $(ref:onDeterminingFilename) listeners registered by any extensions.
filename.name: filename

conflictAction.description: The action to take if filename already exists.
conflictAction.name: conflictAction

url.description: The URL to download.
url.name: url

filename.description: A file path relative to the Downloads directory to contain the downloaded file, possibly containing subdirectories. Absolute paths, empty paths, and paths containing back-references ".." will cause an error. $(ref:onDeterminingFilename) allows suggesting a filename after the file's MIME type and a tentative filename have been determined.
filename.name: filename

conflictAction.description: The action to take if filename already exists.
conflictAction.name: conflictAction

saveAs.description: Use a file-chooser to allow the user to select a filename regardless of whether filename is set or already exists.
saveAs.name: saveAs

method.description: The HTTP method to use if the URL uses the HTTP[S] protocol.
method.name: method

headers.description: Extra HTTP headers to send with the request if the URL uses the HTTP[s] protocol. Each header is represented as a dictionary containing the keys name and either value or binaryValue, restricted to those allowed by XMLHttpRequest.
headers.name: headers

enum.name: file
enum.description: The download's filename is suspicious.

enum.name: url
enum.description: The download's URL is known to be malicious.

enum.name: content
enum.description: The downloaded file is known to be malicious.

enum.name: uncommon
enum.description: The download's URL is not commonly downloaded and could be dangerous.

enum.name: host
enum.description: The download came from a host known to distribute malicious binaries and is likely dangerous.

enum.name: unwanted
enum.description: The download is potentially unwanted or unsafe. E.g. it could make changes to browser or computer settings.

enum.name: safe
enum.description: The download presents no known danger to the user's computer.

enum.name: accepted
enum.description: The user has accepted the dangerous download.

enum.name: allowlistedByPolicy
enum.description: Enterprise-related values.

enum.name: forceSaveToGdrive
enum.description: For use by the Secure Enterprise Browser extension. When required, Chrome will block the download to disc and download the file directly to Google Drive.

types.description: <dl><dt>in_progress</dt>     <dd>The download is currently receiving data from the server.</dd>     <dt>interrupted</dt>     <dd>An error broke the connection with the file host.</dd>     <dt>complete</dt>     <dd>The download completed successfully.</dd> </dl>

id.description: An identifier that is persistent across browser sessions.
id.name: id

url.description: The absolute URL that this download initiated from, before any redirects.
url.name: url

finalUrl.description: The absolute URL that this download is being made from, after all redirects.
finalUrl.name: finalUrl

incognito.description: False if this download is recorded in the history, true if it is not recorded.
incognito.name: incognito

danger.description: Indication of whether this download is thought to be safe or known to be suspicious.
danger.name: danger

startTime.description: The time when the download began in ISO 8601 format. May be passed directly to the Date constructor: chrome.downloads.search({}, function(items){items.forEach(function(item){console.log(new Date(item.startTime))})})
startTime.name: startTime

endTime.description: The time when the download ended in ISO 8601 format. May be passed directly to the Date constructor: chrome.downloads.search({}, function(items){items.forEach(function(item){if (item.endTime) console.log(new Date(item.endTime))})})
endTime.name: endTime

estimatedEndTime.description: Estimated time when the download will complete in ISO 8601 format. May be passed directly to the Date constructor: chrome.downloads.search({}, function(items){items.forEach(function(item){if (item.estimatedEndTime) console.log(new Date(item.estimatedEndTime))})})
estimatedEndTime.name: estimatedEndTime

state.description: Indicates whether the download is progressing, interrupted, or complete.
state.name: state

paused.description: True if the download has stopped reading data from the host, but kept the connection open.
paused.name: paused

canResume.description: True if the download is in progress and paused, or else if it is interrupted and can be resumed starting from where it was interrupted.
canResume.name: canResume

error.description: Why the download was interrupted. Several kinds of HTTP errors may be grouped under one of the errors beginning with SERVER_. Errors relating to the network begin with NETWORK_, errors relating to the process of writing the file to the file system begin with FILE_, and interruptions initiated by the user begin with USER_.
error.name: error

bytesReceived.description: Number of bytes received so far from the host, without considering file compression.
bytesReceived.name: bytesReceived

totalBytes.description: Number of bytes in the whole file, without considering file compression, or -1 if unknown.
totalBytes.name: totalBytes

fileSize.description: Number of bytes in the whole file post-decompression, or -1 if unknown.
fileSize.name: fileSize

exists.description: Whether the downloaded file still exists. This information may be out of date because Chrome does not automatically watch for file removal. Call $(ref:search)() in order to trigger the check for file existence. When the existence check completes, if the file has been deleted, then an $(ref:onChanged) event will fire. Note that $(ref:search)() does not wait for the existence check to finish before returning, so results from $(ref:search)() may not accurately reflect the file system. Also, $(ref:search)() may be called as often as necessary, but will not check for file existence any more frequently than once every 10 seconds.
exists.name: exists

byExtensionId.description: The identifier for the extension that initiated this download if this download was initiated by an extension. Does not change once it is set.
byExtensionId.name: byExtensionId

byExtensionName.description: The localized name of the extension that initiated this download if this download was initiated by an extension. May change if the extension changes its name or if the user changes their locale.
byExtensionName.name: byExtensionName

query.description: This array of search terms limits results to $(ref:DownloadItem) whose filename or url or finalUrl contain all of the search terms that do not begin with a dash '-' and none of the search terms that do begin with a dash.
query.name: query

startedBefore.description: Limits results to $(ref:DownloadItem) that started before the given ms in ISO 8601 format.
startedBefore.name: startedBefore

startedAfter.description: Limits results to $(ref:DownloadItem) that started after the given ms in ISO 8601 format.
startedAfter.name: startedAfter

endedBefore.description: Limits results to $(ref:DownloadItem) that ended before the given ms in ISO 8601 format.
endedBefore.name: endedBefore

endedAfter.description: Limits results to $(ref:DownloadItem) that ended after the given ms in ISO 8601 format
endedAfter.name: endedAfter

totalBytesGreater.description: Limits results to $(ref:DownloadItem) whose totalBytes is greater than the given integer.
totalBytesGreater.name: totalBytesGreater

totalBytesLess.description: Limits results to $(ref:DownloadItem) whose totalBytes is less than the given integer.
totalBytesLess.name: totalBytesLess

filenameRegex.description: Limits results to $(ref:DownloadItem) whose filename matches the given regular expression.
filenameRegex.name: filenameRegex

urlRegex.description: Limits results to $(ref:DownloadItem) whose url matches the given regular expression.
urlRegex.name: urlRegex

finalUrlRegex.description: Limits results to $(ref:DownloadItem) whose finalUrl matches the given regular expression.
finalUrlRegex.name: finalUrlRegex

limit.description: The maximum number of matching $(ref:DownloadItem) returned. Defaults to 1000. Set to 0 in order to return all matching $(ref:DownloadItem). See $(ref:search) for how to page through results.
limit.name: limit

orderBy.description: Set elements of this array to $(ref:DownloadItem) properties in order to sort search results. For example, setting orderBy=['startTime'] sorts the $(ref:DownloadItem) by their start time in ascending order. To specify descending order, prefix with a hyphen: '-startTime'.
orderBy.name: orderBy

id.description: The id of the $(ref:DownloadItem) to query.
id.name: id

url.description: The absolute URL that this download initiated from, before any redirects.
url.name: url

finalUrl.description: The absolute URL that this download is being made from, after all redirects.
finalUrl.name: finalUrl

danger.description: Indication of whether this download is thought to be safe or known to be suspicious.
danger.name: danger

startTime.description: The time when the download began in ISO 8601 format.
startTime.name: startTime

endTime.description: The time when the download ended in ISO 8601 format.
endTime.name: endTime

state.description: Indicates whether the download is progressing, interrupted, or complete.
state.name: state

paused.description: True if the download has stopped reading data from the host, but kept the connection open.
paused.name: paused

bytesReceived.description: Number of bytes received so far from the host, without considering file compression.
bytesReceived.name: bytesReceived

totalBytes.description: Number of bytes in the whole file, without considering file compression, or -1 if unknown.
totalBytes.name: totalBytes

fileSize.description: Number of bytes in the whole file post-decompression, or -1 if unknown.
fileSize.name: fileSize

id.description: The id of the $(ref:DownloadItem) that changed.
id.name: id

url.description: The change in url, if any.
url.name: url

size.description: The size of the returned icon. The icon will be square with dimensions size * size pixels. The default and largest size for the icon is 32x32 pixels. The only supported sizes are 16 and 32. It is an error to specify any other size.
size.name: size

enabled.description: Enable or disable the download UI.
enabled.name: enabled

functions.description: Download a URL. If the URL uses the HTTP[S] protocol, then the request will include all cookies currently set for its hostname. If both filename and saveAs are specified, then the Save As dialog will be displayed, pre-populated with the specified filename. If the download started successfully, callback will be called with the new $(ref:DownloadItem)'s downloadId. If there was an error starting the download, then callback will be called with downloadId=undefined and $(ref:runtime.lastError) will contain a descriptive string. The error strings are not guaranteed to remain backwards compatible between releases. Extensions must not parse it.

parameters.name: options
parameters.description: What to download and how.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Called with the id of the new $(ref:DownloadItem).

functions.name: download

functions.description: Find $(ref:DownloadItem). Set query to the empty object to get all $(ref:DownloadItem). To get a specific $(ref:DownloadItem), set only the id field. To page through a large number of items, set orderBy: ['-startTime'], set limit to the number of items per page, and set startedAfter to the startTime of the last item from the last page.
functions.name: search

functions.description: Pause the download. If the request was successful the download is in a paused state. Otherwise $(ref:runtime.lastError) contains an error message. The request will fail if the download is not active.

parameters.name: downloadId
parameters.description: The id of the download to pause.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Called when the pause request is completed.

functions.name: pause

functions.description: Resume a paused download. If the request was successful the download is in progress and unpaused. Otherwise $(ref:runtime.lastError) contains an error message. The request will fail if the download is not active.

parameters.name: downloadId
parameters.description: The id of the download to resume.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Called when the resume request is completed.

functions.name: resume

functions.description: Cancel a download. When callback is run, the download is cancelled, completed, interrupted or doesn't exist anymore.

parameters.name: downloadId
parameters.description: The id of the download to cancel.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Called when the cancel request is completed.

functions.name: cancel

functions.description: Retrieve an icon for the specified download. For new downloads, file icons are available after the $(ref:onCreated) event has been received. The image returned by this function while a download is in progress may be different from the image returned after the download is complete. Icon retrieval is done by querying the underlying operating system or toolkit depending on the platform. The icon that is returned will therefore depend on a number of factors including state of the download, platform, registered file types and visual theme. If a file icon cannot be determined, $(ref:runtime.lastError) will contain an error message.

parameters.name: downloadId
parameters.description: The identifier for the download.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: A URL to an image that represents the download.

functions.name: getFileIcon

functions.description: Opens the downloaded file now if the $(ref:DownloadItem) is complete; otherwise returns an error through $(ref:runtime.lastError). This method requires the "downloads.open" permission in addition to the "downloads" permission. An $(ref:onChanged) event fires when the item is opened for the first time. This method can only be called in response to a user gesture.

parameters.name: downloadId
parameters.description: The identifier for the downloaded file.

functions.name: open

functions.description: Show the downloaded file in its folder in a file manager.

parameters.name: downloadId
parameters.description: The identifier for the downloaded file.

functions.name: show

functions.description: Show the default Downloads folder in a file manager.
functions.name: showDefaultFolder

functions.description: Erase matching $(ref:DownloadItem) from history without deleting the downloaded file. An $(ref:onErased) event will fire for each $(ref:DownloadItem) that matches query, then callback will be called.
functions.name: erase

functions.description: Remove the downloaded file if it exists and the $(ref:DownloadItem) is complete; otherwise return an error through $(ref:runtime.lastError).
functions.name: removeFile

functions.description: Prompt the user to accept a dangerous download. Can only be called from a visible context (tab, window, or page/browser action popup). Does not automatically accept dangerous downloads. If the download is accepted, then an $(ref:onChanged) event will fire, otherwise nothing will happen. When all the data is fetched into a temporary file and either the download is not dangerous or the danger has been accepted, then the temporary file is renamed to the target filename, the |state| changes to 'complete', and $(ref:onChanged) fires.

parameters.name: downloadId
parameters.description: The identifier for the $(ref:DownloadItem).

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Called when the danger prompt dialog closes.

functions.name: acceptDanger

functions.description: Enable or disable the gray shelf at the bottom of every window associated with the current browser profile. The shelf will be disabled as long as at least one extension has disabled it. Enabling the shelf while at least one other extension has disabled it will return an error through $(ref:runtime.lastError). Requires the "downloads.shelf" permission in addition to the "downloads" permission.
functions.name: setShelfEnabled

functions.description: Change the download UI of every window associated with the current browser profile. As long as at least one extension has set $(ref:UiOptions.enabled) to false, the download UI will be hidden. Setting $(ref:UiOptions.enabled) to true while at least one other extension has disabled it will return an error through $(ref:runtime.lastError). Requires the "downloads.ui" permission in addition to the "downloads" permission.

parameters.name: options
parameters.description: Encapsulate a change to the download UI.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Called when the UI update is completed.

functions.name: setUiOptions

events.description: This event fires with the $(ref:DownloadItem) object when a download begins.
events.name: onCreated

events.description: Fires with the downloadId when a download is erased from history.

parameters.name: downloadId
parameters.description: The id of the $(ref:DownloadItem) that was erased.

events.name: onErased

events.description: When any of a $(ref:DownloadItem)'s properties except bytesReceived and estimatedEndTime changes, this event fires with the downloadId and an object containing the properties that changed.
events.name: onChanged

events.description: During the filename determination process, extensions will be given the opportunity to override the target $(ref:DownloadItem.filename). Each extension may not register more than one listener for this event. Each listener must call suggest exactly once, either synchronously or asynchronously. If the listener calls suggest asynchronously, then it must return true. If the listener neither calls suggest synchronously nor returns true, then suggest will be called automatically. The $(ref:DownloadItem) will not complete until all listeners have called suggest. Listeners may call suggest without any arguments in order to allow the download to use downloadItem.filename for its filename, or pass a suggestion object to suggest in order to override the target filename. If more than one extension overrides the filename, then the last extension installed whose listener passes a suggestion object to suggest wins. In order to avoid confusion regarding which extension will win, users should not install extensions that may conflict. If the download is initiated by $(ref:download) and the target filename is known before the MIME type and tentative filename have been determined, pass filename to $(ref:download) instead.
events.name: onDeterminingFilename

functions.description: Secretly called when onDeterminingFilename handlers return.
functions.name: determineFilename

enterprise.deviceAttributes.description: Use the chrome.enterprise.deviceAttributes API to read device attributes. Note: This API is only available to extensions force-installed by enterprise policy.

functions.description: Fetches the value of the device identifier of the directory API, that is generated by the server and identifies the cloud record of the device for querying in the cloud directory API. If the current user is not affiliated, returns an empty string.

functions.description: Fetches the device's serial number. Please note the purpose of this API is to administrate the device (e.g. generating Certificate Sign Requests for device-wide certificates). This API may not be used for tracking devices without the consent of the device's administrator. If the current user is not affiliated, returns an empty string.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Called with the serial number of the device.

returns_async.name: callback

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Called with the Annotated Location of the device.

functions.name: getDeviceAnnotatedLocation

functions.description: Fetches the device's hostname as set by DeviceHostnameTemplate policy. If the current user is not affiliated or no hostname has been set by the enterprise policy, returns an empty string.

returns_async.name: callback

enterprise.hardwarePlatform.description: Use the chrome.enterprise.hardwarePlatform API to get the manufacturer and model of the hardware platform where the browser runs. Note: This API is only available to extensions installed by enterprise policy.

functions.description: Obtains the manufacturer and model for the hardware platform and, if the extension is authorized, returns it via |callback|.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Called with the hardware platform info.

enterprise.kioskInput.description: Use the chrome.enterprise.kioskInput API to change input settings for Kiosk sessions. Note: This API is only available to extensions installed by enterprise policy in ChromeOS Kiosk sessions.

inputMethodId.description: The input method ID to set as current input method. This input method has to be enabled by enterprise policies. Supported IDs are located in https://crsrc.org/c/chrome/browser/resources/chromeos/input_method.
inputMethodId.name: inputMethodId

functions.description: Sets the current input method. This function only changes the current input method to an enabled input method. Input methods can be enabled by enterprise polices. If the input method ID is invalid, or not enabled, $(ref:runtime.lastError) will be set with a failure reason.

parameters.name: options
parameters.description: Object containing the fields defined in            $(ref:SetCurrentInputMethodOptions).

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Called when the input method is changed or if there is an error.

functions.name: setCurrentInputMethod

enterprise.login.description: Use the chrome.enterprise.login API to exit Managed Guest sessions. Note: This API is only available to extensions installed by enterprise policy in ChromeOS Managed Guest sessions.

functions.description: Exits the current managed guest session.
functions.name: exitCurrentManagedGuestSession

enterprise.networkingAttributes.description: Use the chrome.enterprise.networkingAttributes API to read information about your current network. Note: This API is only available to extensions force-installed by enterprise policy.

ipv4.description: The device's local IPv4 address (undefined if not configured).
ipv4.name: ipv4

ipv6.description: The device's local IPv6 address (undefined if not configured).
ipv6.name: ipv6

functions.description: Retrieves the network details of the device's default network. If the user is not affiliated or the device is not connected to a network, $(ref:runtime.lastError) will be set with a failure reason.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Called with the device's default network's $(ref:NetworkDetails).

functions.name: getNetworkDetails

enterprise.platformKeys.description: Use the chrome.enterprise.platformKeys API to generate keys and install certificates for these keys. The certificates will be managed by the platform and can be used for TLS authentication, network access or by other extension through $(ref:platformKeys chrome.platformKeys).

id.description:
Uniquely identifies this Token.

Static IDs are "user" and "system", referring to the platform's user-specific and the system-wide hardware token, respectively. Any other tokens (with other identifiers) might be returned by $(ref:enterprise.platformKeys.getTokens).
id.name: id

subtleCrypto.description:
Implements the WebCrypto's SubtleCrypto interface. The cryptographic operations, including key generation, are hardware-backed.

Only non-extractable keys can be generated. The supported key types are RSASSA-PKCS1-V1_5 and RSA-OAEP (on Chrome versions 135+) with modulusLength up to 2048 and ECDSA with namedCurve P-256. Each RSASSA-PKCS1-V1_5 and ECDSA key can be used for signing data at most once, unless the extension is allowlisted through the KeyPermissions policy, in which case the key can be used indefinitely. RSA-OAEP keys are supported since Chrome version 135 and can be used by extensions allowlisted through that same policy to unwrap other keys.

Keys generated on a specific Token cannot be used with any other Tokens, nor can they be used with window.crypto.subtle. Equally, Key objects created with window.crypto.subtle cannot be used with this interface.
subtleCrypto.name: subtleCrypto

softwareBackedSubtleCrypto.description:
Implements the WebCrypto's SubtleCrypto interface. The cryptographic operations, including key generation, are software-backed. Protection of the keys, and thus implementation of the non-extractable property, is done in software, so the keys are less protected than hardware-backed keys.

Only non-extractable keys can be generated. The supported key types are RSASSA-PKCS1-V1_5 and RSA-OAEP (on Chrome versions 135+) with modulusLength up to 2048. Each RSASSA-PKCS1-V1_5 key can be used for signing data at most once, unless the extension is allowlisted through the KeyPermissions policy, in which case the key can be used indefinitely. RSA-OAEP keys are supported since Chrome version 135 and can be used by extensions allowlisted through that same policy to unwrap other keys.

Keys generated on a specific Token cannot be used with any other Tokens, nor can they be used with window.crypto.subtle. Equally, Key objects created with window.crypto.subtle cannot be used with this interface.
softwareBackedSubtleCrypto.name: softwareBackedSubtleCrypto

functions.description:
Similar to challengeMachineKey and challengeUserKey, but allows specifying the algorithm of a registered key. Challenges a hardware-backed Enterprise Machine Key and emits the response as part of a remote attestation protocol. Only useful on ChromeOS and in conjunction with the Verified Access Web API which both issues challenges and verifies responses.

A successful verification by the Verified Access Web API is a strong signal that the current device is a legitimate ChromeOS device, the current device is managed by the domain specified during verification, the current signed-in user is managed by the domain specified during verification, and the current device state complies with enterprise device policy. For example, a policy may specify that the device must not be in developer mode. Any device identity emitted by the verification is tightly bound to the hardware of the current device. If "user" Scope is specified, the identity is also tightly bound to the current signed-in user.

This function is highly restricted and will fail if the current device is not managed, the current user is not managed, or if this operation has not explicitly been enabled for the caller by enterprise device policy. The challenged key does not reside in the "system" or "user" token and is not accessible by any other API.

parameters.name: options
parameters.description: Object containing the fields defined in            $(ref:ChallengeKeyOptions).

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Called back with the challenge response.

parameters.name: response
parameters.description: The challenge response.

functions.name: challengeKey

functions.description: Challenges a hardware-backed Enterprise Machine Key and emits the response as part of a remote attestation protocol. Only useful on ChromeOS and in conjunction with the Verified Access Web API which both issues challenges and verifies responses. A successful verification by the Verified Access Web API is a strong signal of all of the following: * The current device is a legitimate ChromeOS device. * The current device is managed by the domain specified during verification. * The current signed-in user is managed by the domain specified during verification. * The current device state complies with enterprise device policy. For example, a policy may specify that the device must not be in developer mode. * Any device identity emitted by the verification is tightly bound to the hardware of the current device. This function is highly restricted and will fail if the current device is not managed, the current user is not managed, or if this operation has not explicitly been enabled for the caller by enterprise device policy. The Enterprise Machine Key does not reside in the "system" token and is not accessible by any other API.

parameters.name: challenge
parameters.description: A challenge as emitted by the Verified Access Web API.

parameters.name: registerKey
parameters.description: If set, the current Enterprise Machine Key is registered with the "system" token and relinquishes the Enterprise Machine Key role. The key can then be associated with a certificate and used like any other signing key. This key is 2048-bit RSA. Subsequent calls to this function will then generate a new Enterprise Machine Key.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Called back with the challenge response.

parameters.name: response
parameters.description: The challenge response.

functions.name: challengeMachineKey

functions.description: Challenges a hardware-backed Enterprise User Key and emits the response as part of a remote attestation protocol. Only useful on ChromeOS and in conjunction with the Verified Access Web API which both issues challenges and verifies responses. A successful verification by the Verified Access Web API is a strong signal of all of the following: * The current device is a legitimate ChromeOS device. * The current device is managed by the domain specified during verification. * The current signed-in user is managed by the domain specified during verification. * The current device state complies with enterprise user policy. For example, a policy may specify that the device must not be in developer mode. * The public key emitted by the verification is tightly bound to the hardware of the current device and to the current signed-in user. This function is highly restricted and will fail if the current device is not managed, the current user is not managed, or if this operation has not explicitly been enabled for the caller by enterprise user policy. The Enterprise User Key does not reside in the "user" token and is not accessible by any other API.

parameters.name: challenge
parameters.description: A challenge as emitted by the Verified Access Web API.

parameters.name: registerKey
parameters.description: If set, the current Enterprise User Key is registered with the "user" token and relinquishes the Enterprise User Key role. The key can then be associated with a certificate and used like any other signing key. This key is 2048-bit RSA. Subsequent calls to this function will then generate a new Enterprise User Key.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Called back with the challenge response.

parameters.name: response
parameters.description: The challenge response.

functions.name: challengeUserKey

fileManagerPrivate.description: fileManagerPrivate API. This is a private API used by the file manager on ChromeOS. The API can roughly be divided into two parts: functions and events. Functions: The Functions interface defines a number of privileged operations that allow File Manager to execute tasks not available via public APIs. Most of the time this is due to the fact that enabling those tasks via public APIs would allow malicious applications to either take control of the hardware or leak private information about the user. None of these API must be exposed in any public services. Events: The Event interface defines a number of events that are supported by the API. These events allow one to register, in JavaScript, a listener that is invoked with event's parameters, every time the event is observed by the file_manager::EventRouter. Both the functions and events interface are only available to clients that are explicitly granted permission to use the fileManagerPrivate API. This API is not available to any client without code reviewed changes (eg. via _api_features.json) CAVEAT: An application A registering as a listener to any events must assume that an application B can listen to any events that are destined for A, where A and B are any applications that are granted access to fileManagerPrivate. For example, if applications A and B listen to onDirectoryChanged events on two unique paths, they both receive events about changes in either path. This is due to the fact that events are broadcasted to ALL listeners. It is the responsibility of the listener to discard events not destined for it. It is also the responsibility of all listeners not to log information transmitted in those events, as it may record in logs information that is private to a given user (e.g., the full paths and name of a given file).  This API is designed with the assumption that all users are equal in terms of their permission to observe events, call the function interface and access the file system of the device. As the API is only used by Chrome OS' File Manager, and the File Manager is being used by the user to access their own files, this assumption holds true. The API defined in this file may use W3C Entry object (FileEntry and DirectoryEntry). Since these cannot be directly sent or received by the C++ code, there exists an additional layer, in file_manager_private_internal.idl, that provides translation from or to W3C Entry objects.

functions.description:
Mounts a file system with the given fileSystemId and displayName. displayName will be shown in the left panel of the Files app. displayName can contain any characters including '/', but cannot be an empty string. displayName must be descriptive but doesn't have to be unique. The fileSystemId must not be an empty string.

Depending on the type of the file system being mounted, the source option must be set appropriately.

In case of an error, $(ref:runtime.lastError) will be set with a corresponding error code.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: A generic result callback to indicate success or failure.

functions.name: mount

functions.description:
Unmounts a file system with the given fileSystemId. It must be called after $(ref:onUnmountRequested) is invoked. Also, the providing extension can decide to perform unmounting if not requested (eg. in case of lost connection, or a file error).

In case of an error, $(ref:runtime.lastError) will be set with a corresponding error code.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: A generic result callback to indicate success or failure.

functions.name: unmount

functions.description: Returns all file systems mounted by the extension.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Callback to receive the result of $(ref:getAll) function.

functions.name: getAll

functions.description: Returns information about a file system with the passed fileSystemId.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Callback to receive the result of $(ref:get) function.

functions.name: get

functions.description:
Notifies about changes in the watched directory at observedPath in recursive mode. If the file system is mounted with supportsNotifyTag, then tag must be provided, and all changes since the last notification always reported, even if the system was shutdown. The last tag can be obtained with $(ref:getAll).

To use, the file_system_provider.notify manifest option must be set to true.

Value of tag can be any string which is unique per call, so it's possible to identify the last registered notification. Eg. if the providing extension starts after a reboot, and the last registered notification's tag is equal to "123", then it should call $(ref:notify) for all changes which happened since the change tagged as "123". It cannot be an empty string.

Not all providers are able to provide a tag, but if the file system has a changelog, then the tag can be eg. a change number, or a revision number.

Note that if a parent directory is removed, then all descendant entries are also removed, and if they are watched, then the API must be notified about the fact. Also, if a directory is renamed, then all descendant entries are in fact removed, as there is no entry under their original paths anymore.

In case of an error, $(ref:runtime.lastError) will be set will a corresponding error code.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: A generic result callback to indicate success or failure.

functions.name: notify

events.description: Raised when unmounting for the file system with the fileSystemId identifier is requested. In the response, the $(ref:unmount) API method must be called together with successCallback. If unmounting is not possible (eg. due to a pending operation), then errorCallback must be called.

parameters.name: successCallback
parameters.description: Callback to be called by the providing extension in case of a success.

parameters.name: errorCallback
parameters.description: Callback to be called by the providing extension in case of an error. Any error code is allowed except OK.

The operation executed with operationRequestId must be immediately stopped and successCallback of this abort request executed. If aborting fails, then errorCallback must be called. identity.description: Use the chrome.identity API to get OAuth2 access tokens.

id.description: A unique identifier for the account. This ID will not change for the lifetime of the account.
id.name: id

enum.name: SYNC
enum.description: Specifies that Sync is enabled for the primary account.

enum.name: ANY
enum.description: Specifies the existence of a primary account, if any.

accountStatus.description: A status of the primary account signed into a profile whose ProfileUserInfo should be returned. Defaults to SYNC account status.
accountStatus.name: accountStatus

email.description: An email address for the user account signed into the current profile. Empty if the user is not signed in or the identity.email manifest permission is not specified.
email.name: email

id.description: A unique identifier for the account. This ID will not change for the lifetime of the account. Empty if the user is not signed in or (in M41+) the identity.email manifest permission is not specified.
id.name: id

interactive.description: Fetching a token may require the user to sign-in to Chrome, or approve the application's requested scopes. If the interactive flag is true, getAuthToken will prompt the user as necessary. When the flag is false or omitted, getAuthToken will return failure any time a prompt would be required.
interactive.name: interactive

account.description: The account ID whose token should be returned. If not specified, the function will use an account from the Chrome profile: the Sync account if there is one, or otherwise the first Google web account.
account.name: account

scopes.description:
A list of OAuth2 scopes to request.

When the scopes field is present, it overrides the list of scopes specified in manifest.json.
scopes.name: scopes

enableGranularPermissions.description: The enableGranularPermissions flag allows extensions to opt-in early to the granular permissions consent screen, in which requested permissions are granted or denied individually.
enableGranularPermissions.name: enableGranularPermissions

token.description: The specific token that should be removed from the cache.
token.name: token

url.description: The URL that initiates the auth flow.
url.name: url

interactive.description:
Whether to launch auth flow in interactive mode.

Since some auth flows may immediately redirect to a result URL, launchWebAuthFlow hides its web view until the first navigation either redirects to the final URL, or finishes loading a page meant to be displayed.

If the interactive flag is true, the window will be displayed when a page load completes. If the flag is false or omitted, launchWebAuthFlow will return with an error if the initial navigation does not complete the flow.

For flows that use JavaScript for redirection, abortOnLoadForNonInteractive can be set to false in combination with setting timeoutMsForNonInteractive to give the page a chance to perform any redirects.
interactive.name: interactive

abortOnLoadForNonInteractive.description:
Whether to terminate launchWebAuthFlow for non-interactive requests after the page loads. This parameter does not affect interactive flows.

When set to true (default) the flow will terminate immediately after the page loads. When set to false, the flow will only terminate after the timeoutMsForNonInteractive passes. This is useful for identity providers that use JavaScript to perform redirections after the page loads.
abortOnLoadForNonInteractive.name: abortOnLoadForNonInteractive

timeoutMsForNonInteractive.description: The maximum amount of time, in miliseconds, launchWebAuthFlow is allowed to run in non-interactive mode in total. Only has an effect if interactive is false.
timeoutMsForNonInteractive.name: timeoutMsForNonInteractive

token.description: The specific token associated with the request.
token.name: token

grantedScopes.description: A list of OAuth2 scopes granted to the extension.
grantedScopes.name: grantedScopes

functions.description:
Retrieves a list of AccountInfo objects describing the accounts present on the profile.

getAccounts is only supported on dev channel.
functions.name: getAccounts

functions.description:
Gets an OAuth2 access token using the client ID and scopes specified in the oauth2 section of manifest.json.

The Identity API caches access tokens in memory, so it's ok to call getAuthToken non-interactively any time a token is required. The token cache automatically handles expiration.

For a good user experience it is important interactive token requests are initiated by UI in your app explaining what the authorization is for. Failing to do this will cause your users to get authorization requests, or Chrome sign in screens if they are not signed in, with with no context. In particular, do not use getAuthToken interactively when your app is first launched.

Note: When called with a callback, instead of returning an object this function will return the two properties as separate arguments passed to the callback.

parameters.name: details
parameters.description: Token options.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Called with an OAuth2 access token as specified by the manifest, or undefined if there was an error. The grantedScopes parameter is populated since Chrome 87. When available, this parameter contains the list of granted scopes corresponding with the returned token.

functions.name: getAuthToken

functions.description:
Retrieves email address and obfuscated gaia id of the user signed into a profile.

Requires the identity.email manifest permission. Otherwise, returns an empty result.

This API is different from identity.getAccounts in two ways. The information returned is available offline, and it only applies to the primary account for the profile.

parameters.name: details
parameters.description: Profile options.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Called with the ProfileUserInfo of the primary Chrome account, of an empty ProfileUserInfo if the account with given details doesn't exist.

functions.name: getProfileUserInfo

functions.description:
Removes an OAuth2 access token from the Identity API's token cache.

If an access token is discovered to be invalid, it should be passed to removeCachedAuthToken to remove it from the cache. The app may then retrieve a fresh token with getAuthToken.

parameters.name: details
parameters.description: Token information.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Called when the token has been removed from the cache.

functions.name: removeCachedAuthToken

functions.description:
Resets the state of the Identity API:
  • Removes all OAuth2 access tokens from the token cache
  • Removes user's account preferences
  • De-authorizes the user from all auth flows

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Called when the state has been cleared.

functions.name: clearAllCachedAuthTokens

functions.description:
Starts an auth flow at the specified URL.

This method enables auth flows with non-Google identity providers by launching a web view and navigating it to the first URL in the provider's auth flow. When the provider redirects to a URL matching the pattern https://<app-id>.chromiumapp.org/*, the window will close, and the final redirect URL will be passed to the callback function.

For a good user experience it is important interactive auth flows are initiated by UI in your app explaining what the authorization is for. Failing to do this will cause your users to get authorization requests with no context. In particular, do not launch an interactive auth flow when your app is first launched.

parameters.name: details
parameters.description: WebAuth flow options.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Called with the URL redirected back to your application.

functions.name: launchWebAuthFlow

functions.description:
Generates a redirect URL to be used in |launchWebAuthFlow|.

The generated URLs match the pattern https://<app-id>.chromiumapp.org/*.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The path appended to the end of the generated URL.

functions.name: getRedirectURL

events.description: Fired when signin state changes for an account on the user's profile.

If the document does not support thumbnails, |callback| is called with an empty string. Note: The thumbnail data may originate from third-party application code, and is untrustworthy (Security).

imageWriterPrivate.description: Use the chrome.image_writer API to write images to removable media.

types.description:
The different stages of a write call.

confirmation
The process starts by prompting the user for confirmation.
download
The image file is being download if a remote image was requested.
verifyDownload
The download is being verified to match the image hash, if provided
unzip
The image is being extracted from the downloaded zip file
write
The image is being written to disk.
verifyWrite
The system is verifying that the written image matches the downloaded image.

imageHash.description: If present, verify that the downloaded image matches this hash.
imageHash.name: imageHash

saveAsDownload.description: If true, save the downloaded image as a file using the user's downloads preferences.
saveAsDownload.name: saveAsDownload

stage.description: The $(ref:Stage) that the write process is currently in.
stage.name: stage

functions.description: Write an image to the disk downloaded from the provided URL.  The callback will be called when the entire operation completes, either successfully or on error.

parameters.name: storageUnitId
parameters.description: The identifier for the storage unit

parameters.name: imageUrl
parameters.description: The url of the image to download which will be written to the storage unit identified by |storageUnitId|

parameters.name: options
parameters.description: Optional parameters if comparing the download with a given hash or saving the download to the users Downloads folder instead of a temporary directory is desired

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: The callback which signifies that the write operation has been started by the system and provides a unique ID for this operation.

functions.name: writeFromUrl

functions.name: writeFromFile

functions.description: Cancel a current write operation.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: The callback which is triggered with the write is successfully cancelled, passing the $(ref:ProgressInfo) of the operation at the time it was cancelled.

functions.name: cancelWrite

functions.description: Destroys the partition table of a disk, effectively erasing it.  This is a fairly quick operation and so it does not have complex stages or progress information, just a write phase.

parameters.name: storageUnitId

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: A callback that triggers when the operation has been successfully started.

login.description: Use the chrome.login API to launch and exit user sessions.

oauthCode.description: Oauth_code cookie set in the SAML handshake.

functions.description: Launches a managed guest session if one is set up via the admin console. If there are several managed guest sessions set up, it will launch the first available one.

parameters.name: password
parameters.description: If provided, the launched managed guest session will be lockable, and can only be unlocked by calling $(ref:unlockManagedGuestSession) with the same password.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Note: If the function succeeds, the callback is not guaranteed to be invoked as the extension will be disabled when the session starts. Use this callback only to handle the failure case by checking $(ref:runtime.lastError).

functions.name: launchManagedGuestSession

functions.description: Exits the current session.

parameters.name: dataForNextLoginAttempt
parameters.description: If set, stores data which can be read by $(ref:fetchDataForNextLoginAttempt) from the login screen. If unset, any currently stored data will be cleared.

functions.name: exitCurrentSession

functions.description: Reads the $(ref:dataForNextLoginAttempt) set by $(ref:exitCurrentSession). Clears the previously stored data after reading so it can only be read once.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Called with the stored data, or an empty string if there was no previously stored data.

functions.name: fetchDataForNextLoginAttempt

functions.description: Deprecated. Please use $(ref:lockCurrentSession) instead.
functions.name: lockManagedGuestSession

functions.description: Locks the current session. The session has to be either a user session or a Managed Guest Session launched by $(ref:launchManagedGuestSession) with a password.
functions.name: lockCurrentSession

functions.description: Deprecated. Please use $(ref:unlockCurrentSession) instead.
functions.name: unlockManagedGuestSession

functions.description: Unlocks the current session. The session has to be either a user session or a Managed Guest Session launched by $(ref:launchManagedGuestSession) with a password. The session will unlock if the provided password matches the one used to launch the session.

parameters.name: password
parameters.description: The password which will be used to unlock the session.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Note: If the function succeeds, the callback is not guaranteed to be invoked as the extension will be disabled when the session starts. Use this callback only to handle the failure case by checking $(ref:runtime.lastError).

functions.name: unlockCurrentSession

functions.description: Launches a SAML-backed user session.

parameters.name: properties
parameters.description: User's email address, gaia ID, password and oauth_code.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Note: If the function succeeds, the callback is not guaranteed to be invoked as the extension will be disabled when the session starts. Use this callback only to handle the failure case by checking $(ref:runtime.lastError).

functions.name: launchSamlUserSession

functions.description: Starts a ChromeOS Managed Guest Session which will host the shared user sessions. An initial shared session is entered with |password| as the password. When this shared session is locked, it can only be unlocked by the same extension calling $(ref:unlockSharedSession) with the same password. Fails when another shared ChromeOS Managed Guest Session has already been launched. Can only be called from the login screen.

parameters.name: password
parameters.description: The password which can be used to unlock the shared session.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Note: If the function succeeds, the callback is not guaranteed to be invoked as the extension will be disabled when the session starts. Use this callback only to handle the failure case by checking $(ref:runtime.lastError).

functions.name: launchSharedManagedGuestSession

functions.description: Enters the shared session with the given password. If the session is locked, it can only be unlocked by calling $(ref:unlockSharedSession) with the same password. Fails if calling extension is not the same as the one which called $(ref:launchSharedManagedGuestSession) or there is already a shared session running. Can only be called from the lock screen.

parameters.name: password
parameters.description: The password which can be used to unlock the shared session.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Note: If the function succeeds, the callback is not guaranteed to be invoked as the extension will be disabled when the session starts. Use this callback only to handle the failure case by checking $(ref:runtime.lastError).

functions.name: enterSharedSession

functions.description: Unlocks the shared session with the provided password. Fails if the password does not match the one provided to $(ref:launchSharedManagedGuestSession) or $(ref:enterSharedSession). Fails if the calling extension is not the same as the one which called $(ref:launchSharedManagedGuestSession) or if there is no existing shared session. Can only be called from the lock screen.

parameters.name: password
parameters.description: The password used to unlock the shared session.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Note: If the function succeeds, the callback is not guaranteed to be invoked as the extension will be disabled when the session starts. Use this callback only to handle the failure case by checking $(ref:runtime.lastError).

functions.name: unlockSharedSession

functions.description: Ends the shared session. Security- and privacy-sensitive data in the session will be cleaned up on a best effort basis. The calling extension does not have to be the same one which called $(ref:launchSharedManagedGuestSession). Can be called from both the lock screen or in session. Fails if there is no existing shared session.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Invoked after cleanup operations have finished and the session is locked.

functions.name: endSharedSession

functions.description: Sets data for the next login attempt. The data can be retrieved by calling $(ref:fetchDataForNextLoginAttempt). The data is cleared when it is fetched so it can only be read once.

enum.name: LOCK_PROFILE
enum.description: Specifies that the extension is in the lock screen profile.

enum.name: UNKNOWN
enum.description: Specifies that the session state is unknown.

enum.name: IN_OOBE_SCREEN
enum.description: Specifies that the user is in the out-of-box-experience screen.

enum.name: IN_LOGIN_SCREEN
enum.description: Specifies that the user is in the login screen.

enum.name: IN_SESSION
enum.description: Specifies that the user is in the session.

enum.name: IN_LOCK_SCREEN
enum.description: Specifies that the user is in the lock screen.

enum.name: IN_RMA_SCREEN
enum.description: Specifies that the device is in RMA mode, finalizing repairs.

returns_async.description: Callback invoked after ForceDiscovery() has started.

MAX_SERVICE_INSTANCES_PER_EVENT.description: The maximum number of service instances that will be included in onServiceList events.  If more instances are available, they may be truncated from the onServiceList event.

events.description: Event fired to inform clients of the current complete set of known available services. Clients should only need to store the list from the most recent event. The service type that the extension is interested in discovering should be specified as the event filter with the 'serviceType' key. Not specifying an event filter will not start any discovery listeners.
events.name: onServiceList

notifications.description: Use the chrome.notifications API to create rich notifications using templates and show these notifications to users in the system tray.

enum.name: basic
enum.description: Contains an icon, title, message, expandedMessage, and up to two buttons.

enum.name: image
enum.description: Contains an icon, title, message, expandedMessage, image, and up  to two buttons.

enum.name: list
enum.description: Contains an icon, title, message, items, and up to two buttons. Users on Mac OS X only see the first item.

enum.name: progress
enum.description: Contains an icon, title, message, progress, and up to two buttons.

enum.name: granted
enum.description: Specifies that the user has elected to show notifications from the app or extension. This is the default at install time.

enum.name: denied
enum.description: Specifies that the user has elected not to show notifications from the app or extension.

title.description: Title of one item of a list notification.
title.name: title

iconUrl.deprecated: Button icons not visible for Mac OS X users.
iconUrl.name: iconUrl

type.description: Which type of notification to display. Required for $(ref:notifications.create) method.
type.name: type

iconUrl.description:
A URL to the sender's avatar, app icon, or a thumbnail for image notifications.

URLs can be a data URL, a blob URL, or a URL relative to a resource within this extension's .crx file

Note:This value is required for the $(ref:notifications.create)() method.
iconUrl.name: iconUrl

appIconMaskUrl.deprecated: The app icon mask is not visible for Mac OS X users.
appIconMaskUrl.description:
A URL to the app icon mask. URLs have the same restrictions as $(ref:notifications.NotificationOptions.iconUrl iconUrl).

The app icon mask should be in alpha channel, as only the alpha channel of the image will be considered.
appIconMaskUrl.name: appIconMaskUrl

title.description:
Title of the notification (e.g. sender name for email).
Note:This value is required for the $(ref:notifications.create)() method.
title.name: title

message.description:
Main notification content.
Note:This value is required for the $(ref:notifications.create)() method.
message.name: message

contextMessage.description: Alternate notification content with a lower-weight font.
contextMessage.name: contextMessage

priority.description: Priority ranges from -2 to 2. -2 is lowest priority. 2 is highest. Zero is default.  On platforms that don't support a notification center (Windows, Linux & Mac), -2 and -1 result in an error as notifications with those priorities will not be shown at all.
priority.name: priority

eventTime.description: A timestamp associated with the notification, in milliseconds past the epoch (e.g. Date.now() + n).
eventTime.name: eventTime

buttons.description: Text and icons for up to two notification action buttons.
buttons.name: buttons

imageUrl.deprecated: The image is not visible for Mac OS X users.
imageUrl.description: A URL to the image thumbnail for image-type notifications. URLs have the same restrictions as $(ref:notifications.NotificationOptions.iconUrl iconUrl).
imageUrl.name: imageUrl

items.description: Items for multi-item notifications. Users on Mac OS X only see the first item.
items.name: items

isClickable.deprecated: This UI hint is ignored as of Chrome 67
isClickable.name: isClickable

requireInteraction.description: Indicates that the notification should remain visible on screen until the user activates or dismisses the notification. This defaults to false.
requireInteraction.name: requireInteraction

silent.description: Indicates that no sounds or vibrations should be made when the notification is being shown. This defaults to false.
silent.name: silent

functions.description: Creates and displays a notification.

parameters.name: notificationId
parameters.description:
Identifier of the notification. If not set or empty, an ID will automatically be generated. If it matches an existing notification, this method first clears that notification before proceeding with the create operation. The identifier may not be longer than 500 characters.

The notificationId parameter is required before Chrome 42.

parameters.name: options
parameters.description: Contents of the notification.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description:
Returns the notification id (either supplied or generated) that represents the created notification.

The callback is required before Chrome 42.

functions.name: create

functions.description: Updates an existing notification.

parameters.name: notificationId
parameters.description: The id of the notification to be updated. This is returned by $(ref:notifications.create) method.

parameters.name: options
parameters.description: Contents of the notification to update to.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description:
Called to indicate whether a matching notification existed.

The callback is required before Chrome 42.

functions.name: update

parameters.name: notificationId
parameters.description: The id of the notification to be cleared. This is returned by $(ref:notifications.create) method.

returns_async.name: callback

Called to indicate whether a matching notification existed.

The callback is required before Chrome 42.
