passwordsPrivate.description: Use the chrome.passwordsPrivate API to add or remove password data from the settings UI.

types.description: Possible reasons why a plaintext password was requested.

enum.name: VIEW
enum.description: The user wants to view the password.

enum.name: COPY
enum.description: The user wants to copy the password.

enum.name: EDIT
enum.description: The user wants to edit the password.

enum.name: NOT_STARTED
enum.description: No export was started.

enum.name: IN_PROGRESS
enum.description: Data is being written to the destination.

enum.name: SUCCEEDED
enum.description: Data has been written.

enum.name: FAILED_CANCELLED
enum.description: The user rejected the file selection prompts.

enum.name: FAILED_WRITE_FAILED
enum.description: Writing to the destination failed.

enum.name: LEAKED
enum.description: If the credentials was leaked by a data breach.

enum.name: PHISHED
enum.description: If the credentials was reused on a phishing site.

enum.name: REUSED
enum.description: If the credentials have a password which was reused by other credentials.

enum.name: WEAK
enum.description: If the credentials have a weak password.

enum.name: DEVICE
enum.description: Corresponds to profile-scoped password store.

enum.name: ACCOUNT
enum.description: Corresponds to Gaia-account-scoped password store (i.e. account store).

enum.name: DEVICE_AND_ACCOUNT
enum.description: Corresponds to both profile-scoped and Gaia-account-scoped password stores.

enum.name: IDLE
enum.description: idle state, e.g. after successfully running to completion.

enum.name: RUNNING
enum.description: Running, following an explicit user action to start the check.

enum.name: CANCELED
enum.description: Canceled, entered when the user explicitly cancels a check.

enum.name: OFFLINE
enum.description: Offline, the user is offline.

enum.name: SIGNED_OUT
enum.description: The user is not signed into Chrome.

enum.name: NO_PASSWORDS
enum.description: The user does not have any passwords saved.

enum.name: QUOTA_LIMIT
enum.description: The user hit the quota limit.

enum.name: OTHER_ERROR
enum.description: Any other error state.

enum.name: UNKNOWN_ERROR
enum.description: Any other error state.

enum.name: SUCCESS
enum.description: Data was fully or partially imported.

enum.name: IO_ERROR
enum.description: Failed to read provided file.

enum.name: BAD_FORMAT
enum.description: Header is missing, invalid or could not be read.

enum.name: DISMISSED
enum.description: File selection dismissed.

enum.name: MAX_FILE_SIZE
enum.description: Size of the chosen file exceeds the limit.

enum.name: IMPORT_ALREADY_ACTIVE
enum.description: User has already started the import flow in a different window.

enum.name: NUM_PASSWORDS_EXCEEDED
enum.description: User tried to import too many passwords from one file.

enum.name: CONFLICTS
enum.description: Conflicts found and they need to be resolved by the user.

enum.name: UNKNOWN_ERROR
enum.description: Any other error state.

enum.name: MISSING_PASSWORD
enum.description: Missing password field.

enum.name: MISSING_URL
enum.description: Missing url field.

enum.name: INVALID_URL
enum.description: Bad url formatting.

enum.name: NON_ASCII_URL
enum.description: URL contains non-ASCII chars.

enum.name: LONG_URL
enum.description: URL is too long.

enum.name: LONG_PASSWORD
enum.description: Password is too long.

enum.name: LONG_USERNAME
enum.description: Username is too long.

enum.name: CONFLICT_PROFILE
enum.description: Credential is already stored in profile store.

enum.name: CONFLICT_ACCOUNT
enum.description: Credential is already stored in account store.

enum.name: LONG_NOTE
enum.description: Note is too long.

enum.name: LONG_CONCATENATED_NOTE
enum.description: Concatenation of imported and local notes is too long.

enum.name: VALID
enum.description: Valid credential.

enum.name: UNKNOWN_ERROR
enum.description: Unknown or network error.

enum.name: NO_MEMBERS
enum.description: No family members found.

enum.name: SUCCESS
enum.description: At least one family member found.

value.description: The value of the public key.
value.name: value

version.description: The version of the public key.
version.name: version

profileImageUrl.description: Profile image URL of the recipient.
profileImageUrl.name: profileImageUrl

isEligible.description: Whether the user can receive passwords.
isEligible.name: isEligible

publicKey.description: The public key of the recipient.
publicKey.name: publicKey

status.description: Status of the family members fetch.
status.name: status

status.description: The parsing status of individual row that represents credential during import process.
status.name: status

url.description: The url of the credential.
url.name: url

id.description: Unique identifier of the credential.
id.name: id

status.description: General status of the triggered passwords import process.
status.name: status

displayedEntries.description: Possibly emtpy, list of credentials that couldn't be imported.
displayedEntries.name: displayedEntries

fileName.description: Name of file that user has chosen for the import.
fileName.name: fileName

signonRealm.description: The signon realm of the credential.
signonRealm.name: signonRealm

shown.description: A human readable version of the URL of the credential's origin. For android credentials this is usually App name.
shown.name: shown

link.description: The URL that will be linked to when an entry is clicked.
link.name: link

compromiseTime.description: The timestamp of when this credential was determined to be compromised. Specified in milliseconds since the UNIX epoch. Intended to be passed to the JavaScript Date() constructor.
compromiseTime.name: compromiseTime

elapsedTimeSinceCompromise.description: The elapsed time since this credential was determined to be compromised. This is passed as an already formatted string, since JavaScript lacks the required formatting APIs. Example: "5 minutes ago"
elapsedTimeSinceCompromise.name: elapsedTimeSinceCompromise

isMuted.description: Indicates whether this credential is muted.
isMuted.name: isMuted

name.description: A human readable version of the URL of the credential's origin. For android credentials this is usually the app name.
name.name: name

url.description: The URL that will be linked to when an entry is clicked.
url.name: url

value.description: The value of the backup password.
value.name: value

creationDate.description: Internationalized date on which the backup password was created. e.g. Mar 17.
creationDate.name: creationDate

affiliatedDomains.description: The URL collection corresponding to this saved password entry.
affiliatedDomains.name: affiliatedDomains

username.description: The username used in conjunction with the saved password.
username.name: username

displayName.description: If this is a passkey, the user's display name. Empty otherwise.
displayName.name: displayName

password.description: The password of the credential. Empty by default, only set if explicitly requested.
password.name: password

backupPassword.description: Recovery password for the password change flow.
backupPassword.name: backupPassword

federationText.description: Text shown if the password was obtained via a federated identity.
federationText.name: federationText

id.description: An index to refer back to a unique password entry record.
id.name: id

storedIn.description: Corresponds to where the credential is stored.
storedIn.name: storedIn

isPasskey.description: Indicates whether this credential is a passkey.
isPasskey.name: isPasskey

note.description: The value of the attached note.
note.name: note

changePasswordUrl.description: The URL where the insecure password can be changed. Might be not set for Android apps.
changePasswordUrl.name: changePasswordUrl

compromisedInfo.description: Additional information in case a credential is compromised.
compromisedInfo.name: compromisedInfo

creationTime.description: The timestamp of when this credential was created, or undefined if not a passkey. Specified in milliseconds since the UNIX epoch. Intended to be passed to the JavaScript Date() constructor.
creationTime.name: creationTime

hidden.description: Indicates that the credential was marked for deletion (e.g. by a website) and should be marked as such in management surfaces. Used for passkeys only. Always false for other credential types.
hidden.name: hidden

name.description: Group name being displayed.
name.name: name

iconUrl.description: Icon url for the given group.
iconUrl.name: iconUrl

urls.description: The URL collection corresponding to this exception entry.
urls.name: urls

id.description: An id to refer back to a unique exception entry record.
id.name: id

status.description: The current status of the export task.
status.name: status

filePath.description: If |status| is $ref(ExportProgressStatus.SUCCEEDED), this will be the full path of the written file.
filePath.name: filePath

folderName.description: If |status| is $ref(ExportProgressStatus.FAILED_WRITE_FAILED), this will be the name of the selected folder to export to.
folderName.name: folderName

state.description: The state of the password check.
state.name: state

alreadyProcessed.description: How many passwords have already been processed. Populated if and only if the password check is currently running.
alreadyProcessed.name: alreadyProcessed

remainingInQueue.description: How many passwords are remaining in the queue. Populated if and only if the password check is currently running.
remainingInQueue.name: remainingInQueue

elapsedTimeSinceLastCheck.description: The elapsed time since the last full password check was performed. This is passed as a string, since JavaScript lacks the required formatting APIs. If no check has been performed yet this is not set.
elapsedTimeSinceLastCheck.name: elapsedTimeSinceLastCheck

url.description: The url to save the password for.
url.name: url

username.description: The username to save the password for.
username.name: username

password.description: The password value to be saved.
password.name: password

useAccountStore.description: True for account store, false for device store.
useAccountStore.name: useAccountStore

types.description: Must match `SaveRequestType` in `pdf/mojom/pdf.mojom` and `tools/typescript/definitions/pdf_viewer_private.d.ts`.

Enumeration of save to drive error types. Must match `SaveToDriveErrorType` in tools/typescript/definitions/pdf_viewer_private.d.ts and `PdfSaveToDriveErrorType` in tools/metrics/histograms/metadata/pdf/enums.xml.

Enumeration of save to drive status. Must match `SaveToDriveStatus` in tools/typescript/definitions/pdf_viewer_private.d.ts and `PdfSaveToDriveStatus` in tools/metrics/histograms/metadata/pdf/enums.xml.

errorType.description: The error type of the upload.
errorType.name: errorType

driveItemId.description: The ID of the drive item that was uploaded. It is only set if the upload was successful, i.e. if `status` is `UPLOAD_COMPLETED`.
driveItemId.name: driveItemId

fileSizeBytes.description: The total size of the file in bytes. It is only set if the upload is in progress or completed, i.e. if `status` is `UPLOAD_STARTED`, `UPLOAD_IN_PROGRESS`, or `UPLOAD_COMPLETED`.
fileSizeBytes.name: fileSizeBytes

uploadedBytes.description: The number of bytes that have been uploaded. It is only set if the upload is in progress or completed, i.e. if `status` is `UPLOAD_STARTED`, `UPLOAD_IN_PROGRESS`, or `UPLOAD_COMPLETED`.
uploadedBytes.name: uploadedBytes

fileMetadata.description: The localized metadata and progress of the file. It is only set if the upload is in progress or completed, i.e. if `status` is `UPLOAD_STARTED`, `UPLOAD_IN_PROGRESS`, or `UPLOAD_COMPLETED`.
fileMetadata.name: fileMetadata

fileName.description: The name of the file. It is only set if the upload was successful, i.e. if `status` is `UPLOAD_COMPLETED`.
fileName.name: fileName

parentFolderName.description: The name of the parent folder. It is only set if the upload was successful, i.e. if `status` is `UPLOAD_COMPLETED`.
parentFolderName.name: parentFolderName

accountEmail.description: The email of the account that is chosen to save the PDF to Drive. It is only set after the account is selected.
accountEmail.name: accountEmail

accountIsManaged.description: Whether the account is a managed account. It is only set after the account is selected.
accountIsManaged.name: accountIsManaged

originalUrl.description: The original URL that was intercepted.
originalUrl.name: originalUrl

streamUrl.description: The URL that the stream can be read from.
streamUrl.name: streamUrl

tabId.description: The ID of the tab that opened the stream. If the stream is not opened in a tab, it will be -1.
tabId.name: tabId

embedded.description: Whether the stream is embedded within another document.
embedded.name: embedded

backgroundColor.description: The background color in ARGB format for painting. Since the background color is an unsigned 32-bit integer which can be outside the range of "long" type, define it as a "double" type here.
backgroundColor.name: backgroundColor

allowJavascript.description: Indicates whether the plugin allows to execute JavaScript and maybe XFA. Loading XFA for PDF forms will automatically be disabled if this flag is false.
allowJavascript.name: allowJavascript

functions.description: Returns the StreamInfo for the stream for this context if there is one.

functions.description: Sets the current tab title to `title` for a full-page PDF.

functions.description: Sets PDF plugin attributes in the stream for this context if there is one.

events.name: onSave

platformKeys.description: Use the chrome.platformKeys API to access client certificates managed by the platform. If the user or policy grants the permission, an extension can use such a certficate in its custom authentication protocol. E.g. this allows usage of platform managed certificates in third party VPNs (see $(ref:vpnProvider chrome.vpnProvider)).

certificate.description: The DER encoding of a X.509 certificate.
certificate.name: certificate

keyAlgorithm.description: The KeyAlgorithm of the certified key. This contains algorithm parameters that are inherent to the key of the certificate (e.g. the key length). Other parameters like the hash function used by the sign function are not included.
keyAlgorithm.name: keyAlgorithm

certificateTypes.description: This field is a list of the types of certificates requested, sorted in order of the server's preference. Only certificates of a type contained in this list will be retrieved. If certificateTypes is the empty list, however, certificates of any type will be returned.
certificateTypes.name: certificateTypes

certificateAuthorities.description: List of distinguished names of certificate authorities allowed by the server. Each entry must be a DER-encoded X.509 DistinguishedName.
certificateAuthorities.name: certificateAuthorities

request.description: Only certificates that match this request will be returned.
request.name: request

clientCerts.description: If given, the selectClientCertificates operates on this list. Otherwise, obtains the list of all certificates from the platform's certificate stores that are available to this extensions. Entries that the extension doesn't have permission for or which doesn't match the request, are removed.
clientCerts.name: clientCerts

interactive.description: If true, the filtered list is presented to the user to manually select a certificate and thereby granting the extension access to the certificate(s) and key(s). Only the selected certificate(s) will be returned. If is false, the list is reduced to all certificates that the extension has been granted access to (automatically or manually).
interactive.name: interactive

serverCertificateChain.description: Each chain entry must be the DER encoding of a X.509 certificate, the first entry must be the server certificate and each entry must certify the entry preceding it.
serverCertificateChain.name: serverCertificateChain

hostname.description: The hostname of the server to verify the certificate for, e.g. the server that presented the serverCertificateChain.
hostname.name: hostname

trusted.description: The result of the trust verification: true if trust for the given verification details could be established and false if trust is rejected for any reason.
trusted.name: trusted

debug_errors.description:
If the trust verification failed, this array contains the errors reported by the underlying network layer. Otherwise, this array is empty.

Note: This list is meant for debugging only and may not contain all relevant errors. The errors returned may change in future revisions of this API, and are not guaranteed to be forwards or backwards compatible.
debug_errors.name: debug_errors

functions.description: This method filters from a list of client certificates the ones that are known to the platform, match request and for which the extension has permission to access the certificate and its private key. If interactive is true, the user is presented a dialog where they can select from matching certificates and grant the extension access to the certificate. The selected/filtered client certificates will be passed to callback.

parameters.name: matches
parameters.description: The list of certificates that match the request, that the extension has permission for and, if interactive is true, that were selected by the user.

functions.name: selectClientCertificates

functions.description: Passes the key pair of certificate for usage with $(ref:platformKeys.subtleCrypto) to callback.

parameters.name: certificate
parameters.description: The certificate of a $(ref:Match) returned by $(ref:selectClientCertificates).

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description:
Determines signature/hash algorithm parameters additionally to the parameters fixed by the key itself. The same parameters are accepted as by WebCrypto's importKey function, e.g. RsaHashedImportParams for a RSASSA-PKCS1-v1_5 key and EcKeyImportParams for EC key. Additionally for RSASSA-PKCS1-v1_5 keys, hashing algorithm name parameter can be specified with one of the following values: "none", "SHA-1", "SHA-256", "SHA-384", or "SHA-512", e.g. {"hash": { "name": "none" } }. The sign function will then apply PKCS#1 v1.5 padding but not hash the given data.

Currently, this method only supports the "RSASSA-PKCS1-v1_5" and "ECDSA" algorithms.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: The public and private CryptoKey of a certificate which can only be used with $(ref:platformKeys.subtleCrypto).

parameters.name: privateKey
parameters.description: Might be null if this extension does not have access to it.

functions.name: getKeyPair

functions.description: Passes the key pair identified by publicKeySpkiDer for usage with $(ref:platformKeys.subtleCrypto) to callback.

parameters.name: publicKeySpkiDer
parameters.description: A DER-encoded X.509 SubjectPublicKeyInfo, obtained e.g. by calling WebCrypto's exportKey function with format="spki".

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description:
Provides signature and hash algorithm parameters, in addition to those fixed by the key itself. The same parameters are accepted as by WebCrypto's importKey function, e.g. RsaHashedImportParams for a RSASSA-PKCS1-v1_5 key. For RSASSA-PKCS1-v1_5 keys, we need to also pass a "hash" parameter { "hash": { "name": string } }. The "hash" parameter represents the name of the hashing algorithm to be used in the digest operation before a sign. It is possible to pass "none" as the hash name, in which case the sign function will apply PKCS#1 v1.5 padding and but not hash the given data.

Currently, this method supports the "ECDSA" algorithm with named-curve P-256 and "RSASSA-PKCS1-v1_5" algorithm with one of the hashing algorithms "none", "SHA-1", "SHA-256", "SHA-384", and "SHA-512".

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: The public and private CryptoKey of a certificate which can only be used with $(ref:platformKeys.subtleCrypto).

parameters.name: privateKey
parameters.description: Might be null if this extension does not have access to it.

functions.name: getKeyPairBySpki

functions.description: An implementation of WebCrypto's SubtleCrypto that allows crypto operations on keys of client certificates that are available to this extension.
functions.name: subtleCrypto

functions.description: Checks whether details.serverCertificateChain can be trusted for details.hostname according to the trust settings of the platform. Note: The actual behavior of the trust verification is not fully specified and might change in the future. The API implementation verifies certificate expiration, validates the certification path and checks trust by a known CA. The implementation is supposed to respect the EKU serverAuth and to support subject alternative names.
functions.name: verifyTLSServerCertificate

platformKeysInternal.description: Internal API for to implement the platformKeys and enterprise.platformKeys APIs.

functions.description: See documentation in platformKeys.
functions.name: selectClientCertificates

functions.description: Internal version of platformKeys.subtleCrypto.sign and enterprise.platformKeys.Token.subtleCrypto.sign. |tokenId| The id of a Token returned by |getTokens|. |publicKey| The Subject Public Key Info of a key previously generated by     |generateKey| in DER encoding. |algorithmName| The name of the algorithm used to generate the key pair. |hashAlgorithmName| The recognized algorithm name of the hash algorithm,     as specified by WebCrypto, that will be used to digest |data|     before signing. Currently supported are: SHA-{1,256,384,512}.     If instead the algorithm name "none" is provided, no hashing will be     applied, the data is PKCS#1 v1.5 padded but not hashed.     TODO(pneubeck): use an enum once supported:         http://www.crbug.com/385539 . |data| The data to sign. |callback| Called back with the signature of |data|. TODO: Instead of ArrayBuffer should be (ArrayBuffer or ArrayBufferView), or at least (ArrayBuffer or Uint8Array).

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Invoked by sign. |signature| The signature, a octet string.

functions.name: sign

functions.description: Checks whether certificate certifies a key that allows usage of the WebCrypto algorithm algorithmName. If so, calls back callback with the key info and a WebCrypto KeyAlgorithm dictionary describing the key's algorithm. The name property will equal algorithmName. Otherwise, calls back with an error.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Called back by getPublicKey. |publicKey| The Subject Public Key Info (see X.509) of the requested certificate. |algorithm| A partial WebCrypto KeyAlgorithm containing all information that is available from the Subject Public Key Info. It does not contain signature/hash parameters.

functions.name: getPublicKey

functions.description: Takes as arguments a publicKeySpkiDer and algorithmName. Checks if publicKeySpkiDer is not empty and if the algorithmName specified is supported. If so, calls back callback with the key info and a WebCrypto KeyAlgorithm dictionary describing the key's algorithm. The name property will equal algorithmName. Otherwise, calls back with an error.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Called back by getPublicKey. |publicKey| The Subject Public Key Info (see X.509) of the requested certificate. |algorithm| A partial WebCrypto KeyAlgorithm containing all information that is available from the Subject Public Key Info. It does not contain signature/hash parameters.

functions.name: getPublicKeyBySpki

printing.description: Use the chrome.printing API to send print jobs to printers installed on Chromebook.

job.description: The print job to be submitted. Supported content types are "application/pdf" and "image/png". The Cloud Job Ticket shouldn't include FitToPageTicketItem, PageRangeTicketItem and ReverseOrderTicketItem fields since they are irrelevant for native printing. VendorTicketItem is optional. All other fields must be present.
job.name: job

documentBlobUuid.description: Used internally to store the blob uuid after parameter customization and shouldn't be populated by the extension.
documentBlobUuid.name: documentBlobUuid

types.description: The status of $(ref:submitJob) request.

enum.name: OK
enum.description: Sent print job request is accepted.

enum.name: USER_REJECTED
enum.description: Sent print job request is rejected by the user.

jobId.description: The id of created print job. This is a unique identifier among all print jobs on the device. If status is not OK, jobId will be null.
jobId.name: jobId

types.description: The source of the printer.

enum.name: USER
enum.description: Printer was added by user.

enum.name: POLICY
enum.description: Printer was added via policy.

id.description: The printer's identifier; guaranteed to be unique among printers on the device.
id.name: id

name.description: The name of the printer.
name.name: name

description.description: The human-readable description of the printer.
description.name: description

uri.description: The printer URI. This can be used by extensions to choose the printer for the user.
uri.name: uri

source.description: The source of the printer (user or policy configured).
source.name: source

isDefault.description: The flag which shows whether the printer fits DefaultPrinterSelection rules. Note that several printers could be flagged.
isDefault.name: isDefault

recentlyUsedRank.description: The value showing how recent the printer was used for printing from Chrome. The lower the value is the more recent the printer was used. The minimum value is 0. Missing value indicates that the printer wasn't used recently. This value is guaranteed to be unique amongst printers.
recentlyUsedRank.name: recentlyUsedRank

types.description: The status of the printer.

enum.name: DOOR_OPEN
enum.description: The door of the printer is open. Printer still accepts print jobs.

enum.name: TRAY_MISSING
enum.description: The tray of the printer is missing. Printer still accepts print jobs.

enum.name: OUT_OF_INK
enum.description: The printer is out of ink. Printer still accepts print jobs.

enum.name: OUT_OF_PAPER
enum.description: The printer is out of paper. Printer still accepts print jobs.

enum.name: OUTPUT_FULL
enum.description: The output area of the printer (e.g. tray) is full. Printer still accepts print jobs.

enum.name: PAPER_JAM
enum.description: The printer has a paper jam. Printer still accepts print jobs.

enum.name: GENERIC_ISSUE
enum.description: Some generic issue. Printer still accepts print jobs.

enum.name: STOPPED
enum.description: The printer is stopped and doesn't print but still accepts print jobs.

enum.name: UNREACHABLE
enum.description: The printer is unreachable and doesn't accept print jobs.

enum.name: EXPIRED_CERTIFICATE
enum.description: The SSL certificate is expired. Printer accepts jobs but they fail.

enum.name: AVAILABLE
enum.description: The printer is available.

capabilities.description: Printer capabilities in CDD format. The property may be missing.
capabilities.name: capabilities

types.description: Status of the print job.

enum.name: PENDING
enum.description: Print job is received on Chrome side but was not processed yet.

enum.name: IN_PROGRESS
enum.description: Print job is sent for printing.

enum.name: FAILED
enum.description: Print job was interrupted due to some error.

enum.name: CANCELED
enum.description: Print job was canceled by the user or via API.

enum.name: PRINTED
enum.description: Print job was printed without any errors.

functions.description:
Submits the job for printing. If the extension is not listed in the PrintingAPIExtensionsAllowlist policy, the user is prompted to accept the print job.
Before Chrome 120, this function did not return a promise.

parameters.name: jobId

functions.description: Returns the status of the print job. This call will fail with a runtime error if the print job with the given `jobId` doesn't exist. `jobId`: The id of the print job to return the status of. This should be the same id received in a $(ref:SubmitJobResponse).
functions.name: getJobStatus

enum.name: USER

enum.name: BLACK_AND_WHITE

width.description: Width (in micrometers) of the media used for printing.

vendorId.description: Vendor-provided ID, e.g. "iso_a3_297x420mm" or "na_index-3x5_3x5in". Possible values are values of "media" IPP attribute and can be found on IANA page .

name.description: Displayed name of the printer.

uri.description: The full path for the printer. Contains protocol, hostname, port, and queue.

id.description: The ID of the job.

title.description: The title of the document which was printed.

creationTime.description: The job creation time (in milliseconds past the Unix epoch).

completionTime.description: The job completion time (in milliseconds past the Unix epoch).
completionTime.name: completionTime

printer.description: The info about the printer which printed the document.
printer.name: printer

settings.description: The settings of the print job.

numberOfPages.name: numberOfPages

processes.description: Use the chrome.processes API to interact with the browser's processes.

types.description: The types of the browser processes.

enum.name: worker
enum.description: Obsolete, will never be returned.

enum.name: service_worker
enum.description: Obsolete, will never be returned.

title.description: The title of the task.
title.name: title

tabId.description: Optional tab ID, if this task represents a tab running on a renderer process.
tabId.name: tabId

size.description: The size of the cache, in bytes.
size.name: size

liveSize.description: The part of the cache that is utilized, in bytes.
liveSize.name: liveSize

id.description: Unique ID of the process provided by the browser.
id.name: id

osProcessId.description: The ID of the process, as provided by the OS.
osProcessId.name: osProcessId

type.description: The type of process.
type.name: type

profile.description: The profile which the process is associated with.
profile.name: profile

naclDebugPort.description: The debugging port for Native Client processes. Zero for other process types and for NaCl processes that do not have debugging enabled.
naclDebugPort.name: naclDebugPort

tasks.description: Array of TaskInfos representing the tasks running on this process.
tasks.name: tasks

cpu.description: The most recent measurement of the process's CPU usage, expressed as the percentage of a single CPU core used in total, by all of the process's threads. This gives a value from zero to CpuInfo.numOfProcessors*100, which can exceed 100% in multi-threaded processes. Only available when receiving the object as part of a callback from onUpdated or onUpdatedWithMemory.
cpu.name: cpu

network.description: The most recent measurement of the process network usage, in bytes per second. Only available when receiving the object as part of a callback from onUpdated or onUpdatedWithMemory.
network.name: network

privateMemory.description: The most recent measurement of the process private memory usage, in bytes. Only available when receiving the object as part of a callback from onUpdatedWithMemory or getProcessInfo with the includeMemory flag.
privateMemory.name: privateMemory

jsMemoryAllocated.description: The most recent measurement of the process JavaScript allocated memory, in bytes. Only available when receiving the object as part of a callback from onUpdated or onUpdatedWithMemory.
jsMemoryAllocated.name: jsMemoryAllocated

jsMemoryUsed.description: The most recent measurement of the process JavaScript memory used, in bytes. Only available when receiving the object as part of a callback from onUpdated or onUpdatedWithMemory.
jsMemoryUsed.name: jsMemoryUsed

sqliteMemory.description: The most recent measurement of the process's SQLite memory usage, in bytes. Only available when receiving the object as part of a callback from onUpdated or onUpdatedWithMemory.
sqliteMemory.name: sqliteMemory

imageCache.description: The most recent information about the image cache for the process. Only available when receiving the object as part of a callback from onUpdated or onUpdatedWithMemory.
imageCache.name: imageCache

scriptCache.description: The most recent information about the script cache for the process. Only available when receiving the object as part of a callback from onUpdated or onUpdatedWithMemory.
scriptCache.name: scriptCache

cssCache.description: The most recent information about the CSS cache for the process. Only available when receiving the object as part of a callback from onUpdated or onUpdatedWithMemory.
cssCache.name: cssCache

parameters.description: True if detailed memory usage is required. Note, collecting memory usage information incurs extra CPU usage and should only be queried for when needed.

parameters.name: processes
parameters.description: A dictionary of $(ref:Process) objects for each requested process that is a live child process of the current browser process, indexed by process ID. Metrics requiring aggregation over time will not be populated in each Process object.

functions.name: getProcessInfo

events.description: Fired each time the Task Manager updates its process statistics, providing the dictionary of updated Process objects, indexed by process ID.

parameters.name: processes
parameters.description: A dictionary of updated $(ref:Process) objects for each live process in the browser, indexed by process ID.  Metrics requiring aggregation over time will be populated in each Process object.

events.name: onUpdated

events.description: Fired each time the Task Manager updates its process statistics, providing the dictionary of updated Process objects, indexed by process ID. Identical to onUpdate, with the addition of memory usage details included in each Process object. Note, collecting memory usage information incurs extra CPU usage and should only be listened for when needed.

parameters.name: processes
parameters.description: A dictionary of updated $(ref:Process) objects for each live process in the browser, indexed by process ID.  Memory usage details will be included in each Process object.

parameters.description: Details of the process that was created. Metrics requiring aggregation over time will not be populated in the object.

parameters.description: The ID of the process that exited.

parameters.description: The type of exit that occurred for the process - normal, abnormal, killed, crashed. Only available for renderer processes.

parameters.name: exitCode
parameters.description: The exit code if the process exited abnormally. Only available for renderer processes.

quickUnlockPrivate.description: Use the chrome.quickUnlockPrivate API to change whether the lock screen is enabled and which modes are allowed (active) for unlocking a Chrome OS device from the lock screen. The API is also used to set quick unlock credentials. Note: The API is named 'quickUnlock' for historical reasons but it should be used for all lock screen settings. Note: This API can not be used to actually unlock the device.

token.description: The authentication token that can be passed to $(ref:setModes) calls.
token.name: token

lifetimeSeconds.description: The number of seconds until the token expires. The UI should refresh the token before it expires.
lifetimeSeconds.name: lifetimeSeconds

types.description: TODO(jdufault): Add more quick unlock modes, such as a pattern unlock.
The problems a given PIN might have.

safeBrowsingPrivate.description: Use the chrome.safeBrowsingPrivate API to observe events or retrieve referrer chain.

enum.name: EVENT_URL
enum.description: Ends with the final URL of the referrer chain.

enum.name: LANDING_PAGE
enum.description: One gesture away from the EVENT_URL, i.e. the user will click on the LANDING_PAGE, go through zero or more CLIENT_REDIRECTS, then end up at EVENT_URL.

enum.name: LANDING_REFERRER
enum.description: One gesture away from LANDING_PAGE.

enum.name: CLIENT_REDIRECT
enum.description: The navigation is RENDER_INITIATED_WITHOUT_USER_GESTURE.

enum.name: RECENT_NAVIGATION
enum.description: Doesn't directly lead to the EVENT_URL, but the navigation occurred recently, so it might be involved in the event.

enum.name: REFERRER
enum.description: Triggered by a user gesture and precedes the LANDING_REFERRER.

enum.name: BROWSER_INITIATED
enum.description: Typically from Chrome UI, e.g. bookmarks or omnibox.

enum.name: RENDERER_INITIATED_WITHOUT_USER_GESTURE
enum.description: Renderer initiated navigations involve interactions with the content area, such as link clicks or JS.

enum.name: COPY_PASTE_USER_INITIATED
enum.description: Navigation is initiated by the browser process and it is believed the navigation is the result of the user copy and paste the address from the browser into the address bar.

enum.name: NOTIFICATION_INITIATED
enum.description: Navigation is initiated by a click on a Push Notification.

scripting.description: Use the chrome.scripting API to execute script in different contexts.

types.description: The origin for a style change. See style origins for more info.
The JavaScript world for a script to execute within.

enum.name: ISOLATED
enum.description: Specifies the isolated world, which is the execution environment unique to this extension.

enum.name: MAIN
enum.description: Specifies the main world of the DOM, which is the execution environment shared with the host page's JavaScript.

tabId.description: The ID of the tab into which to inject.
tabId.name: tabId

frameIds.description: The IDs of specific frames to inject into.
frameIds.name: frameIds

documentIds.description: The IDs of specific documentIds to inject into. This must not be set if frameIds is set.
documentIds.name: documentIds

allFrames.description: Whether the script should inject into all frames within the tab. Defaults to false. This must not be true if frameIds is specified.
allFrames.name: allFrames

func.description: A JavaScript function to inject. This function will be serialized, and then deserialized for injection. This means that any bound parameters and execution context will be lost. Exactly one of files or func must be specified.
func.name: func

args.description: The arguments to pass to the provided function. This is only valid if the func parameter is specified. These arguments must be JSON-serializable.
args.name: args

function.description: We used to call the injected function `function`, but this is incompatible with JavaScript's object declaration shorthand (see https://crbug.com/1166438). We leave this silently in for backwards compatibility. TODO(devlin): Remove this in M95.
function.name: function

files.description: The path of the JS or CSS files to inject, relative to the extension's root directory. Exactly one of files or func must be specified.
files.name: files

target.description: Details specifying the target into which to inject the script.
target.name: target

world.description: The JavaScript "world" to run the script in. Defaults to ISOLATED.
world.name: world

injectImmediately.description: Whether the injection should be triggered in the target as soon as possible. Note that this is not a guarantee that injection will occur prior to page load, as the page may have already loaded by the time the script reaches the target.
injectImmediately.name: injectImmediately

target.description: Details specifying the target into which to insert the CSS.
target.name: target

css.description: A string containing the CSS to inject. Exactly one of files and css must be specified.
css.name: css

files.description: The path of the CSS files to inject, relative to the extension's root directory. Exactly one of files and css must be specified.
files.name: files

origin.description: The style origin for the injection. Defaults to 'AUTHOR'.
origin.name: origin

result.description: The result of the script execution.
result.name: result

frameId.description: The frame associated with the injection.
frameId.name: frameId

documentId.description: The document associated with the injection.
documentId.name: documentId

id.description: The id of the content script, specified in the API call. Must not start with a '_' as it's reserved as a prefix for generated script IDs.
id.name: id

matches.description: Specifies which pages this content script will be injected into. See Match Patterns for more details on the syntax of these strings. Must be specified for $(ref:registerContentScripts).
matches.name: matches

excludeMatches.description: Excludes pages that this content script would otherwise be injected into. See Match Patterns for more details on the syntax of these strings.
excludeMatches.name: excludeMatches

css.description: The list of CSS files to be injected into matching pages. These are injected in the order they appear in this array, before any DOM is constructed or displayed for the page.
css.name: css

js.description: The list of JavaScript files to be injected into matching pages. These are injected in the order they appear in this array.
js.name: js

allFrames.description: If specified true, it will inject into all frames, even if the frame is not the top-most frame in the tab. Each frame is checked independently for URL requirements; it will not inject into child frames if the URL requirements are not met. Defaults to false, meaning that only the top frame is matched.
allFrames.name: allFrames

matchOriginAsFallback.description: Indicates whether the script can be injected into frames where the URL contains an unsupported scheme; specifically: about:, data:, blob:, or filesystem:. In these cases, the URL's origin is checked to determine if the script should be injected. If the origin is `null` (as is the case for data: URLs) then the used origin is either the frame that created the current frame or the frame that initiated the navigation to this frame. Note that this may not be the parent frame.
matchOriginAsFallback.name: matchOriginAsFallback

runAt.description: Specifies when JavaScript files are injected into the web page. The preferred and default value is document_idle.
runAt.name: runAt

persistAcrossSessions.description: Specifies if this content script will persist into future sessions. The default is true.
persistAcrossSessions.name: persistAcrossSessions

world.description: The JavaScript "world" to run the script in. Defaults to ISOLATED.
world.name: world

ids.description: If specified, $(ref:getRegisteredContentScripts) will only return scripts with an id specified in this list.
ids.name: ids

functions.description: Injects a script into a target context. By default, the script will be run at document_idle, or immediately if the page has already loaded. If the injectImmediately property is set, the script will inject without waiting, even if the page has not finished loading. If the script evaluates to a promise, the browser will wait for the promise to settle and return the resulting value.

parameters.name: injection
parameters.description: The details of the script which to inject.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Invoked upon completion of the injection. The resulting array contains the result of execution for each frame where the injection succeeded.

functions.name: executeScript

functions.description: Inserts a CSS stylesheet into a target context. If multiple frames are specified, unsuccessful injections are ignored.

parameters.name: injection
parameters.description: The details of the styles to insert.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Invoked upon completion of the insertion.

functions.name: insertCSS

functions.description: Removes a CSS stylesheet that was previously inserted by this extension from a target context.

parameters.name: injection
parameters.description: The details of the styles to remove. Note that the css, files, and origin properties must exactly match the stylesheet inserted through $(ref:insertCSS). Attempting to remove a non-existent stylesheet is a no-op.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: A callback to be invoked upon the completion of the removal.

functions.name: removeCSS

parameters.name: scripts
parameters.description: Contains a list of scripts to be registered. If there are errors during script parsing/file validation, or if the IDs specified already exist, then no scripts are registered.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: A callback to be invoked once scripts have been fully registered or if an error has occurred.

parameters.description: An object to filter the extension's dynamically registered scripts.

functions.description: Unregisters content scripts for this extension.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: If specified, only unregisters dynamic content scripts which match the filter. Otherwise, all of the extension's dynamic content scripts are unregistered.

returns_async.name: callback

functions.name: unregisterContentScripts

functions.description: Updates one or more content scripts for this extension.

parameters.name: scripts
parameters.description: Contains a list of scripts to be updated. A property is only updated for the existing script if it is specified in this object. If there are errors during script parsing/file validation, or if the IDs specified do not correspond to a fully registered script, then no scripts are updated.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: A callback to be invoked once scripts have been updated or if an error has occurred.

search.description: Use the chrome.search API to search via the default provider.

enum.name: CURRENT_TAB
enum.description: Specifies that the search results display in the calling tab or the tab from the active browser.

enum.name: NEW_TAB
enum.description: Specifies that the search results display in a new tab.

enum.name: NEW_WINDOW
enum.description: Specifies that the search results display in a new window.

text.description: String to query with the default search provider.
text.name: text

disposition.description: Location where search results should be displayed. CURRENT_TAB is the default.
disposition.name: disposition

tabId.description: Location where search results should be displayed. tabId cannot be used with disposition.
tabId.name: tabId

functions.description: Used to query the default search provider. In case of an error, $(ref:runtime.lastError) will be set.
functions.name: query

settingsPrivate.description: Use the chrome.settingsPrivate API to get or set preferences from the settings UI. Access is restricted to a set of allowed user facing preferences.

enum.name: PARENT
enum.description: Preferences are controlled by the parent of the child user.

enum.name: CHILD_RESTRICTION
enum.description: Preferences are controlled neither by parent nor the child user. Preference values are hard-coded values and can not be changed.

enum.name: SAFE_BROWSING_OFF
enum.description: Preferences are controlled by "Safe Browsing" off setting.

enum.name: ENFORCED
enum.description: Value cannot be changed by user.

enum.name: RECOMMENDED
enum.description: Value can be changed, but the administrator recommends a default.

enum.name: PARENT_SUPERVISED
enum.description: Value is protected by a code that only parents can access. The logic to require the code is NOT automatically added to a preference using this enforcement. This is only used to display the correct pref indicator.

type.description: The type of the pref (e.g., boolean, string, etc.).
type.name: type

value.description: The current value of the pref.
value.name: value

controlledBy.description: The policy source of the pref; an undefined value means there is no policy.
controlledBy.name: controlledBy

controlledByName.description: The owner name if controlledBy == OWNER. The primary user name if controlledBy == PRIMARY_USER. The extension name if controlledBy == EXTENSION.
controlledByName.name: controlledByName

enforcement.description: The policy enforcement of the pref; must be specified if controlledBy is also present.
enforcement.name: enforcement

recommendedValue.description: The recommended value if enforcement == RECOMMENDED.
recommendedValue.name: recommendedValue

userSelectableValues.description: If enforcement == ENFORCED this optionally specifies preference values that are still available for selection by the user. If set, must contain at least 2 distinct values, as must contain |value| and |recommendedValue| (if present).
userSelectableValues.name: userSelectableValues

userControlDisabled.description: If true, user control of the preference is disabled for reasons unrelated to controlledBy (e.g. no signed-in profile is present). A false value is a no-op.
userControlDisabled.name: userControlDisabled

extensionId.description: The extension ID if controlledBy == EXTENSION.
extensionId.name: extensionId

extensionCanBeDisabled.description: Whether the controlling extension can be disabled if controlledBy == EXTENSION.
extensionCanBeDisabled.name: extensionCanBeDisabled

sidePanel.description: Use the `chrome.sidePanel` API to host content in the browser's side panel alongside the main content of a webpage.

default_path.description: Developer specified path for side panel display.
default_path.name: default_path

types.description: Defines the possible alignment for the side panel in the browser UI.

tabId.description: If specified, the side panel options will only apply to the tab with this id. If omitted, these options set the default behavior (used for any tab that doesn't have specific settings). Note: if the same path is set for this tabId and the default tabId, then the panel for this tabId will be a different instance than the panel for the default tabId.
tabId.name: tabId

path.description: The path to the side panel HTML file to use. This must be a local resource within the extension package.
path.name: path

enabled.description: Whether the side panel should be enabled. This is optional. The default value is true.
enabled.name: enabled

openPanelOnActionClick.description: Whether clicking the extension's icon will toggle showing the extension's entry in the side panel. Defaults to false.
openPanelOnActionClick.name: openPanelOnActionClick

tabId.description: If specified, the side panel options for the given tab will be returned. Otherwise, returns the default side panel options (used for any tab that doesn't have specific settings).
tabId.name: tabId

windowId.description: The window in which to open the side panel. This is only applicable if the extension has a global (non-tab-specific) side panel or tabId is also specified. This will override any currently-active global side panel the user has open in the given window. At least one of this or tabId must be provided.
windowId.name: windowId

tabId.description: The tab in which to open the side panel. If the corresponding tab has a tab-specific side panel, the panel will only be open for that tab. If there is not a tab-specific panel, the global panel will be open in the specified tab and any other tabs without a currently-open tab- specific panel. This will override any currently-active side panel (global or tab-specific) in the corresponding tab. At least one of this or windowId must be provided.
tabId.name: tabId

windowId.description: The window in which to close the side panel. If a global side panel is open in the specified window, it will be closed for all tabs in that window where no tab-specific panel is active. At least one of this or tabId must be provided.
windowId.name: windowId

tabId.description: The tab in which to close the side panel. If a tab-specific side panel is open in the specified tab, it will be closed for that tab. At least one of this or windowId must be provided.
tabId.name: tabId

windowId.description: The ID of the window where the side panel is opened. This is available for both global and tab-specific panels.
windowId.name: windowId

tabId.description: The optional ID of the tab where the side panel is opened. This is provided only when the panel is tab-specific.
tabId.name: tabId

path.description: The path of the local resource within the extension package whose content is displayed in the panel.
path.name: path

windowId.description: The ID of the window where the side panel was closed. This is available for both global and tab-specific panels.
windowId.name: windowId

tabId.description: The optional ID of the tab where the side panel was closed. This is provided only when the panel is tab-specific.
tabId.name: tabId

path.description: The path of the local resource within the extension package whose content is displayed in the panel.
path.name: path

smartCardProviderPrivate.description: Use this API to give the browser access to a winscard.h[1] compatible PC/SC[2] implementation, which will be the backend of the browser's Web Smart Card API[3]. [1] https://pcsclite.apdu.fr/api/winscard_8h.html [2] https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/PC/SC [3] https://github.com/WICG/web-smart-card/blob/main/README.md#web-idl TODO(crbug.com/40247152): Add API for the remaining SCard* functions.

types.description: PC/SC error codes we can expect to hit (thus a non-exhaustive list). UNKNOWN means an SCARD error code that is not mapped in this enum (and thus should probably be added here).
Maps to the SCARD_SHARE_* values defined in the winscard.h API.
What the reader should do with the card inserted in it.

enum.name: LEAVE_CARD
enum.description: SCARD_LEAVE_CARD - Do nothing.

enum.name: RESET_CARD
enum.description: SCARD_RESET_CARD - Reset the card (warm reset).

enum.name: UNPOWER_CARD
enum.description: SCARD_UNPOWER_CARD - Power down the card (cold reset).

enum.name: EJECT_CARD
enum.description: SCARD_EJECT_CARD - Eject the card.

enum.name: ABSENT
enum.description: SCARD_ABSENT

enum.name: PRESENT
enum.description: SCARD_PRESENT

enum.name: SWALLOWED
enum.description: SCARD_SWALLOWED

enum.name: POWERED
enum.description: SCARD_POWERED

enum.name: NEGOTIABLE
enum.description: SCARD_NEGOTIABLE

enum.name: SPECIFIC
enum.description: SCARD_SPECIFIC

types.description: Maps to the SCARD_PROTOCOL_* values defined in the winscard.h API.

eventCount.description: The actual number of card insertion and removal events that happened in this reader. Set to zero if not supported.
eventCount.name: eventCount

milliseconds.description: If absent, it means "infinite" or "never timeout"

speechRecognitionPrivate.description: The chrome.speechRecognitionPrivate API allows internal extensions to use either network-based or on-device speech recognition.

types.description: Possible types of speech recognition.

isFinal.description: Whether the result is a final or an interim result.
isFinal.name: isFinal

clientId.description: An optional ID to specify the client.
clientId.name: clientId

locale.description: The locale, in BCP-47 format e.g. "en-US", to use for speech recognition.

interimResults.description: Whether interim speech results should be returned.
interimResults.name: interimResults

clientId.description: An optional ID to specify the client. This must match the clientId used when starting speech recognition to work as intended.
clientId.name: clientId

functions.description: Starts listening to audio from the user. The callback is invoked when speech recognition has started. If speech recognition is already active when calling start(), the callback is run with an error.

functions.name: start

functions.description: Stops listening to audio from the user. The callback is invoked when speech recognition has stopped. If speech recognition has already stopped when calling stop(), the callback is run with an error.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Called when speech recognition has stopped listening to the user's audio.

functions.name: stop

events.description: Fired when speech recognition stops.

events.description: Fired when a speech recognition result is returned.

events.description: Fired when a speech recognition error occurs.

tabCapture.description: Use the chrome.tabCapture API to interact with tab media streams.

tabId.description: The id of the tab whose status changed.
tabId.name: tabId

status.description: The new capture status of the tab.
status.name: status

fullscreen.description: Whether an element in the tab being captured is in fullscreen mode.
fullscreen.name: fullscreen

consumerTabId.description: Optional tab id of the tab which will later invoke getUserMedia() to consume the stream. If not specified then the resulting stream can be used only by the calling extension. The stream can only be used by frames in the given tab whose security origin matches the consumber tab's origin. The tab's origin must be a secure origin, e.g. HTTPS.
consumerTabId.name: consumerTabId

targetTabId.description: Optional tab id of the tab which will be captured. If not specified then the current active tab will be selected. Only tabs for which the extension has been granted the activeTab permission can be used as the target tab.
targetTabId.name: targetTabId

functions.description: Captures the visible area of the currently active tab. Capture can only be started on the currently active tab after the extension has been invoked, similar to the way that activeTab works. Capture is maintained across page navigations within the tab, and stops when the tab is closed, or the media stream is closed by the extension.

parameters.name: options
parameters.description: Configures the returned media stream.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Callback with either the tab capture MediaStream or null. null indicates an error has occurred and the client may query $(ref:runtime.lastError) to access the error details.

functions.name: capture

functions.description: Returns a list of tabs that have requested capture or are being captured, i.e. status != stopped and status != error. This allows extensions to inform the user that there is an existing tab capture that would prevent a new tab capture from succeeding (or to prevent redundant requests for the same tab).

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Callback invoked with CaptureInfo[] for captured tabs.

functions.name: getCapturedTabs

functions.description: Creates a stream ID to capture the target tab. Similar to chrome.tabCapture.capture() method, but returns a media stream ID, instead of a media stream, to the consumer tab.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Callback to invoke with the result. If successful, the result is an opaque string that can be passed to the getUserMedia() API to generate a media stream that corresponds to the target tab. The created streamId can only be used once and expires after a few seconds if it is not used.

functions.name: getMediaStreamId

events.description: Event fired when the capture status of a tab changes. This allows extension authors to keep track of the capture status of tabs to keep UI elements like page actions in sync.

parameters.name: info
parameters.description: CaptureInfo with new capture status for the tab.

events.name: onStatusChanged

vpnProvider.description: Use the chrome.vpnProvider API to implement a VPN client.

address.description: IP address for the VPN interface in CIDR notation. IPv4 is currently the only supported mode.
address.name: address

broadcastAddress.description: Broadcast address for the VPN interface. (default: deduced from IP address and mask)
broadcastAddress.name: broadcastAddress

mtu.description: MTU setting for the VPN interface. (default: 1500 bytes)
mtu.name: mtu

exclusionList.description: Exclude network traffic to the list of IP blocks in CIDR notation from the tunnel. This can be used to bypass traffic to and from the VPN server. When many rules match a destination, the rule with the longest matching prefix wins. Entries that correspond to the same CIDR block are treated as duplicates. Such duplicates in the collated (exclusionList + inclusionList) list are eliminated and the exact duplicate entry that will be eliminated is undefined.
exclusionList.name: exclusionList

inclusionList.description: Include network traffic to the list of IP blocks in CIDR notation to the tunnel. This parameter can be used to set up a split tunnel. By default no traffic is directed to the tunnel. Adding the entry "0.0.0.0/0" to this list gets all the user traffic redirected to the tunnel. When many rules match a destination, the rule with the longest matching prefix wins. Entries that correspond to the same CIDR block are treated as duplicates. Such duplicates in the collated (exclusionList + inclusionList) list are eliminated and the exact duplicate entry that will be eliminated is undefined.
inclusionList.name: inclusionList

domainSearch.description: A list of search domains. (default: no search domain)
domainSearch.name: domainSearch

dnsServers.description: A list of IPs for the DNS servers.
dnsServers.name: dnsServers

reconnect.description:
Whether or not the VPN extension implements auto-reconnection.

If true, the linkDown, linkUp, linkChanged, suspend, and resume platform messages will be used to signal the respective events. If false, the system will forcibly disconnect the VPN if the network topology changes, and the user will need to reconnect manually. (default: false)

This property is new in Chrome 51; it will generate an exception in earlier versions. try/catch can be used to conditionally enable the feature based on browser support.
reconnect.name: reconnect

types.description: The enum is used by the platform to notify the client of the VPN session status.

enum.name: connected
enum.description: Indicates that the VPN configuration connected.

enum.name: disconnected
enum.description: Indicates that the VPN configuration disconnected.

enum.name: error
enum.description: Indicates that an error occurred in VPN connection, for example a timeout. A description of the error is given as the error argument to onPlatformMessage.

enum.name: linkDown
enum.description: Indicates that the default physical network connection is down.

enum.name: linkUp
enum.description: Indicates that the default physical network connection is back up.

enum.name: linkChanged
enum.description: Indicates that the default physical network connection changed, e.g. wifi->mobile.

enum.name: suspend
enum.description: Indicates that the OS is preparing to suspend, so the VPN should drop its connection. The extension is not guaranteed to receive this event prior to suspending.

enum.name: resume
enum.description: Indicates that the OS has resumed and the user has logged back in, so the VPN should try to reconnect.

types.description: The enum is used by the VPN client to inform the platform of its current state. This helps provide meaningful messages to the user.

enum.name: connected
enum.description: Specifies that VPN connection was successful.

enum.name: failure
enum.description: Specifies that VPN connection has failed.

functions.name: completeCreateRequest
functions.description: Reports the result of a navigator.credentials.create() call. The extension must call this for every onCreateRequest event it has received, unless the request was canceled (in which case, an onRequestCanceled event is fired).

functions.name: completeGetRequest
functions.description: Reports the result of a navigator.credentials.get() call. The extension must call this for every onGetRequest event it has received, unless the request was canceled (in which case, an onRequestCanceled event is fired).

functions.name: completeIsUvpaaRequest
functions.description: Reports the result of a PublicKeyCredential.isUserVerifyingPlatformAuthenticator() call. The extension must call this for every onIsUvpaaRequest event it has received.

functions.name: attach
functions.description:
Makes this extension the active Web Authentication API request proxy.

Remote desktop extensions typically call this method after detecting attachment of a remote session to this host. Once this method returns without error, regular processing of WebAuthn requests is suspended, and events from this extension API are raised.

This method fails with an error if a different extension is already attached.

The attached extension must call detach() once the remote desktop session has ended in order to resume regular WebAuthn request processing. Extensions automatically become detached if they are unloaded.

Refer to the onRemoteSessionStateChange event for signaling a change of remote session attachment from a native application to to the (possibly suspended) extension.

functions.name: detach
functions.description:
Removes this extension from being the active Web Authentication API request proxy.

This method is typically called when the extension detects that a remote desktop session was terminated. Once this method returns, the extension ceases to be the active Web Authentication API request proxy.

Refer to the onRemoteSessionStateChange event for signaling a change of remote session attachment from a native application to to the (possibly suspended) extension.

requestId.name: requestId
requestId.description: An opaque identifier for the request.

requestId.name: requestId
requestId.description: An opaque identifier for the request.

requestDetailsJson.name: requestDetailsJson
requestDetailsJson.description: The PublicKeyCredentialRequestOptions passed to navigator.credentials.get(), serialized as a JSON string. The serialization format is compatible with PublicKeyCredential.parseRequestOptionsFromJSON().

requestId.description: The requestId of the CreateRequest.

error.name: error

responseJson.name: responseJson
responseJson.description: The PublicKeyCredential, yielded by the remote request, if any, serialized as a JSON string by calling href="https://w3c.github.io/webauthn/#dom-publickeycredential-tojson"> PublicKeyCredential.toJSON().

events.name: onRemoteSessionStateChange
events.description:
A native application associated with this extension can cause this event to be fired by writing to a file with a name equal to the extension's ID in a directory named WebAuthenticationProxyRemoteSessionStateChange inside the default user data directory

The contents of the file should be empty. I.e., it is not necessary to change the contents of the file in order to trigger this event.

The native host application may use this event mechanism to signal a possible remote session state change (i.e. from detached to attached, or vice versa) while the extension service worker is possibly suspended. In the handler for this event, the extension can call the attach() or detach() API methods accordingly.

The event listener must be registered synchronously at load time.

events.name: onCreateRequest
events.description: Fires when a WebAuthn navigator.credentials.create() call occurs. The extension must supply a response by calling completeCreateRequest() with the requestId from requestInfo.

events.name: onGetRequest
events.description: Fires when a WebAuthn navigator.credentials.get() call occurs. The extension must supply a response by calling completeGetRequest() with the requestId from requestInfo

events.name: onIsUvpaaRequest
events.description: Fires when a PublicKeyCredential.isUserVerifyingPlatformAuthenticatorAvailable() call occurs. The extension must supply a response by calling completeIsUvpaaRequest() with the requestId from requestInfo

events.name: onRequestCanceled
events.description: Fires when a onCreateRequest or onGetRequest event is canceled (because the WebAuthn request was aborted by the caller, or because it timed out). When receiving this event, the extension should cancel processing of the corresponding request on the client side. Extensions cannot complete a request once it has been canceled.

webAuthenticationProxy.description: The chrome.webAuthenticationProxy API lets remote desktop software running on a remote host intercept Web Authentication API (WebAuthn) requests in order to handle them on a local client.

webrtcAudioPrivate.description: The chrome.webrtcAudioPrivate API allows enumeration of audio output (sink) devices. Note that device IDs as used in this API are opaque (i.e. they are not the hardware identifier of the device) and while they are unique and persistent across sessions, they are valid only to the extension calling this API (i.e. they cannot be shared between extensions). See this document for further details of this API: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1un8aJoUvyt5jMUkK_hoeEJ4HRw-Nf8bA25hYUOpg_Oo/

sinkId.description: The opaque identifier of the audio sink device, which is unique and static for the extension calling the API but invalid for others.
sinkId.name: sinkId

sampleRate.description: Current sample rate of the device, in Hz. Useful e.g. to know if the remote side should be asked to send a lower sampling rate.
sampleRate.name: sampleRate

isReady.description:
True if the device is ready to play out audio. E.g. if it is a device that takes an audio jack, whether a jack is plugged in.

TODO(joi): Do unplugged devices even get included in enumeration?
isReady.name: isReady

isDefault.description: True if this device is the default audio sink device on the machine.
isDefault.name: isDefault

functions.description: Retrieves a list of available audio sink devices.
functions.name: getSinks

functions.description:
Given a security origin and an input device ID valid for that security origin, retrieve an audio sink ID valid for the extension, or the empty string if there is no associated audio sink.

The associated sink ID can be used as a sink ID for setActiveSink. It is valid irrespective of which process you are setting the active sink for.
functions.name: getAssociatedSink

events.description: Fired when audio sink devices are added or removed.
events.name: onSinksChanged

webrtcLoggingPrivate.description: Use the chrome.webrtcLoggingPrivate API to control diagnostic WebRTC logging.

value.description: The meta data entry value.
value.name: value

reportId.description: The report ID for the uploaded log. Will be empty if not successful.
reportId.name: reportId

tabId.description: The tab identifier from the chrome.tabs API, if the request is from a tab.
tabId.name: tabId

guestProcessId.description: The guest process id for the requester, if the request is from a webview.
guestProcessId.name: guestProcessId

targetWebview.description: Use the render process of the webview in the current page. This allows an app to make a request for a webview it contains. If there are more or less than 1 webview, this will fail with a runtime error.
targetWebview.name: targetWebview

prefixPath.description: Absolute path prefix for the files with the audio debug recordings.
prefixPath.name: prefixPath

didStop.description: Indicates if recording was stopped (either by a timed callback after the time limit has elapsed, or by a manual call).
didStop.name: didStop

didManualStop.description: Indicates if recording was stopped manually through a stopAudioDebugRecordings() call.
didManualStop.name: didManualStop

logId.description: The log ID. Non-empty if and only if StartEventLogging() was successful.
logId.name: logId

functions.description: Sets additional custom meta data that will be uploaded along with the log. |metaData| is a dictionary of the metadata (key, value).
functions.name: setMetaData

functions.description: Starts logging. If logging has already been started for this render process, the call will be ignored. |appSessionId| is the unique session ID which will be added to the log.
functions.name: start

functions.description: Sets whether the log should be uploaded automatically for the case when the render process goes away (tab is closed or crashes) and stop has not been called before that. If |shouldUpload| is true it will be uploaded, otherwise it will be discarded. The default setting is to discard it.
functions.name: setUploadOnRenderClose

functions.description: Stops logging. After stop has finished, either upload() or discard() should be called, otherwise the log will be kept in memory until the render process is closed or logging restarted.
functions.name: stop

functions.description: Stores the current log without uploading. The log may stay around for as much as 5 days. The application has the option of supplying an id for uniquely identifying the log for later upload via a call to uploadStored().
functions.name: store

functions.description: Uploads a previously kept log that was stored via a call to store(). The caller needs to know the logId as was originally provided in the call to store().
functions.name: uploadStored

functions.description: Uploads the log and the RTP dumps, if they exist. Logging and RTP dumping must be stopped before this function is called.
functions.name: upload

functions.description: Discards the log. Logging must be stopped before this function is called.
functions.name: discard

functions.description: Starts RTP dumping. If it has already been started for this render process, the call will be ignored.
functions.name: startRtpDump

functions.description: Stops RTP dumping. After stop has finished, the dumps will be uploaded with the log if upload is called. Otherwise, the dumps will be discarded.
functions.name: stopRtpDump

functions.description: Starts audio debug recordings. |seconds| indicates how many seconds of audio to record. |callback| is invoked once recording stops. If |seconds| is zero, recording will continue until stopAudioDebugRecordings() is explicitly called. In this case, |callback| is invoked once recording starts and will report that recording has not stopped. If |seconds| is negative, startAudioDebugRecordings() fails.
functions.name: startAudioDebugRecordings

functions.description: Stops audio debug recordings.  |callback| is invoked once recording stops. If there is no recording in progress, stopAudioDebugRecordings() fails.
functions.name: stopAudioDebugRecordings

functions.description: Start remote-bound event logging for a specific peer connection, indicated by its session description's ID. If successful, the callback will carry the ID of the log. * |webAppId| must be a number between 1 and 99 (inclusive), which will be   incorporated into the uploaded log, so as to help distinugish logs   captured by different web-apps. * |outputPeriodMs| refers to the time between emissions of logs.   Only non-negative values are allowed. If set to zero, logs will be   produced as soon as an event occurs. If positive, events will be   batched together and emitted approximately every |outputPeriodMs| ms.
functions.name: startEventLogging

functions.description: Returns the directory entry for the "WebRTC Logs" directory. If the directory doesn't exist yet, this will create it. If the directory cannot be created, this call will fail with a runtime error.
functions.name: getLogsDirectory

If `allowUndo` is present or set to true, prompt the user with a notification allowing for the desk to be retrieved. Otherwise close all windows on the desk.

mediaGalleries.description: Use the chrome.mediaGalleries API to access media files (audio, images, video) from the user's local disks (with the user's consent).

enum.name: contents_changed
enum.description: The contents of the gallery have changed.

enum.name: watch_dropped
enum.description: The watch has been dropped because the device has been detached, the gallery permission has been removed, or any other reason.

enum.name: no
enum.description: Do not act interactively.

enum.name: yes
enum.description: Ask the user to manage permitted media galleries.

enum.name: if_needed
enum.description: Ask the user to manage permitted galleries only if the return set would otherwise be empty.

enum.name: all
enum.description: Retrieve the mime type, metadata tags, and attached images.

enum.name: mimeTypeAndTags
enum.description: Retrieve only the mime type and the metadata tags.

enum.name: mimeTypeOnly
enum.description: Retrieve only the mime type.

type.description: Type of change event.
type.name: type

interactive.description: Whether to prompt the user for permission to additional media galleries before returning the permitted set. Default is silent.  If the value 'yes' is passed, or if the application has not been granted access to any media galleries and the value 'if_needed' is passed, then the media gallery configuration dialog will be displayed.
interactive.name: interactive

metadataType.description: Specifies which subset of the metadata to retrieve. Defaults to 'all' if the option is omitted.
metadataType.name: metadataType

name.description: The name of the file system.
name.name: name

galleryId.description: A unique and persistent id for the media gallery.
galleryId.name: galleryId

deviceId.description: If the media gallery is on a removable device, a unique id for the device while the device is online.
deviceId.name: deviceId

isRemovable.description: True if the media gallery is on a removable device.
isRemovable.name: isRemovable

isMediaDevice.description: True if the device the media gallery is on was detected as a media device.  i.e. a PTP or MTP device, or a DCIM directory is present.
isMediaDevice.name: isMediaDevice

isAvailable.description: True if the device is currently available.
isAvailable.name: isAvailable

type.description: Describes format of container or codec of stream, i.e. "mp3", "h264".
type.name: type

tags.description: An unfiltered string->string dictionary of tags for the stream.
tags.name: tags

duration.description: Defined for audio and video. In seconds.
duration.name: duration

rawTags.description: All the metadata in the media file. For formats with multiple streams, stream order will be preserved. Container metadata is the first element.
rawTags.name: rawTags

attachedImages.description: The images embedded in the media file's metadata. This is most often used for album art or video thumbnails.
attachedImages.name: attachedImages

functions.description: Get the media galleries configured in this user agent. If none are configured or available, the callback will receive an empty array.
