functions.description: Present a directory picker to the user and add the selected directory as a gallery. If the user cancels the picker, selectedFileSystemName will be empty. A user gesture is required for the dialog to display. Without a user gesture, the callback will run as though the user canceled.
functions.name: addUserSelectedFolder

functions.description: Get metadata about a specific media file system.
functions.name: getMediaFileSystemMetadata

functions.description: Gets the media-specific metadata for a media file. This should work for files in media galleries as well as other DOM filesystems.
functions.name: getMetadata

functions.description: Adds a gallery watch for the gallery with the specified gallery ID. The given callback is then fired with a success or failure result.
functions.name: addGalleryWatch

functions.description: Removes a gallery watch for the gallery with the specified gallery ID.
functions.name: removeGalleryWatch

events.description: Fired when a media gallery is changed or a gallery watch is dropped.
events.name: onGalleryChanged

syncFileSystem.description: Use the chrome.syncFileSystem API to save and synchronize data on Google Drive. This API is NOT for accessing arbitrary user docs stored in Google Drive. It provides app-specific syncable storage for offline and caching usage so that the same data can be available across different clients. Read Manage Data for more on using this API.

enum.name: initializing
enum.description: The sync service is being initialized (e.g. restoring data from the database, checking connectivity and authenticating to the service etc).

enum.name: running
enum.description: The sync service is up and running.

enum.name: authentication_required
enum.description: The sync service is not synchronizing files because the remote service needs to be authenticated by the user to proceed.

enum.name: temporary_unavailable
enum.description: The sync service is not synchronizing files because the remote service is (temporarily) unavailable due to some recoverable errors, e.g. network is offline, the remote service is down or not reachable etc. More details should be given by |description| parameter in OnServiceInfoUpdated (which could contain service-specific details).

enum.name: disabled
enum.description: The sync service is disabled and the content will never sync. (E.g. this could happen when the user has no account on the remote service or the sync service has had an unrecoverable error.)

enum.name: synced
enum.description: Not conflicting and has no pending local changes.

enum.name: pending
enum.description: Has one or more pending local changes that haven't been synchronized.

enum.name: conflicting
enum.description: File conflicts with remote version and must be resolved manually.

fileEntry.description: fileEntry for the target file whose status has changed. Contains name and path information of synchronized file. On file deletion, fileEntry information will still be available but file will no longer exist.
fileEntry.name: fileEntry

status.description: Resulting file status after $(ref:onFileStatusChanged) event. The status value can be 'synced', 'pending' or 'conflicting'.
status.name: status

action.description: Sync action taken to fire $(ref:onFileStatusChanged) event. The action value can be 'added', 'updated' or 'deleted'. Only applies if status is 'synced'.
action.name: action

direction.description: Sync direction for the $(ref:onFileStatusChanged) event. Sync direction value can be 'local_to_remote' or 'remote_to_local'. Only applies if status is 'synced'.
direction.name: direction

fileEntry.description: One of the Entry's originally given to getFileStatuses.
fileEntry.name: fileEntry

status.description: The status value can be 'synced', 'pending' or 'conflicting'.
status.name: status

error.description: Optional error that is only returned if there was a problem retrieving the FileStatus for the given file.
error.name: error

functions.description:
Returns a syncable filesystem backed by Google Drive. The returned DOMFileSystem instance can be operated on in the same way as the Temporary and Persistant file systems (see http://dev.w3.org/2009/dap/file-system/file-dir-sys.html).

Calling this multiple times from the same app will return the same handle to the same file system.

Note this call can fail. For example, if the user is not signed in to Chrome or if there is no network operation. To handle these errors it is important chrome.runtime.lastError is checked in the callback.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: A callback type for requestFileSystem.

functions.name: requestFileSystem

functions.description: Sets the default conflict resolution policy for the 'syncable' file storage for the app. By default it is set to 'last_write_win'. When conflict resolution policy is set to 'last_write_win' conflicts for existing files are automatically resolved next time the file is updated. |callback| can be optionally given to know if the request has succeeded or not.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: A generic result callback to indicate success or failure.

functions.name: setConflictResolutionPolicy

functions.description: Gets the current conflict resolution policy.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: A callback type for getConflictResolutionPolicy.

functions.name: getConflictResolutionPolicy

functions.description: Returns the current usage and quota in bytes for the 'syncable' file storage for the app.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: A callback type for getUsageAndQuota.

functions.name: getUsageAndQuota

functions.description: Returns the $(ref:FileStatus) for the given fileEntry. The status value can be 'synced', 'pending' or 'conflicting'. Note that 'conflicting' state only happens when the service's conflict resolution policy is set to 'manual'.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: A callback type for getFileStatus.

functions.name: getFileStatus

functions.description: Returns each $(ref:FileStatus) for the given fileEntry array. Typically called with the result from dirReader.readEntries().

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: A callback type for getFileStatuses.

functions.name: getFileStatuses

functions.description: Returns the current sync backend status.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: A callback type for getServiceStatus.

functions.name: getServiceStatus

events.description: Fired when an error or other status change has happened in the sync backend (for example, when the sync is temporarily disabled due to network or authentication error).
events.name: onServiceStatusChanged

events.description: Fired when a file has been updated by the background sync service.
events.name: onFileStatusChanged

events.description: The chrome.events namespace contains common types used by APIs dispatching events to notify you when something interesting happens.

types.description: Filters URLs for various criteria. See event filtering. All criteria are case sensitive.

hostContains.description: Matches if the host name of the URL contains a specified string. To test whether a host name component has a prefix 'foo', use hostContains: '.foo'. This matches 'www.foobar.com' and 'foo.com', because an implicit dot is added at the beginning of the host name. Similarly, hostContains can be used to match against component suffix ('foo.') and to exactly match against components ('.foo.'). Suffix- and exact-matching for the last components need to be done separately using hostSuffix, because no implicit dot is added at the end of the host name.

hostEquals.description: Matches if the host name of the URL is equal to a specified string.

hostPrefix.description: Matches if the host name of the URL starts with a specified string.

hostSuffix.description: Matches if the host name of the URL ends with a specified string.

pathContains.description: Matches if the path segment of the URL contains a specified string.

pathEquals.description: Matches if the path segment of the URL is equal to a specified string.

pathPrefix.description: Matches if the path segment of the URL starts with a specified string.

pathSuffix.description: Matches if the path segment of the URL ends with a specified string.

queryContains.description: Matches if the query segment of the URL contains a specified string.

queryEquals.description: Matches if the query segment of the URL is equal to a specified string.

queryPrefix.description: Matches if the query segment of the URL starts with a specified string.

querySuffix.description: Matches if the query segment of the URL ends with a specified string.

urlContains.description: Matches if the URL (without fragment identifier) contains a specified string. Port numbers are stripped from the URL if they match the default port number.

urlEquals.description: Matches if the URL (without fragment identifier) is equal to a specified string. Port numbers are stripped from the URL if they match the default port number.

urlMatches.description: Matches if the URL (without fragment identifier) matches a specified regular expression. Port numbers are stripped from the URL if they match the default port number. The regular expressions use the RE2 syntax.

originAndPathMatches.description: Matches if the URL without query segment and fragment identifier matches a specified regular expression. Port numbers are stripped from the URL if they match the default port number. The regular expressions use the RE2 syntax.

urlPrefix.description: Matches if the URL (without fragment identifier) starts with a specified string. Port numbers are stripped from the URL if they match the default port number.

urlSuffix.description: Matches if the URL (without fragment identifier) ends with a specified string. Port numbers are stripped from the URL if they match the default port number.

schemes.description: Matches if the scheme of the URL is equal to any of the schemes specified in the array.

ports.description: Matches if the port of the URL is contained in any of the specified port lists. For example [80, 443, [1000, 1200]] matches all requests on port 80, 443 and in the range 1000-1200.

choices.description: A pair of integers identiying the start and end (both inclusive) of a port range.

cidrBlocks.description: Matches if the host part of the URL is an IP address and is contained in any of the CIDR blocks specified in the array.

extensionTypes.description: The chrome.extensionTypes API contains type declarations for Chrome extensions.

types.description: Pixel data for an image. Must be an ImageData object; for example, from a canvas element.
The format of an image.
An object specifying the area of the document to capture, in CSS pixels, relative to the page. All properties default to 0.

x.description: The x coordinate of the rectangle.

y.description: The y coordinate of the rectangle.

types.description: Details about the format, quality, and area of an image.

format.description: The format of the resulting image. Default is "jpeg".

quality.description: When format is "jpeg", controls the quality of the resulting image. This value is ignored for PNG images. As quality is decreased, the resulting image will have more visual artifacts, and the number of bytes needed to store it will decrease.

rect.description: An object specifying the area of the document to capture, in CSS pixels, relative to the page. If omitted, the currently visible viewport is captured.

scale.description: The scale factor to apply to the image. Defaults to devicePixelRatio.

enum.name: document_start
enum.description: Script is injected after any files from css, but before any other DOM is constructed or any other script is run.

enum.name: document_end
enum.description: Script is injected immediately after the DOM is complete, but before subresources like images and frames have loaded.

enum.name: document_idle
enum.description: The browser chooses a time to inject the script between "document_end" and immediately after the window.onload event fires. The exact moment of injection depends on how complex the document is and how long it is taking to load, and is optimized for page load speed. Content scripts running at "document_idle" don't need to listen for the window.onload event; they are guaranteed to run after the DOM completes. If a script definitely needs to run after window.onload, the extension can check if onload has already fired by using the document.readyState property.

types.description: The soonest that the JavaScript or CSS will be injected into the tab.
The origin of injected CSS.
Details of the script or CSS to inject. Either the code or the file property must be set, but both may not be set at the same time.

code.description:
JavaScript or CSS code to inject.

Warning: Be careful using the code parameter. Incorrect use of it may open your extension to cross site scripting attacks

file.description: JavaScript or CSS file to inject.

allFrames.description: If allFrames is true, implies that the JavaScript or CSS should be injected into all frames of current page. By default, it's false and is only injected into the top frame. If true and frameId is set, then the code is inserted in the selected frame and all of its child frames.

frameId.description: The frame where the script or CSS should be injected. Defaults to 0 (the top-level frame).

matchAboutBlank.description: If matchAboutBlank is true, then the code is also injected in about:blank and about:srcdoc frames if your extension has access to its parent document. Code cannot be inserted in top-level about:-frames. By default it is false.

runAt.description: The soonest that the JavaScript or CSS will be injected into the tab. Defaults to "document_idle".

cssOrigin.description: The origin of the CSS to inject. This may only be specified for CSS, not JavaScript. Defaults to "author".

types.description: Details of the CSS to remove. Either the code or the file property must be set, but both may not be set at the same time.

allFrames.description: If allFrames is true, implies that the CSS should be removed from all frames of current page. By default, it's false and is only removed from the top frame. If true and frameId is set, then the code is removed from the selected frame and all of its child frames.

frameId.description: The frame from where the CSS should be removed. Defaults to 0 (the top-level frame).

matchAboutBlank.description: If matchAboutBlank is true, then the code is also removed from about:blank and about:srcdoc frames if your extension has access to its parent document. By default it is false.

cssOrigin.description: The origin of the CSS to remove. Defaults to "author".

types.description: The type of frame.
The document lifecycle of the frame.

The JavaScript world for a script to execute within. Can either be an isolated world unique to this extension, the main world of the DOM which is shared with the page's JavaScript, or a user scripts world that is only available for scripts registered with the User Scripts API.

declarativeWebRequest.description: Note: this API is deprecated. Check out the $(ref:declarativeNetRequest) API instead. Use the chrome.declarativeWebRequest API to intercept, block, or modify requests in-flight. It is significantly faster than the chrome.webRequest API because you can register rules that are evaluated in the browser rather than the JavaScript engine, which reduces roundtrip latencies and allows higher efficiency.

types.description: Filters request headers for various criteria. Multiple criteria are evaluated as a conjunction.

namePrefix.description: Matches if the header name starts with the specified string.

nameSuffix.description: Matches if the header name ends with the specified string.

nameContains.description: Matches if the header name contains all of the specified strings.

nameEquals.description: Matches if the header name is equal to the specified string.

valuePrefix.description: Matches if the header value starts with the specified string.

valueSuffix.description: Matches if the header value ends with the specified string.

valueContains.description: Matches if the header value contains all of the specified strings.

valueEquals.description: Matches if the header value is equal to the specified string.

types.description: Matches network events by various criteria.

url.description: Matches if the conditions of the UrlFilter are fulfilled for the URL of the request.

firstPartyForCookiesUrl.description: Matches if the conditions of the UrlFilter are fulfilled for the 'first party' URL of the request. The 'first party' URL of a request, when present, can be different from the request's target URL, and describes what is considered 'first party' for the sake of third-party checks for cookies.

resourceType.description: Matches if the request type of a request is contained in the list. Requests that cannot match any of the types will be filtered out.

contentType.description: Matches if the MIME media type of a response (from the HTTP Content-Type header) is contained in the list.

excludeContentType.description: Matches if the MIME media type of a response (from the HTTP Content-Type header) is not contained in the list.

requestHeaders.description: Matches if some of the request headers is matched by one of the HeaderFilters.

excludeRequestHeaders.description: Matches if none of the request headers is matched by any of the HeaderFilters.

responseHeaders.description: Matches if some of the response headers is matched by one of the HeaderFilters.

excludeResponseHeaders.description: Matches if none of the response headers is matched by any of the HeaderFilters.

thirdPartyForCookies.description: If set to true, matches requests that are subject to third-party cookie policies. If set to false, matches all other requests.

stages.description: Contains a list of strings describing stages. Allowed values are 'onBeforeRequest', 'onBeforeSendHeaders', 'onHeadersReceived', 'onAuthRequired'. If this attribute is present, then it limits the applicable stages to those listed. Note that the whole condition is only applicable in stages compatible with all attributes.

types.description: Declarative event action that cancels a network request.
Declarative event action that redirects a network request.

redirectUrl.description: Destination to where the request is redirected.

types.description: Declarative event action that redirects a network request to a transparent image.
Declarative event action that redirects a network request to an empty document.
Redirects a request by applying a regular expression on the URL. The regular expressions use the RE2 syntax.

from.description: A match pattern that may contain capture groups. Capture groups are referenced in the Perl syntax ($1, $2, ...) instead of the RE2 syntax (\1, \2, ...) in order to be closer to JavaScript Regular Expressions.

types.description: Sets the request header of the specified name to the specified value. If a header with the specified name did not exist before, a new one is created. Header name comparison is always case-insensitive. Each request header name occurs only once in each request.

name.description: HTTP request header name.

value.description: HTTP request header value.

types.description: Removes the request header of the specified name. Do not use SetRequestHeader and RemoveRequestHeader with the same header name on the same request. Each request header name occurs only once in each request.

name.description: HTTP request header name (case-insensitive).

types.description: Adds the response header to the response of this web request. As multiple response headers may share the same name, you need to first remove and then add a new response header in order to replace one.

name.description: HTTP response header name.

value.description: HTTP response header value.

types.description: Removes all response headers of the specified names and values.

name.description: HTTP request header name (case-insensitive).

value.description: HTTP request header value (case-insensitive).

types.description: Masks all rules that match the specified criteria.

lowerPriorityThan.description: If set, rules with a lower priority than the specified value are ignored. This boundary is not persisted, it affects only rules and their actions of the same network request stage.

hasTag.description: If set, rules with the specified tag are ignored. This ignoring is not persisted, it affects only rules and their actions of the same network request stage. Note that rules are executed in descending order of their priorities. This action affects rules of lower priority than the current rule. Rules with the same priority may or may not be ignored.

types.description: Triggers the $(ref:declarativeWebRequest.onMessage) event.

message.description: The value that will be passed in the message attribute of the dictionary that is passed to the event handler.

types.description: A filter or specification of a cookie in HTTP Requests.

name.description: Name of a cookie.

value.description: Value of a cookie, may be padded in double-quotes.

types.description: A specification of a cookie in HTTP Responses.

name.description: Name of a cookie.

value.description: Value of a cookie, may be padded in double-quotes.

expires.description: Value of the Expires cookie attribute.

maxAge.description: Value of the Max-Age cookie attribute

domain.description: Value of the Domain cookie attribute.

path.description: Value of the Path cookie attribute.

secure.description: Existence of the Secure cookie attribute.

httpOnly.description: Existence of the HttpOnly cookie attribute.

types.description: A filter of a cookie in HTTP Responses.

name.description: Name of a cookie.

value.description: Value of a cookie, may be padded in double-quotes.

expires.description: Value of the Expires cookie attribute.

maxAge.description: Value of the Max-Age cookie attribute

domain.description: Value of the Domain cookie attribute.

path.description: Value of the Path cookie attribute.

secure.description: Existence of the Secure cookie attribute.

httpOnly.description: Existence of the HttpOnly cookie attribute.

ageUpperBound.description: Inclusive upper bound on the cookie lifetime (specified in seconds after current time). Only cookies whose expiration date-time is in the interval [now, now + ageUpperBound] fulfill this criterion. Session cookies and cookies whose expiration date-time is in the past do not meet the criterion of this filter. The cookie lifetime is calculated from either 'max-age' or 'expires' cookie attributes. If both are specified, 'max-age' is used to calculate the cookie lifetime.

ageLowerBound.description: Inclusive lower bound on the cookie lifetime (specified in seconds after current time). Only cookies whose expiration date-time is set to 'now + ageLowerBound' or later fulfill this criterion. Session cookies do not meet the criterion of this filter. The cookie lifetime is calculated from either 'max-age' or 'expires' cookie attributes. If both are specified, 'max-age' is used to calculate the cookie lifetime.

sessionCookie.description: Filters session cookies. Session cookies have no lifetime specified in any of 'max-age' or 'expires' attributes.

types.description: Adds a cookie to the request or overrides a cookie, in case another cookie of the same name exists already. Note that it is preferred to use the Cookies API because this is computationally less expensive.

cookie.description: Cookie to be added to the request. No field may be undefined.

types.description: Adds a cookie to the response or overrides a cookie, in case another cookie of the same name exists already. Note that it is preferred to use the Cookies API because this is computationally less expensive.

cookie.description: Cookie to be added to the response. The name and value need to be specified.

types.description: Edits one or more cookies of request. Note that it is preferred to use the Cookies API because this is computationally less expensive.

filter.description: Filter for cookies that will be modified. All empty entries are ignored.

modification.description: Attributes that shall be overridden in cookies that machted the filter. Attributes that are set to an empty string are removed.

types.description: Edits one or more cookies of response. Note that it is preferred to use the Cookies API because this is computationally less expensive.

filter.description: Filter for cookies that will be modified. All empty entries are ignored.

modification.description: Attributes that shall be overridden in cookies that machted the filter. Attributes that are set to an empty string are removed.

types.description: Removes one or more cookies of request. Note that it is preferred to use the Cookies API because this is computationally less expensive.

filter.description: Filter for cookies that will be removed. All empty entries are ignored.

types.description: Removes one or more cookies of response. Note that it is preferred to use the Cookies API because this is computationally less expensive.

filter.description: Filter for cookies that will be removed. All empty entries are ignored.

events.name: onMessage
events.description: Fired when a message is sent via $(ref:declarativeWebRequest.SendMessageToExtension) from an action of the declarative web request API.

message.description: The message sent by the calling script.

stage.description: The stage of the network request during which the event was triggered.

requestId.description: The ID of the request. Request IDs are unique within a browser session. As a result, they could be used to relate different events of the same request.

frameId.description: The value 0 indicates that the request happens in the main frame; a positive value indicates the ID of a subframe in which the request happens. If the document of a (sub-)frame is loaded (type is main_frame or sub_frame), frameId indicates the ID of this frame, not the ID of the outer frame. Frame IDs are unique within a tab.

parentFrameId.description: ID of frame that wraps the frame which sent the request. Set to -1 if no parent frame exists.

documentId.description: A UUID of the document that made the request.

parentDocumentId.description: A UUID of the parent document owning this frame. This is not set if there is no parent.

documentLifecycle.description: The lifecycle the document is in.

frameType.description: The type of frame the navigation occurred in.

tabId.description: The ID of the tab in which the request takes place. Set to -1 if the request isn't related to a tab.

type.description: How the requested resource will be used.

timeStamp.description: The time when this signal is triggered, in milliseconds since the epoch.

types.description: This API provides programmatic access to the user interface elements of Chrome. This includes everything in the web view, and optionally Chrome's full user interface.

choices.description: If true, enables non-interactive access to the automation tree only for the sites for which the extension has a host permission or activeTab permission).

desktop.description: Whether to request permission to the whole ChromeOS desktop. If granted, this gives the extension access to every aspect of the desktop, and every site and app. If this permission is requested, all other permissions are implicitly included and do not need to be requested separately.

types.description: The content_capabilities manifest entry allows an extension to grant certain additional capabilities to web contents whose locations match a given set of URL patterns.

matches.description: The set of URL patterns to match against. If any of the given patterns match a URL, its contents will be granted the specified capabilities.

permissions.description: The set of capabilities to grant matched contents. This is currently limited to clipboardRead, clipboardWrite, and unlimitedStorage.

ids.description:
The IDs of extensions or apps that are allowed to connect. If left empty or unspecified, no extensions or apps can connect.

The wildcard "*" will allow all extensions and apps to connect.

matches.description:
The URL patterns for web pages that are allowed to connect. This does not affect content scripts. If left empty or unspecified, no web pages can connect.

Patterns cannot include wildcard domains nor subdomains of (effective) top level domains; *://google.com/* and http://*.chromium.org/* are valid, while <all_urls>, http://*/*, *://*.com/*, and even http://*.appspot.com/* are not.

accepts_tls_channel_id.description: If true, messages sent via $(ref:runtime.connect) or $(ref:runtime.sendMessage) will set $(ref:runtime.MessageSender.tlsChannelId) if those methods request it to be. If false, $(ref:runtime.MessageSender.tlsChannelId) will never be set under any circumstance.

types.description: The options_ui manifest property declares how the options page should be displayed.

page.description: The path to your options page, relative to your extension's root.

chrome_style.description: If true, a Chrome user agent stylesheet will be applied to your options page. The default value is false. We do not recommend you enable it as it no longer results in a consistent UI with Chrome. This option will be removed in Manifest V3.

open_in_tab.description:
If true, your extension's options page will be opened in a new tab rather than embedded in chrome://extensions. The default is false, and we recommend that you don't change it.

This is only useful to delay the inevitable deprecation of the old options UI! It will be removed soon, so try not to use it. It will break.

types.description: A single string or a list of strings representing host:port patterns.
The sockets manifest property declares which sockets operations an app can issue.

udp.description: The udp manifest property declares which sockets.udp operations an app can issue.

tcp.description: The tcp manifest property declares which sockets.tcp operations an app can issue.

tcpServer.description: The tcpServer manifest property declares which sockets.tcpServer operations an app can issue.

types.description: The bluetooth manifest property give permission to an app to use the $(ref:bluetooth) API. A list of UUIDs can be optionally specified to enable communication with devices.

uuids.description: The uuids manifest property declares the list of protocols, profiles and services that an app can communicate using.

socket.description: If true, gives permission to an app to use the $(ref:bluetoothSocket) API

low_energy.description: If true, gives permission to an app to use the $(ref:bluetoothLowEnergy) API

peripheral.description: If true, gives permission to an app to use the advertisement functions in the $(ref:bluetoothLowEnergy) API

types.description: The usb_printers manifest property lists the USB printers supported by an app implementing the $(ref:printerProvider) API.

filters.description: A list of $(ref:usb.DeviceFilter USB device filters) matching supported devices. A device only needs to match one of the provided filters. A vendorId is required and only one of productId or interfaceClass may be provided.

vendorId.description: USB vendor ID of matching devices

productId.description: USB product ID of matching devices

interfaceClass.description: USB interface class implemented by any interface of a matching device.

interfaceSubclass.description: USB interface sub-class implemented by the interface matching $(ref:interfaceClass).

interfaceProtocol.description: USB interface protocol implemented by the interface matching $(ref:interfaceClass) and $(ref:interfaceSubclass).

types.description: The kiosk_secondary_apps manifest property lists the secondary kiosk apps to be deployed by the primary kiosk app.

id.description: ID of secondary kiosk app

enabled_on_launch.description: Whether the secondary app should be enabled when kiosk app is launched. If true, the app will be enabled before the kiosk app launch; if false the app will be disabled before the kiosk app launch; if not set, the app's enabled state will not be changed during the kiosk app launch. The ${ref:management} API can be used to later change the secondary app state.

types.description: Size parameters.

parameters.name: instanceId
parameters.description: The instance ID of the guest <webview> process. This not exposed to developers through the API.

i18n.description: Use the chrome.i18n infrastructure to implement internationalization across your whole app or extension.

types.description: An ISO language code such as en or fr. For a complete list of languages supported by this method, see kLanguageInfoTable. For an unknown language, und will be returned, which means that [percentage] of the text is unknown to CLD

functions.name: getAcceptLanguages
functions.description: Gets the accept-languages of the browser. This is different from the locale used by the browser; to get the locale, use $(ref:i18n.getUILanguage).

parameters.name: languages
parameters.description: Array of LanguageCode

functions.name: getMessage
functions.description: Gets the localized string for the specified message. If the message is missing, this method returns an empty string (''). If the format of the getMessage() call is wrong — for example, messageName is not a string or the substitutions array has more than 9 elements — this method returns undefined.

parameters.name: messageName
parameters.description: The name of the message, as specified in the messages.json file.

parameters.name: substitutions
parameters.description: Up to 9 substitution strings, if the message requires any.

escapeLt.description: Escape < in translation to <. This applies only to the message itself, not to the placeholders. Developers might want to use this if the translation is used in an HTML context. Closure Templates used with Closure Compiler generate this automatically.

returns.description: Message localized for current locale.

functions.name: getUILanguage
functions.description: Gets the browser UI language of the browser. This is different from $(ref:i18n.getAcceptLanguages) which returns the preferred user languages.

returns.description: The browser UI language code such as en-US or fr-FR.

functions.name: detectLanguage
functions.description: Detects the language of the provided text using CLD.

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: User input string to be translated.

parameters.name: result
parameters.description: LanguageDetectionResult object that holds detected langugae reliability and array of DetectedLanguage

items.description: DetectedLanguage object that holds detected ISO language code and its percentage in the input string

percentage.description: The percentage of the detected language

idle.description: Use the chrome.idle API to detect when the machine's idle state changes.

functions.name: queryState
functions.description: Returns "locked" if the system is locked, "idle" if the user has not generated any input for a specified number of seconds, or "active" otherwise.

parameters.name: detectionIntervalInSeconds
parameters.description: The system is considered idle if detectionIntervalInSeconds seconds have elapsed since the last user input detected.

functions.name: setDetectionInterval
functions.description: Sets the interval, in seconds, used to determine when the system is in an idle state for onStateChanged events. The default interval is 60 seconds.

parameters.name: intervalInSeconds
parameters.description: Threshold, in seconds, used to determine when the system is in an idle state.

functions.name: getAutoLockDelay
functions.description: Gets the time, in seconds, it takes until the screen is locked automatically while idle. Returns a zero duration if the screen is never locked automatically. Currently supported on Chrome OS only.

parameters.name: delay
parameters.description: Time, in seconds, until the screen is locked automatically while idle. This is zero if the screen never locks automatically.

events.name: onStateChanged
events.description: Fired when the system changes to an active, idle or locked state. The event fires with "locked" if the screen is locked or the screensaver activates, "idle" if the system is unlocked and the user has not generated any input for a specified number of seconds, and "active" when the user generates input on an idle system.

incognito.description: Dummy namespace for the incognito manifest key.
Configures whether and how the extension runs in incognito mode. Default mode is spanning.

management.description: The chrome.management API provides ways to manage installed apps and extensions.

types.description: Information about an icon belonging to an extension, app, or theme.

size.description: A number representing the width and height of the icon. Likely values include (but are not limited to) 128, 48, 24, and 16.

url.description: The URL for this icon image. To display a grayscale version of the icon (to indicate that an extension is disabled, for example), append ?grayscale=true to the URL.

types.description: These are all possible app launch types.
A reason the item is disabled.
The type of this extension, app, or theme.

How the extension was installed. One of
admin: The extension was installed because of an administrative policy,
development: The extension was loaded unpacked in developer mode,
normal: The extension was installed normally via a .crx file,
sideload: The extension was installed by other software on the machine,
other: The extension was installed by other means.
Information about an installed extension, app, or theme.

id.description: The extension's unique identifier.

name.description: The name of this extension, app, or theme.

shortName.description: A short version of the name of this extension, app, or theme.

description.description: The description of this extension, app, or theme.

version.description: The version of this extension, app, or theme.

versionName.description: The version name of this extension, app, or theme if the manifest specified one.

mayDisable.description: Whether this extension can be disabled or uninstalled by the user.

mayEnable.description: Whether this extension can be enabled by the user. This is only returned for extensions which are not enabled.

enabled.description: Whether it is currently enabled or disabled.

disabledReason.description: A reason the item is disabled.

isApp.description: True if this is an app.

type.description: The type of this extension, app, or theme.

appLaunchUrl.description: The launch url (only present for apps).

homepageUrl.description: The URL of the homepage of this extension, app, or theme.

updateUrl.description: The update URL of this extension, app, or theme.

offlineEnabled.description: Whether the extension, app, or theme declares that it supports offline.

optionsUrl.description: The url for the item's options page, if it has one.

icons.description: A list of icon information. Note that this just reflects what was declared in the manifest, and the actual image at that url may be larger or smaller than what was declared, so you might consider using explicit width and height attributes on img tags referencing these images. See the manifest documentation on icons for more details.

permissions.description: Returns a list of API based permissions.

hostPermissions.description: Returns a list of host based permissions.

launchType.description: The app launch type (only present for apps).

availableLaunchTypes.description: The currently available launch types (only present for apps).

types.description: Options for how to handle the extension's uninstallation.

showConfirmDialog.description: Whether or not a confirm-uninstall dialog should prompt the user. Defaults to false for self uninstalls. If an extension uninstalls another extension, this parameter is ignored and the dialog is always shown.

functions.name: getAll
functions.description: Returns a list of information about installed extensions and apps.

functions.name: get
functions.description: Returns information about the installed extension, app, or theme that has the given ID.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID from an item of $(ref:management.ExtensionInfo).

functions.name: getSelf
functions.description: Returns information about the calling extension, app, or theme. Note: This function can be used without requesting the 'management' permission in the manifest.

functions.name: getPermissionWarningsById
functions.description: Returns a list of permission warnings for the given extension id.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of an already installed extension.

functions.name: getPermissionWarningsByManifest
functions.description: Returns a list of permission warnings for the given extension manifest string. Note: This function can be used without requesting the 'management' permission in the manifest.

parameters.name: manifestStr
parameters.description: Extension manifest JSON string.

functions.name: setEnabled
functions.description: Enables or disables an app or extension. In most cases this function must be called in the context of a user gesture (e.g. an onclick handler for a button), and may present the user with a native confirmation UI as a way of preventing abuse.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: This should be the id from an item of $(ref:management.ExtensionInfo).

parameters.name: enabled
parameters.description: Whether this item should be enabled or disabled.

functions.name: uninstall
functions.description: Uninstalls a currently installed app or extension. Note: This function does not work in managed environments when the user is not allowed to uninstall the specified extension/app. If the uninstall fails (e.g. the user cancels the dialog) the promise will be rejected or the callback will be called with $(ref:runtime.lastError) set.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: This should be the id from an item of $(ref:management.ExtensionInfo).

functions.name: uninstallSelf
functions.description: Uninstalls the calling extension. Note: This function can be used without requesting the 'management' permission in the manifest. This function does not work in managed environments when the user is not allowed to uninstall the specified extension/app.

functions.name: launchApp
functions.description: Launches an application.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The extension id of the application.

functions.name: createAppShortcut
functions.description: Display options to create shortcuts for an app. On Mac, only packaged app shortcuts can be created.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: This should be the id from an app item of $(ref:management.ExtensionInfo).

functions.name: setLaunchType
functions.description: Set the launch type of an app.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: This should be the id from an app item of $(ref:management.ExtensionInfo).

parameters.name: launchType
parameters.description: The target launch type. Always check and make sure this launch type is in $(ref:ExtensionInfo.availableLaunchTypes), because the available launch types vary on different platforms and configurations.

functions.name: generateAppForLink
functions.description: Generate an app for a URL. Returns the generated bookmark app.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: The URL of a web page. The scheme of the URL can only be "http" or "https".

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: The title of the generated app.

functions.name: installReplacementWebApp
functions.description: Launches the replacement_web_app specified in the manifest. Prompts the user to install if not already installed.

events.name: onInstalled
events.description: Fired when an app or extension has been installed.

events.name: onUninstalled
events.description: Fired when an app or extension has been uninstalled.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the extension, app, or theme that was uninstalled.

events.name: onEnabled
events.description: Fired when an app or extension has been enabled.

events.name: onDisabled
events.description: Fired when an app or extension has been disabled.

types.description: The type of metric, such as 'histogram-log' or 'histogram-linear'.
Describes the type of metric that is to be collected.

metricName.description: A unique name within the extension for the metric.

min.description: The minimum sample value to be recoded.  Must be greater than zero.

max.description: The maximum sample value to be recoded.

buckets.description: The number of buckets to use when separating the recorded values.

min.description: Minimum sample value that can be stored in this bucket (i.e. inclusive).

max.description: Exclusive maximum value for samples stored this bucket.

count.description: Number of samples stored in this bucket.

types.description: The type of extension usage action triggered by user UI actions.

functions.name: getHistogram
functions.description: Get details about a histogram displayed at chrome://histogram.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Histogram name, e.g. 'Accessibility.CrosAutoclick'.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Invoked with details.

functions.name: getIsCrashReportingEnabled
functions.description: Returns true if the user opted in to sending crash reports.

functions.name: getFieldTrial
functions.description: Returns the group name chosen for the named trial, or the empty string if the trial does not exist or is not enabled.

functions.name: getVariationParams
functions.description: Returns variation parameters for the named trial if available, or undefined otherwise.

functions.name: recordUserAction
functions.description: Records an action performed by the user.

functions.name: recordExtensionUsageUkm
functions.description: Records an extension usage UKM event triggered by user UI actions.

functions.name: recordPercentage
functions.description: Records a percentage value from 1 to 100.

functions.name: recordCount
functions.description: Records a value than can range from 1 to 1,000,000.

functions.name: recordSmallCount
functions.description: Records a value than can range from 1 to 100.

functions.name: recordMediumCount
functions.description: Records a value than can range from 1 to 10,000.

functions.name: recordTime
functions.description: Records an elapsed time of no more than 10 seconds.  The sample value is specified in milliseconds.

functions.name: recordMediumTime
functions.description: Records an elapsed time of no more than 3 minutes.  The sample value is specified in milliseconds.

functions.name: recordLongTime
functions.description: Records an elapsed time of no more than 1 hour.  The sample value is specified in milliseconds.

functions.name: recordSparseValueWithHashMetricName
functions.description: Increments the count associated with the hash of |value| in the sparse histogram defined by the |metricName| using base::HashMetricName(value).

functions.name: recordSparseValueWithPersistentHash
functions.description: Increments the count associated with the hash of |value| in the sparse histogram defined by the |metricName| using base::PersistentHash(value).

functions.name: recordSparseValue
functions.description: Increments the count associated with |value| in the sparse histogram defined by the |metricName|.

functions.name: recordValue
functions.description: Adds a value to the given metric.

functions.name: recordBoolean
functions.description: Records a boolean value to the given metric. Analogous to base::UmaHistogramBoolean().

functions.name: recordEnumerationValue
functions.description: Records an enumeration value to the given metric. Analogous to base::UmaHistogramEnumeration(). Use recordSparseValue for sparse enums or enums not starting at 0.

metricsPrivateIndividualApis.description: An alias of metricsPrivate, which gives individual APIs permission separately in _api_features.json

functions.name: recordUserAction
functions.description: Records an action performed by the user.

functions.name: recordMediumTime
functions.description: Records an elapsed time of no more than 3 minutes.  The sample value is specified in milliseconds.

functions.name: recordEnumerationValue
functions.description: Records an enumeration value to the given metric. Analogous to base::UmaHistogramEnumeration(). Use recordSparseValue for sparse enums or enums not starting at 0.

mimeHandlerViewGuestInternal.description: Placeholder for mime handler view guest API, currently unused.

requirements.description: Stub namespace for the 'requirements' manifest key.

runtime.description: Use the chrome.runtime API to retrieve the service worker, return details about the manifest, and listen for and respond to events in the extension lifecycle. You can also use this API to convert the relative path of URLs to fully-qualified URLs.

types.description: An object which allows two way communication with other pages. See Long-lived connections for more information.

name.description: The name of the port, as specified in the call to $(ref:runtime.connect).

disconnect.description: Immediately disconnect the port. Calling disconnect() on an already-disconnected port has no effect. When a port is disconnected, no new events will be dispatched to this port.

postMessage.description: Send a message to the other end of the port. If the port is disconnected, an error is thrown.

parameters.name: message
parameters.description: The message to send. This object should be JSON-ifiable.

sender.description: This property will only be present on ports passed to $(ref:runtime.onConnect onConnect) / $(ref:runtime.onConnectExternal onConnectExternal) / $(ref:runtime.onConnectExternal onConnectNative) listeners.

events.name: onDisconnect
events.description: Fired when the port is disconnected from the other end(s). $(ref:runtime.lastError) may be set if the port was disconnected by an error. If the port is closed via $(ref:Port.disconnect disconnect), then this event is only fired on the other end. This event is fired at most once (see also Port lifetime).

parameters.name: port
parameters.description: The disconnected port.

events.name: onMessage
events.description: This event is fired when $(ref:Port.postMessage postMessage) is called by the other end of the port.

parameters.name: message
parameters.description: The message received on the port.

parameters.name: port
parameters.description: The port that received the message.

types.description: An object containing information about the script context that sent a message or request.

tab.description: The $(ref:tabs.Tab) which opened the connection, if any. This property will only be present when the connection was opened from a tab (including content scripts), and only if the receiver is an extension, not an app.

frameId.description: The frame that opened the connection. 0 for top-level frames, positive for child frames. This will only be set when tab is set.

guestProcessId.description: The guest process id of the requesting webview, if available. Only available for component extensions.

guestRenderFrameRoutingId.description: The guest render frame routing id of the requesting webview, if available. Only available for component extensions.

id.description: The ID of the extension that opened the connection, if any.

url.description: The URL of the page or frame that opened the connection. If the sender is in an iframe, it will be iframe's URL not the URL of the page which hosts it.

nativeApplication.description: The name of the native application that opened the connection, if any.

tlsChannelId.description: The TLS channel ID of the page or frame that opened the connection, if requested by the extension, and if available.

origin.description: The origin of the page or frame that opened the connection. It can vary from the url property (e.g., about:blank) or can be opaque (e.g., sandboxed iframes). This is useful for identifying if the origin can be trusted if we can't immediately tell from the URL.

documentId.description: A UUID of the document that opened the connection.

documentLifecycle.description: The lifecycle the document that opened the connection is in at the time the port was created. Note that the lifecycle state of the document may have changed since port creation.
