The native client architecture. This may be different from arch on some platforms.

enum.name: arm
enum.description: Specifies the native client architecture as arm.

enum.name: x86-32
enum.description: Specifies the native client architecture as x86-32.

enum.name: x86-64
enum.description: Specifies the native client architecture as x86-64.

enum.name: mips
enum.description: Specifies the native client architecture as mips.

enum.name: mips64
enum.description: Specifies the native client architecture as mips64.

types.description: An object containing information about the current platform.

os.description: The operating system Chrome is running on.

nacl_arch.description: The native client architecture. This may be different from arch on some platforms.

enum.name: throttled
enum.description: Specifies that the status check has been throttled. This can occur after repeated checks within a short amount of time.

enum.name: no_update
enum.description: Specifies that there are no available updates to install.

enum.name: update_available
enum.description: Specifies that there is an available update to install.

types.description: Result of the update check.

enum.name: install
enum.description: Specifies the event reason as an installation.

enum.name: update
enum.description: Specifies the event reason as an extension update.

enum.name: chrome_update
enum.description: Specifies the event reason as a Chrome update.

enum.name: shared_module_update
enum.description: Specifies the event reason as an update to a shared module.

types.description: The reason that this event is being dispatched.

The reason that the event is being dispatched. 'app_update' is used when the restart is needed because the application is updated to a newer version. 'os_update' is used when the restart is needed because the browser/OS is updated to a newer version. 'periodic' is used when the system runs for more than the permitted uptime set in the enterprise policy.

enum.name: app_update
enum.description: Specifies the event reason as an update to the app.

enum.name: os_update
enum.description: Specifies the event reason as an update to the operating system.

enum.name: periodic
enum.description: Specifies the event reason as a periodic restart of the app.

enum.name: TAB
enum.description: Specifies the context type as a tab

enum.name: POPUP
enum.description: Specifies the context type as an extension popup window

enum.name: BACKGROUND
enum.description: Specifies the context type as a service worker.

enum.name: OFFSCREEN_DOCUMENT
enum.description: Specifies the context type as an offscreen document.

enum.name: SIDE_PANEL
enum.description: Specifies the context type as a side panel.

enum.name: DEVELOPER_TOOLS
enum.description: Specifies the context type as developer tools.

types.description: A context hosting extension content.

contextType.description: The type of context this corresponds to.

contextId.description: A unique identifier for this context

tabId.description: The ID of the tab for this context, or -1 if this context is not hosted in a tab.

windowId.description: The ID of the window for this context, or -1 if this context is not hosted in a window.

documentId.description: A UUID for the document associated with this context, or undefined if this context is hosted not in a document.

frameId.description: The ID of the frame for this context, or -1 if this context is not hosted in a frame.

documentUrl.description: The URL of the document associated with this context, or undefined if the context is not hosted in a document.

documentOrigin.description: The origin of the document associated with this context, or undefined if the context is not hosted in a document.

incognito.description: Whether the context is associated with an incognito profile.

types.description: A filter to match against certain extension contexts. Matching contexts must match all specified filters; any filter that is not specified matches all available contexts. Thus, a filter of `{}` will match all available contexts.

lastError.description: Populated with an error message if calling an API function fails; otherwise undefined. This is only defined within the scope of that function's callback. If an error is produced, but runtime.lastError is not accessed within the callback, a message is logged to the console listing the API function that produced the error. API functions that return promises do not set this property.

message.description: Details about the error which occurred.

id.description: The ID of the extension/app.

functions.name: getBackgroundPage
functions.description: Retrieves the JavaScript 'window' object for the background page running inside the current extension/app. If the background page is an event page, the system will ensure it is loaded before calling the callback. If there is no background page, an error is set.
functions.deprecated: Background pages do not exist in MV3 extensions.

parameters.name: backgroundPage
parameters.description: The JavaScript 'window' object for the background page.

functions.name: openOptionsPage
functions.description:
Open your Extension's options page, if possible.

The precise behavior may depend on your manifest's options_ui or options_page key, or what Chrome happens to support at the time. For example, the page may be opened in a new tab, within chrome://extensions, within an App, or it may just focus an open options page. It will never cause the caller page to reload.

If your Extension does not declare an options page, or Chrome failed to create one for some other reason, the callback will set $(ref:lastError).

functions.name: getManifest
functions.description: Returns details about the app or extension from the manifest. The object returned is a serialization of the full manifest file.

returns.description: The manifest details.

functions.name: getVersion
functions.description: Returns the extension's version as declared in the manifest.

returns.description: The extension's version.

functions.name: getURL
functions.description: Converts a relative path within an app/extension install directory to a fully-qualified URL.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: A path to a resource within an app/extension expressed relative to its install directory.

returns.description: The fully-qualified URL to the resource.

functions.name: setUninstallURL
functions.description: Sets the URL to be visited upon uninstallation. This may be used to clean up server-side data, do analytics, and implement surveys. Maximum 1023 characters.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: URL to be opened after the extension is uninstalled. This URL must have an http: or https: scheme. Set an empty string to not open a new tab upon uninstallation.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Called when the uninstall URL is set. If the given URL is invalid, $(ref:runtime.lastError) will be set.

functions.name: reload
functions.description: Reloads the app or extension. This method is not supported in kiosk mode. For kiosk mode, use chrome.runtime.restart() method.

functions.name: requestUpdateCheck
functions.description:
Requests an immediate update check be done for this app/extension.

Important: Most extensions/apps should not use this method, since Chrome already does automatic checks every few hours, and you can listen for the $(ref:runtime.onUpdateAvailable) event without needing to call requestUpdateCheck.

This method is only appropriate to call in very limited circumstances, such as if your extension talks to a backend service, and the backend service has determined that the client extension version is very far out of date and you'd like to prompt a user to update. Most other uses of requestUpdateCheck, such as calling it unconditionally based on a repeating timer, probably only serve to waste client, network, and server resources.

Note: When called with a callback, instead of returning an object this function will return the two properties as separate arguments passed to the callback.

parameters.name: result
parameters.description: RequestUpdateCheckResult object that holds the status of the update check and any details of the result if there is an update available

version.description: If an update is available, this contains the version of the available update.

functions.name: restart
functions.description: Restart the ChromeOS device when the app runs in kiosk mode. Otherwise, it's no-op.

functions.name: restartAfterDelay
functions.description: Restart the ChromeOS device when the app runs in kiosk mode after the given seconds. If called again before the time ends, the reboot will be delayed. If called with a value of -1, the reboot will be cancelled. It's a no-op in non-kiosk mode. It's only allowed to be called repeatedly by the first extension to invoke this API.

parameters.name: seconds
parameters.description: Time to wait in seconds before rebooting the device, or -1 to cancel a scheduled reboot.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: A callback to be invoked when a restart request was successfully rescheduled.

functions.name: connect
functions.description: Attempts to connect listeners within an extension (such as the background page), or other extensions/apps. This is useful for content scripts connecting to their extension processes, inter-app/extension communication, and web messaging. Note that this does not connect to any listeners in a content script. Extensions may connect to content scripts embedded in tabs via $(ref:tabs.connect).

parameters.name: extensionId
parameters.description: The ID of the extension to connect to. If omitted, a connection will be attempted with your own extension. Required if sending messages from a web page for web messaging.

name.description: Will be passed into onConnect for processes that are listening for the connection event.

includeTlsChannelId.description: Whether the TLS channel ID will be passed into onConnectExternal for processes that are listening for the connection event.

returns.description: Port through which messages can be sent and received. The port's $(ref:Port onDisconnect) event is fired if the extension does not exist.

functions.name: connectNative
functions.description: Connects to a native application in the host machine. This method requires the "nativeMessaging" permission. See Native Messaging for more information.

parameters.name: application
parameters.description: The name of the registered application to connect to.

returns.description: Port through which messages can be sent and received with the application

functions.name: sendMessage
functions.description: Sends a single message to event listeners within your extension or a different extension/app. Similar to $(ref:runtime.connect) but only sends a single message, with an optional response. If sending to your extension, the $(ref:runtime.onMessage) event will be fired in every frame of your extension (except for the sender's frame), or $(ref:runtime.onMessageExternal), if a different extension. Note that extensions cannot send messages to content scripts using this method. To send messages to content scripts, use $(ref:tabs.sendMessage).

parameters.name: extensionId
parameters.description: The ID of the extension to send the message to. If omitted, the message will be sent to your own extension/app. Required if sending messages from a web page for web messaging.

parameters.name: message
parameters.description: The message to send. This message should be a JSON-ifiable object.

includeTlsChannelId.description: Whether the TLS channel ID will be passed into onMessageExternal for processes that are listening for the connection event.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Promise support was added for extension contexts in Chrome 99. When communicating from a web page to an extension, promises are available from Chrome 118.

parameters.name: response
parameters.description: The JSON response object sent by the handler of the message. If an error occurs while connecting to the extension, the callback will be called with no arguments and $(ref:runtime.lastError) will be set to the error message.

functions.name: sendNativeMessage
functions.description: Send a single message to a native application. This method requires the "nativeMessaging" permission.

parameters.name: application
parameters.description: The name of the native messaging host.

parameters.name: message
parameters.description: The message that will be passed to the native messaging host.

parameters.name: response
parameters.description: The response message sent by the native messaging host. If an error occurs while connecting to the native messaging host, the callback will be called with no arguments and $(ref:runtime.lastError) will be set to the error message.

functions.name: getPlatformInfo
functions.description: Returns information about the current platform.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Called with results

functions.name: getPackageDirectoryEntry
functions.description: Returns a DirectoryEntry for the package directory.

functions.name: getContexts
functions.description: Fetches information about active contexts associated with this extension

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: A filter to find matching contexts. A context matches if it matches all specified fields in the filter. Any unspecified field in the filter matches all contexts.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Invoked with the matching contexts, if any.

parameters.name: contexts
parameters.description: The matching contexts, if any.

events.name: onStartup
events.description: Fired when a profile that has this extension installed first starts up. This event is not fired when an incognito profile is started, even if this extension is operating in 'split' incognito mode.

events.name: onInstalled
events.description: Fired when the extension is first installed, when the extension is updated to a new version, and when Chrome is updated to a new version.

reason.description: The reason that this event is being dispatched.

previousVersion.description: Indicates the previous version of the extension, which has just been updated. This is present only if 'reason' is 'update'.

id.description: Indicates the ID of the imported shared module extension which updated. This is present only if 'reason' is 'shared_module_update'.

events.name: onSuspend
events.description: Sent to the event page just before it is unloaded. This gives the extension opportunity to do some clean up. Note that since the page is unloading, any asynchronous operations started while handling this event are not guaranteed to complete. If more activity for the event page occurs before it gets unloaded the onSuspendCanceled event will be sent and the page won't be unloaded.

events.name: onSuspendCanceled
events.description: Sent after onSuspend to indicate that the app won't be unloaded after all.

events.name: onUpdateAvailable
events.description: Fired when an update is available, but isn't installed immediately because the app is currently running. If you do nothing, the update will be installed the next time the background page gets unloaded, if you want it to be installed sooner you can explicitly call chrome.runtime.reload(). If your extension is using a persistent background page, the background page of course never gets unloaded, so unless you call chrome.runtime.reload() manually in response to this event the update will not get installed until the next time Chrome itself restarts. If no handlers are listening for this event, and your extension has a persistent background page, it behaves as if chrome.runtime.reload() is called in response to this event.

parameters.name: details

version.description: The version number of the available update.

parameters.description: The manifest details of the available update.

events.name: onBrowserUpdateAvailable
events.description: Fired when a Chrome update is available, but isn't installed immediately because a browser restart is required.

events.name: onConnect
events.description: Fired when a connection is made from either an extension process or a content script (by $(ref:runtime.connect)).

events.name: onConnectExternal
events.description: Fired when a connection is made from another extension (by $(ref:runtime.connect)), or from an externally connectable web site.

events.name: onUserScriptConnect
events.description: Fired when a connection is made from a user script from this extension.

events.name: onConnectNative
events.description: Fired when a connection is made from a native application. This event requires the "nativeMessaging" permission. It is only supported on Chrome OS.

events.name: onMessage
events.description: Fired when a message is sent from either an extension process (by $(ref:runtime.sendMessage)) or a content script (by $(ref:tabs.sendMessage)).

parameters.name: message
parameters.description: The message sent by the calling script.

parameters.name: sendResponse
parameters.description: Function to call (at most once) when you have a response. The argument should be any JSON-ifiable object. If you have more than one onMessage listener in the same document, then only one may send a response. This function becomes invalid when the event listener returns, unless you return true from the event listener to indicate you wish to send a response asynchronously (this will keep the message channel open to the other end until sendResponse is called).

parameters.name: response
parameters.description: The response to return to the message sender.

returns.description: Return true from the event listener if you wish to call sendResponse after the event listener returns.

events.name: onMessageExternal
events.description: Fired when a message is sent from another extension (by $(ref:runtime.sendMessage)). Cannot be used in a content script.

parameters.name: message
parameters.description: The message sent by the calling script.

parameters.name: sendResponse
parameters.description: Function to call (at most once) when you have a response. The argument should be any JSON-ifiable object. If you have more than one onMessage listener in the same document, then only one may send a response. This function becomes invalid when the event listener returns, unless you return true from the event listener to indicate you wish to send a response asynchronously (this will keep the message channel open to the other end until sendResponse is called).

parameters.name: response
parameters.description: The response to return to the message sender.

returns.description: Return true from the event listener if you wish to call sendResponse after the event listener returns.

events.name: onUserScriptMessage
events.description: Fired when a message is sent from a user script associated with the same extension.

parameters.name: message
parameters.description: The message sent by the user script.

parameters.name: sendResponse
parameters.description: Function to call (at most once) when you have a response. The argument should be any JSON-ifiable object. If you have more than one onMessage listener in the same document, then only one may send a response. This function becomes invalid when the event listener returns, unless you return true from the event listener to indicate you wish to send a response asynchronously (this will keep the message channel open to the other end until sendResponse is called).

parameters.name: response
parameters.description: The response to return to the message sender.

returns.description: Return true from the event listener if you wish to call sendResponse after the event listener returns.

events.name: onRestartRequired
events.description: Fired when an app or the device that it runs on needs to be restarted. The app should close all its windows at its earliest convenient time to let the restart to happen. If the app does nothing, a restart will be enforced after a 24-hour grace period has passed. Currently, this event is only fired for Chrome OS kiosk apps.

parameters.name: reason
parameters.description: The reason that the event is being dispatched.

storage.description: Use the chrome.storage API to store, retrieve, and track changes to user data.

enum.name: TRUSTED_CONTEXTS
enum.description: Specifies contexts originating from the extension itself.

enum.name: TRUSTED_AND_UNTRUSTED_CONTEXTS
enum.description: Specifies contexts originating from outside the extension.

types.description: The storage area's access level.

oldValue.description: The old value of the item, if there was an old value.

newValue.description: The new value of the item, if there is a new value.

functions.name: get
functions.description: Gets one or more items from storage.

parameters.name: keys

choices.description: Storage items to return in the callback, where the values are replaced with those from storage if they exist.

parameters.description: A single key to get, list of keys to get, or a dictionary specifying default values (see description of the object). An empty list or object will return an empty result object. Pass in null to get the entire contents of storage.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Callback with storage items, or on failure (in which case $(ref:runtime.lastError) will be set).

parameters.name: items
parameters.description: Object with items in their key-value mappings.

functions.name: getKeys
functions.description: Gets all keys from storage.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Callback with storage keys, or on failure (in which case $(ref:runtime.lastError) will be set).

parameters.name: keys
parameters.description: Array with keys read from storage.

functions.name: getBytesInUse
functions.description: Gets the amount of space (in bytes) being used by one or more items.

parameters.name: keys
parameters.description: A single key or list of keys to get the total usage for. An empty list will return 0. Pass in null to get the total usage of all of storage.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Callback with the amount of space being used by storage, or on failure (in which case $(ref:runtime.lastError) will be set).

parameters.name: bytesInUse
parameters.description: Amount of space being used in storage, in bytes.

functions.name: set
functions.description: Sets multiple items.

parameters.name: items
parameters.description:
An object which gives each key/value pair to update storage with. Any other key/value pairs in storage will not be affected.

Primitive values such as numbers will serialize as expected. Values with a typeof "object" and "function" will typically serialize to {}, with the exception of Array (serializes as expected), Date, and Regex (serialize using their String representation).

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Callback on success, or on failure (in which case $(ref:runtime.lastError) will be set).

functions.name: remove
functions.description: Removes one or more items from storage.

parameters.name: keys
parameters.description: A single key or a list of keys for items to remove.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Callback on success, or on failure (in which case $(ref:runtime.lastError) will be set).

functions.name: clear
functions.description: Removes all items from storage.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Callback on success, or on failure (in which case $(ref:runtime.lastError) will be set).

functions.name: setAccessLevel
functions.description: Sets the desired access level for the storage area. By default, `session` storage is restricted to trusted contexts (extension pages and service workers), while `managed`, `local`, and `sync` storage allow access from both trusted and untrusted contexts.

accessLevel.description: The access level of the storage area.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Callback on success, or on failure (in which case $(ref:runtime.lastError) will be set).

events.name: onChanged
events.description: Fired when one or more items change.

parameters.name: changes
parameters.description: Object mapping each key that changed to its corresponding $(ref:storage.StorageChange) for that item.

events.name: onChanged
events.description: Fired when one or more items change.

parameters.name: changes
parameters.description: Object mapping each key that changed to its corresponding $(ref:storage.StorageChange) for that item.

parameters.name: areaName
parameters.description: The name of the storage area ("local", "managed", "session", or "sync") the changes are for.

sync.description: Items in the sync storage area are synced using Chrome Sync.

QUOTA_BYTES.description: The maximum total amount (in bytes) of data that can be stored in sync storage, as measured by the JSON stringification of every value plus every key's length. Updates that would cause this limit to be exceeded fail immediately and set $(ref:runtime.lastError) when using a callback, or when a Promise is rejected.

QUOTA_BYTES_PER_ITEM.description: The maximum size (in bytes) of each individual item in sync storage, as measured by the JSON stringification of its value plus its key length. Updates containing items larger than this limit will fail immediately and set $(ref:runtime.lastError) when using a callback, or when a Promise is rejected.

MAX_ITEMS.description: The maximum number of items that can be stored in sync storage. Updates that would cause this limit to be exceeded will fail immediately and set $(ref:runtime.lastError) when using a callback, or when a Promise is rejected.

MAX_WRITE_OPERATIONS_PER_HOUR.description:
The maximum number of set, remove, or clear operations that can be performed each hour. This is 1 every 2 seconds, a lower ceiling than the short term higher writes-per-minute limit.

Updates that would cause this limit to be exceeded fail immediately and set $(ref:runtime.lastError) when using a callback, or when a Promise is rejected.

MAX_WRITE_OPERATIONS_PER_MINUTE.description:
The maximum number of set, remove, or clear operations that can be performed each minute. This is 2 per second, providing higher throughput than writes-per-hour over a shorter period of time.

Updates that would cause this limit to be exceeded fail immediately and set $(ref:runtime.lastError) when using a callback, or when a Promise is rejected.

MAX_SUSTAINED_WRITE_OPERATIONS_PER_MINUT.deprecated: The storage.sync API no longer has a sustained write operation quota.

local.description: Items in the local storage area are local to each machine.

QUOTA_BYTES.description: The maximum amount (in bytes) of data that can be stored in local storage, as measured by the JSON stringification of every value plus every key's length. This value will be ignored if the extension has the unlimitedStorage permission. Updates that would cause this limit to be exceeded fail immediately and set $(ref:runtime.lastError) when using a callback, or a rejected Promise if using async/await.

managed.description: Items in the managed storage area are set by an enterprise policy configured by the domain administrator, and are read-only for the extension; trying to modify this namespace results in an error. For information on configuring a policy, see Manifest for storage areas.

session.description: Items in the session storage area are stored in-memory and will not be persisted to disk.

QUOTA_BYTES.description: The maximum amount (in bytes) of data that can be stored in memory, as measured by estimating the dynamically allocated memory usage of every value and key. Updates that would cause this limit to be exceeded fail immediately and set $(ref:runtime.lastError) when using a callback, or when a Promise is rejected.

functions.name: getConfig

customArg.description: Additional string argument to pass to test.

functions.name: setExceptionHandler
functions.description: Sets the function to be called when an exception occurs. By default this is a function which fails the test. This is reset for every test run through $ref:test.runTests.

events.name: onMessage
events.description: Used to test sending messages to extensions.

lastMessage.description: True if this was the last message for this test

types.description: The chrome.types API contains type declarations for Chrome.

The scope of the ChromeSetting. One of
  • regular: setting for the regular profile (which is inherited by the incognito profile if not overridden elsewhere),
  • regular_only: setting for the regular profile only (not inherited by the incognito profile),
  • incognito_persistent: setting for the incognito profile that survives browser restarts (overrides regular preferences),
  • incognito_session_only: setting for the incognito profile that can only be set during an incognito session and is deleted when the incognito session ends (overrides regular and incognito_persistent preferences).

One of
  • not_controllable: cannot be controlled by any extension
  • controlled_by_other_extensions: controlled by extensions with higher precedence
  • controllable_by_this_extension: can be controlled by this extension
  • controlled_by_this_extension: controlled by this extension
An interface that allows access to a Chrome browser setting. See $(ref:accessibilityFeatures) for an example.

functions.name: get
functions.description: Gets the value of a setting.

parameters.name: details
parameters.description: Which setting to consider.

incognito.description: Whether to return the value that applies to the incognito session (default false).

parameters.name: details
parameters.description: Details of the currently effective value.

value.description: The value of the setting.

levelOfControl.description: The level of control of the setting.

incognitoSpecific.description:
Whether the effective value is specific to the incognito session.
This property will only be present if the incognito property in the details parameter of get() was true.

functions.name: set
functions.description: Sets the value of a setting.

parameters.name: details
parameters.description: Which setting to change.

value.description:
The value of the setting.
Note that every setting has a specific value type, which is described together with the setting. An extension should not set a value of a different type.

scope.description: Where to set the setting (default: regular).

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Called at the completion of the set operation.

functions.name: clear
functions.description: Clears the setting, restoring any default value.

parameters.name: details
parameters.description: Which setting to clear.

scope.description: Where to clear the setting (default: regular).

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Called at the completion of the clear operation.

events.name: onChange
events.description: Fired after the setting changes.

value.description: The value of the setting after the change.

levelOfControl.description: The level of control of the setting.

incognitoSpecific.description:
Whether the value that has changed is specific to the incognito session.
This property will only be present if the user has enabled the extension in incognito mode.

types.description: One of keyup or keydown.

keyName.description: Name of the key, which is independent of modifier state.

modifiers.description: Flag for modifiers that are active. None = 0, Shift = 2, Control = 4, Alt = 8.

types.description: The value of the virtual keyboard mode to set to.
The value of the virtual keyboard state to change to.

left.description: The position of the virtual keyboard window's left edge.

top.description: The position of the virtual keyboard window's top edge.

width.description: The width of the virtual keyboard window.

height.description: The height of the virtual keyboard window.

hotrodmode.description: Virtual keyboard is in hotrod mode.

a11ymode.description: True if accessibility virtual keyboard is enabled.

mode.name: mode
mode.description: The value of the virtual keyboard mode to set to.

bounds.description: The bounds of the virtual keyboard after changing mode

types.description: The display format associated with this item.

imageData.description: The image data associated with this item.

textData.description: The text data associated with this item.

displayFormat.name: displayFormat
displayFormat.description: The display format associated with this item.

timeCopied.description: The time that this item was added to the clipboard, in milliseconds since the epoch.

functions.name: insertText

functions.name: keyboardLoaded
functions.description: Inform the system that the keyboard has loaded.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Called when load acknowledgement is complete.

functions.name: getKeyboardConfig
functions.description: Gets the virtual keyboard configuration.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Called when querying virtual keyboard configuration is complete.

functions.name: openSettings
functions.description: Opens chrome://os-settings/osLanguages/input page.

functions.name: openSuggestionSettings
functions.description: Opens chrome://os-settings/osLanguages/smartInputs page.

functions.name: setContainerBehavior
functions.description: Sets the virtual keyboard container behavior

parameters.name: options
parameters.description: Optional parameters for new container behavior.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Called when container mode is ready to change, or if the operation failed.

parameters.name: success
parameters.description: Whether the container mode changed successfully

functions.name: setDraggableArea
functions.description: Sets the virtual keyboard draggable area bounds.

parameters.name: bounds
parameters.description: The value of draggable rect area of floating keyboard.

functions.name: setKeyboardState
functions.description: Requests the virtual keyboard to change state.

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: The value of the virtual keyboard state to change to.

functions.name: setOccludedBounds
functions.description: Sets the areas on the screen that are blocked by the virtual keyboard.

parameters.name: boundsList
parameters.description: List of rectangles representing regions occluded by the keyboard.

functions.name: setHitTestBounds
functions.description: Sets the areas on the keyboard window where events are handled. Any event outside of these areas are passed on to the window behind it.

parameters.name: boundsList
parameters.description: List of rectangles representing regions where events targeting the keyboard should be handled.

functions.name: setAreaToRemainOnScreen
functions.description: Sets the area of the keyboard window that should not move off screen. Any area outside of this can be moved off the user's screen.

parameters.name: bounds
parameters.description: The bounds of the area inside the keyboard window, relative to the window origin, that should not be moved off screen. Any area outside of this bounds can be moved off screen.

functions.name: setWindowBoundsInScreen
functions.description: Sets the bounds of the keyboard window in screen coordinates.

parameters.name: bounds
parameters.description: A rectangle defining the new bounds of the window in screen coordinates.

functions.name: getClipboardHistory
functions.description: Get the clipboard history

itemIds.description: A filter represented as a list of clipboard item ids. getClipboardHistory will only return the items in this list. If this list is empty, getClipboardHistory will return all clipboard items in the history.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Called when querying the ClipboardHistory is complete.

parameters.name: clipboardHistory
parameters.description: List of clipboard items corresponding to the requested items (or everything if 'itemIds' was not specified).

functions.name: pasteClipboardItem
functions.description: Pastes a clipboard item from the clipboard history.

parameters.name: itemId
parameters.description: The unique id which identifies this clipboard item.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Called when pasting the clipboard item is complete.

functions.name: deleteClipboardItem
functions.description: Deletes a clipboard item from the clipboard history.

parameters.name: itemId
parameters.description: The unique id which identifies this clipboard item.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Called when deleting the clipboard item is complete.

events.name: onBoundsChanged
events.description: This event is sent when virtual keyboard bounds changed and overscroll/resize is enabled.

parameters.name: bounds
parameters.description: The virtual keyboard bounds

events.name: onKeyboardClosed
events.description: Fired when the virtual keyboard window has been closed. For example, this can happen when turning off on-screen keyboard or exiting tablet mode.

events.name: onKeyboardConfigChanged
events.description: Fired when a configuration for virtual keyboard IME has changed, e.g. auto complete disabled.

parameters.name: config
parameters.description: The virtual keyboard config

events.name: onClipboardHistoryChanged
events.description: Fired when the list of items in the clipboard history changes.

parameters.name: itemIds
parameters.description: A list of ids for all current items in the clipboard history.

events.name: onClipboardItemUpdated
events.description: Fired when the data in a specific clipboard item is updated (mainly used for sending updated rendered html image).

parameters.name: clipboardHistoryItem
parameters.description: An existing clipboard history item with changed data

events.name: onColorProviderChanged
events.description: Fired when the color provider of virtual keyboard window has changed.

webRequest.description: Use the chrome.webRequest API to observe and analyze traffic and to intercept, block, or modify requests in-flight.

MAX_HANDLER_BEHAVIOR_CHANGED_CALLS_PER_1.description: The maximum number of times that handlerBehaviorChanged can be called per 10 minute sustained interval. handlerBehaviorChanged is an expensive function call that shouldn't be called often.

types.description: An object describing filters to apply to webRequest events.

urls.description: A list of URLs or URL patterns. Requests that cannot match any of the URLs will be filtered out.

types.description: A list of request types. Requests that cannot match any of the types will be filtered out.
An array of HTTP headers. Each header is represented as a dictionary containing the keys name and either value or binaryValue.

name.description: Name of the HTTP header.

value.description: Value of the HTTP header if it can be represented by UTF-8.

binaryValue.description: Value of the HTTP header if it cannot be represented by UTF-8, stored as individual byte values (0..255).

types.description: Returns value for event handlers that have the 'blocking' extraInfoSpec applied. Allows the event handler to modify network requests.

cancel.description: If true, the request is cancelled. This prevents the request from being sent. This can be used as a response to the onBeforeRequest, onBeforeSendHeaders, onHeadersReceived and onAuthRequired events.

redirectUrl.description: Only used as a response to the onBeforeRequest and onHeadersReceived events. If set, the original request is prevented from being sent/completed and is instead redirected to the given URL. Redirections to non-HTTP schemes such as data: are allowed. Redirects initiated by a redirect action use the original request method for the redirect, with one exception: If the redirect is initiated at the onHeadersReceived stage, then the redirect will be issued using the GET method. Redirects from URLs with ws:// and wss:// schemes are ignored.

requestHeaders.description: Only used as a response to the onBeforeSendHeaders event. If set, the request is made with these request headers instead.

responseHeaders.description: Only used as a response to the onHeadersReceived event. If set, the server is assumed to have responded with these response headers instead. Only return responseHeaders if you really want to modify the headers in order to limit the number of conflicts (only one extension may modify responseHeaders for each request).

authCredentials.description: Only used as a response to the onAuthRequired event. If set, the request is made using the supplied credentials.

bytes.description: An ArrayBuffer with a copy of the data.

file.description: A string with the file's path and name.

types.description: Contains data uploaded in a URL request.

rawDER.description: Raw bytes of DER encoded server certificate

state.description: State of the connection. One of secure, insecure, broken.

types.description: Contains data passed within form data. For urlencoded form it is stored as string if data is utf-8 string and as ArrayBuffer otherwise. For form-data it is ArrayBuffer. If form-data represents uploading file, it is string with filename, if the filename is provided.

types.decription: Denotes the extension proposed action which was ignored.

functions.name: handlerBehaviorChanged
functions.description: Needs to be called when the behavior of the webRequest handlers has changed to prevent incorrect handling due to caching. This function call is expensive. Don't call it often.

events.name: onBeforeRequest
events.description: Fired when a request is about to occur.

requestId.description: The ID of the request. Request IDs are unique within a browser session. As a result, they could be used to relate different events of the same request.

frameId.description: The value 0 indicates that the request happens in the main frame; a positive value indicates the ID of a subframe in which the request happens. If the document of a (sub-)frame is loaded (type is main_frame or sub_frame), frameId indicates the ID of this frame, not the ID of the outer frame. Frame IDs are unique within a tab.

parentFrameId.description: ID of frame that wraps the frame which sent the request. Set to -1 if no parent frame exists.

documentId.description: The UUID of the document making the request.

parentDocumentId.description: The UUID of the parent document owning this frame. This is not set if there is no parent.

documentLifecycle.description: The lifecycle the document is in.

frameType.description: The type of frame the request occurred in.

requestBody.description: Contains the HTTP request body data. Only provided if extraInfoSpec contains 'requestBody'.

error.description: Errors when obtaining request body data.

formData.description: If the request method is POST and the body is a sequence of key-value pairs encoded in UTF8, encoded as either multipart/form-data, or application/x-www-form-urlencoded, this dictionary is present and for each key contains the list of all values for that key. If the data is of another media type, or if it is malformed, the dictionary is not present. An example value of this dictionary is {'key': ['value1', 'value2']}.

raw.description: If the request method is PUT or POST, and the body is not already parsed in formData, then the unparsed request body elements are contained in this array.

tabId.description: The ID of the tab in which the request takes place. Set to -1 if the request isn't related to a tab.

type.description: How the requested resource will be used.

initiator.description: The origin where the request was initiated. This does not change through redirects. If this is an opaque origin, the string 'null' will be used.

timeStamp.description: The time when this signal is triggered, in milliseconds since the epoch.

extraParameters.name: filter
extraParameters.description: A set of filters that restricts the events that will be sent to this listener.

extraParameters.name: extraInfoSpec
extraParameters.description: Array of extra information that should be passed to the listener function.

returns.description: If "blocking" is specified in the "extraInfoSpec" parameter, the event listener should return an object of this type.

The listener has three options: it can provide authentication credentials, it can cancel the request and display the error page, or it can take no action on the challenge. requestId.description: The ID of the request. Request IDs are unique within a browser session. As a result, they could be used to relate different events of the same request.

action.description: The proposed action which was ignored.

MAX_CAPTURE_VISIBLE_REGION_CALLS_PER_SEC.description: The maximum number of times that $(ref:captureVisibleRegion) can be called per second. $(ref:captureVisibleRegion) is expensive and should not be called too often.

types.description: A set of data types. Missing data types are interpreted as false.

cookies.description: The Websites' cookies. This will remove both session and persistent cookies

cache.description: The Websites' cache data. Note: when removing data, this clears the entire cache: it is not limited to the range you specify.

types.description: Options that determine exactly what data will be removed.

since.description: Remove data accumulated on or after this date, represented in milliseconds since the epoch (accessible via the getTime method of the JavaScript Date object). If absent, defaults to 0 (which would remove all browsing data).

types.description: Defines the how zooming is handled in the webview.

enum.name: per-origin
enum.description: Zoom changes will persist in the zoomed page's origin, i.e. all other webviews in the same partition that are navigated to that same origin will be zoomed as well. Moreover, per-origin zoom changes are saved with the origin, meaning that when navigating to other pages in the same origin, they will all be zoomed to the same zoom factor.

enum.name: per-view
enum.description: Zoom changes only take effect in this webview, and zoom changes in other webviews will not affect the zooming of this webview. Also, per-view zoom changes are reset on navigation; navigating a webview will always load pages with their per-origin zoom factors (within the scope of the partition).

enum.name: disabled
enum.description: Disables all zooming in the webview. The content will revert to the default zoom level, and all attempted zoom changes will be ignored.

types.description: Determines what to do with the active match after the find session has ended. 'clear' will clear the highlighting over the active match; 'keep' will keep the active match highlighted; 'activate' will keep the active match highlighted and simulate a user click on that match.
The type of injection item: code or a set of files.

code.description: JavaScript code or CSS to be injected into matching pages.

files.description: The list of JavaScript or CSS files to be injected into matching pages. These are injected in the order they appear in this array.

types.description: Details of the content script to inject.

name.description: The name of the content script to inject.

matches.description: Specifies which pages this content script will be injected into.

exclude_matches.description: Excludes pages that this content script would otherwise be injected into.

match_about_blank.description: Whether to insert the content script on about:blank and about:srcdoc. Content scripts will only be injected on pages when their inherit URL is matched by one of the declared patterns in the matches field. The inherit URL is the URL of the document that created the frame or window. Content scripts cannot be inserted in sandboxed frames.

css.description: The CSS code or a list of CSS files to be injected into matching pages. These are injected in the order they appear, before any DOM is constructed or displayed for the page.

js.description: The JavaScript code or a list of JavaScript files to be injected into matching pages. These are injected in the order they appear.

run_at.description: The soonest that the JavaScript or CSS will be injected into the tab. Defaults to "document_idle".

all_frames.description: If allFrames is true, implies that the JavaScript or CSS should be injected into all frames of current page. By default, it's false and is only injected into the top frame.

include_globs.description: Applied after matches to include only those URLs that also match this glob. Intended to emulate the @include Greasemonkey keyword.

exclude_globs.description: Applied after matches to exclude URLs that match this glob. Intended to emulate the @exclude Greasemonkey keyword.

webViewRequest.description: Use the chrome.webViewRequest API to intercept, block, or modify requests in-flight. It is potentially faster than the chrome.webRequest API because you can register rules that are evaluated in the browser rather than the JavaScript engine, which reduces roundtrip latencies and allows higher efficiency.

accessibilityFeatures.description: Use the chrome.accessibilityFeatures API to manage Chrome's accessibility features. This API relies on the ChromeSetting prototype of the type API for getting and setting individual accessibility features. In order to get feature states the extension must request accessibilityFeatures.read permission. For modifying feature state, the extension needs accessibilityFeatures.modify permission. Note that accessibilityFeatures.modify does not imply accessibilityFeatures.read permission.

spokenFeedback.description:
ChromeOS only.

Spoken feedback (text-to-speech). The value indicates whether the feature is enabled or not. get() requires accessibilityFeatures.read permission. set() and clear() require accessibilityFeatures.modify permission.

largeCursor.description:
ChromeOS only.

Enlarged cursor. The value indicates whether the feature is enabled or not. get() requires accessibilityFeatures.read permission. set() and clear() require accessibilityFeatures.modify permission.

stickyKeys.description:
ChromeOS only.

Sticky modifier keys (like shift or alt). The value indicates whether the feature is enabled or not. get() requires accessibilityFeatures.read permission. set() and clear() require accessibilityFeatures.modify permission.

highContrast.description:
ChromeOS only.

High contrast rendering mode. The value indicates whether the feature is enabled or not. get() requires accessibilityFeatures.read permission. set() and clear() require accessibilityFeatures.modify permission.

screenMagnifier.description:
ChromeOS only.

Full screen magnification. The value indicates whether the feature is enabled or not. get() requires accessibilityFeatures.read permission. set() and clear() require accessibilityFeatures.modify permission.

autoclick.description:
ChromeOS only.

Auto mouse click after mouse stops moving. The value indicates whether the feature is enabled or not. get() requires accessibilityFeatures.read permission. set() and clear() require accessibilityFeatures.modify permission.

virtualKeyboard.description:
ChromeOS only.

Virtual on-screen keyboard. The value indicates whether the feature is enabled or not. get() requires accessibilityFeatures.read permission. set() and clear() require accessibilityFeatures.modify permission.

caretHighlight.description:
ChromeOS only.

Caret highlighting. The value indicates whether the feature is enabled or not. get() requires accessibilityFeatures.read permission. set() and clear() require accessibilityFeatures.modify permission.

cursorHighlight.description:
ChromeOS only.

Cursor highlighting. The value indicates whether the feature is enabled or not. get() requires accessibilityFeatures.read permission. set() and clear() require accessibilityFeatures.modify permission.

cursorColor.description:
ChromeOS only.

Cursor color. The value indicates whether the feature is enabled or not, doesn't indicate the color of it. get() requires accessibilityFeatures.read permission. set() and clear() require accessibilityFeatures.modify permission.

dockedMagnifier.description:
ChromeOS only.

Docked magnifier. The value indicates whether docked magnifier feature is enabled or not. get() requires accessibilityFeatures.read permission. set() and clear() require accessibilityFeatures.modify permission.

focusHighlight.description:
ChromeOS only.

Focus highlighting. The value indicates whether the feature is enabled or not. get() requires accessibilityFeatures.read permission. set() and clear() require accessibilityFeatures.modify permission.

selectToSpeak.description:
ChromeOS only.

Select-to-speak. The value indicates whether the feature is enabled or not. get() requires accessibilityFeatures.read permission. set() and clear() require accessibilityFeatures.modify permission.

switchAccess.description:
ChromeOS only.

Switch Access. The value indicates whether the feature is enabled or not. get() requires accessibilityFeatures.read permission. set() and clear() require accessibilityFeatures.modify permission.

action.description: Use the chrome.action API to control the extension's icon in the Google Chrome toolbar.

tabId.description: The ID of the tab to query state for. If no tab is specified, the non-tab-specific state is returned.

isOnToolbar.description: Whether the extension's action icon is visible on browser windows' top-level toolbar (i.e., whether the extension has been 'pinned' by the user).

types.description: The collection of user-specified settings relating to an extension's action.

isOnToolbar.description: Whether the extension's action icon is visible on browser windows' top-level toolbar (i.e., whether the extension has been 'pinned' by the user).

windowId.description: The ID of the window to open the action popup in. Defaults to the currently-active window if unspecified.

functions.name: setTitle
functions.description: Sets the title of the action. This shows up in the tooltip.

title.description: The string the action should display when moused over.

tabId.description: Limits the change to when a particular tab is selected. Automatically resets when the tab is closed.

functions.name: getTitle
functions.description: Gets the title of the action.

functions.name: setIcon
functions.description: Sets the icon for the action. The icon can be specified either as the path to an image file or as the pixel data from a canvas element, or as dictionary of either one of those. Either the path or the imageData property must be specified.

imageData.description: Either an ImageData object or a dictionary {size -> ImageData} representing icon to be set. If the icon is specified as a dictionary, the actual image to be used is chosen depending on screen's pixel density. If the number of image pixels that fit into one screen space unit equals scale, then image with size scale * n will be selected, where n is the size of the icon in the UI. At least one image must be specified. Note that 'details.imageData = foo' is equivalent to 'details.imageData = {'16': foo}'

path.description: Either a relative image path or a dictionary {size -> relative image path} pointing to icon to be set. If the icon is specified as a dictionary, the actual image to be used is chosen depending on screen's pixel density. If the number of image pixels that fit into one screen space unit equals scale, then image with size scale * n will be selected, where n is the size of the icon in the UI. At least one image must be specified. Note that 'details.path = foo' is equivalent to 'details.path = {'16': foo}'

tabId.description: Limits the change to when a particular tab is selected. Automatically resets when the tab is closed.

functions.name: setPopup
functions.description: Sets the HTML document to be opened as a popup when the user clicks on the action's icon.

tabId.description: Limits the change to when a particular tab is selected. Automatically resets when the tab is closed.

popup.description: The relative path to the HTML file to show in a popup. If set to the empty string (''), no popup is shown.

functions.name: getPopup
functions.description: Gets the html document set as the popup for this action.

functions.name: setBadgeText
functions.description: Sets the badge text for the action. The badge is displayed on top of the icon.

text.description: Any number of characters can be passed, but only about four can fit in the space. If an empty string ('') is passed, the badge text is cleared. If tabId is specified and text is null, the text for the specified tab is cleared and defaults to the global badge text.

tabId.description: Limits the change to when a particular tab is selected. Automatically resets when the tab is closed.

functions.name: getBadgeText
functions.description: Gets the badge text of the action. If no tab is specified, the non-tab-specific badge text is returned. If displayActionCountAsBadgeText is enabled, a placeholder text will be returned unless the declarativeNetRequestFeedback permission is present or tab-specific badge text was provided.

functions.name: setBadgeBackgroundColor
functions.description: Sets the background color for the badge.

color.description: An array of four integers in the range [0,255] that make up the RGBA color of the badge. For example, opaque red is [255, 0, 0, 255]. Can also be a string with a CSS value, with opaque red being #FF0000 or #F00.

tabId.description: Limits the change to when a particular tab is selected. Automatically resets when the tab is closed.

functions.name: getBadgeBackgroundColor
functions.description: Gets the background color of the action.

functions.name: setBadgeTextColor
functions.description: Sets the text color for the badge.

color.description: An array of four integers in the range [0,255] that make up the RGBA color of the badge. For example, opaque red is [255, 0, 0, 255]. Can also be a string with a CSS value, with opaque red being #FF0000 or #F00. Not setting this value will cause a color to be automatically chosen that will contrast with the badge's background color so the text will be visible. Colors with alpha values equivalent to 0 will not be set and will return an error.

tabId.description: Limits the change to when a particular tab is selected. Automatically resets when the tab is closed.

functions.name: moveMagnifierToRect
functions.description: Called by the Accessibility Common extension to move |rect| within the magnifier viewport (e.g. when focus has changed). If |rect| is already completely within the viewport, magnifier doesn't move. If any edge of |rect| is outside the viewport (e.g. if rect is larger than or extends partially beyond the viewport), magnifier will center the overflowing dimensions of the viewport on center of |rect| (e.g. center viewport vertically if |rect| extends beyond bottom of screen).

bookmarks.description: Use the chrome.bookmarks API to create, organize, and otherwise manipulate bookmarks. Also see Override Pages, which you can use to create a custom Bookmark Manager page.

MAX_WRITE_OPERATIONS_PER_HOUR.deprecated: Bookmark write operations are no longer limited by Chrome.

MAX_SUSTAINED_WRITE_OPERATIONS_PER_MINUT.deprecated: Bookmark write operations are no longer limited by Chrome.

enum.name: bookmarks-bar
enum.description: The folder whose contents is displayed at the top of the browser window.

enum.name: other
enum.description: Bookmarks which are displayed in the full list of bookmarks on all platforms.

enum.name: mobile
enum.description: Bookmarks generally available on the user's mobile devices, but modifiable by extension or in the bookmarks manager.

enum.name: managed
enum.description: A top-level folder that may be present if the system administrator or the custodian of a supervised user has configured bookmarks.

types.description: Indicates the type of folder.

Indicates the reason why this node is unmodifiable. The <var>managed</var> value indicates that this node was configured by the system administrator. Omitted if the node can be modified by the user and the extension (default).
A node (either a bookmark or a folder) in the bookmark tree.  Child nodes are ordered within their parent folder.

id.description: The unique identifier for the node. IDs are unique within the current profile, and they remain valid even after the browser is restarted.

parentId.description: The id of the parent folder. Omitted for the root node.

index.description: The 0-based position of this node within its parent folder.

url.description: The URL navigated to when a user clicks the bookmark. Omitted for folders.

title.description: The text displayed for the node.

dateAdded.description: When this node was created, in milliseconds since the epoch (new Date(dateAdded)).

dateLastUsed.description: When this node was last opened, in milliseconds since the epoch. Not set for folders.

dateGroupModified.description: When the contents of this folder last changed, in milliseconds since the epoch.

folderType.description:
If present, this is a folder that is added by the browser and that cannot be modified by the user or the extension. Child nodes may be modified, if this node does not have the unmodifiable property set. Omitted if the node can be modified by the user and the extension (default).

There may be zero, one or multiple nodes of each folder type. A folder may be added or removed by the browser, but not via the extensions API.

unmodifiable.description: Indicates the reason why this node is unmodifiable. The <var>managed</var> value indicates that this node was configured by the system administrator or by the custodian of a supervised user. Omitted if the node can be modified by the user and the extension (default).

syncing.description:
Whether this node is synced with the user's remote account storage by the browser. This can be used to distinguish between account and local-only versions of the same $(ref:FolderType). The value of this property may change for an existing node, for example as a result of user action.

Note: this reflects whether the node is saved to the browser's built-in account provider. It is possible that a node could be synced via a third-party, even if this value is false.

For managed nodes (nodes where unmodifiable is set to true), this property will always be false.

children.description: An ordered list of children of this node.

types.description: Object passed to the create() function.

parentId.description: Defaults to the Other Bookmarks folder.

functions.name: get
functions.description: Retrieves the specified BookmarkTreeNode(s).

parameters.name: idOrIdList
parameters.description: A single string-valued id, or an array of string-valued ids

functions.name: getChildren
functions.description: Retrieves the children of the specified BookmarkTreeNode id.

functions.name: getRecent
functions.description: Retrieves the recently added bookmarks.

parameters.description: The maximum number of items to return.

functions.name: getSubTree

functions.name: search
functions.description: Searches for BookmarkTreeNodes matching the given query. Queries specified with an object produce BookmarkTreeNodes matching all specified properties.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Either a string of words and quoted phrases that are matched against bookmark URLs and titles, or an object. If an object, the properties query, url, and title may be specified and bookmarks matching all specified properties will be produced.

choices.description: A string of words and quoted phrases that are matched against bookmark URLs and titles.
An object specifying properties and values to match when searching. Produces bookmarks matching all properties.

query.description: A string of words and quoted phrases that are matched against bookmark URLs and titles.

url.description: The URL of the bookmark; matches verbatim. Note that folders have no URL.

title.description: The title of the bookmark; matches verbatim.

functions.name: create
functions.description: Creates a bookmark or folder under the specified parentId.  If url is NULL or missing, it will be a folder.

functions.name: move
functions.description: Moves the specified BookmarkTreeNode to the provided location.

functions.name: update
functions.description: Updates the properties of a bookmark or folder. Specify only the properties that you want to change; unspecified properties will be left unchanged. Note: Currently, only 'title' and 'url' are supported.

functions.name: remove
functions.description: Removes a bookmark or an empty bookmark folder.

functions.name: removeTree
functions.description: Recursively removes a bookmark folder.

events.name: onCreated
events.description: Fired when a bookmark or folder is created.

events.name: onRemoved
events.description: Fired when a bookmark or folder is removed.  When a folder is removed recursively, a single notification is fired for the folder, and none for its contents.

events.name: onChanged
events.description: Fired when a bookmark or folder changes. Note: Currently, only title and url changes trigger this.

events.name: onMoved
events.description: Fired when a bookmark or folder is moved to a different parent folder.

events.name: onChildrenReordered
events.description: Fired when the children of a folder have changed their order due to the order being sorted in the UI.  This is not called as a result of a move().

events.name: onImportBegan
events.description: Fired when a bookmark import session is begun.  Expensive observers should ignore onCreated updates until onImportEnded is fired.  Observers should still handle other notifications immediately.

events.name: onImportEnded
events.description: Fired when a bookmark import session is ended.

browserAction.description: Use browser actions to put icons in the main Google Chrome toolbar, to the right of the address bar. In addition to its icon, a browser action can have a tooltip, a badge, and a popup.

tabId.description: The ID of the tab to query state for. If no tab is specified, the non-tab-specific state is returned.

functions.name: setTitle
functions.description: Sets the title of the browser action. This title appears in the tooltip.

title.description: The string the browser action should display when moused over.

tabId.description: Limits the change to when a particular tab is selected. Automatically resets when the tab is closed.

functions.name: getTitle
functions.description: Gets the title of the browser action.

functions.name: setIcon
functions.description: Sets the icon for the browser action. The icon can be specified as the path to an image file, as the pixel data from a canvas element, or as a dictionary of one of those. Either the path or the imageData property must be specified.

imageData.description: Either an ImageData object or a dictionary {size -> ImageData} representing an icon to be set. If the icon is specified as a dictionary, the image used is chosen depending on the screen's pixel density. If the number of image pixels that fit into one screen space unit equals scale, then an image with size scale * n is selected, where n is the size of the icon in the UI. At least one image must be specified. Note that 'details.imageData = foo' is equivalent to 'details.imageData = {'16': foo}'

path.description: Either a relative image path or a dictionary {size -> relative image path} pointing to an icon to be set. If the icon is specified as a dictionary, the image used is chosen depending on the screen's pixel density. If the number of image pixels that fit into one screen space unit equals scale, then an image with size scale * n is selected, where n is the size of the icon in the UI. At least one image must be specified. Note that 'details.path = foo' is equivalent to 'details.path = {'16': foo}'

tabId.description: Limits the change to when a particular tab is selected. Automatically resets when the tab is closed.

functions.name: setPopup
functions.description: Sets the HTML document to be opened as a popup when the user clicks the browser action icon.

tabId.description: Limits the change to when a particular tab is selected. Automatically resets when the tab is closed.

popup.description: The relative path to the HTML file to show in a popup. If set to the empty string (''), no popup is shown.

functions.name: getPopup
functions.description: Gets the HTML document that is set as the popup for this browser action.

functions.name: setBadgeText
functions.description: Sets the badge text for the browser action. The badge is displayed on top of the icon.

text.description: Any number of characters can be passed, but only about four can fit into the space. If an empty string ('') is passed, the badge text is cleared. If tabId is specified and text is null, the text for the specified tab is cleared and defaults to the global badge text.

tabId.description: Limits the change to when a particular tab is selected. Automatically resets when the tab is closed.

functions.name: getBadgeText
functions.description: Gets the badge text of the browser action. If no tab is specified, the non-tab-specific badge text is returned.

functions.name: setBadgeBackgroundColor
functions.description: Sets the background color for the badge.

color.description: An array of four integers in the range 0-255 that make up the RGBA color of the badge. Can also be a string with a CSS hex color value; for example, #FF0000 or #F00 (red). Renders colors at full opacity.

tabId.description: Limits the change to when a particular tab is selected. Automatically resets when the tab is closed.

functions.name: getBadgeBackgroundColor
functions.description: Gets the background color of the browser action.

functions.name: enable
functions.description: Enables the browser action for a tab. Defaults to enabled.

parameters.name: tabId
parameters.description: The ID of the tab for which to modify the browser action.

functions.name: disable
functions.description: Disables the browser action for a tab.

parameters.name: tabId
parameters.description: The ID of the tab for which to modify the browser action.

functions.name: openPopup
functions.description: Opens the extension popup window in the active window but does not grant tab permissions.

parameters.name: popupView
parameters.description: JavaScript 'window' object for the popup window if it was succesfully opened.

events.name: onClicked
events.description: Fired when a browser action icon is clicked. Does not fire if the browser action has a popup.

browsingData.description: Use the chrome.browsingData API to remove browsing data from a user's local profile.

types.description: Options that determine exactly what data will be removed.

since.description: Remove data accumulated on or after this date, represented in milliseconds since the epoch (accessible via the getTime method of the JavaScript Date object). If absent, defaults to 0 (which would remove all browsing data).

originTypes.description: An object whose properties specify which origin types ought to be cleared. If this object isn't specified, it defaults to clearing only "unprotected" origins. Please ensure that you really want to remove application data before adding 'protectedWeb' or 'extensions'.

protectedWeb.description: Websites that have been installed as hosted applications (be careful!).

extension.description: Extensions and packaged applications a user has installed (be _really_ careful!).

origins.description: When present, only data for origins in this list is deleted. Only supported for cookies, storage and cache. Cookies are cleared for the whole registrable domain.

excludeOrigins.description: When present, data for origins in this list is excluded from deletion. Can't be used together with origins. Only supported for cookies, storage and cache. Cookies are excluded for the whole registrable domain.

types.description: A set of data types. Missing data types are interpreted as false.

serverBoundCertificates.deprecated: Support for server-bound certificates has been removed. This data type will be ignored.

passwords.deprecated: Support for password deletion through extensions has been removed. This data type will be ignored.

pluginData.deprecated: Support for Flash has been removed. This data type will be ignored.

functions.name: settings
functions.description: Reports which types of data are currently selected in the 'Clear browsing data' settings UI.  Note: some of the data types included in this API are not available in the settings UI, and some UI settings control more than one data type listed here.

dataToRemove.description: All of the types will be present in the result, with values of true if they are both selected to be removed and permitted to be removed, otherwise false.

dataRemovalPermitted.description: All of the types will be present in the result, with values of true if they are permitted to be removed (e.g., by enterprise policy) and false if not.

functions.name: remove
functions.description: Clears various types of browsing data stored in a user's profile.

parameters.name: dataToRemove
parameters.description: The set of data types to remove.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Resolves when deletion has completed.

functions.name: removeAppcache
functions.description: Clears websites' appcache data.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Resolves when websites' appcache data has been cleared.

functions.name: removeCache
functions.description: Clears the browser's cache.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Resolves when the browser's cache has been cleared.

functions.name: removeCacheStorage
functions.description: Clears websites' cache storage data.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Resolves when websites' cache storage has been cleared.

functions.name: removeCookies
functions.description: Clears the browser's cookies and server-bound certificates modified within a particular timeframe.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Resolves when the browser's cookies and server-bound certificates have been cleared.

functions.name: removeDownloads
functions.description: Clears the browser's list of downloaded files (not the downloaded files themselves).

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Resolves when the browser's list of downloaded files has been cleared.

functions.name: removeFileSystems
functions.description: Clears websites' file system data.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Resolves when websites' file systems have been cleared.

functions.name: removeFormData
functions.description: Clears the browser's stored form data (autofill).

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Resolves when the browser's form data has been cleared.

functions.name: removeHistory
functions.description: Clears the browser's history.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Resolves when the browser's history has cleared.

functions.name: removeIndexedDB
functions.description: Clears websites' IndexedDB data.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Resolves when websites' IndexedDB data has been cleared.

functions.name: removeLocalStorage
functions.description: Clears websites' local storage data.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Resolves when websites' local storage has been cleared.

functions.name: removePluginData
functions.description: Clears plugins' data.
functions.deprecated: Support for Flash has been removed. This function has no effect.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Resolves when plugins' data has been cleared.

functions.name: removePasswords
functions.description: Clears the browser's stored passwords.
functions.deprecated: Support for password deletion through extensions has been removed. This function has no effect.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Resolves when the browser's passwords have been cleared.

functions.name: removeServiceWorkers
functions.description: Clears websites' service workers.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Resolves when websites' service workers have been cleared.

functions.name: removeWebSQL
functions.description: Clears websites' WebSQL data.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Resolves when websites' WebSQL databases have been cleared.

types.description: An item in the context menu.

returns.description: The ID of the newly created item.

type.description: The type of menu item. Defaults to 'normal' if not specified.

id.description: The unique ID to assign to this item. Cannot be the same as another ID for this webview.

title.description: The text to be displayed in the item; this is required unless type is 'separator'. When the context is 'selection', you can use %s within the string to show the selected text. For example, if this parameter's value is "Translate '%s' to Pig Latin" and the user selects the word "cool", the context menu item for the selection is "Translate 'cool' to Pig Latin".

checked.description: The initial state of a checkbox or radio item: true for selected and false for unselected. Only one radio item can be selected at a time in a given group of radio items.

contexts.description: List of contexts this menu item will appear in. Defaults to ['page'] if not specified.

visible.description: Whether the item is visible in the menu.

onclick.description: A function that will be called back when the menu item is clicked.

parameters.name: info
parameters.description: Information about the item clicked and the context where the click happened.

parentId.description: The ID of a parent menu item; this makes the item a child of a previously added item.

documentUrlPatterns.description: Lets you restrict the item to apply only to documents whose URL matches one of the given patterns. (This applies to frames as well.) For details on the format of a pattern, see Match Patterns.

targetUrlPatterns.description: Similar to documentUrlPatterns, but lets you filter based on the src attribute of img/audio/video tags and the href of anchor tags.

enabled.description: Whether this context menu item is enabled or disabled. Defaults to true.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Called when the item has been created in the browser. If there were any problems creating the item, details will be available in $(ref:runtime.lastError).

functions.name: contextMenusUpdate
functions.description: Updates a previously created context menu item.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the item to update.

parameters.name: updateProperties
parameters.description: The properties to update. Accepts the same values as the create function.

contexts.description: List of contexts this menu item will appear in. Defaults to ['page'] if not specified.

visible.description: Whether the item is visible in the menu.

parentId.description: Note: You cannot change an item to be a child of one of its own descendants.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Resolves when the context menu has been updated.

functions.name: contextMenusRemove
functions.description: Removes a context menu item.

parameters.name: menuItemId
parameters.description: The ID of the context menu item to remove.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Resolves when the context menu has been removed.

functions.name: contextMenusRemoveAll
functions.description: Removes all context menu items added by this webview.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Resolves when removal is complete.

parameters.name: instanceId
