parameters.description: The instance ID of the guest <webview> process. This not exposed to developers through the API.

parameters.name: requestId
parameters.description: The strictly increasing request counter that serves as ID for the context menu. This not exposed to developers through the API.

parameters.name: itemsToShow
parameters.description: Items to be shown in the context menu. These are top level items as opposed to children items.

events.name: onShow
events.description: Fired when context menu is about to be shown. Provides the ability to cancel the context menu by calling event.preventDefault() from this handler.

types.description: Chrome OS system property name
Current session type.
Status of the play store. Note: 'available' means that the device supports the playstore but it is not enabled.
Status of enterprise enrollment.
Device type.
Status of stylus.
Status of Google Assistant.

functions.name: get
functions.description: Fetches customization values for the given property names. See property names in the declaration of the returned dictionary.

parameters.name: propertyNames
parameters.description: Chrome OS Property names

parameters.name: propertiesDictionary
parameters.description: Dictionary which contains all requested properties

homeProvider.description: Home provider which is used by the cellular device

deviceRequisition.description: OEM Device Requisition set in VPD

isMeetDevice.description: True if Chrome is built with is_cfm build flag

isOwner.description: True if current logged in user is device owner

a11yLargeCursorEnabled.description: If true, ChromeOS is showing enlarged cursor.

a11yStickyKeysEnabled.description: If true, sticky keys are turned on.

a11ySpokenFeedbackEnabled.description: If enabled, ChromeOS text-to-speech feature is turned on.

a11yHighContrastEnabled.description: If true, all displays have high contrast mode turned on.

a11yScreenMagnifierEnabled.description: If true, all displays have screen magnifier turned on.

a11yAutoClickEnabled.description: If true, autoclick accessibility feature is turned on.

a11yVirtualKeyboardEnabled.description: If true, virtual keyboard will be enabled.

a11yCaretHighlightEnabled.description: If true, caret highlighting will be enabled.

a11yCursorHighlightEnabled.description: If true, cursor highlighting will be enabled.

a11yFocusHighlightEnabled.description: If true, focus highlighting will be enabled.

a11ySelectToSpeakEnabled.description: If true, select to speak will be enabled.

a11ySwitchAccessEnabled.description: If true, switch access will be enabled.

a11yCursorColorEnabled.description: If true, colorized cursor will be enabled.

a11yDockedMagnifierEnabled.description: If true, docked magnifier will be enabled.

sendFunctionKeys.description: If true, the ChromeOS top row keys send function keys.

functions.name: set
functions.description: Sets values for the given system property.

parameters.name: propertyName
parameters.description: Chrome OS system property name

parameters.name: propertyValue
parameters.description: Chrome OS system property value

functions.name: isTabletModeEnabled
functions.description: Called to request tablet mode enabled status from the Chrome OS system.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Resolves with tablet mode enabled status as a boolean.

functions.name: hasSwitch
functions.description: Returns whether a switch is specified on the command line when launching Chrome.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of a command line switch, without leading "--", such as "enable-experimental-extension-apis".

parameters.name: result
parameters.description: Whether the switch is specified on the command line.

commands.description: Use the commands API to add keyboard shortcuts that trigger actions in your extension, for example, an action to open the browser action or send a command to the extension.

name.description: The name of the Extension Command

shortcut.description: The shortcut active for this command, or blank if not active.

events.name: onCommand
events.description: Fired when a registered command is activated using a keyboard shortcut.

functions.name: getAll
functions.description: Returns all the registered extension commands for this extension and their shortcut (if active). Before Chrome 110, this command did not return _execute_action.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Resolves with a list of the registered commands.

contentSettings.description: Use the chrome.contentSettings API to change settings that control whether websites can use features such as cookies, JavaScript, and plugins. More generally speaking, content settings allow you to customize Chrome's behavior on a per-site basis instead of globally.

id.description: The resource identifier for the given content type.

description.description: A human readable description of the resource.

types.description: The only content type using resource identifiers is $(ref:contentSettings.plugins). For more information, see Resource Identifiers.

The scope of the ContentSetting. One of
regular: setting for regular profile (which is inherited by the incognito profile if not overridden elsewhere),
incognito_session_only: setting for incognito profile that can only be set during an incognito session and is deleted when the incognito session ends (overrides regular settings).

functions.name: clear
functions.description: Clear all content setting rules set by this extension.

scope.description: Where to clear the setting (default: regular).

functions.name: get
functions.description: Gets the current content setting for a given pair of URLs.

primaryUrl.description: The primary URL for which the content setting should be retrieved. Note that the meaning of a primary URL depends on the content type.

secondaryUrl.description: The secondary URL for which the content setting should be retrieved. Defaults to the primary URL. Note that the meaning of a secondary URL depends on the content type, and not all content types use secondary URLs.

resourceIdentifier.description: A more specific identifier of the type of content for which the settings should be retrieved.

incognito.description: Whether to check the content settings for an incognito session. (default false)

setting.description: The content setting. See the description of the individual ContentSetting objects for the possible values.

functions.name: set
functions.description: Applies a new content setting rule.

primaryPattern.description: The pattern for the primary URL. For details on the format of a pattern, see Content Setting Patterns.

secondaryPattern.description: The pattern for the secondary URL. Defaults to matching all URLs. For details on the format of a pattern, see Content Setting Patterns.

resourceIdentifier.description: The resource identifier for the content type.

setting.description: The setting applied by this rule. See the description of the individual ContentSetting objects for the possible values.

scope.description: Where to set the setting (default: regular).

parameters.name: resourceIdentifiers
parameters.description: A list of resource identifiers for this content type, or <var>undefined</var> if this content type does not use resource identifiers.

autoVerify.description:
Whether to allow sites to use the Private State Tokens API. One of
allow: Allow sites to use the Private State Tokens API,
block: Block sites from using the Private State Tokens API.
Default is allow.
When calling set(), the primary URL pattern must be <all_urls>. The secondary URL is not used.

cookies.description:
Whether to allow cookies and other local data to be set by websites. One of
allow: Accept cookies,
block: Block cookies,
session_only: Accept cookies only for the current session.
Default is allow.
The primary URL is the URL representing the cookie origin. The secondary URL is the URL of the top-level frame.

images.description:
Whether to show images. One of
allow: Show images,
block: Don't show images.
Default is allow.
The primary URL is the URL of the top-level frame. The secondary URL is the URL of the image.

javascript.description:
Whether to run JavaScript. One of
allow: Run JavaScript,
block: Don't run JavaScript.
Default is allow.
The primary URL is the URL of the top-level frame. The secondary URL is not used.

location.description:
Whether to allow Geolocation. One of
allow: Allow sites to track your physical location,
block: Don't allow sites to track your physical location,
ask: Ask before allowing sites to track your physical location.
Default is ask.
The primary URL is the URL of the document which requested location data. The secondary URL is the URL of the top-level frame (which may or may not differ from the requesting URL).

plugins.description: Deprecated. With Flash support removed in Chrome 88, this permission no longer has any effect. Value is always block. Calls to set() and clear() will be ignored.

popups.description:
Whether to allow sites to show pop-ups. One of
allow: Allow sites to show pop-ups,
block: Don't allow sites to show pop-ups.
Default is block.
The primary URL is the URL of the top-level frame. The secondary URL is not used.

notifications.description:
Whether to allow sites to show desktop notifications. One of
allow: Allow sites to show desktop notifications,
block: Don't allow sites to show desktop notifications,
ask: Ask when a site wants to show desktop notifications.
Default is ask.
The primary URL is the URL of the document which wants to show the notification. The secondary URL is not used.

fullscreen.description: Deprecated. No longer has any effect. Fullscreen permission is now automatically granted for all sites. Value is always allow.

mouselock.description: Deprecated. No longer has any effect. Mouse lock permission is now automatically granted for all sites. Value is always allow.

microphone.description:
Whether to allow sites to access the microphone. One of
allow: Allow sites to access the microphone,
block: Don't allow sites to access the microphone,
ask: Ask when a site wants to access the microphone.
Default is ask.
The primary URL is the URL of the document which requested microphone access. The secondary URL is not used.
NOTE: The 'allow' setting is not valid if both patterns are '<all_urls>'.

clipboard.description:
Whether to allow sites to access the clipboard via advanced capabilities of the Async Clipboard API. "Advanced" capabilities include anything besides writing built-in formats after a user gesture, i.e. the ability to read, the ability to write custom formats, and the ability to write without a user gesture. One of
allow: Allow sites to use advanced clipboard capabilities,
block: Don't allow sites to use advanced clipboard capabilties,
ask: Ask when a site wants to use advanced clipboard capabilities.
Default is ask.
The primary URL is the URL of the document which requested clipboard access. The secondary URL is not used.

camera.description:
Whether to allow sites to access the camera. One of
allow: Allow sites to access the camera,
block: Don't allow sites to access the camera,
ask: Ask when a site wants to access the camera.
Default is ask.
The primary URL is the URL of the document which requested camera access. The secondary URL is not used.
NOTE: The 'allow' setting is not valid if both patterns are '<all_urls>'.

unsandboxedPlugins.description: Deprecated. Previously, controlled whether to allow sites to run plugins unsandboxed, however, with the Flash broker process removed in Chrome 88, this permission no longer has any effect. Value is always block. Calls to set() and clear() will be ignored.

automaticDownloads.description:
Whether to allow sites to download multiple files automatically. One of
allow: Allow sites to download multiple files automatically,
block: Don't allow sites to download multiple files automatically,
ask: Ask when a site wants to download files automatically after the first file.
Default is ask.
The primary URL is the URL of the top-level frame. The secondary URL is not used.

sound.description:
Whether to allow sites to play sound. One of
allow: Allow sites to play sound,
block: Don't allow sites to play sound.
Default is allow.
The primary URL is the URL of the document which wants to play sound. The secondary URL is not used.

contextMenus.description: Use the chrome.contextMenus API to add items to Google Chrome's context menu. You can choose what types of objects your context menu additions apply to, such as images, hyperlinks, and pages.

ACTION_MENU_TOP_LEVEL_LIMIT.description: The maximum number of top level extension items that can be added to an extension action context menu. Any items beyond this limit will be ignored.

types.description: The different contexts a menu can appear in. Specifying 'all' is equivalent to the combination of all other contexts except for 'launcher'. The 'launcher' context is only supported by apps and is used to add menu items to the context menu that appears when clicking the app icon in the launcher/taskbar/dock/etc. Different platforms might put limitations on what is actually supported in a launcher context menu.
The type of menu item.
Information sent when a context menu item is clicked.

menuItemId.description: The ID of the menu item that was clicked.

parentMenuItemId.description: The parent ID, if any, for the item clicked.

mediaType.description: One of 'image', 'video', or 'audio' if the context menu was activated on one of these types of elements.

linkUrl.description: If the element is a link, the URL it points to.

srcUrl.description: Will be present for elements with a 'src' URL.

pageUrl.description: The URL of the page where the menu item was clicked. This property is not set if the click occured in a context where there is no current page, such as in a launcher context menu.

frameUrl.description: The URL of the frame of the element where the context menu was clicked, if it was in a frame.

frameId.description: The ID of the frame of the element where the context menu was clicked, if it was in a frame.

selectionText.description: The text for the context selection, if any.

editable.description: A flag indicating whether the element is editable (text input, textarea, etc.).

wasChecked.description: A flag indicating the state of a checkbox or radio item before it was clicked.

checked.description: A flag indicating the state of a checkbox or radio item after it is clicked.

types.description: Properties of the new context menu item.

type.description: The type of menu item. Defaults to normal.

id.description: The unique ID to assign to this item. Mandatory for event pages. Cannot be the same as another ID for this extension.

title.description: The text to display in the item; this is required unless type is separator. When the context is selection, use %s within the string to show the selected text. For example, if this parameter's value is "Translate '%s' to Pig Latin" and the user selects the word "cool", the context menu item for the selection is "Translate 'cool' to Pig Latin".

checked.description: The initial state of a checkbox or radio button: true for selected, false for unselected. Only one radio button can be selected at a time in a given group.

contexts.description: List of contexts this menu item will appear in. Defaults to ['page'].

visible.description: Whether the item is visible in the menu.

onclick.description: A function that is called back when the menu item is clicked. This is not available inside of a service worker; instead, you should register a listener for $(ref:contextMenus.onClicked).

parameters.name: info
parameters.description: Information about the item clicked and the context where the click happened.

parameters.name: tab
parameters.description: The details of the tab where the click took place. This parameter is not present for platform apps.

parentId.description: The ID of a parent menu item; this makes the item a child of a previously added item.

documentUrlPatterns.description: Restricts the item to apply only to documents or frames whose URL matches one of the given patterns. For details on pattern formats, see Match Patterns.

targetUrlPatterns.description: Similar to documentUrlPatterns, filters based on the src attribute of img, audio, and video tags and the href attribute of a tags.

enabled.description: Whether this context menu item is enabled or disabled. Defaults to true.

functions.name: create
functions.description: Creates a new context menu item. If an error occurs during creation, it may not be detected until the creation callback fires; details will be in $(ref:runtime.lastError).

returns.description: The ID of the newly created item.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Called when the item has been created in the browser. If an error occurs during creation, details will be available in $(ref:runtime.lastError).

functions.name: update
functions.description: Updates a previously created context menu item.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the item to update.

parameters.name: updateProperties
parameters.description: The properties to update. Accepts the same values as the $(ref:contextMenus.create) function.

visible.description: Whether the item is visible in the menu.

parameters.name: tab
parameters.description: The details of the tab where the click took place. This parameter is not present for platform apps.

parentId.description: The ID of the item to be made this item's parent. Note: You cannot set an item to become a child of its own descendant.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Resolves when the context menu has been updated.

functions.name: remove
functions.description: Removes a context menu item.

parameters.name: menuItemId
parameters.description: The ID of the context menu item to remove.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Resolves when the context menu has been removed.

functions.name: removeAll
functions.description: Removes all context menu items added by this extension.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Resolves when removal is complete.

events.name: onClicked
events.description: Fired when a context menu item is clicked.

parameters.name: info
parameters.description: Information about the item clicked and the context where the click happened.

parameters.name: tab
parameters.description: The details of the tab where the click took place. If the click did not take place in a tab, this parameter will be missing.

cookies.description: Use the chrome.cookies API to query and modify cookies, and to be notified when they change.

types.description: A cookie's 'SameSite' state (https://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-west-first-party-cookies). 'no_restriction' corresponds to a cookie set with 'SameSite=None', 'lax' to 'SameSite=Lax', and 'strict' to 'SameSite=Strict'. 'unspecified' corresponds to a cookie set without the SameSite attribute.
Represents a partitioned cookie's partition key.

topLevelSite.description: The top-level site the partitioned cookie is available in.

hasCrossSiteAncestor.description: Indicates if the cookie was set in a cross-cross site context. This prevents a top-level site embedded in a cross-site context from accessing cookies set by the top-level site in a same-site context.

types.description: Represents information about an HTTP cookie.

name.description: The name of the cookie.

value.description: The value of the cookie.

hostOnly.description: True if the cookie is a host-only cookie (i.e. a request's host must exactly match the domain of the cookie).

secure.description: True if the cookie is marked as Secure (i.e. its scope is limited to secure channels, typically HTTPS).

httpOnly.description: True if the cookie is marked as HttpOnly (i.e. the cookie is inaccessible to client-side scripts).

sameSite.description: The cookie's same-site status (i.e. whether the cookie is sent with cross-site requests).

session.description: True if the cookie is a session cookie, as opposed to a persistent cookie with an expiration date.

expirationDate.description: The expiration date of the cookie as the number of seconds since the UNIX epoch. Not provided for session cookies.

storeId.description: The ID of the cookie store containing this cookie, as provided in getAllCookieStores().

partitionKey.description: The partition key for reading or modifying cookies with the Partitioned attribute.

types.description: Represents a cookie store in the browser. An incognito mode window, for instance, uses a separate cookie store from a non-incognito window.

id.description: The unique identifier for the cookie store.

tabIds.description: Identifiers of all the browser tabs that share this cookie store.

types.description: The underlying reason behind the cookie's change. If a cookie was inserted, or removed via an explicit call to "chrome.cookies.remove", "cause" will be "explicit". If a cookie was automatically removed due to expiry, "cause" will be "expired". If a cookie was removed due to being overwritten with an already-expired expiration date, "cause" will be set to "expired_overwrite".  If a cookie was automatically removed due to garbage collection, "cause" will be "evicted".  If a cookie was automatically removed due to a "set" call that overwrote it, "cause" will be "overwrite". Plan your response accordingly.
Details to identify the cookie.

url.description: The URL with which the cookie to access is associated. This argument may be a full URL, in which case any data following the URL path (e.g. the query string) is simply ignored. If host permissions for this URL are not specified in the manifest file, the API call will fail.

name.description: The name of the cookie to access.

storeId.description: The ID of the cookie store in which to look for the cookie. By default, the current execution context's cookie store will be used.

partitionKey.description: The partition key for reading or modifying cookies with the Partitioned attribute.

types.description: Details to identify the frame.

tabId.description: The unique identifier for the tab containing the frame.

frameId.description: The unique identifier for the frame within the tab.

documentId.description: The unique identifier for the document. If the frameId and/or tabId are provided they will be validated to match the document found by provided document ID.

functions.name: get
functions.description: Retrieves information about a single cookie. If more than one cookie of the same name exists for the given URL, the one with the longest path will be returned. For cookies with the same path length, the cookie with the earliest creation time will be returned.

parameters.name: cookie
parameters.description: Contains details about the cookie. This parameter is null if no such cookie was found.

functions.name: getAll
functions.description: Retrieves all cookies from a single cookie store that match the given information. The cookies returned will be sorted, with those with the longest path first. If multiple cookies have the same path length, those with the earliest creation time will be first. This method only retrieves cookies for domains that the extension has host permissions to.

parameters.name: details
parameters.description: Information to filter the cookies being retrieved.

url.description: Restricts the retrieved cookies to those that would match the given URL.

name.description: Filters the cookies by name.

domain.description: Restricts the retrieved cookies to those whose domains match or are subdomains of this one.

path.description: Restricts the retrieved cookies to those whose path exactly matches this string.

secure.description: Filters the cookies by their Secure property.

session.description: Filters out session vs. persistent cookies.

storeId.description: The cookie store to retrieve cookies from. If omitted, the current execution context's cookie store will be used.

partitionKey.description: The partition key for reading or modifying cookies with the Partitioned attribute.

parameters.name: cookies
parameters.description: All the existing, unexpired cookies that match the given cookie info.

functions.name: set
functions.description: Sets a cookie with the given cookie data; may overwrite equivalent cookies if they exist.

parameters.name: details
parameters.description: Details about the cookie being set.

url.description: The request-URI to associate with the setting of the cookie. This value can affect the default domain and path values of the created cookie. If host permissions for this URL are not specified in the manifest file, the API call will fail.

name.description: The name of the cookie. Empty by default if omitted.

value.description: The value of the cookie. Empty by default if omitted.

domain.description: The domain of the cookie. If omitted, the cookie becomes a host-only cookie.

path.description: The path of the cookie. Defaults to the path portion of the url parameter.

secure.description: Whether the cookie should be marked as Secure. Defaults to false.

httpOnly.description: Whether the cookie should be marked as HttpOnly. Defaults to false.

sameSite.description: The cookie's same-site status. Defaults to "unspecified", i.e., if omitted, the cookie is set without specifying a SameSite attribute.

expirationDate.description: The expiration date of the cookie as the number of seconds since the UNIX epoch. If omitted, the cookie becomes a session cookie.

storeId.description: The ID of the cookie store in which to set the cookie. By default, the cookie is set in the current execution context's cookie store.

partitionKey.description: The partition key for reading or modifying cookies with the Partitioned attribute.

parameters.name: cookie
parameters.description: Contains details about the cookie that's been set. If setting failed for any reason, the promise will be rejected.

functions.name: remove
functions.description: Deletes a cookie by name.

parameters.name: details
parameters.description: Contains details about the cookie that's been removed. If removal failed for any reason, the promise will be rejected.

url.description: The URL associated with the cookie that's been removed.

name.description: The name of the cookie that's been removed.

storeId.description: The ID of the cookie store from which the cookie was removed.

partitionKey.description: The partition key for reading or modifying cookies with the Partitioned attribute.

functions.name: getAllCookieStores
functions.description: Lists all existing cookie stores.

parameters.name: cookieStores
parameters.description: All the existing cookie stores.

functions.name: getPartitionKey
functions.description: The partition key for the frame indicated.

parameters.name: details
parameters.description: Contains details about the partition key that's been retrieved.

partitionKey.description: The partition key for reading or modifying cookies with the Partitioned attribute.

events.name: onChanged
events.description: Fired when a cookie is set or removed. As a special case, note that updating a cookie's properties is implemented as a two step process: the cookie to be updated is first removed entirely, generating a notification with "cause" of "overwrite" .  Afterwards, a new cookie is written with the updated values, generating a second notification with "cause" "explicit".

removed.description: True if a cookie was removed.

cookie.description: Information about the cookie that was set or removed.

cause.description: The underlying reason behind the cookie's change.

debugger.description: The chrome.debugger API serves as an alternate transport for Chrome's remote debugging protocol. Use chrome.debugger to attach to one or more tabs to instrument network interaction, debug JavaScript, mutate the DOM and CSS, and more. Use the $(ref:Debuggee) property tabId to target tabs with sendCommand and route events by tabId from onEvent callbacks.

types.description: Debuggee identifier. Either tabId, extensionId or targetId must be specified

tabId.description: The id of the tab which you intend to debug.

extensionId.description: The id of the extension which you intend to debug. Attaching to an extension background page is only possible when the --silent-debugger-extension-api command-line switch is used.

targetId.description: The opaque id of the debug target.

types.description: Debugger session identifier. One of tabId, extensionId or targetId must be specified. Additionally, an optional sessionId can be provided. If sessionId is specified for arguments sent from $(ref:onEvent), it means the event is coming from a child protocol session within the root debuggee session. If sessionId is specified when passed to $(ref:sendCommand), it targets a child protocol session within the root debuggee session.

tabId.description: The id of the tab which you intend to debug.

extensionId.description: The id of the extension which you intend to debug. Attaching to an extension background page is only possible when the --silent-debugger-extension-api command-line switch is used.

targetId.description: The opaque id of the debug target.

sessionId.description: The opaque id of the Chrome DevTools Protocol session. Identifies a child session within the root session identified by tabId, extensionId or targetId.

types.description: Target type.
Connection termination reason.
Debug target information

type.description: Target type.

id.description: Target id.

tabId.description: The tab id, defined if type == 'page'.

extensionId.description: The extension id, defined if type = 'background_page'.

attached.description: True if debugger is already attached.

title.description: Target page title.

url.description: Target URL.

functions.name: attach
functions.description: Attaches debugger to the given target.

parameters.name: target
parameters.description: Debugging target to which you want to attach.

parameters.name: requiredVersion
parameters.description: Required debugging protocol version ("0.1"). One can only attach to the debuggee with matching major version and greater or equal minor version. List of the protocol versions can be obtained here.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Resolves once the attach operation succeeds or fails. The promise resolves with no value. If the attach fails, the promise will be rejected.

functions.name: detach
functions.description: Detaches debugger from the given target.

parameters.name: target
parameters.description: Debugging target from which you want to detach.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Resolves once the detach operation succeeds or fails. The promise resolves with no value. If the detach fails, the promise will be rejected.

functions.name: sendCommand
functions.description: Sends given command to the debugging target.

parameters.name: target
parameters.description: Debugging target to which you want to send the command.

parameters.name: method
parameters.description: Method name. Should be one of the methods defined by the remote debugging protocol.

parameters.name: commandParams
parameters.description: JSON object with request parameters. This object must conform to the remote debugging params scheme for given method.

returns_async.name: callback

parameters.name: result
parameters.description: JSON object with the response. Structure of the response varies depending on the method name and is defined by the 'returns' attribute of the command description in the remote debugging protocol.

returns_async.description: Response body. If an error occurs while posting the message, the promise will be rejected.

functions.name: getTargets
functions.description: Returns the list of available debug targets.

parameters.name: result
parameters.description: Array of TargetInfo objects corresponding to the available debug targets.

events.name: onEvent
events.description: Fired whenever debugging target issues instrumentation event.

parameters.name: source
parameters.description: The debugger session that generated this event.

parameters.name: method
parameters.description: Method name. Should be one of the notifications defined by the remote debugging protocol.

parameters.name: params
parameters.description: JSON object with the parameters. Structure of the parameters varies depending on the method name and is defined by the 'parameters' attribute of the event description in the remote debugging protocol.

events.name: onDetach
events.description: Fired when browser terminates debugging session for the tab. This happens when either the tab is being closed or Chrome DevTools is being invoked for the attached tab.

parameters.name: source
parameters.description: The debuggee that was detached.

parameters.name: reason
parameters.description: Connection termination reason.

declarativeContent.description: Use the chrome.declarativeContent API to take actions depending on the content of a page, without requiring permission to read the page's content.

types.description: See https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ImageData.
Matches the state of a web page based on various criteria.

pageUrl.description: Matches if the conditions of the UrlFilter are fulfilled for the top-level URL of the page.

css.description: Matches if all of the CSS selectors in the array match displayed elements in a frame with the same origin as the page's main frame. All selectors in this array must be compound selectors to speed up matching. Note: Listing hundreds of CSS selectors or listing CSS selectors that match hundreds of times per page can slow down web sites.

isBookmarked.description: Matches if the bookmarked state of the page is equal to the specified value. Requres the bookmarks permission.

types.description:
A declarative event action that sets the extension's $(ref:pageAction page action) to an enabled state while the corresponding conditions are met. This action can be used without host permissions, but the extension must have a page action. If the extension has the activeTab permission, clicking the page action grants access to the active tab.

On pages where the conditions are not met the extension's toolbar action will be grey-scale, and clicking it will open the context menu, instead of triggering the action.

A declarative event action that sets the extension's toolbar $(ref:action action) to an enabled state while the corresponding conditions are met. This action can be used without host permissions. If the extension has the activeTab permission, clicking the page action grants access to the active tab.

On pages where the conditions are not met the extension's toolbar action will be grey-scale, and clicking it will open the context menu, instead of triggering the action.

Declarative event action that sets the n-dip square icon for the extension's $(ref:pageAction page action) or $(ref:browserAction browser action) while the corresponding conditions are met. This action can be used without host permissions, but the extension must have a page or browser action.

Exactly one of imageData or path must be specified. Both are dictionaries mapping a number of pixels to an image representation. The image representation in imageData is an ImageData object; for example, from a canvas element, while the image representation in path is the path to an image file relative to the extension's manifest. If scale screen pixels fit into a device-independent pixel, the scale * n icon is used. If that scale is missing, another image is resized to the required size.

imageData.description: Either an ImageData object or a dictionary {size -> ImageData} representing an icon to be set. If the icon is specified as a dictionary, the image used is chosen depending on the screen's pixel density. If the number of image pixels that fit into one screen space unit equals scale, then an image with size scale * n is selected, where n is the size of the icon in the UI. At least one image must be specified. Note that details.imageData = foo is equivalent to details.imageData = {'16': foo}.

types.description:
Declarative event action that injects a content script.

WARNING: This action is still experimental and is not supported on stable builds of Chrome.

css.description: Names of CSS files to be injected as a part of the content script.

js.description: Names of JavaScript files to be injected as a part of the content script.

allFrames.description: Whether the content script runs in all frames of the matching page, or in only the top frame. Default is false.

matchAboutBlank.description: Whether to insert the content script on about:blank and about:srcdoc. Default is false.

desktopCapture.description: The Desktop Capture API captures the content of the screen, individual windows, or individual tabs.

types.description: Enum used to define set of desktop media sources used in chooseDesktopMedia().
Mirrors SystemAudioPreferenceEnum.
Mirrors WindowAudioPreferenceEnum.
Mirrors SelfCapturePreferenceEnum.

functions.name: chooseDesktopMedia
functions.description: Shows desktop media picker UI with the specified set of sources.

parameters.name: sources
parameters.description: Set of sources that should be shown to the user. The sources order in the set decides the tab order in the picker.

parameters.name: targetTab
parameters.description: Optional tab for which the stream is created. If not specified then the resulting stream can be used only by the calling extension. The stream can only be used by frames in the given tab whose security origin matches tab.url. The tab's origin must be a secure origin, e.g. HTTPS.

parameters.name: options

suppressLocalAudioPlaybackIntended.description: Indicates that the caller intends to perform local audio suppression, and that the media picker shown to the user should therefore reflect that with the appropriate warnings, as it does when getDisplayMedia() is invoked.

parameters.description: Mirrors members of DisplayMediaStreamConstraints which need to be applied before the user makes their selection, and must therefore be provided to chooseDesktopMedia() rather than be deferred to getUserMedia().

returns_async.name: callback

parameters.name: streamId
parameters.description: An opaque string that can be passed to getUserMedia() API to generate media stream that corresponds to the source selected by the user. If user didn't select any source (i.e. canceled the prompt) then the callback is called with an empty streamId. The created streamId can be used only once and expires after a few seconds when it is not used.

parameters.name: options
parameters.description: Contains properties that describe the stream.

canRequestAudioTrack.description: True if "audio" is included in parameter sources, and the end user does not uncheck the "Share audio" checkbox. Otherwise false, and in this case, one should not ask for audio stream through getUserMedia call.

returns_async.does_not_support_promises: Synchronous return and callback crbug.com/1143032, Multi-parameter callback crbug.com/1313625

returns.description: An id that can be passed to cancelChooseDesktopMedia() in case the prompt need to be canceled.

functions.name: cancelChooseDesktopMedia
functions.description: Hides desktop media picker dialog shown by chooseDesktopMedia().

parameters.name: desktopMediaRequestId
parameters.description: Id returned by chooseDesktopMedia()

dom.description: Use the chrome.dom API to access special DOM APIs for Extensions

functions.name: openOrClosedShadowRoot
functions.description: Gets the open shadow root or the closed shadow root hosted by the specified element. If the element doesn't attach the shadow root, it will return null.

returns.name: shadowRoot
returns.description: See https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ShadowRoot

functions.name: setOfferInfo
functions.description: Sets the offer info in Local State.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The service id of the echo offer.

parameters.name: offerInfo
parameters.description: The offer info.

functions.name: getOfferInfo
functions.description: Check in Local State for the offer info.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The service id of the offer eligibility check.

parameters.name: result
parameters.description: The returned offer info. If the offer info is not available, api will raise error.

functions.name: getRegistrationCode
functions.description: Get the group or coupon code from underlying storage.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Type of coupon code requested to be read (coupon or group).

parameters.name: result
parameters.description: The coupon code.

functions.name: getOobeTimestamp
functions.description: Get the OOBE timestamp.

parameters.name: result
parameters.description: The OOBE timestamp.

functions.name: getUserConsent
functions.description: If device policy allows user to redeem offer, displays a native dialog asking user for a consent to verify device's eligibility for the offer. If the device policy forbids user to redeem offers, displays a native dialog informing user the offer redeeming is disabled.

parameters.name: consentRequester
parameters.description: Information about the service requesting user consent.

serviceName.description: User friendly name of the service that is requesting the consent.

origin.description: URL origin of the service requesting the consent.

tabId.description: The ID of the tab from which the user consent was requested. The tab ID is used to determine with which tab to associate the user consent request dialog. If the user consent was requested from an app window, the tab ID should not be set.

parameters.name: result
parameters.description: Whether the user consent was given.

functions.name: challengeMachineKey
functions.description: Challenge a machine key.

parameters.name: challenge
parameters.description: Challenge to be signed in base64.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Resolves with the response.

parameters.name: response
parameters.description: Response in base64.

functions.name: challengeUserKey
functions.description: Challenge an user key.

parameters.name: challenge
parameters.description: Challenge to be signed in base64.

parameters.name: registerKey
parameters.description: If true, the key will be registered.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Resolves with the response.

parameters.name: response
parameters.description: Response in base64.

extension.description: The chrome.extension API has utilities that can be used by any extension page. It includes support for exchanging messages between an extension and its content scripts or between extensions, as described in detail in Message Passing.

lastError.description: Set for the lifetime of a callback if an ansychronous extension api has resulted in an error. If no error has occured lastError will be <var>undefined</var>.

message.description: Description of the error that has taken place.

inIncognitoContext.description: True for content scripts running inside incognito tabs, and for extension pages running inside an incognito process. The latter only applies to extensions with 'split' incognito_behavior.

types.description: The type of extension view.

functions.name: sendRequest
functions.description: Sends a single request to other listeners within the extension. Similar to $(ref:runtime.connect), but only sends a single request with an optional response. The $(ref:extension.onRequest) event is fired in each page of the extension.

parameters.name: extensionId
parameters.description: The extension ID of the extension you want to connect to. If omitted, default is your own extension.

parameters.name: response
parameters.description: The JSON response object sent by the handler of the request. If an error occurs while connecting to the extension, the promise will be rejected.

functions.name: getURL
functions.description: Converts a relative path within an extension install directory to a fully-qualified URL.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: A path to a resource within an extension expressed relative to its install directory.

returns.description: The fully-qualified URL to the resource.

functions.name: getViews
functions.description: Returns an array of the JavaScript 'window' objects for each of the pages running inside the current extension.

type.description: The type of view to get. If omitted, returns all views (including background pages and tabs).

windowId.description: The window to restrict the search to. If omitted, returns all views.

tabId.description: Find a view according to a tab id. If this field is omitted, returns all views.

returns.description: Array of global objects

functions.name: getBackgroundPage
functions.description: Returns the JavaScript 'window' object for the background page running inside the current extension. Returns null if the extension has no background page.

functions.name: getExtensionTabs
functions.description: Returns an array of the JavaScript 'window' objects for each of the tabs running inside the current extension. If windowId is specified, returns only the 'window' objects of tabs attached to the specified window.

returns.description: Array of global window objects

functions.name: isAllowedIncognitoAccess
functions.description: Retrieves the state of the extension's access to Incognito-mode. This corresponds to the user-controlled per-extension 'Allowed in Incognito' setting accessible via the chrome://extensions page.

parameters.name: isAllowedAccess
parameters.description: True if the extension has access to Incognito mode, false otherwise.

functions.name: isAllowedFileSchemeAccess
functions.description: Retrieves the state of the extension's access to the 'file://' scheme. This corresponds to the user-controlled per-extension 'Allow access to File URLs' setting accessible via the chrome://extensions page.

parameters.name: isAllowedAccess
parameters.description: True if the extension can access the 'file://' scheme, false otherwise.

functions.name: setUpdateUrlData
functions.description: Sets the value of the ap CGI parameter used in the extension's update URL.  This value is ignored for extensions that are hosted in the Chrome Extension Gallery.

events.name: onRequest
events.description: Fired when a request is sent from either an extension process or a content script.

parameters.name: request
parameters.description: The request sent by the calling script.

parameters.name: sendResponse
parameters.description: Function to call (at most once) when you have a response. The argument should be any JSON-ifiable object, or undefined if there is no response. If you have more than one onRequest listener in the same document, then only one may send a response.

events.name: onRequestExternal
events.description: Fired when a request is sent from another extension.

parameters.name: request
parameters.description: The request sent by the calling script.

parameters.name: sendResponse
parameters.description: Function to call when you have a response. The argument should be any JSON-ifiable object, or undefined if there is no response.

fileBrowserHandler.description: Use the chrome.fileBrowserHandler API to extend the Chrome OS file browser. For example, you can use this API to enable users to upload files to your website.

types.description: Event details payload for fileBrowserHandler.onExecute event.

entries.description: Array of Entry instances representing files that are targets of this action (selected in ChromeOS file browser).

tab_id.description: The ID of the tab that raised this event. Tab IDs are unique within a browser session.

events.name: onExecute
events.description: Fired when file system action is executed from ChromeOS file browser.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: File browser action id as specified in the listener component's manifest.

parameters.name: details
parameters.description: File handler execute event details.

fontSettings.description: Use the chrome.fontSettings API to manage Chrome's font settings.

types.description: Represents a font name.

displayName.description: The display name of the font.

types.description: An ISO 15924 script code. The default, or global, script is represented by script code "Zyyy".
A CSS generic font family.

One of
not_controllable: cannot be controlled by any extension
controlled_by_other_extensions: controlled by extensions with higher precedence
controllable_by_this_extension: can be controlled by this extension
controlled_by_this_extension: controlled by this extension

functions.name: clearFont
functions.description: Clears the font set by this extension, if any.

script.description: The script for which the font should be cleared. If omitted, the global script font setting is cleared.

genericFamily.description: The generic font family for which the font should be cleared.

functions.name: getFont
functions.description: Gets the font for a given script and generic font family.

script.description: The script for which the font should be retrieved. If omitted, the font setting for the global script (script code "Zyyy") is retrieved.

genericFamily.description: The generic font family for which the font should be retrieved.

fontId.description: The font ID. Rather than the literal font ID preference value, this may be the ID of the font that the system resolves the preference value to. So, fontId can differ from the font passed to setFont, if, for example, the font is not available on the system. The empty string signifies fallback to the global script font setting.

levelOfControl.description: The level of control this extension has over the setting.

functions.name: setFont
functions.description: Sets the font for a given script and generic font family.

script.description: The script code which the font should be set. If omitted, the font setting for the global script (script code "Zyyy") is set.

genericFamily.description: The generic font family for which the font should be set.

fontId.description: The font ID. The empty string means to fallback to the global script font setting.

functions.name: getFontList
functions.description: Gets a list of fonts on the system.

functions.name: clearDefaultFontSize
functions.description: Clears the default font size set by this extension, if any.

parameters.name: details
parameters.description: This parameter is currently unused.

functions.name: getDefaultFontSize
functions.description: Gets the default font size.

parameters.name: details
parameters.description: This parameter is currently unused.

levelOfControl.description: The level of control this extension has over the setting.

functions.name: setDefaultFontSize
functions.description: Sets the default font size.

functions.name: clearDefaultFixedFontSize
functions.description: Clears the default fixed font size set by this extension, if any.

parameters.name: details
parameters.description: This parameter is currently unused.

functions.name: getDefaultFixedFontSize
functions.description: Gets the default size for fixed width fonts.

parameters.name: details
parameters.description: This parameter is currently unused.

levelOfControl.description: The level of control this extension has over the setting.

functions.name: setDefaultFixedFontSize
functions.description: Sets the default size for fixed width fonts.

functions.name: clearMinimumFontSize
functions.description: Clears the minimum font size set by this extension, if any.

parameters.name: details
parameters.description: This parameter is currently unused.

functions.name: getMinimumFontSize
functions.description: Gets the minimum font size.

parameters.name: details
parameters.description: This parameter is currently unused.

levelOfControl.description: The level of control this extension has over the setting.

functions.name: setMinimumFontSize
functions.description: Sets the minimum font size.

events.name: onFontChanged
events.description: Fired when a font setting changes.

fontId.description: The font ID. See the description in getFont.

script.description: The script code for which the font setting has changed.

genericFamily.description: The generic font family for which the font setting has changed.

levelOfControl.description: The level of control this extension has over the setting.

events.name: onDefaultFontSizeChanged
events.description: Fired when the default font size setting changes.

levelOfControl.description: The level of control this extension has over the setting.

events.name: onDefaultFixedFontSizeChanged
events.description: Fired when the default fixed font size setting changes.

levelOfControl.description: The level of control this extension has over the setting.

events.name: onMinimumFontSizeChanged
events.description: Fired when the minimum font size setting changes.

levelOfControl.description: The level of control this extension has over the setting.

gcm.description: Use chrome.gcm to enable apps and extensions to send and receive messages through Firebase Cloud Messaging (FCM).

MAX_MESSAGE_SIZE.description: The maximum size (in bytes) of all key/value pairs in a message.

functions.name: register
functions.description: Registers the application with FCM. The registration ID will be returned by the callback. If register is called again with the same list of senderIds, the same registration ID will be returned.

parameters.name: senderIds
parameters.description: A list of server IDs that are allowed to send messages to the application. It should contain at least one and no more than 100 sender IDs.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Resolves when registration completes.

parameters.name: registrationId
parameters.description: A registration ID assigned to the application by the FCM.

functions.name: unregister
functions.description: Unregisters the application from FCM.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Resolves after the unregistration completes. Unregistration was successful if the promise does not reject.

functions.name: send
functions.description: Sends a message according to its contents.

parameters.name: message
parameters.description: A message to send to the other party via FCM.

destinationId.description: The ID of the server to send the message to as assigned by Google API Console.

messageId.description: The ID of the message. It must be unique for each message in scope of the applications. See the Cloud Messaging documentation for advice for picking and handling an ID.

timeToLive.description: Time-to-live of the message in seconds. If it is not possible to send the message within that time, an onSendError event will be raised. A time-to-live of 0 indicates that the message should be sent immediately or fail if it's not possible. The default value of time-to-live is 86,400 seconds (1 day) and the maximum value is 2,419,200 seconds (28 days).

data.description: Message data to send to the server. Case-insensitive goog. and google, as well as case-sensitive collapse_key are disallowed as key prefixes. Sum of all key/value pairs should not exceed $(ref:gcm.MAX_MESSAGE_SIZE).

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Resolves after the message is successfully queued for sending. If an error occurs, the promise will be rejected.

parameters.name: messageId
parameters.description: The ID of the message that the callback was issued for.

events.name: onMessage
events.description: Fired when a message is received through FCM.

parameters.name: message
parameters.description: A message received from another party via FCM.

from.description: The sender who issued the message.

collapseKey.description: The collapse key of a message. See the Non-collapsible and collapsible messages for details.

events.name: onMessagesDeleted
events.description: Fired when a FCM server had to delete messages sent by an app server to the application. See Lifetime of a message for details on handling this event.

events.name: onSendError
events.description: Fired when it was not possible to send a message to the FCM server.

parameters.name: error

errorMessage.description: The error message describing the problem.

messageId.description: The ID of the message with this error, if error is related to a specific message.

details.description: Additional details related to the error, when available.

parameters.description: An error that occured while trying to send the message either in Chrome or on the FCM server. Application can retry sending the message with a reasonable backoff and possibly longer time-to-live.

history.description: Use the chrome.history API to interact with the browser's record of visited pages. You can add, remove, and query for URLs in the browser's history. To override the history page with your own version, see Override Pages.

enum.name: link
enum.description: The user arrived at this page by clicking a link on another page.

enum.name: typed
enum.description: The user arrived at this page by typing the URL in the address bar. This is also used for other explicit navigation actions.

enum.name: auto_bookmark
enum.description: The user arrived at this page through a suggestion in the UI, for example, through a menu item.

enum.name: auto_subframe
enum.description: The user arrived at this page through subframe navigation that they didn't request, such as through an ad loading in a frame on the previous page. These don't always generate new navigation entries in the back and forward menus.

enum.name: manual_subframe
enum.description: The user arrived at this page by selecting something in a subframe.

enum.name: generated
enum.description: The user arrived at this page by typing in the address bar and selecting an entry that didn't look like a URL, such as a Google Search suggestion. For example, a match might have the URL of a Google Search result page, but it might appear to the user as "Search Google for ...". These are different from typed navigations because the user didn't type or see the destination URL. They're also related to keyword navigations.

enum.name: auto_toplevel
enum.description: The page was specified in the command line or is the start page.

enum.name: form_submit
enum.description: The user arrived at this page by filling out values in a form and submitting the form. Not all form submissions use this transition type.

enum.name: reload
enum.description: The user reloaded the page, either by clicking the reload button or by pressing Enter in the address bar. Session restore and Reopen closed tab also use this transition type.

enum.name: keyword
enum.description: The URL for this page was generated from a replaceable keyword other than the default search provider.

enum.name: keyword_generated
enum.description: Corresponds to a visit generated for a keyword.

types.description: The transition type for this visit from its referrer.
An object encapsulating one result of a history query.

id.description: The unique identifier for the item.

url.description: The URL navigated to by a user.

title.description: The title of the page when it was last loaded.

lastVisitTime.description: When this page was last loaded, represented in milliseconds since the epoch.

visitCount.description: The number of times the user has navigated to this page.

typedCount.description: The number of times the user has navigated to this page by typing in the address.

types.description: An object encapsulating one visit to a URL.

id.description: The unique identifier for the corresponding $(ref:history.HistoryItem).

visitId.description: The unique identifier for this visit.

visitTime.description: When this visit occurred, represented in milliseconds since the epoch.

referringVisitId.description: The visit ID of the referrer.

transition.description: The transition type for this visit from its referrer.

isLocal.description: True if the visit originated on this device. False if it was synced from a different device.

url.description: The URL for the operation. It must be in the format as returned from a call to history.search().

functions.name: search
functions.description: Searches the history for the last visit time of each page matching the query.

text.description: A free-text query to the history service. Leave this empty to retrieve all pages.

startTime.description: Limit results to those visited after this date, represented in milliseconds since the epoch. If property is not specified, it will default to 24 hours.

endTime.description: Limit results to those visited before this date, represented in milliseconds since the epoch.

maxResults.description: The maximum number of results to retrieve. Defaults to 100.

functions.name: getVisits
functions.description: Retrieves information about visits to a URL.

functions.name: addUrl
functions.description: Adds a URL to the history at the current time with a transition type of "link".

functions.name: deleteUrl
functions.description: Removes all occurrences of the given URL from the history.

functions.name: deleteRange
functions.description: Removes all items within the specified date range from the history. Pages will not be removed from the history unless all visits fall within the range.

startTime.description: Items added to history after this date, represented in milliseconds since the epoch.

endTime.description: Items added to history before this date, represented in milliseconds since the epoch.

functions.name: deleteAll
functions.description: Deletes all items from the history.

events.name: onVisited
events.description: Fired when a URL is visited, providing the HistoryItem data for that URL. This event fires before the page has loaded.

events.name: onVisitRemoved
events.description: Fired when one or more URLs are removed from history. When all visits have been removed the URL is purged from history.

allHistory.description: True if all history was removed. If true, then urls will be empty.

input.ime.description: Use the chrome.input.ime API to implement a custom IME for Chrome OS. This allows your extension to handle keystrokes, set the composition, and manage the candidate window.

types.description: See http://www.w3.org/TR/DOM-Level-3-Events/#events-KeyboardEvent

type.description: One of keyup or keydown.

requestId.description: (Deprecated) The ID of the request. Use the requestId param from the onKeyEvent event instead.

extensionId.description: The extension ID of the sender of this keyevent.

key.description: Value of the key being pressed

code.description: Value of the physical key being pressed. The value is not affected by current keyboard layout or modifier state.

keyCode.description: The deprecated HTML keyCode, which is system- and implementation-dependent numerical code signifying the unmodified identifier associated with the key pressed.

altKey.description: Whether or not the ALT key is pressed.

altgrKey.description: Whether or not the ALTGR key is pressed.

ctrlKey.description: Whether or not the CTRL key is pressed.

shiftKey.description: Whether or not the SHIFT key is pressed.

capsLock.description: Whether or not the CAPS_LOCK is enabled.

types.description: Type of value this text field edits, (Text, Number, URL, etc)
The auto-capitalize type of the text field.
Describes an input Context

contextID.description: This is used to specify targets of text field operations.  This ID becomes invalid as soon as onBlur is called.

type.description: Type of value this text field edits, (Text, Number, URL, etc)

autoCorrect.description: Whether the text field wants auto-correct.

autoComplete.description: Whether the text field wants auto-complete.

autoCapitalize.description: The auto-capitalize type of the text field.

spellCheck.description: Whether the text field wants spell-check.

shouldDoLearning.description: Whether text entered into the text field should be used to improve typing suggestions for the user.

types.description: The type of menu item. Radio buttons between separators are considered grouped.
A menu item used by an input method to interact with the user from the language menu.

id.description: String that will be passed to callbacks referencing this MenuItem.

label.description: Text displayed in the menu for this item.

checked.description: Indicates this item should be drawn with a check.

types.description: The type of the underline to modify this segment.
Where to display the candidate window. If set to 'cursor', the window follows the cursor. If set to 'composition', the window is locked to the beginning of the composition.
The screen type under which the IME is activated.
Which mouse buttons was clicked.
Type of assistive window.
Properties of the assistive window.

visible.description: Sets true to show AssistiveWindow, sets false to hide.

types.description: ID of buttons in assistive window.

engineID.description: ID of the engine to use.

items.description: MenuItems to add or update. They will be added in the order they exist in the array.

functions.name: setComposition
functions.description: Set the current composition. If this extension does not own the active IME, this fails.

contextID.description: ID of the context where the composition text will be set

selectionStart.description: Position in the text that the selection starts at.

selectionEnd.description: Position in the text that the selection ends at.

cursor.description: Position in the text of the cursor.

segments.description: List of segments and their associated types.

start.description: Index of the character to start this segment at

end.description: Index of the character to end this segment after.

style.description: The type of the underline to modify this segment.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Resolves when the operation completes with a boolean indicating if the text was accepted or not. On failure, the promise will be rejected.

functions.name: clearComposition
functions.description: Clear the current composition. If this extension does not own the active IME, this fails.

contextID.description: ID of the context where the composition will be cleared

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Resolves when the operation completes with a boolean indicating if the text was accepted or not. On failure, the promise will be rejected.

functions.name: commitText
functions.description: Commits the provided text to the current input.

contextID.description: ID of the context where the text will be committed

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Resolves when the operation completes with a boolean indicating if the text was accepted or not. On failure, the promise will be rejected.

functions.name: sendKeyEvents
functions.description: Sends the key events.  This function is expected to be used by virtual keyboards.  When key(s) on a virtual keyboard is pressed by a user, this function is used to propagate that event to the system.

contextID.description: ID of the context where the key events will be sent, or zero to send key events to non-input field.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Resolves when the operation completes.

functions.name: hideInputView
functions.description: Hides the input view window, which is popped up automatically by system. If the input view window is already hidden, this function will do nothing.

functions.name: setCandidateWindowProperties
functions.description: Sets the properties of the candidate window. This fails if the extension doesn't own the active IME

engineID.description: ID of the engine to set properties on.

visible.description: True to show the Candidate window, false to hide it.

cursorVisible.description: True to show the cursor, false to hide it.

vertical.description: True if the candidate window should be rendered vertical, false to make it horizontal.

pageSize.description: The number of candidates to display per page.

auxiliaryText.description: Text that is shown at the bottom of the candidate window.

auxiliaryTextVisible.description: True to display the auxiliary text, false to hide it.

totalCandidates.description: The total number of candidates for the candidate window.

currentCandidateIndex.description: The index of the current chosen candidate out of total candidates.

windowPosition.description: Where to display the candidate window.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Resolves when the operation completes.

functions.name: setCandidates
functions.description: Sets the current candidate list. This fails if this extension doesn't own the active IME

contextID.description: ID of the context that owns the candidate window.

candidates.description: List of candidates to show in the candidate window

id.description: The candidate's id

parentId.description: The id to add these candidates under

label.description: Short string displayed to next to the candidate, often the shortcut key or index

usage.description: The usage or detail description of word.

title.description: The title string of details description.

body.description: The body string of detail description.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Resolves when the operation completes.

functions.name: setCursorPosition
functions.description: Set the position of the cursor in the candidate window. This is a no-op if this extension does not own the active IME.

contextID.description: ID of the context that owns the candidate window.

candidateID.description: ID of the candidate to select.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Resolves when the operation completes

functions.name: setAssistiveWindowProperties
functions.description: Shows/Hides an assistive window with the given properties.

contextID.description: ID of the context owning the assistive window.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Resolves when the operation completes.

functions.name: setAssistiveWindowButtonHighlighted
functions.description: Highlights/Unhighlights a button in an assistive window.

contextID.description: ID of the context owning the assistive window.

windowType.description: The window type the button belongs to.

announceString.description: The text for the screenreader to announce.

highlighted.description: Whether the button should be highlighted.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Resolves when the operation completes. On failure, the promise will be rejected.

functions.name: setMenuItems
functions.description: Adds the provided menu items to the language menu when this IME is active.

functions.name: updateMenuItems
functions.description: Updates the state of the MenuItems specified

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Resolves when the operation completes

functions.name: deleteSurroundingText
functions.description: Deletes the text around the caret.

engineID.description: ID of the engine receiving the event.

contextID.description: ID of the context where the surrounding text will be deleted.

offset.description: The offset from the caret position where deletion will start. This value can be negative.

length.description: The number of characters to be deleted

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Resolves when the operation completes.

functions.name: keyEventHandled
functions.description: Indicates that the key event received by onKeyEvent is handled.  This should only be called if the onKeyEvent listener is asynchronous.

parameters.name: requestId
parameters.description: Request id of the event that was handled.  This should come from keyEvent.requestId

parameters.name: response
parameters.description: True if the keystroke was handled, false if not

events.name: onActivate
events.description: This event is sent when an IME is activated. It signals that the IME will be receiving onKeyPress events.

parameters.name: engineID
parameters.description: ID of the engine receiving the event

parameters.name: screen
parameters.description: The screen type under which the IME is activated.

events.name: onDeactivated
events.description: This event is sent when an IME is deactivated. It signals that the IME will no longer be receiving onKeyPress events.

parameters.name: engineID
parameters.description: ID of the engine receiving the event

events.name: onFocus
events.description: This event is sent when focus enters a text box. It is sent to all extensions that are listening to this event, and enabled by the user.

parameters.name: context
parameters.description: Describes the text field that has acquired focus.

events.name: onBlur
events.description: This event is sent when focus leaves a text box. It is sent to all extensions that are listening to this event, and enabled by the user.

parameters.name: contextID
parameters.description: The ID of the text field that has lost focus. The ID is invalid after this call

events.name: onInputContextUpdate
events.description: This event is sent when the properties of the current InputContext change, such as the the type. It is sent to all extensions that are listening to this event, and enabled by the user.

parameters.name: context
parameters.description: An InputContext object describing the text field that has changed.

events.name: onKeyEvent
events.description: Fired when a key event is sent from the operating system. The event will be sent to the extension if this extension owns the active IME. The listener function should return true if the event was handled false if it was not.  If the event will be evaluated asynchronously, this function must return undefined and the IME must later call keyEventHandled() with the result.

parameters.name: engineID
parameters.description: ID of the engine receiving the event

parameters.name: keyData
parameters.description: Data on the key event

parameters.name: requestId
parameters.description: ID of the request. If the event listener returns undefined, then keyEventHandled must be called later with this requestId.

returns.description: True if the keystroke was handled, false if not. Or returns undefined if the extension decides to call keyEventHandled explicitly.

events.name: onCandidateClicked
events.description: This event is sent if this extension owns the active IME.

parameters.name: engineID
parameters.description: ID of the engine receiving the event

parameters.name: candidateID
parameters.description: ID of the candidate that was clicked.

parameters.name: button
parameters.description: Which mouse buttons was clicked.

events.name: onMenuItemActivated
events.description: Called when the user selects a menu item

parameters.name: engineID
parameters.description: ID of the engine receiving the event

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the MenuItem which was activated

events.name: onSurroundingTextChanged
events.description: Called when the editable string around caret is changed or when the caret position is moved. The text length is limited to 100 characters for each back and forth direction.

parameters.name: engineID
parameters.description: ID of the engine receiving the event

parameters.name: surroundingInfo
parameters.description: The surrounding information.

text.description: The text around the cursor. This is only a subset of all text in the input field.

focus.description: The ending position of the selection. This value indicates caret position if there is no selection.

anchor.description: The beginning position of the selection. This value indicates caret position if there is no selection.

offset.description: The offset position of text. Since text only includes a subset of text around the cursor, offset indicates the absolute position of the first character of text.

events.name: onReset
events.description: This event is sent when chrome terminates ongoing text input session.

parameters.name: engineID
parameters.description: ID of the engine receiving the event

events.name: onAssistiveWindowButtonClicked
events.description: This event is sent when a button in an assistive window is clicked.

buttonID.description: The ID of the button clicked.

windowType.description: The type of the assistive window.

types.description: The type of menu item. Radio buttons between separators are considered grouped.
A menu item used by an input method to interact with the user from the language menu.

id.description: String that will be passed to callbacks referencing this MenuItem.

label.description: Text displayed in the menu for this item.

checked.description: Indicates this item should be drawn with a check.

types.description: The type of the underline to modify a composition segment.
Describes how the text field was focused
Type of keyboard to show for this text field, (Text, Number, URL, etc) set by mode property of input tag
Type of value this text field edits, (Text, Number, URL, etc)
The auto-capitalize type of the text field.
The aggregated status of all language packs for a given input method.
Object returned by callbacks when the status of language packs change.

engineIds.description: All engine IDs for which this language pack status change applies to.

types.description: Describes an input Context

contextID.description: This is used to specify targets of text field operations.  This ID becomes invalid as soon as onBlur is called.

type.description: Type of value this text field edits, (Text, Number, URL, etc)

mode.description: Type of keyboard to show for this field (Text, Number, URL, etc)

autoCorrect.description: Whether the text field wants auto-correct.

autoComplete.description: Whether the text field wants auto-complete.

autoCapitalize.description: The auto-capitalize type of the text field.

spellCheck.description: Whether the text field wants spell-check.

shouldDoLearning.description: Whether text entered into the text field should be used to improve typing suggestions for the user.

focusReason.description: How the text field was focused

appKey.description: Key of the app associated with this text field if any.

types.description: Japanese IME: input mode. Enum values MUST match CrOS Settings @ https://crsrc.org/c/chrome/browser/resources/ash/settings/os_languages_page/input_method_prefs_consts.ts
Japanese IME: punctuation style. Enum values MUST match CrOS Settings @ https://crsrc.org/c/chrome/browser/resources/ash/settings/os_languages_page/input_method_prefs_consts.ts
Japanese IME: symbol style. Enum values MUST match CrOS Settings @ https://crsrc.org/c/chrome/browser/resources/ash/settings/os_languages_page/input_method_prefs_consts.ts
Japanese IME: space input style. Enum values MUST match CrOS Settings @ https://crsrc.org/c/chrome/browser/resources/ash/settings/os_languages_page/input_method_prefs_consts.ts
Japanese IME: selection shortcut. Enum values MUST match CrOS Settings @ https://crsrc.org/c/chrome/browser/resources/ash/settings/os_languages_page/input_method_prefs_consts.ts
Japanese IME: keymap style. Enum values MUST match CrOS Settings @ https://crsrc.org/c/chrome/browser/resources/ash/settings/os_languages_page/input_method_prefs_consts.ts
Japanese IME: shift key mode switch. Enum values MUST match CrOS Settings @ https://crsrc.org/c/chrome/browser/resources/ash/settings/os_languages_page/input_method_prefs_consts.ts
User preference settings for a specific input method. Entry names MUST match CrOS Settings @ https://crsrc.org/c/chrome/browser/resources/ash/settings/os_languages_page/input_method_prefs_consts.ts

enableDoubleSpacePeriod.description: Whether to auto transform double spaces to type period.

enableSoundOnKeypress.description: Whether to enable sound on keypress.
