physicalKeyboardAutoCorrectionEnabledByD.description: Whether auto correction should be enabled for physical keyboard by default.

physicalKeyboardAutoCorrectionLevel.description: The level of auto correction for physical keyboard (0: Off, 1: Modest, 2: Aggressive).

physicalKeyboardEnableCapitalization.description: Whether to enable auto capitalization for physical keyboard.

physicalKeyboardEnableDiacriticsOnLongpr.description: Whether to enable diacritics on longpress for physical keyboard.

physicalKeyboardEnablePredictiveWriting.description: Whether to enable physical keyboard predictive writing

virtualKeyboardAutoCorrectionLevel.description: The level of auto correction for virtual keyboard (0: Off, 1: Modest, 2: Aggressive).

virtualKeyboardEnableCapitalization.description: Whether enable auto capitalization for virtual keyboard.

xkbLayout.description: The xkb keyboard (system provided keyboard) layout.

JapaneseSectionShortcut.description: Japanese IME: selection shortcut (NOTE: 'Section' in property name is a persisted typo).

AutomaticallySwitchToHalfwidth.description: Japanese IME: Whether to switch to halfwidth automatically.

ShiftKeyModeStyle.description: Japanese IME: shift key mode switch.

UseInputHistory.description: Japanese IME: Whether to use input history for suggestions.

UseSystemDictionary.description: Japanese IME: Whether to use system dictionary for suggestions.

JapaneseDisableSuggestions.description: Japanese IME: Whether to disable personalized conversions, suggestions, and user dictionary.

koreanEnableSyllableInput.description: Whether input one syllable at a time in korean input method.

koreanShowHangulCandidate.description: Whether to show hangul candidates in korean input method.

pinyinChinesePunctuation.description: Whether to use Chinese punctuations in pinyin.

pinyinDefaultChinese.description: User can use shortcuts to switch between Chinese and English quickly when using pinyin, this flag indicates whether the default language is Chinese.

pinyinEnableLowerPaging.description: Whether to enable using ','/'.' to page up/down the candidates in pinyin.

pinyinEnableUpperPaging.description: Whether to enable using '-'/'=' to page up/down the candidates in pinyin.

pinyinFullWidthCharacter.description: Whether to output full width letters and digits in pinyin.

zhuyinPageSize.description: The page size of zhuyin candidate page.

zhuyinSelectKeys.description: The keys used to select candidates in zhuyin.

vietnameseVniAllowFlexibleDiacritics.description: Enable VNI flexible Vietnamese typing mode

vietnameseVniNewStyleToneMarkPlacement.description: Enable VNI modern tone mark placement

vietnameseVniShowUnderline.description: Enable VNI showing underline on composition text

vietnameseTelexAllowFlexibleDiacritics.description: Enable Telex flexible Vietnamese typing mode

vietnameseTelexNewStyleToneMarkPlacement.description: Enable Telex modern tone mark placement

vietnameseTelexShowUnderline.description: Enable Telex showing underline on composition text

functions.name: getInputMethodConfig
functions.description: Gets configurations for input methods.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Resolves with the config object.

parameters.name: config
parameters.description: The input method config object.

functions.name: getInputMethods
functions.description: Gets all enabled input methods, sorted in ascending order of their localized full display names, according to the lexicographical order defined by the current system locale aka. display language.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Resolves with the input method objects.

parameters.name: inputMethods
parameters.description: Enabled input method objects, sorted in ascending order of their localized full display names, according to the lexicographical order defined by the current system locale aka. display language.

functions.name: getCurrentInputMethod
functions.description: Gets the current input method.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Resolves with the current input method.

parameters.name: inputMethodId
parameters.description: Current input method.

functions.name: setCurrentInputMethod
functions.description: Sets the current input method.

parameters.name: inputMethodId
parameters.description: The input method ID to be set as current input method.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Resolves once the current input method is set. If unsuccessful, the promise is rejected.

functions.name: switchToLastUsedInputMethod
functions.description: Switches to the last used input method. If no last used input method, this is a no-op.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Resolves once the input method is swapped (if applicable). If unsuccessful, the promise is rejected.

functions.name: fetchAllDictionaryWords
functions.description: Fetches a list of all the words currently in the dictionary.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Resolves once the list of dictionary words are ready.

parameters.name: words
parameters.description: List of dictionary words.

functions.name: addWordToDictionary
functions.description: Adds a single word to be stored in the dictionary.

parameters.name: word
parameters.description: A new word to add to the dictionary.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Resolves once the word is added. If unsuccessful, the promise is rejected.

functions.name: setXkbLayout
functions.description: Sets the XKB layout for the given input method.

parameters.name: xkb_name
parameters.description: The XKB layout name.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Resolves when the layout is set.

functions.name: finishComposingText
functions.description: Commits the text currently being composed without moving the selected text range. This is a no-op if the context is incorrect.

contextID.description: ID of the context where we want to finish composing.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Resolves when the operation completes.

functions.name: showInputView
functions.description: Shows the input view window. If the input view window is already shown, this function will do nothing.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Resolves when the operation completes.

functions.name: hideInputView
functions.description: Hides the input view window. If the input view window is already hidden, this function will do nothing.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Resolves when the operation completes.

functions.name: openOptionsPage
functions.description: Opens the options page for the input method extension. If the input method does not have options, this function will do nothing.

parameters.name: inputMethodId
parameters.description: ID of the input method to open options for.

functions.name: getSurroundingText
functions.description: Gets the surrounding text of the current selection. WARNING: This could return a stale cache that doesn't reflect reality, due to async between IMF and TextInputClient.

parameters.name: beforeLength
parameters.description: The number of characters before the current selection.

parameters.name: afterLength
parameters.description: The number of characters after the current selection.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Resolves to provide the result

parameters.name: surroundingInfo
parameters.description: The surrouding text info.

functions.name: getSettings
functions.description: Gets the current values of all settings for a particular input method

parameters.name: engineID
parameters.description: The ID of the engine (e.g. 'zh-t-i0-pinyin', 'xkb:us::eng')

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Resolves with the settings

parameters.name: settings
parameters.description: The requested setting, or null if there's no value

functions.name: setSettings
functions.description: Sets the value of all settings for a particular input method

parameters.name: engineID
parameters.description: The ID of the engine (e.g. 'zh-t-i0-pinyin', 'xkb:us::eng')

parameters.name: settings
parameters.description: The settings to set

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Resolves to notify that the new value has been set

functions.name: setCompositionRange
functions.description: (Deprecated) Set the composition range. If this extension does not own the active IME, this fails. Use setComposingRange instead.

contextID.description: ID of the context where the composition text will be set

selectionBefore.description: How much before the current selection to set as composition.

selectionAfter.description: How much after the current selection to set as composition.

segments.description: List of segments and their associated types.

start.description: Index of the character to start this segment at

end.description: Index of the character to end this segment after.

style.description: The type of the underline to modify this segment.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Resolves when the operation completes with a boolean indicating if the text was accepted or not. On failure, the promise will be rejected.

functions.name: reset
functions.description: Resets the current engine to its initial state. Fires an OnReset event.

functions.name: onAutocorrect
functions.description: Called after a word has been autocorrected to show some UI for autocorrect.

contextID.description: ID of the context where the autocorrect occurred.

typedWord.description: Corrected word will be replaced by this when clicking undo

correctedWord.description: Needed primarily to know the length of the autocorrected text to show the correct length of underline. String content technically redundant; required however, as what IMF knows may be stale due to async.

startIndex.description: Offset index (in code units) in surroundingInfo (see onSurroundingTextChanged) for the start of the autocorrected text

functions.name: notifyInputMethodReadyForTesting
functions.description: Notifies Chrome that the current input method is ready to accept key events from Tast.

functions.name: getLanguagePackStatus
functions.description: Gets the aggregate status of all language packs for a given input method.

parameters.name: inputMethodId
parameters.description: Fully qualified ID of the input method

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Resolves with a LanguagePackStatus when the operation completes.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: The aggregated status of all language packs for the given input method, or 'installed' if there are no language packs.

events.name: onCaretBoundsChanged
events.description: Fired when the caret bounds change.

parameters.name: caretBounds
parameters.description: The bounds information for the caret.

events.name: onChanged
events.description: Fired when the input method is changed.

parameters.name: newInputMethodId
parameters.description: New input method which is being used.

events.name: onDictionaryLoaded
events.description: Fired when the custom spelling dictionary is loaded.

events.name: onDictionaryChanged
events.description: Fired when words are added or removed from the custom spelling dictionary.

parameters.name: added
parameters.description: List of added words.

parameters.name: removed
parameters.description: List of removed words.

events.name: onImeMenuActivationChanged
events.description: Fired when the IME menu is activated or deactivated.

parameters.name: activation
parameters.description: Whether the IME menu is currently active.

events.name: onImeMenuListChanged
events.description: Fired when the input method or the list of active input method IDs is changed.

events.name: onImeMenuItemsChanged
events.description: Fired when the input.ime.setMenuItems or input.ime.updateMenuItems API is called.

parameters.name: engineID
parameters.description: ID of the engine to use

parameters.name: items
parameters.description: MenuItems to add or update.

events.name: onFocus
events.description: This event is sent when focus enters a text box. It is sent to all extensions that are listening to this event, and enabled by the user.

parameters.name: context
parameters.description: Describes the text field that has acquired focus.

events.name: onScreenProjectionChanged
events.description: This event is sent when the screen is being mirrored or the desktop is being cast.

parameters.name: isProjected
parameters.description: Whether the screen is projected.

events.name: onSuggestionsChanged
events.description: This event is sent when a new set of suggestions has been generated

parameters.name: suggestions
parameters.description: List of suggestions to display, in order of relevance

events.name: onInputMethodOptionsChanged
events.description: This event is sent when input method options are changed.

parameters.name: engineID
parameters.description: The engine ID for the input method being changed.

events.name: onLanguagePackStatusChanged
events.description: This event is sent when any IME's language pack status is changed.

parameters.name: change
parameters.description: Information about what changed.

instanceID.description: Use chrome.instanceID to access the Instance ID service.

functions.name: getID
functions.description: Retrieves an identifier for the app instance. The instance ID will be returned by the callback. The same ID will be returned as long as the application identity has not been revoked or expired.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Resolves when the retrieval completes.

parameters.name: instanceID
parameters.description: An Instance ID assigned to the app instance.

functions.name: getCreationTime
functions.description: Retrieves the time when the InstanceID has been generated. The creation time will be returned by the callback.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Resolves when the retrieval completes.

parameters.name: creationTime
parameters.description: The time when the Instance ID has been generated, represented in milliseconds since the epoch.

functions.name: getToken
functions.description: Return a token that allows the authorized entity to access the service defined by scope.

parameters.name: getTokenParams
parameters.description: Parameters for getToken.

authorizedEntity.description: Identifies the entity that is authorized to access resources associated with this Instance ID. It can be a project ID from Google developer console.

scope.description: Identifies authorized actions that the authorized entity can take. E.g. for sending GCM messages, GCM scope should be used.

options.deprecated: options are deprecated and will be ignored.
options.description: Allows including a small number of string key/value pairs that will be associated with the token and may be used in processing the request.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Resolves when the retrieval completes.

parameters.name: token
parameters.description: A token assigned by the requested service.

functions.name: deleteToken
functions.description: Revokes a granted token.

parameters.name: deleteTokenParams
parameters.description: Parameters for deleteToken.

authorizedEntity.description: The authorized entity that is used to obtain the token.

scope.description: The scope that is used to obtain the token.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Resolves when the token deletion completes. The token was revoked successfully if the promise does not reject.

functions.name: deleteID
functions.description: Resets the app instance identifier and revokes all tokens associated with it.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Resolves when the deletion completes. The instance identifier was revoked successfully if the promise does not reject.

events.name: onTokenRefresh
events.description: Fired when all the granted tokens need to be refreshed.

types.description: Chrome settings which can be overriden by an extension.

name.description: Name of the search engine displayed to user. This may only be omitted if prepopulated_id is set.

keyword.description: Omnibox keyword for the search engine. This may only be omitted if prepopulated_id is set.

favicon_url.description: An icon URL for the search engine. This may only be omitted if prepopulated_id is set.

search_url.description: An search URL used by the search engine.

encoding.description: Encoding of the search term. This may only be omitted if prepopulated_id is set.

suggest_url.description: If omitted, this engine does not support suggestions.

image_url.description: If omitted, this engine does not support image search.

search_url_post_params.description: The string of post parameters to search_url

suggest_url_post_params.description: The string of post parameters to suggest_url

image_url_post_params.description: The string of post parameters to image_url

alternate_urls.description: A list of URL patterns that can be used, in addition to |search_url|.

prepopulated_id.description: An ID of the built-in search engine in Chrome.

is_default.description: Specifies if the search provider should be default.

startup_pages.description: An array of length one containing a URL to be used as the startup page.

types.description: For "file" the source is a file passed via onLaunched event. For "device" contents are fetched from an external device (eg. plugged via USB), without using file_handlers. Finally, for "network" source, contents should be fetched via network.
Represents capabilities of a providing extension.

configurable.description: Whether configuring via onConfigureRequested is supported. By default: false.

multiple_mounts.description: Whether multiple (more than one) mounted file systems are supported. By default: false.

watchable.description: Whether setting watchers and notifying about changes is supported. By default: false.

source.description: Source of data for mounted file systems.

events.name: onNextTrack
events.description: Notifies that the next track was requested.

events.name: onPrevTrack
events.description: Notifies that the previous tack was requested.

events.name: onTogglePlayState
events.description: Notifies that a play/pause toggle was requested.

omnibox.description: The omnibox API allows you to register a keyword with Google Chrome's address bar, which is also known as the omnibox.

types.description: The style type.

The window disposition for the omnibox query. This is the recommended context to display results. For example, if the omnibox command is to navigate to a certain URL, a disposition of 'newForegroundTab' means the navigation should take place in a new selected tab.
The style ranges for the description, as provided by the extension.

type.description: The style type

types.description: An action button attached to a suggest result.

name.description: The string sent to the extension in the event corresponding to the user clicking on the action.

tooltipText.description: The action button hover tooltip text.

icon.description: The icon shown in the action button on the leading side of the  action label. The icon must be specified as an imageData object. The size should not be more than 160 px wide and tall.

types.description: A suggest result.

content.description: The text that is put into the URL bar, and that is sent to the extension when the user chooses this entry.

description.description: The text that is displayed in the URL dropdown. Can contain XML-style markup for styling. The supported tags are 'url' (for a literal URL), 'match' (for highlighting text that matched what the user's query), and 'dim' (for dim helper text). The styles can be nested, eg. <dim><match>dimmed match</match></dim>. You must escape the five predefined entities to display them as text: stackoverflow.com/a/1091953/89484

deletable.description: Whether the suggest result can be deleted by the user.

descriptionStyles.description: An array of style ranges for the description, as provided by the extension.

actions.description: An array of actions attached to the suggestion. Only supported for suggestions added in unscoped mode.

iconUrl.description: An icon shown on the leading edge of the suggestion in the omnibox dropdown. Only supported for suggestions added in unscoped mode.

types.description: A suggest result.

description.description: The text that is displayed in the URL dropdown. Can contain XML-style markup for styling. The supported tags are 'url' (for a literal URL), 'match' (for highlighting text that matched what the user's query), and 'dim' (for dim helper text). The styles can be nested, eg. <dim><match>dimmed match</match></dim>.

descriptionStyles.description: An array of style ranges for the description, as provided by the extension.

types.description: Details about an action executed by the user sent in the listener of `onActionExecuted`.

actionName.description: The name of the action the user selected, as defined by the `action` field in `Action`.

content.description: The text of the suggestion corresponding to the action, as shown in the Omnibox. The same as the `SuggestResult.content`.

keyword.description: The keyword to register with the omnibox. Must be non-empty.

functions.name: sendSuggestions
functions.description: A callback passed to the onInputChanged event used for sending suggestions back to the browser.

parameters.name: suggestResults
parameters.description: An array of suggest results

functions.name: setDefaultSuggestion
functions.description: Sets the description and styling for the default suggestion. The default suggestion is the text that is displayed in the first suggestion row underneath the URL bar.

parameters.name: suggestion
parameters.description: A partial SuggestResult object, without the 'content' parameter.

events.name: onInputStarted
events.description: User has started a keyword input session by typing the extension's keyword. This is guaranteed to be sent exactly once per input session, and before any onInputChanged events.

events.name: onInputChanged
events.description: User has changed what is typed into the omnibox.

parameters.name: suggest
parameters.description: A callback passed to the onInputChanged event used for sending suggestions back to the browser.

parameters.name: suggestResults
parameters.description: Array of suggest results

events.name: onInputEntered
events.description: User has accepted what is typed into the omnibox.

events.name: onInputCancelled
events.description: User has ended the keyword input session without accepting the input.

events.name: onDeleteSuggestion
events.description: User has deleted a suggested result.

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: Text of the deleted suggestion.

events.name: onActionExecuted
events.description: User has selected an action attached to a suggested result by pressing the corresponding button in the Omnibox.

pageAction.description: Use the chrome.pageAction API to put icons in the main Google Chrome toolbar, to the right of the address bar. Page actions represent actions that can be taken on the current page, but that aren't applicable to all pages. Page actions appear grayed out when inactive.

types.description: Pixel data for an image. Must be an ImageData object (for example, from a canvas element).

tabId.description: The ID of the tab to query state for. If no tab is specified, the non-tab-specific state is returned.

functions.name: show
functions.description: Shows the page action. The page action is shown whenever the tab is selected.

parameters.name: tabId
parameters.description: The id of the tab for which you want to modify the page action.

functions.name: hide
functions.description: Hides the page action. Hidden page actions still appear in the Chrome toolbar, but are grayed out.

parameters.name: tabId
parameters.description: The id of the tab for which you want to modify the page action.

functions.name: setTitle
functions.description: Sets the title of the page action. This is displayed in a tooltip over the page action.

tabId.description: The id of the tab for which you want to modify the page action.

title.description: The tooltip string.

functions.name: getTitle
functions.description: Gets the title of the page action.

functions.name: setIcon
functions.description: Sets the icon for the page action. The icon can be specified either as the path to an image file or as the pixel data from a canvas element, or as dictionary of either one of those. Either the path or the imageData property must be specified.

tabId.description: The id of the tab for which you want to modify the page action.

imageData.description: Either an ImageData object or a dictionary {size -> ImageData} representing icon to be set. If the icon is specified as a dictionary, the actual image to be used is chosen depending on screen's pixel density. If the number of image pixels that fit into one screen space unit equals scale, then image with size scale * n will be selected, where n is the size of the icon in the UI. At least one image must be specified. Note that 'details.imageData = foo' is equivalent to 'details.imageData = {'16': foo}'

path.description: Either a relative image path or a dictionary {size -> relative image path} pointing to icon to be set. If the icon is specified as a dictionary, the actual image to be used is chosen depending on screen's pixel density. If the number of image pixels that fit into one screen space unit equals scale, then image with size scale * n will be selected, where n is the size of the icon in the UI. At least one image must be specified. Note that 'details.path = foo' is equivalent to 'details.path = {'16': foo}'

functions.name: setPopup
functions.description: Sets the HTML document to be opened as a popup when the user clicks on the page action's icon.

tabId.description: The id of the tab for which you want to modify the page action.

popup.description: The relative path to the HTML file to show in a popup. If set to the empty string (''), no popup is shown.

functions.name: getPopup
functions.description: Gets the html document set as the popup for this page action.

events.name: onClicked
events.description: Fired when a page action icon is clicked.  This event will not fire if the page action has a popup.

pageCapture.description: Use the chrome.pageCapture API to save a tab as MHTML.

functions.name: saveAsMHTML
functions.description: Saves the content of the tab with given id as MHTML.

tabId.description: The id of the tab to save as MHTML.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Resolves when the MHTML has been generated.

parameters.name: mhtmlData
parameters.description: The MHTML data as a Blob.

permissions.description: Use the chrome.permissions API to request declared optional permissions at run time rather than install time, so users understand why the permissions are needed and grant only those that are necessary.
List of named permissions (does not include hosts or origins).

origins.description: The list of host permissions, including those specified in the optional_permissions or permissions keys in the manifest, and those associated with Content Scripts.

events.name: onAdded
events.description: Fired when the extension acquires new permissions.

parameters.name: permissions
parameters.description: The newly acquired permissions.

events.name: onRemoved
events.description: Fired when access to permissions has been removed from the extension.

parameters.name: permissions
parameters.description: The permissions that have been removed.

functions.name: getAll
functions.description: Gets the extension's current set of permissions.

parameters.name: permissions
parameters.description: The extension's active permissions. Note that the origins property will contain granted origins from those specified in the permissions and optional_permissions keys in the manifest and those associated with Content Scripts.

functions.name: contains
functions.description: Checks if the extension has the specified permissions.

parameters.name: result
parameters.description: True if the extension has the specified permissions. If an origin is specified as both an optional permission and a content script match pattern, this will return false unless both permissions are granted.

functions.name: request
functions.description: Requests access to the specified permissions, displaying a prompt to the user if necessary. These permissions must either be defined in the optional_permissions field of the manifest or be required permissions that were withheld by the user. Paths on origin patterns will be ignored. You can request subsets of optional origin permissions; for example, if you specify *://*/* in the optional_permissions section of the manifest, you can request http://example.com/. If there are any problems requesting the permissions, the promise will be rejected.

parameters.name: granted
parameters.description: True if the user granted the specified permissions.

functions.name: remove
functions.description: Removes access to the specified permissions. If there are any problems removing the permissions, the promise will be rejected.

parameters.name: removed
parameters.description: True if the permissions were removed.

functions.name: addHostAccessRequest
functions.description: Adds a host access request. Request will only be signaled to the user if extension can be granted access to the host in the request. Request will be reset on cross-origin navigation. When accepted, grants persistent access to the sites top origin

documentId.description: The id of a document where host access requests can be shown. Must be the top-level document within a tab. If provided, the request is shown on the tab of the specified document and is removed when the document navigates to a new origin. Adding a new request will override any existent request for `tabId`. This or `tabId` must be specified.

tabId.description: The id of the tab where host access requests can be shown. If provided, the request is shown on the specified tab and is removed when the tab navigates to a new origin. Adding a new request will override an existent request for `documentId`. This or `documentId` must be specified.

pattern.description: The URL pattern where host access requests can be shown. If provided, host access requests will only be shown on URLs that match this pattern.

functions.name: removeHostAccessRequest
functions.description: Removes a host access request, if existent.

documentId.description: The id of a document where host access request will be removed. Must be the top-level document within a tab. This or `tabId` must be specified.

tabId.description: The id of the tab where host access request will be removed. This or `documentId` must be specified.

pattern.description: The URL pattern where host access request will be removed. If provided, this must exactly match the pattern of an existing host access request.

privacy.description: Use the chrome.privacy API to control usage of the features in Chrome that can affect a user's privacy. This API relies on the ChromeSetting prototype of the type API for getting and setting Chrome's configuration.

types.description: The IP handling policy of WebRTC.

network.description: Settings that influence Chrome's handling of network connections in general.

networkPredictionEnabled.description: If enabled, Chrome attempts to speed up your web browsing experience by pre-resolving DNS entries and preemptively opening TCP and SSL connections to servers. This preference only affects actions taken by Chrome's internal prediction service. It does not affect webpage-initiated prefectches or preconnects. This preference's value is a boolean, defaulting to true.

webRTCIPHandlingPolicy.description: Allow users to specify the media performance/privacy tradeoffs which impacts how WebRTC traffic will be routed and how much local address information is exposed. This preference's value is of type IPHandlingPolicy, defaulting to default.

services.description: Settings that enable or disable features that require third-party network services provided by Google and your default search provider.

alternateErrorPagesEnabled.description: If enabled, Chrome uses a web service to help resolve navigation errors. This preference's value is a boolean, defaulting to true.

autofillEnabled.deprecated: Please use privacy.services.autofillAddressEnabled and privacy.services.autofillCreditCardEnabled. This remains for backward compatibility in this release and will be removed in the future.
autofillEnabled.description: If enabled, Chrome offers to automatically fill in forms. This preference's value is a boolean, defaulting to true.

autofillAddressEnabled.description: If enabled, Chrome offers to automatically fill in addresses and other form data. This preference's value is a boolean, defaulting to true.

autofillCreditCardEnabled.description: If enabled, Chrome offers to automatically fill in credit card forms. This preference's value is a boolean, defaulting to true.

passwordSavingEnabled.description: If enabled, the password manager will ask if you want to save passwords. This preference's value is a boolean, defaulting to true.

safeBrowsingEnabled.description: If enabled, Chrome does its best to protect you from phishing and malware. This preference's value is a boolean, defaulting to true.

safeBrowsingExtendedReportingEnabled.description: If enabled, Chrome will send additional information to Google when SafeBrowsing blocks a page, such as the content of the blocked page. This preference's value is a boolean, defaulting to false.

searchSuggestEnabled.description: If enabled, Chrome sends the text you type into the Omnibox to your default search engine, which provides predictions of websites and searches that are likely completions of what you've typed so far. This preference's value is a boolean, defaulting to true.

spellingServiceEnabled.description: If enabled, Chrome uses a web service to help correct spelling errors. This preference's value is a boolean, defaulting to false.

translationServiceEnabled.description: If enabled, Chrome offers to translate pages that aren't in a language you read. This preference's value is a boolean, defaulting to true.

websites.description: Settings that determine what information Chrome makes available to websites.

thirdPartyCookiesAllowed.description:
If disabled, Chrome blocks third-party sites from setting cookies. The value of this preference is of type boolean, and the default value is true. Extensions may not enable this API in Incognito mode, where third-party cookies are blocked and can only be allowed at the site level. If you try setting this API to true in Incognito, it will throw an error.

Note: Individual sites may still be able to access third-party cookies when this API returns false, if they have a valid exemption or they use the Storage Access API instead.

topicsEnabled.description: If disabled, the Topics API is deactivated. The value of this preference is of type boolean, and the default value is true. Extensions may only disable this API by setting the value to false. If you try setting this API to true, it will throw an error.

fledgeEnabled.description: If disabled, the Fledge API is deactivated. The value of this preference is of type boolean, and the default value is true. Extensions may only disable this API by setting the value to false. If you try setting this API to true, it will throw an error.

adMeasurementEnabled.description: If disabled, the Attribution Reporting API and Private Aggregation API are deactivated. The value of this preference is of type boolean, and the default value is true. Extensions may only disable these APIs by setting the value to false. If you try setting these APIs to true, it will throw an error.

hyperlinkAuditingEnabled.description: If enabled, Chrome sends auditing pings when requested by a website (<a ping>). The value of this preference is of type boolean, and the default value is true.

referrersEnabled.description: If enabled, Chrome sends referer headers with your requests. Yes, the name of this preference doesn't match the misspelled header. No, we're not going to change it. The value of this preference is of type boolean, and the default value is true.

doNotTrackEnabled.description: If enabled, Chrome sends 'Do Not Track' (DNT: 1) header with your requests. The value of this preference is of type boolean, and the default value is false.

protectedContentEnabled.description: Available on Windows and ChromeOS only: If enabled, Chrome provides a unique ID to plugins in order to run protected content. The value of this preference is of type boolean, and the default value is true.

relatedWebsiteSetsEnabled.description: If disabled, Related Website Sets is deactivated. The value of this preference is of type boolean, and the default value is true. Extensions may only disable this API by setting the value to false. If you try setting this API to true, it will throw an error.

proxy.description: Use the chrome.proxy API to manage Chrome's proxy settings. This API relies on the ChromeSetting prototype of the type API for getting and setting the proxy configuration.

types.description: An object encapsulating a single proxy server's specification.

scheme.description: The scheme (protocol) of the proxy server itself. Defaults to 'http'.

host.description: The hostname or IP address of the proxy server. Hostnames must be in ASCII (in Punycode format). IDNA is not supported, yet.

port.description: The port of the proxy server. Defaults to a port that depends on the scheme.

types.description: An object encapsulating the set of proxy rules for all protocols. Use either 'singleProxy' or (a subset of) 'proxyForHttp', 'proxyForHttps', 'proxyForFtp' and 'fallbackProxy'.

singleProxy.description: The proxy server to be used for all per-URL requests (that is http, https, and ftp).

proxyForHttp.description: The proxy server to be used for HTTP requests.

proxyForHttps.description: The proxy server to be used for HTTPS requests.

proxyForFtp.description: The proxy server to be used for FTP requests.

fallbackProxy.description: The proxy server to be used for everthing else or if any of the specific proxyFor... is not specified.

bypassList.description: List of servers to connect to without a proxy server.

types.description: An object holding proxy auto-config information. Exactly one of the fields should be non-empty.

url.description: URL of the PAC file to be used.

mandatory.description: If true, an invalid PAC script will prevent the network stack from falling back to direct connections. Defaults to false.

types.description: An object encapsulating a complete proxy configuration.

rules.description: The proxy rules describing this configuration. Use this for 'fixed_servers' mode.

pacScript.description: The proxy auto-config (PAC) script for this configuration. Use this for 'pac_script' mode.

mode.description:
'direct' = Never use a proxy
'auto_detect' = Auto detect proxy settings
'pac_script' = Use specified PAC script
'fixed_servers' = Manually specify proxy servers
'system' = Use system proxy settings

settings.description: Proxy settings to be used. The value of this setting is a ProxyConfig object.

events.name: onProxyError
events.description: Notifies about proxy errors.

fatal.description: If true, the error was fatal and the network transaction was aborted. Otherwise, a direct connection is used instead.

details.description: Additional details about the error such as a JavaScript runtime error.

sessions.description: Use the chrome.sessions API to query and restore tabs and windows from a browsing session.

maxResults.description: The maximum number of entries to be fetched in the requested list. Omit this parameter to fetch the maximum number of entries ($(ref:sessions.MAX_SESSION_RESULTS)).

lastModified.description: The time when the window or tab was closed or modified, represented in seconds since the epoch.

tab.description: The $(ref:tabs.Tab), if this entry describes a tab. Either this or $(ref:sessions.Session.window) will be set.

window.description: The $(ref:windows.Window), if this entry describes a window. Either this or $(ref:sessions.Session.tab) will be set.

deviceName.description: The name of the foreign device.

sessions.description: A list of open window sessions for the foreign device, sorted from most recently to least recently modified session.

functions.name: getRecentlyClosed
functions.description: Gets the list of recently closed tabs and/or windows.

parameters.name: sessions
parameters.description: The list of closed entries in reverse order that they were closed (the most recently closed tab or window will be at index 0). The entries may contain either tabs or windows.

functions.name: getDevices
functions.description: Retrieves all devices with synced sessions.

parameters.name: devices
parameters.description: The list of $(ref:sessions.Device) objects for each synced session, sorted in order from device with most recently modified session to device with least recently modified session. $(ref:tabs.Tab) objects are sorted by recency in the $(ref:windows.Window) of the $(ref:sessions.Session) objects.

functions.name: restore
functions.description: Reopens a $(ref:windows.Window) or $(ref:tabs.Tab), with an optional callback to run when the entry has been restored.

parameters.name: sessionId
parameters.description: The $(ref:windows.Window.sessionId), or $(ref:tabs.Tab.sessionId) to restore. If this parameter is not specified, the most recently closed session is restored.

parameters.name: restoredSession
parameters.description: A $(ref:sessions.Session) containing the restored $(ref:windows.Window) or $(ref:tabs.Tab) object.

events.name: onChanged
events.description: Fired when recently closed tabs and/or windows are changed. This event does not monitor synced sessions changes.

MAX_SESSION_RESULTS.description: The maximum number of $(ref:sessions.Session) that will be included in a requested list.

types.description: State of system update.  NotAvailable when there is no available update or the update system is in error state, Updating when a system update is in progress, NeedRestart when a system update is finished and restart is needed.
Exposes whether the incognito mode is available to windows. One of 'enabled', 'disabled' (user cannot browse pages in Incognito mode), 'forced' (all pages/sessions are forced into Incognito mode).
Information about the system update.

downloadProgress.description: Value between 0 and 1 describing the progress of system update download.  This value will be set to 0 when |state| is NotAvailable, 1 when NeedRestart.

functions.name: getIncognitoModeAvailability
functions.description: Returns whether the incognito mode is enabled, disabled or forced

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Resolves with the result.

functions.name: getUpdateStatus
functions.description: Gets information about the system update.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Details of the system update

functions.name: getApiKey
functions.description: Gets Chrome's API key to use for requests to Google services.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The API key.

tabGroups.description: Use the chrome.tabGroups API to interact with the browser's tab grouping system. You can use this API to modify and rearrange tab groups in the browser. To group and ungroup tabs, or to query what tabs are in groups, use the chrome.tabs API.

types.description: The group's color.

id.description: The ID of the group. Group IDs are unique within a browser session.

collapsed.description: Whether the group is collapsed. A collapsed group is one whose tabs are hidden.

title.description: The title of the group.

windowId.description: The ID of the window that contains the group.

TAB_GROUP_ID_NONE.description: An ID that represents the absence of a group.

functions.name: get
functions.description: Retrieves details about the specified group.

functions.name: query
functions.description: Gets all groups that have the specified properties, or all groups if no properties are specified.

title.description: Match group titles against a pattern.

windowId.description: The ID of the parent window, or $(ref:windows.WINDOW_ID_CURRENT) for the current window.

functions.name: update
functions.description: Modifies the properties of a group. Properties that are not specified in <var>updateProperties</var> are not modified.

parameters.name: groupId
parameters.description: The ID of the group to modify.

collapsed.description: Whether the group should be collapsed.

title.description: The title of the group.

parameters.name: group
parameters.description: Details about the updated group.

functions.name: move
functions.description: Moves the group and all its tabs within its window, or to a new window.

parameters.name: groupId
parameters.description: The ID of the group to move.

windowId.description: The window to move the group to. Defaults to the window the group is currently in. Note that groups can only be moved to and from windows with $(ref:windows.WindowType) type "normal".

index.description: The position to move the group to. Use -1 to place the group at the end of the window.

parameters.name: group
parameters.description: Details about the moved group.

events.name: onCreated
events.description: Fired when a group is created.

parameters.name: group
parameters.description: Details of the group that was created.

events.name: onUpdated
events.description: Fired when a group is updated.

parameters.name: group
parameters.description: Details of the group that was updated.

events.name: onMoved
events.description: Fired when a group is moved within a window. Move events are still fired for the individual tabs within the group, as well as for the group itself. This event is not fired when a group is moved between windows; instead, it will be removed from one window and created in another.

parameters.name: group
parameters.description: Details of the group that was moved.

events.name: onRemoved
events.description: Fired when a group is closed, either directly by the user or automatically because it contained zero tabs.

parameters.name: group
parameters.description: Details of the group that was removed.

tabs.description: Use the chrome.tabs API to interact with the browser's tab system. You can use this API to create, modify, and rearrange tabs in the browser.

types.description: The tab's loading status.
An event that caused a muted state change.

enum.name: user
enum.description: A user input action set the muted state.

enum.name: capture
enum.description: Tab capture was started, forcing a muted state change.

enum.name: extension
enum.description: An extension, identified by the extensionId field, set the muted state.

types.description: The tab's muted state and the reason for the last state change.

muted.description: Whether the tab is muted (prevented from playing sound). The tab may be muted even if it has not played or is not currently playing sound. Equivalent to whether the 'muted' audio indicator is showing.

reason.description: The reason the tab was muted or unmuted. Not set if the tab's mute state has never been changed.

extensionId.description: The ID of the extension that changed the muted state. Not set if an extension was not the reason the muted state last changed.

id.description: The ID of the tab. Tab IDs are unique within a browser session. Under some circumstances a tab may not be assigned an ID; for example, when querying foreign tabs using the $(ref:sessions) API, in which case a session ID may be present. Tab ID can also be set to chrome.tabs.TAB_ID_NONE for apps and devtools windows.

index.description: The zero-based index of the tab within its window.

groupId.description: The ID of the group that the tab belongs to.

splitViewId.description: The ID of the Split View that the tab belongs to.

windowId.description: The ID of the window that contains the tab.

openerTabId.description: The ID of the tab that opened this tab, if any. This property is only present if the opener tab still exists.

lastAccessed.description: The last time the tab became active in its window as the number of milliseconds since epoch.

active.description: Whether the tab is active in its window. Does not necessarily mean the window is focused.

audible.description: Whether the tab has produced sound over the past couple of seconds (but it might not be heard if also muted). Equivalent to whether the 'speaker audio' indicator is showing.

frozen.description: Whether the tab is frozen. A frozen tab cannot execute tasks, including event handlers or timers. It is visible in the tab strip and its content is loaded in memory.  It is unfrozen on activation.

discarded.description: Whether the tab is discarded. A discarded tab is one whose content has been unloaded from memory, but is still visible in the tab strip. Its content is reloaded the next time it is activated.

autoDiscardable.description: Whether the tab can be discarded automatically by the browser when resources are low.

mutedInfo.description: The tab's muted state and the reason for the last state change.

url.description: The last committed URL of the main frame of the tab. This property is only present if the extension has the "tabs" permission or has host permissions for the page. May be an empty string if the tab has not yet committed. See also $(ref:Tab.pendingUrl).

pendingUrl.description: The URL the tab is navigating to, before it has committed. This property is only present if the extension has the "tabs" permission or has host permissions for the page and there is a pending navigation.

title.description: The title of the tab. This property is only present if the extension has the "tabs" permission or has host permissions for the page.

favIconUrl.description: The URL of the tab's favicon. This property is only present if the extension has the "tabs" permission or has host permissions for the page. It may also be an empty string if the tab is loading.

incognito.description: Whether the tab is in an incognito window.

width.description: The width of the tab in pixels.

height.description: The height of the tab in pixels.

sessionId.description: The session ID used to uniquely identify a tab obtained from the $(ref:sessions) API.

types.description: Defines how zoom changes are handled, i.e., which entity is responsible for the actual scaling of the page; defaults to automatic.

enum.name: automatic
enum.description: Zoom changes are handled automatically by the browser.

enum.name: manual
enum.description: Overrides the automatic handling of zoom changes. The onZoomChange event will still be dispatched, and it is the extension's responsibility to listen for this event and manually scale the page. This mode does not support per-origin zooming, and thus ignores the scope zoom setting and assumes per-tab.

enum.name: disabled
enum.description: Disables all zooming in the tab. The tab reverts to the default zoom level, and all attempted zoom changes are ignored.

types.description: Defines whether zoom changes persist for the page's origin, or only take effect in this tab; defaults to per-origin when in automatic mode, and per-tab otherwise.

enum.name: per-origin
enum.description: Zoom changes persist in the zoomed page's origin, i.e., all other tabs navigated to that same origin are zoomed as well. Moreover, per-origin zoom changes are saved with the origin, meaning that when navigating to other pages in the same origin, they are all zoomed to the same zoom factor. The per-origin scope is only available in the automatic mode.

enum.name: per-tab
enum.description: Zoom changes only take effect in this tab, and zoom changes in other tabs do not affect the zooming of this tab. Also, per-tab zoom changes are reset on navigation; navigating a tab always loads pages with their per-origin zoom factors.

types.description: Defines how zoom changes in a tab are handled and at what scope.

mode.description: Defines how zoom changes are handled, i.e., which entity is responsible for the actual scaling of the page; defaults to automatic.

scope.description: Defines whether zoom changes persist for the page's origin, or only take effect in this tab; defaults to per-origin when in automatic mode, and per-tab otherwise.

defaultZoomFactor.description: Used to return the default zoom level for the current tab in calls to tabs.getZoomSettings.

types.description: The type of window.

MAX_CAPTURE_VISIBLE_TAB_CALLS_PER_SECOND.description: The maximum number of times that $(ref:captureVisibleTab) can be called per second. $(ref:captureVisibleTab) is expensive and should not be called too often.

SPLIT_VIEW_ID_NONE.description: An ID that represents the absence of a split tab.

TAB_ID_NONE.description: An ID that represents the absence of a browser tab.

TAB_INDEX_NONE.description: An index that represents the absence of a tab index in a tab_strip.

functions.name: get
functions.description: Retrieves details about the specified tab.

functions.name: getCurrent
functions.description: Gets the tab that this script call is being made from. Returns undefined if called from a non-tab context (for example, a background page or popup view).

functions.name: connect
functions.description: Connects to the content script(s) in the specified tab. The $(ref:runtime.onConnect) event is fired in each content script running in the specified tab for the current extension. For more details, see Content Script Messaging.

name.description: Is passed into onConnect for content scripts that are listening for the connection event.

frameId.description: Open a port to a specific frame identified by frameId instead of all frames in the tab.

documentId.description: Open a port to a specific document identified by documentId instead of all frames in the tab.

returns.description: A port that can be used to communicate with the content scripts running in the specified tab. The port's $(ref:runtime.Port) event is fired if the tab closes or does not exist.

functions.name: sendRequest
functions.description: Sends a single request to the content script(s) in the specified tab, with an optional callback to run when a response is sent back.  The $(ref:extension.onRequest) event is fired in each content script running in the specified tab for the current extension.

parameters.name: response
parameters.description: The JSON response object sent by the handler of the request. If an error occurs while connecting to the specified tab, the promise will be rejected.

functions.name: sendMessage
functions.description: Sends a single message to the content script(s) in the specified tab, with an optional callback to run when a response is sent back.  The $(ref:runtime.onMessage) event is fired in each content script running in the specified tab for the current extension.

parameters.name: message
parameters.description: The message to send. This message should be a JSON-ifiable object.

frameId.description: Send a message to a specific frame identified by frameId instead of all frames in the tab.

documentId.description: Send a message to a specific document identified by documentId instead of all frames in the tab.

parameters.name: response
parameters.description: The JSON response object sent by the handler of the message. If an error occurs while connecting to the specified tab, the promise will be rejected.

functions.name: getSelected
functions.description: Gets the tab that is selected in the specified window.

parameters.name: windowId
parameters.description: Defaults to the current window.

functions.name: getAllInWindow
functions.description: Gets details about all tabs in the specified window.

parameters.name: windowId
parameters.description: Defaults to the current window.

functions.name: create
functions.description: Creates a new tab.

windowId.description: The window in which to create the new tab. Defaults to the current window.

index.description: The position the tab should take in the window. The provided value is clamped to between zero and the number of tabs in the window.

url.description: The URL to initially navigate the tab to. Fully-qualified URLs must include a scheme (i.e., 'http://www.google.com', not 'www.google.com'). Relative URLs are relative to the current page within the extension. Defaults to the New Tab Page.

active.description: Whether the tab should become the active tab in the window. Does not affect whether the window is focused (see $(ref:windows.update)). Defaults to <var>true</var>.

selected.description: Whether the tab should become the selected tab in the window. Defaults to <var>true</var>

pinned.description: Whether the tab should be pinned. Defaults to <var>false</var>

openerTabId.description: The ID of the tab that opened this tab. If specified, the opener tab must be in the same window as the newly created tab.

parameters.name: tab
parameters.description: The created tab.

functions.name: duplicate
functions.description: Duplicates a tab.

parameters.name: tabId
parameters.description: The ID of the tab to duplicate.

parameters.name: tab
parameters.description: Details about the duplicated tab. The url, pendingUrl, title and favIconUrl properties are only included on the $(ref:tabs.Tab) object if the extension has the "tabs" permission or has host permissions for the page.

functions.name: query
functions.description: Gets all tabs that have the specified properties, or all tabs if no properties are specified.

active.description: Whether the tabs are active in their windows.

frozen.description: Whether the tabs are frozen. A frozen tab cannot execute tasks, including event handlers or timers. It is visible in the tab strip and its content is loaded in memory.  It is unfrozen on activation.

discarded.description: Whether the tabs are discarded. A discarded tab is one whose content has been unloaded from memory, but is still visible in the tab strip. Its content is reloaded the next time it is activated.

autoDiscardable.description: Whether the tabs can be discarded automatically by the browser when resources are low.

currentWindow.description: Whether the tabs are in the current window.

lastFocusedWindow.description: Whether the tabs are in the last focused window.

title.description: Match page titles against a pattern. This property is ignored if the extension does not have the "tabs" permission or host permissions for the page.

url.description: Match tabs against one or more URL patterns. Fragment identifiers are not matched. This property is ignored if the extension does not have the "tabs" permission or host permissions for the page.

groupId.description: The ID of the group that the tabs are in, or $(ref:tabGroups.TAB_GROUP_ID_NONE) for ungrouped tabs.

splitViewId.description: The ID of the Split View that the tabs are in, or $(ref:tabs.SPLIT_VIEW_ID_NONE) for tabs that aren't in a Split View.

windowId.description: The ID of the parent window, or $(ref:windows.WINDOW_ID_CURRENT) for the current window.

windowType.description: The type of window the tabs are in.

index.description: The position of the tabs within their windows.

functions.name: highlight
functions.description: Highlights the given tabs and focuses on the first of group. Will appear to do nothing if the specified tab is currently active.

windowId.description: The window that contains the tabs.

tabs.description: One or more tab indices to highlight.

parameters.name: window
parameters.description: Contains details about the window whose tabs were highlighted.

functions.name: update
functions.description: Modifies the properties of a tab. Properties that are not specified in <var>updateProperties</var> are not modified.

parameters.name: tabId
parameters.description: Defaults to the selected tab of the current window.

url.description: A URL to navigate the tab to. JavaScript URLs are not supported; use $(ref:scripting.executeScript) instead.

active.description: Whether the tab should be active. Does not affect whether the window is focused (see $(ref:windows.update)).

highlighted.description: Adds or removes the tab from the current selection.

selected.description: Whether the tab should be selected.

pinned.description: Whether the tab should be pinned.

muted.description: Whether the tab should be muted.

openerTabId.description: The ID of the tab that opened this tab. If specified, the opener tab must be in the same window as this tab.

autoDiscardable.description: Whether the tab should be discarded automatically by the browser when resources are low.

parameters.name: tab
parameters.description: Details about the updated tab. The url, pendingUrl, title and favIconUrl properties are only included on the $(ref:tabs.Tab) object if the extension has the "tabs" permission or has host permissions for the page.

functions.name: move
functions.description: Moves one or more tabs to a new position within its window, or to a new window. Note that tabs can only be moved to and from normal (window.type === "normal") windows.

parameters.name: tabIds
parameters.description: The tab ID or list of tab IDs to move.

windowId.description: Defaults to the window the tab is currently in.

index.description: The position to move the window to. Use -1 to place the tab at the end of the window.

parameters.name: tabs
parameters.description: Details about the moved tabs.

functions.name: reload
functions.description: Reload a tab.

parameters.name: tabId
parameters.description: The ID of the tab to reload; defaults to the selected tab of the current window.

bypassCache.description: Whether to bypass local caching. Defaults to false.

functions.name: remove
functions.description: Closes one or more tabs.

parameters.name: tabIds
parameters.description: The tab ID or list of tab IDs to close.

functions.name: group
functions.description: Adds one or more tabs to a specified group, or if no group is specified, adds the given tabs to a newly created group.

tabIds.description: The tab ID or list of tab IDs to add to the specified group.

groupId.description: The ID of the group to add the tabs to. If not specified, a new group will be created.

createProperties.description: Configurations for creating a group. Cannot be used if groupId is already specified.

windowId.description: The window of the new group. Defaults to the current window.

parameters.name: groupId
parameters.description: The ID of the group that the tabs were added to.

functions.name: ungroup
functions.description: Removes one or more tabs from their respective groups. If any groups become empty, they are deleted.

parameters.name: tabIds
parameters.description: The tab ID or list of tab IDs to remove from their respective groups.

functions.name: detectLanguage
functions.description: Detects the primary language of the content in a tab.

parameters.name: tabId
parameters.description: Defaults to the active tab of the current window.

parameters.name: language
parameters.description: An ISO language code such as en or fr. For a complete list of languages supported by this method, see kLanguageInfoTable. The second to fourth columns are checked and the first non-NULL value is returned, except for Simplified Chinese for which zh-CN is returned. For an unknown/undefined language, und is returned.

functions.name: captureVisibleTab
functions.description: Captures the visible area of the currently active tab in the specified window. In order to call this method, the extension must have either the <all_urls> permission or the activeTab permission. In addition to sites that extensions can normally access, this method allows extensions to capture sensitive sites that are otherwise restricted, including chrome:-scheme pages, other extensions' pages, and data: URLs. These sensitive sites can only be captured with the activeTab permission. File URLs may be captured only if the extension has been granted file access.

parameters.name: windowId
parameters.description: The target window. Defaults to the current window.

parameters.name: dataUrl
parameters.description: A data URL that encodes an image of the visible area of the captured tab. May be assigned to the 'src' property of an HTML img element for display.

functions.name: executeScript
functions.description: Injects JavaScript code into a page. For details, see the programmatic injection section of the content scripts doc.

parameters.name: tabId
parameters.description: The ID of the tab in which to run the script; defaults to the active tab of the current window.

parameters.name: details
parameters.description: Details of the script to run. Either the code or the file property must be set, but both may not be set at the same time.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Resolves after all the JavaScript has been executed.

parameters.name: result
parameters.description: The result of the script in every injected frame.

functions.name: insertCSS
functions.description: Injects CSS into a page. Styles inserted with this method can be removed with $(ref:scripting.removeCSS). For details, see the programmatic injection section of the content scripts doc.

parameters.name: tabId
parameters.description: The ID of the tab in which to insert the CSS; defaults to the active tab of the current window.

parameters.name: details
parameters.description: Details of the CSS text to insert. Either the code or the file property must be set, but both may not be set at the same time.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Resolves when all the CSS has been inserted.

functions.name: removeCSS
functions.description: Removes from a page CSS that was previously injected by a call to $(ref:scripting.insertCSS).

parameters.name: tabId
parameters.description: The ID of the tab from which to remove the CSS; defaults to the active tab of the current window.

parameters.name: details
parameters.description: Details of the CSS text to remove. Either the code or the file property must be set, but both may not be set at the same time.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Resolves when all the CSS has been removed.

functions.name: setZoom
functions.description: Zooms a specified tab.

parameters.name: tabId
parameters.description: The ID of the tab to zoom; defaults to the active tab of the current window.

parameters.name: zoomFactor
parameters.description: The new zoom factor. A value of 0 sets the tab to its current default zoom factor. Values greater than 0 specify a (possibly non-default) zoom factor for the tab.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Resolves after the zoom factor has been changed.

functions.name: getZoom
functions.description: Gets the current zoom factor of a specified tab.

parameters.name: tabId
parameters.description: The ID of the tab to get the current zoom factor from; defaults to the active tab of the current window.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Resolves with the tab's current zoom factor after it has been fetched.

parameters.name: zoomFactor
parameters.description: The tab's current zoom factor.

functions.name: setZoomSettings
functions.description: Sets the zoom settings for a specified tab, which define how zoom changes are handled. These settings are reset to defaults upon navigating the tab.

parameters.name: tabId
parameters.description: The ID of the tab to change the zoom settings for; defaults to the active tab of the current window.

parameters.name: zoomSettings
parameters.description: Defines how zoom changes are handled and at what scope.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Resolves after the zoom settings are changed.

functions.name: getZoomSettings
functions.description: Gets the current zoom settings of a specified tab.

parameters.name: tabId
parameters.description: The ID of the tab to get the current zoom settings from; defaults to the active tab of the current window.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Resolves with the tab's current zoom settings.

parameters.name: zoomSettings
parameters.description: The tab's current zoom settings.

functions.name: discard
functions.description: Discards a tab from memory. Discarded tabs are still visible on the tab strip and are reloaded when activated.

parameters.name: tabId
parameters.description: The ID of the tab to be discarded. If specified, the tab is discarded unless it is active or already discarded. If omitted, the browser discards the least important tab. This can fail if no discardable tabs exist.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Resolves after the operation is completed.

parameters.name: tab
parameters.description: The discarded tab, if it was successfully discarded; undefined otherwise.

functions.name: goForward
functions.description: Go foward to the next page, if one is available.

parameters.name: tabId
parameters.description: The ID of the tab to navigate forward; defaults to the selected tab of the current window.

functions.name: goBack
functions.description: Go back to the previous page, if one is available.

parameters.name: tabId
parameters.description: The ID of the tab to navigate back; defaults to the selected tab of the current window.

events.name: onCreated
events.description: Fired when a tab is created. Note that the tab's URL and tab group membership may not be set at the time this event is fired, but you can listen to onUpdated events so as to be notified when a URL is set or the tab is added to a tab group.

parameters.name: tab
parameters.description: Details of the tab that was created.

events.name: onUpdated
events.description: Fired when a tab is updated.

parameters.name: changeInfo
parameters.description: Lists the changes to the state of the tab that was updated.

url.description: The tab's URL if it has changed.

mutedInfo.description: The tab's new muted state and the reason for the change.

title.description: The tab's new title.

parameters.name: tab
parameters.description: Gives the state of the tab that was updated.

events.name: onMoved
events.description: Fired when a tab is moved within a window. Only one move event is fired, representing the tab the user directly moved. Move events are not fired for the other tabs that must move in response to the manually-moved tab. This event is not fired when a tab is moved between windows; for details, see $(ref:tabs.onDetached).

events.name: onSelectionChanged
events.description: Fires when the selected tab in a window changes.

parameters.name: tabId
parameters.description: The ID of the tab that has become active.

windowId.description: The ID of the window the selected tab changed inside of.

events.name: onActiveChanged
events.description: Fires when the selected tab in a window changes. Note that the tab's URL may not be set at the time this event fired, but you can listen to $(ref:tabs.onUpdated) events so as to be notified when a URL is set.

parameters.name: tabId
parameters.description: The ID of the tab that has become active.

windowId.description: The ID of the window the selected tab changed inside of.

events.name: onActivated
events.description: Fires when the active tab in a window changes. Note that the tab's URL may not be set at the time this event fired, but you can listen to onUpdated events so as to be notified when a URL is set.

tabId.description: The ID of the tab that has become active.

windowId.description: The ID of the window the active tab changed inside of.

events.name: onHighlightChanged
events.description: Fired when the highlighted or selected tabs in a window changes.

windowId.description: The window whose tabs changed.

tabIds.name: tabIds
tabIds.description: All highlighted tabs in the window.

events.name: onHighlighted
events.description: Fired when the highlighted or selected tabs in a window changes.

windowId.description: The window whose tabs changed.

tabIds.name: tabIds
tabIds.description: All highlighted tabs in the window.

events.name: onDetached
events.description: Fired when a tab is detached from a window; for example, because it was moved between windows.

events.name: onAttached
events.description: Fired when a tab is attached to a window; for example, because it was moved between windows.

events.name: onRemoved
events.description: Fired when a tab is closed.

windowId.description: The window whose tab is closed.

isWindowClosing.description: True when the tab was closed because its parent window was closed.

events.name: onReplaced
events.description: Fired when a tab is replaced with another tab due to prerendering or instant.

events.name: onZoomChange
events.description: Fired when a tab is zoomed.

types.description: Type of the output stream from which output came. When process exits, output type will be set to exit

functions.name: openTerminalProcess
functions.description: Starts new process.

parameters.name: processName
parameters.description: Name of the process to open. May be 'crosh' or 'vmshell'.

parameters.name: args
parameters.description: Command line arguments to pass to the process.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Resolves with the ID of the launched process. If no process was launched, the promise is rejected.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Id of the launched process.

functions.name: openVmshellProcess
functions.description: Starts new vmshell process.

parameters.name: args
parameters.description: Command line arguments to pass to vmshell.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Resolves with the ID of the launched vmshell process. If no process was launched, the promise is rejected.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Id of the launched vmshell process.

functions.name: closeTerminalProcess
functions.description: Closes previously opened process from either openTerminalProcess or openVmshellProcess.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique id of the process we want to close.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Resolves with the success of the function.

functions.name: sendInput
functions.description: Sends input that will be routed to stdin of the process with the specified id.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the process to which we want to send input.

parameters.name: input
parameters.description: Input we are sending to the process.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Resolves with success.

functions.name: onTerminalResize
functions.description: Notify the process with the id id that terminal window size has changed.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the process.

parameters.name: width
parameters.description: New window width (as column count).

parameters.name: height
parameters.description: New window height (as row count).

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Resolves with success.

functions.name: ackOutput
functions.description: Called from |onProcessOutput| when the event is dispatched to terminal extension. Observing the terminal process output will be paused after |onProcessOutput| is dispatched until this method is called.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the process to which |onProcessOutput| was dispatched.

functions.name: openWindow
functions.description: Open a Terminal app window/tab

url.description: The url for the new Terminal window.

asTab.description: Instead of openning a new window, open it as a new tab in the current app window.

functions.name: openOptionsPage
functions.description: Open the Terminal Settings page.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Promise that resolves when complete.

functions.name: openSettingsSubpage
functions.description: Open the System Settings at the specified subpage.

parameters.name: subpage
parameters.description: Name of subpage to open.  Currently only 'crostini' supported.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Promise that resolves when complete.

functions.name: getOSInfo
functions.description: Returns an object containing info about ChromeOS settings that affect the Terminal, e.g. which feature flags are enabled.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Resolves with the info object.

parameters.name: info

tast.description: True if tast extension is installed.

parameters.description: Information about which features are enabled.

functions.name: getPrefs
functions.description: Returns specified pref values, ignoring any not in allowlist.

parameters.name: paths
parameters.description: Paths of prefs to fetch.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Resolves with prefs.

parameters.name: prefs
parameters.description: prefs keyed by paths.

functions.name: setPrefs
functions.description: Sets specified prefs, ignoring any not in allowlist.

parameters.name: prefs
parameters.description: Prefs to update keyed by paths.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Resolves when complete.

events.name: onProcessOutput
events.description: Fired when an opened process writes something to its output. Observing further process output will be blocked until |ackOutput| for the terminal is called. Internally, first event argument will be ID of the tab that contains terminal instance for which this event is intended. This argument will be stripped before passing the event to the extension.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Id of the process from which the output came.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Type of the output stream from which output came. When process exits, output type will be set to exit

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: Data that was written to the output stream.

events.name: onPrefChanged
events.description: Fired when pref changes.

parameters.name: prefs
parameters.description: Prefs keyed by paths.

topSites.description: Use the chrome.topSites API to access the top sites (i.e. most visited sites) that are displayed on the new tab page. These do not include shortcuts customized by the user.

types.description: An object encapsulating a most visited URL, such as the default shortcuts on the new tab page.

url.description: The most visited URL.

title.description: The title of the page

functions.name: get
functions.description: Gets a list of top sites.

tts.description: Use the chrome.tts API to play synthesized text-to-speech (TTS). See also the related ttsEngine API, which allows an extension to implement a speech engine.

types.deprecated: Gender is deprecated and is ignored.

types.description: The speech options for the TTS engine.

enqueue.description: If true, enqueues this utterance if TTS is already in progress. If false (the default), interrupts any current speech and flushes the speech queue before speaking this new utterance.

voiceName.description: The name of the voice to use for synthesis. If empty, uses any available voice.

extensionId.description: The extension ID of the speech engine to use, if known.

lang.description: The language to be used for synthesis, in the form language-region. Examples: 'en', 'en-US', 'en-GB', 'zh-CN'.

gender.deprecated: Gender is deprecated and will be ignored.
gender.description: Gender of voice for synthesized speech.

rate.description: Speaking rate relative to the default rate for this voice. 1.0 is the default rate, normally around 180 to 220 words per minute. 2.0 is twice as fast, and 0.5 is half as fast.
