Values below 0.1 or above 10.0 are strictly disallowed, but many voices will constrain the minimum and maximum rates further—for example a particular voice may not actually speak faster than 3 times normal even if you specify a value larger than 3.0.

pitch.description: Speaking pitch between 0 and 2 inclusive, with 0 being lowest and 2 being highest. 1.0 corresponds to a voice's default pitch.

volume.description: Speaking volume between 0 and 1 inclusive, with 0 being lowest and 1 being highest, with a default of 1.0.

requiredEventTypes.description: The TTS event types the voice must support.

desiredEventTypes.description: The TTS event types that you are interested in listening to. If missing, all event types may be sent.

onEvent.description: This function is called with events that occur in the process of speaking the utterance.

parameters.name: event
parameters.description: The update event from the text-to-speech engine indicating the status of this utterance.

types.description: An event from the TTS engine to communicate the status of an utterance.

type.description: The type can be start as soon as speech has started, word when a word boundary is reached, sentence when a sentence boundary is reached, marker when an SSML mark element is reached, end when the end of the utterance is reached, interrupted when the utterance is stopped or interrupted before reaching the end, cancelled when it's removed from the queue before ever being synthesized, or error when any other error occurs. When pausing speech, a pause event is fired if a particular utterance is paused in the middle, and resume if an utterance resumes speech. Note that pause and resume events may not fire if speech is paused in-between utterances.

charIndex.description: The index of the current character in the utterance. For word events, the event fires at the end of one word and before the beginning of the next. The charIndex represents a point in the text at the beginning of the next word to be spoken.

errorMessage.description: The error description, if the event type is error.

srcId.description: An ID unique to the calling function's context so that events can get routed back to the correct tts.speak call.

isFinalEvent.description: True if this is the final event that will be sent to this handler.

length.description: The length of the next part of the utterance. For example, in a word event, this is the length of the word which will be spoken next. It will be set to -1 if not set by the speech engine.

types.description: A description of a voice available for speech synthesis.

lang.description: The language that this voice supports, in the form language-region. Examples: 'en', 'en-US', 'en-GB', 'zh-CN'.

gender.deprecated: Gender is deprecated and will be ignored.

remote.description: If true, the synthesis engine is a remote network resource. It may be higher latency and may incur bandwidth costs.

extensionId.description: The ID of the extension providing this voice.

eventTypes.description: All of the callback event types that this voice is capable of sending.

functions.name: speak
functions.description: Speaks text using a text-to-speech engine.

parameters.name: utterance
parameters.description: The text to speak, either plain text or a complete, well-formed SSML document. Speech engines that do not support SSML will strip away the tags and speak the text. The maximum length of the text is 32,768 characters.

parameters.name: options
parameters.description: The speech options.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Resolves right away, before speech finishes. If an error occurs, the promise will be rejected. Use options.onEvent to get more detailed feedback.

functions.name: stop
functions.description: Stops any current speech and flushes the queue of any pending utterances. In addition, if speech was paused, it will now be un-paused for the next call to speak.

functions.name: pause
functions.description: Pauses speech synthesis, potentially in the middle of an utterance. A call to resume or stop will un-pause speech.

functions.name: resume
functions.description: If speech was paused, resumes speaking where it left off.

functions.name: isSpeaking
functions.description: Checks whether the engine is currently speaking. On Mac OS X, the result is true whenever the system speech engine is speaking, even if the speech wasn't initiated by Chrome.

parameters.name: speaking
parameters.description: True if speaking, false otherwise.

functions.name: getVoices
functions.description: Gets an array of all available voices.

parameters.name: voices
parameters.description: Array of $(ref:tts.TtsVoice) objects representing the available voices for speech synthesis.

events.name: onEvent

parameters.name: event
parameters.description: The event from the text-to-speech engine indicating the status of this utterance.

events.description: Used to pass events back to the function calling speak().

events.name: onVoicesChanged
events.description: Called when the list of $(ref:tts.TtsVoice) that would be returned by getVoices has changed.

ttsEngine.description: Use the chrome.ttsEngine API to implement a text-to-speech(TTS) engine using an extension. If your extension registers using this API, it will receive events containing an utterance to be spoken and other parameters when any extension or Chrome App uses the tts API to generate speech. Your extension can then use any available web technology to synthesize and output the speech, and send events back to the calling function to report the status.

types.description: Type of requestor.
Identifier for the client requesting status.

id.description: Client making a language management request. For an extension, this is the unique extension ID. For Chrome features, this is the human-readable name of the feature.

types.deprecated: Gender is deprecated and will be ignored.

types.description: Options for uninstalling a given language.

uninstallImmediately.description: True if the TTS client wants the language to be immediately uninstalled. The engine may choose whether or when to uninstall the language, based on this parameter and the requestor information. If false, it may use other criteria, such as recent usage, to determine when to uninstall.

types.description: The install status of a voice.
Install status of a language.

lang.description: Language string in the form of language code-region code, where the region may be omitted. Examples are en, en-AU, zh-CH.

error.description: Detail about installation failures. Optionally populated if the language failed to install.

types.description: Options specified to the tts.speak() method.

voiceName.description: The name of the voice to use for synthesis.

lang.description: The language to be used for synthesis, in the form language-region. Examples: 'en', 'en-US', 'en-GB', 'zh-CN'.

gender.deprecated: Gender is deprecated and will be ignored.
gender.description: Gender of voice for synthesized speech.

rate.description: Speaking rate relative to the default rate for this voice. 1.0 is the default rate, normally around 180 to 220 words per minute. 2.0 is twice as fast, and 0.5 is half as fast. This value is guaranteed to be between 0.1 and 10.0, inclusive. When a voice does not support this full range of rates, don't return an error. Instead, clip the rate to the range the voice supports.

pitch.description: Speaking pitch between 0 and 2 inclusive, with 0 being lowest and 2 being highest. 1.0 corresponds to this voice's default pitch.

volume.description: Speaking volume between 0 and 1 inclusive, with 0 being lowest and 1 being highest, with a default of 1.0.

types.description: Contains the audio stream format expected to be produced by an engine.

sampleRate.description: The sample rate expected in an audio buffer.

bufferSize.description: The number of samples within an audio buffer.

types.description: Parameters containing an audio buffer and associated data.

audioBuffer.description: The audio buffer from the text-to-speech engine. It should have length exactly audioStreamOptions.bufferSize and encoded as mono, at audioStreamOptions.sampleRate, and as linear pcm, 32-bit signed float i.e. the Float32Array type in javascript.

charIndex.description: The character index associated with this audio buffer.

isLastBuffer.description: True if this audio buffer is the last for the text being spoken.

functions.name: updateVoices
functions.description: Called by an engine to update its list of voices. This list overrides any voices declared in this extension's manifest.

parameters.name: voices
parameters.description: Array of $(ref:tts.TtsVoice) objects representing the available voices for speech synthesis.

functions.name: sendTtsEvent
functions.description: Routes a TTS event from a speech engine to a client.

parameters.name: event
parameters.description: The update event from the text-to-speech engine indicating the status of this utterance.

functions.name: sendTtsAudio
functions.description: Routes TTS audio from a speech engine to a client.

parameters.name: audio
parameters.description: An audio buffer from the text-to-speech engine.

functions.name: updateLanguage
functions.description: Called by an engine when a language install is attempted, and when a language is uninstalled. Also called in response to a status request from a client. When a voice is installed or uninstalled, the engine should also call ttsEngine.updateVoices to register the voice.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: The install status of the language.

events.name: onSpeak
events.description: Called when the user makes a call to tts.speak() and one of the voices from this extension's manifest is the first to match the options object.

parameters.name: utterance
parameters.description: The text to speak, specified as either plain text or an SSML document. If your engine does not support SSML, you should strip out all XML markup and synthesize only the underlying text content. The value of this parameter is guaranteed to be no more than 32,768 characters. If this engine does not support speaking that many characters at a time, the utterance should be split into smaller chunks and queued internally without returning an error.

parameters.name: options
parameters.description: Options specified to the tts.speak() method.

parameters.name: sendTtsEvent
parameters.description: Call this function with events that occur in the process of speaking the utterance.

parameters.name: event
parameters.description: The event from the text-to-speech engine indicating the status of this utterance.

events.name: onSpeakWithAudioStream
events.description: Called when the user makes a call to tts.speak() and one of the voices from this extension's manifest is the first to match the options object. Differs from ttsEngine.onSpeak in that Chrome provides audio playback services and handles dispatching tts events.

parameters.name: utterance
parameters.description: The text to speak, specified as either plain text or an SSML document. If your engine does not support SSML, you should strip out all XML markup and synthesize only the underlying text content. The value of this parameter is guaranteed to be no more than 32,768 characters. If this engine does not support speaking that many characters at a time, the utterance should be split into smaller chunks and queued internally without returning an error.

parameters.name: options
parameters.description: Options specified to the tts.speak() method.

parameters.name: audioStreamOptions
parameters.description: Contains the audio stream format expected to be produced by this engine.

parameters.name: sendTtsAudio
parameters.description: Call this function with audio that occur in the process of speaking the utterance.

parameters.name: audioBufferParams
parameters.description: Parameters containing an audio buffer and associated data.

parameters.name: sendError
parameters.description: Call this function to indicate an error with rendering this utterance.

parameters.name: errorMessage
parameters.description: A string describing the error.

events.name: onStop
events.description: Fired when a call is made to tts.stop and this extension may be in the middle of speaking. If an extension receives a call to onStop and speech is already stopped, it should do nothing (not raise an error). If speech is in the paused state, this should cancel the paused state.

events.name: onPause
events.description: Optional: if an engine supports the pause event, it should pause the current utterance being spoken, if any, until it receives a resume event or stop event. Note that a stop event should also clear the paused state.

events.name: onResume
events.description: Optional: if an engine supports the pause event, it should also support the resume event, to continue speaking the current utterance, if any. Note that a stop event should also clear the paused state.

events.name: onInstallLanguageRequest
events.description: Fired when a TTS client requests to install a new language. The engine should attempt to download and install the language, and call ttsEngine.updateLanguage with the result. On success, the engine should also call ttsEngine.updateVoices to register the newly available voices.

parameters.name: requestor
parameters.description: Client requesting a language install.

parameters.name: lang
parameters.description: Language string to be installed in the form language code-region code, where the region may be omitted. Examples are en, en-AU, zh-CH.

events.name: onUninstallLanguageRequest
events.description: Fired when a TTS client indicates a language is no longer needed.

parameters.name: requestor
parameters.description: Client requesting language removal.

parameters.name: uninstallOptions
parameters.description: Options for the language removal.

events.name: onLanguageStatusRequest
events.description: Fired when a TTS client requests the install status of a language.

parameters.name: requestor
parameters.description: Client requesting status.

parameters.name: lang
parameters.description: Language string in the form language code-region code, where the region may be omitted. Examples are en, en-AU, zh-CH.

wallpaper.description: Use the chrome.wallpaper API to change the ChromeOS wallpaper.

types.description: The supported wallpaper layouts.

functions.name: setWallpaper
functions.description: Sets wallpaper to the image at url or wallpaperData with the specified layout

data.description: The jpeg or png encoded wallpaper image as an ArrayBuffer.

url.description: The URL of the wallpaper to be set (can be relative).

filename.description: The file name of the saved wallpaper.

thumbnail.description: True if a 128x60 thumbnail should be generated. Layout and ratio are not supported yet.

parameters.name: thumbnail
parameters.description: The jpeg encoded wallpaper thumbnail. It is generated by resizing the wallpaper to 128x60.

webNavigation.description: Use the chrome.webNavigation API to receive notifications about the status of navigation requests in-flight.

types.description: Cause of the navigation. The same transition types as defined in the history API are used. These are the same transition types as defined in the history API except with "start_page" in place of "auto_toplevel" (for backwards compatibility).

functions.name: getFrame
functions.description: Retrieves information about the given frame. A frame refers to an <iframe> or a <frame> of a web page and is identified by a tab ID and a frame ID.

parameters.name: details
parameters.description: Information about the frame to retrieve information about.

tabId.description: The ID of the tab in which the frame is.

processId.deprecated: Frames are now uniquely identified by their tab ID and frame ID; the process ID is no longer needed and therefore ignored.
processId.description: The ID of the process that runs the renderer for this tab.

frameId.description: The ID of the frame in the given tab.

documentId.description: The UUID of the document. If the frameId and/or tabId are provided they will be validated to match the document found by provided document ID.

parameters.name: details
parameters.description: Information about the requested frame, null if the specified frame ID and/or tab ID are invalid.

errorOccurred.description: True if the last navigation in this frame was interrupted by an error, i.e. the onErrorOccurred event fired.

url.description: The URL currently associated with this frame, if the frame identified by the frameId existed at one point in the given tab. The fact that an URL is associated with a given frameId does not imply that the corresponding frame still exists.

parentFrameId.description: The ID of the parent frame, or -1 if this is the main frame.

documentId.description: A UUID of the document loaded.

parentDocumentId.description: A UUID of the parent document owning this frame. This is not set if there is no parent.

documentLifecycle.description: The lifecycle the document is in.

frameType.description: The type of frame the navigation occurred in.

functions.name: getAllFrames
functions.description: Retrieves information about all frames of a given tab.

parameters.name: details
parameters.description: Information about the tab to retrieve all frames from.

tabId.description: The ID of the tab.

parameters.name: details
parameters.description: A list of frames in the given tab, null if the specified tab ID is invalid.

errorOccurred.description: True if the last navigation in this frame was interrupted by an error, i.e. the onErrorOccurred event fired.

processId.description: The ID of the process that runs the renderer for this frame.

frameId.description: The ID of the frame. 0 indicates that this is the main frame; a positive value indicates the ID of a subframe.

parentFrameId.description: The ID of the parent frame, or -1 if this is the main frame.

url.description: The URL currently associated with this frame.

documentId.description: A UUID of the document loaded.

parentDocumentId.description: A UUID of the parent document owning this frame. This is not set if there is no parent.

documentLifecycle.description: The lifecycle the document is in.

frameType.description: The type of frame the navigation occurred in.

events.name: onBeforeNavigate
events.description: Fired when a navigation is about to occur.

filters.name: url
filters.description: Conditions that the URL being navigated to must satisfy. The 'schemes' and 'ports' fields of UrlFilter are ignored for this event.

tabId.description: The ID of the tab in which the navigation is about to occur.

processId.deprecated: The processId is no longer set for this event, since the process which will render the resulting document is not known until onCommit.

frameId.description: 0 indicates the navigation happens in the tab content window; a positive value indicates navigation in a subframe. Frame IDs are unique for a given tab and process.

parentFrameId.description: The ID of the parent frame, or -1 if this is the main frame.

timeStamp.description: The time when the browser was about to start the navigation, in milliseconds since the epoch.

parentDocumentId.description: A UUID of the parent document owning this frame. This is not set if there is no parent.

documentLifecycle.description: The lifecycle the document is in.

frameType.description: The type of frame the navigation occurred in.

events.name: onCommitted
events.description: Fired when a navigation is committed. The document (and the resources it refers to, such as images and subframes) might still be downloading, but at least part of the document has been received from the server and the browser has decided to switch to the new document.

filters.description: Conditions that the URL being navigated to must satisfy. The 'schemes' and 'ports' fields of UrlFilter are ignored for this event.

documentLifecycle.description: The lifecycle the document is in.

frameType.description: The type of frame the navigation occurred in.

enum.description: Empty string, used to indicate success by beginInstallWithManifest3

enum.name: success
enum.description: Installation was successful

enum.name: user_gesture_required
enum.description: Function was called without a user gesture

enum.name: unknown_error
enum.description: An unknown error occured

enum.name: feature_disabled
enum.description: The requested feature is not available

enum.name: unsupported_extension_type
enum.description: The requested feature is not availabe for this type of extension

enum.name: missing_dependencies
enum.description: There were unsatisfied dependencies, such as shared modules

enum.name: install_error
enum.description: An error occured during installation

enum.name: user_cancelled
enum.description: The user canceled the operation

enum.name: invalid_id
enum.description: An invalid Chrome Web Store item ID was provided

enum.name: blacklisted
enum.description: The given extension is blacklisted

enum.name: blocked_by_policy
enum.description: The given extension is blocked by management policy

enum.name: install_in_progress
enum.description: An installation of the same extension is already in progress

enum.name: launch_in_progress
enum.description: A launch of the same extension is already in progress

enum.name: manifest_error
enum.description: Parsing of the extension manifest failed

enum.name: icon_error
enum.description: Failed to retrieve the extension's icon from the Web Store, or the icon was invalid

enum.name: invalid_icon_url
enum.description: An invalid icon URL was provided

enum.name: already_installed
enum.description: The extension is already installed

enum.name: blocked_for_child_account
enum.description: The user is signed in to a child account, and not allowed to perform the operation

types.description: Whether the API call succeeded, or the reason for failure.

enum.name: can_request
enum.description: The extension install request feature is enabled and the extension can be requested.

enum.name: request_pending
enum.description: The extension install request has been sent and is waiting to be reviewed.

enum.name: blocked_by_policy
enum.description: The extension cannot be installed due to enterprise policy.

enum.name: installable
enum.description: The extension can be installed.

enum.name: enabled
enum.description: The extension has been installed already and it's enabled.

enum.name: disabled
enum.description: The extension has been installed already but it's disabled.

enum.name: terminated
enum.description: The extension has been installed already but it's terminated.

enum.name: blacklisted
enum.description: The extension has been blacklisted.

enum.name: custodian_approval_required
enum.description: The existing extension cannot be enabled due to lack of custodian approval for supervised users.

enum.name: custodian_approval_required_for_installation
enum.description: The extension cannot be installed without getting custodian approval for supervised users.

enum.name: force_installed
enum.description: The extension is force installed or recommended by policy.

enum.name: deprecated_manifest_version
enum.description: The extension uses a deprecated manifest version that is no longer supported by Chrome.

enum.name: corrupted
enum.description: The extension has been installed already but it's corrupted.

enum.name: CHROME_ENTERPRISE_CORE
enum.description: Show the promotion banner for Chrome Enterprise Core

enum.name: CHROME_ENTERPRISE_PREMIUM
enum.description: Show the promotion banner for Chrome Enterprise Premium

enum.name: PROMOTION_TYPE_UNSPECIFIED
enum.description: Do not show the promotion banner

functions.name: install
functions.description: Installs the extension corresponding to the given id

parameters.name: expected_id
parameters.description: The id of the extension to install.

functions.name: beginInstallWithManifest3
functions.description: Initiates the install process for the given extension.

id.description: The id of the extension to be installed.

manifest.description: A string with the contents of the extension's manifest.json file. During the install process, the browser will check that the downloaded extension's manifest matches what was passed in here.

iconUrl.desciption: A URL for the image to display in the confirmation dialog

localizedName.description: A string to use instead of the raw value of the 'name' key from manifest.json.

locale.description: The name of the locale used for generating localizedName. This should be the name of one of the directories in the _locales folder of the extension, or the default_locale setting from the manifest.

appInstallBubble.description: A flag to change the UI we show when an app is installed - a value of true means to show a bubble pointing at the new tab button (instead of the default behavior of opening the new tab page and animating the app icon).

enableLauncher.description: A flag to cause the app launcher to be installed before installing the extension, if it isn't installed already.

authuser.description: The authuser index to be included with CRX download requests in multi-login sessions.

esbAllowlist.description: A flag to specify if the extension is included in the ESB allowlist.

returns_async.name: callback
returns_async.description: Resolves when the user has either accepted/rejected the dialog, or rejects if some error occurred (such as invalid manifest or icon image data).

parameters.name: result
parameters.description: A string result code, which will be empty upon success. The possible values in the case of errors include 'unknown_error', 'user_cancelled', 'manifest_error', 'icon_error', 'invalid_id', 'permission_denied', 'invalid_icon_url' and 'already_installed'.

parameters.name: expected_id
parameters.description: The id of the extension to be installed. This should match a previous call to beginInstallWithManifest3.

functions.name: getBrowserLogin
functions.description: Returns the logged-in sync user login if there is one, or the empty string otherwise.

functions.name: getStoreLogin
functions.description: Returns the previous value set by setStoreLogin, or the empty string if there is none.

functions.name: setStoreLogin
functions.description: Sets a preference value with the store login.

functions.name: getWebGLStatus
functions.description: Invokes a callback that returns whether WebGL is blacklisted or not.

functions.name: getIsLauncherEnabled
functions.description: Returns whether the apps launcher is enabled or not.

functions.name: isInIncognitoMode
functions.description: Returns whether the browser is in incognito mode or not.

functions.name: isPendingCustodianApproval
functions.description: Checks if an extension installed on a Supervised User profile is pending custodian approval.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The extension id of the extension to be checked.

functions.name: getReferrerChain
functions.description: Returns a base-64 encoded referrer chain leading to the webstore page. Should only be used for extension anti-abuse purposes.

functions.name: getExtensionStatus
functions.description: Returns the install status of the extension.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the extension

parameters.name: manifest
parameters.description: The manifest of the extension

functions.name: getFullChromeVersion
functions.description: Returns the full version number, e.g. '123.0.6312.112'.

functions.name: getMV2DeprecationStatus
functions.description: Returns the current state of the MV2 deprecation experiments.

functions.name: shouldShowEnterprisePromotionBanner
functions.description: Returns whether the enterprise promotion banner should be shown.

functions.name: logEnterprisePromoShown
functions.description: Logs number of times the enterprise promotion banner was displayed.

functions.name: onEnterprisePromoClick
functions.description: Sets the promotion preference to dismissed and records UMA histogram on promotion click.

webviewTag.description: Use the webview tag to actively load live content from the web over the network and embed it in your Chrome App. Your app can control the appearance of the webview and interact with the web content, initiate navigations in an embedded web page, react to error events that happen within it, and more (see Usage).

types.description: Options that determine what data should be cleared by clearData.

since.description: Clear data accumulated on or after this date, represented in milliseconds since the epoch (accessible via the getTime method of the JavaScript Date object). If absent, defaults to 0 (which would remove all browsing data).

types.description: A set of data types. Missing properties are interpreted as false.

cache.description:
Since Chrome 43.
The browser's cache. Note: when removing data, this clears the entire cache; it is not limited to the range you specify.

types.description: The different contexts a menu can appear in. Specifying 'all' is equivalent to the combination of all other contexts.
Details of the script or CSS to inject. Either the code or the file property must be set, but both may not be set at the same time.

code.description:
JavaScript or CSS code to inject.

Warning:
Be careful using the code parameter. Incorrect use of it may open your app to cross site scripting attacks.

file.description: JavaScript or CSS file to inject.

types.description: The type of injection item: code or a set of files.

code.description: JavaScript code or CSS to be injected into matching pages.

files.description: The list of JavaScript or CSS files to be injected into matching pages. These are injected in the order they appear in this array.

types.description: Details of the content script to inject. Refer to the content scripts documentation for more details.

name.description: The name of the content script to inject.

matches.description: Specifies which pages this content script will be injected into.

exclude_matches.description: Excludes pages that this content script would otherwise be injected into.

match_about_blank.description: Whether to insert the content script on about:blank and about:srcdoc. Content scripts will only be injected on pages when their inherit URL is matched by one of the declared patterns in the matches field. The inherit URL is the URL of the document that created the frame or window. Content scripts cannot be inserted in sandboxed frames.

css.description: The CSS code or a list of CSS files to be injected into matching pages. These are injected in the order they appear, before any DOM is constructed or displayed for the page.

js.description: The JavaScript code or a list of JavaScript files to be injected into matching pages. These are injected in the order they appear.

run_at.description: The soonest that the JavaScript or CSS will be injected into the tab. Defaults to "document_idle".

all_frames.description: If all_frames is true, this implies that the JavaScript or CSS should be injected into all frames of current page. By default, all_frames is false and the JavaScript or CSS is only injected into the top frame.

include_globs.description: Applied after matches to include only those URLs that also match this glob. Intended to emulate the @include Greasemonkey keyword.

exclude_globs.description: Applied after matches to exclude URLs that match this glob. Intended to emulate the @exclude Greasemonkey keyword.

type.description: The type of menu item. Defaults to 'normal' if not specified.

id.description: The unique ID to assign to this item. Mandatory for event pages. Cannot be the same as another ID for this extension.

title.description: The text to be displayed in the item; this is required unless type is 'separator'. When the context is 'selection', you can use %s within the string to show the selected text. For example, if this parameter's value is "Translate '%s' to Pig Latin" and the user selects the word "cool", the context menu item for the selection is "Translate 'cool' to Pig Latin".

checked.description: The initial state of a checkbox or radio item: true for selected and false for unselected. Only one radio item can be selected at a time in a given group of radio items.

contexts.description: List of contexts this menu item will appear in. Defaults to ['page'] if not specified.

onclick.description: A function that will be called back when the menu item is clicked.

parameters.name: info
parameters.description: Information about the item clicked and the context where the click happened.

parentId.description: The ID of a parent menu item; this makes the item a child of a previously added item.

documentUrlPatterns.description: Lets you restrict the item to apply only to documents whose URL matches one of the given patterns. (This applies to frames as well.) For details on the format of a pattern, see Match Patterns.

targetUrlPatterns.description: Similar to documentUrlPatterns, but lets you filter based on the src attribute of img/audio/video tags and the href of anchor tags.

enabled.description: Whether this context menu item is enabled or disabled. Defaults to true.

title.description: The text to be displayed in the item

functions.name: postMessage
functions.description:
Posts a message to the embedded web content as long as the embedded content is displaying a page from the target origin. This method is available once the page has completed loading. Listen for the contentload event and then call the method.

The guest will be able to send replies to the embedder by posting message to event.source on the message event it receives.

This API is identical to the HTML5 postMessage API for communication between web pages. The embedder may listen for replies by adding a message event listener to its own frame.

parameters.name: message
parameters.description: Message object to send to the guest.

parameters.name: targetOrigin
parameters.description: Specifies what the origin of the guest window must be for the event to be dispatched.

types.description: Interface attached to dialog DOM events.

functions.name: ok
functions.description: Accept the dialog. Equivalent to clicking OK in an alert, confirm, or prompt dialog.

parameters.name: response
parameters.description: The response string to provide to the guest when accepting a prompt dialog.

functions.name: cancel
functions.description: Reject the dialog. Equivalent to clicking Cancel in a confirm or prompt dialog.

types.description: Contains all of the results of the find request.

activeMatchOrdinal.description: The ordinal number of the current match.

selectionRect.description: Describes a rectangle around the active match in screen coordinates.

backward.description: Flag to find matches in reverse order. The default value is false.

matchCase.description: Flag to match with case-sensitivity. The default value is false.
