types.description:
Describes a rectangle in screen coordinates.

The containment semantics are array-like; that is, the coordinate (left, top) is considered to be contained by the rectangle, but the coordinate (left + width, top) is not.

left.description: Distance from the left edge of the screen to the left edge of the rectangle.

top.description: Distance from the top edge of the screen to the top edge of the rectangle.

types.description:
Interface which provides access to webRequest events on the guest page. See the chrome.webRequest extensions API for details on webRequest life cycle and related concepts. Note: The chrome.webRequest.onActionIgnored event is not supported for webviews.

To illustrate how usage differs from the extensions webRequest API, consider the following example code which blocks any guest requests for URLs which match *://www.evil.com/*:

webview.request.onBeforeRequest.addListener(
  function(details) { return {cancel: true}; },
  {urls: ["*://www.evil.com/*"]},
  ["blocking"]);

Additionally, this interface supports declarative webRequest rules through onRequest and onMessage events. See declarativeWebRequest for API details.

Note that conditions and actions for declarative webview webRequests should be instantiated from their chrome.webViewRequest.* counterparts. The following example code declaratively blocks all requests to "example.com" on the webview myWebview:

var rule = {
  conditions: [
    new chrome.webViewRequest.RequestMatcher({ url: { hostSuffix: 'example.com' } })
  ],
  actions: [ new chrome.webViewRequest.CancelRequest() ]
};
myWebview.request.onRequest.addRules([rule]);
Defines the how zooming is handled in the webview.

enum.name: per-origin
enum.description: Zoom changes will persist in the zoomed page's origin, i.e. all other webviews in the same partition that are navigated to that same origin will be zoomed as well. Moreover, per-origin zoom changes are saved with the origin, meaning that when navigating to other pages in the same origin, they will all be zoomed to the same zoom factor.

enum.name: per-view
enum.description: Zoom changes only take effect in this webview, and zoom changes in other webviews will not affect the zooming of this webview. Also, per-view zoom changes are reset on navigation; navigating a webview will always load pages with their per-origin zoom factors (within the scope of the partition).

enum.name: disabled
enum.description: Disables all zooming in the webview. The content will revert to the default zoom level, and all attempted zoom changes will be ignored.

types.description: Determines what to do with the active match after the find session has ended. clear will clear the highlighting over the active match; keep will keep the active match highlighted; activate will keep the active match highlighted and simulate a user click on that match. The default action is keep.
The type of modal dialog requested by the guest.
String indicating the reason for the exit.

String indicating what type of abort occurred. This string is not guaranteed to remain backwards compatible between releases. You must not parse and act based upon its content. It is also possible that, in some cases, an error not listed here could be reported.
The requested disposition of the new window.
The type of permission being requested.

functions.name: getAudioState
functions.description: Queries audio state.

functions.name: setAudioMuted
functions.description: Sets audio mute state of the webview.

parameters.name: mute
parameters.description: Mute audio value

functions.name: isAudioMuted
functions.description: Queries whether audio is muted.

functions.name: captureVisibleRegion
functions.description: Captures the visible region of the webview.

parameters.name: dataUrl
parameters.description: A data URL which encodes an image of the visible area of the captured tab. May be assigned to the 'src' property of an HTML Image element for display.

functions.name: addContentScripts
functions.description:
Adds content script injection rules to the webview. When the webview navigates to a page matching one or more rules, the associated scripts will be injected. You can programmatically add rules or update existing rules.

The following example adds two rules to the webview: 'myRule' and 'anotherRule'.

webview.addContentScripts([
  {
    name: 'myRule',
    matches: ['http://www.foo.com/*'],
    css: { files: ['mystyles.css'] },
    js: { files: ['jquery.js', 'myscript.js'] },
    run_at: 'document_start'
  },
  {
    name: 'anotherRule',
    matches: ['http://www.bar.com/*'],
    js: { code: "document.body.style.backgroundColor = 'red';" },
    run_at: 'document_end'
  }]);
 ...

// Navigates webview.
webview.src = 'http://www.foo.com';

You can defer addContentScripts call until you needs to inject scripts.

The following example shows how to overwrite an existing rule.

webview.addContentScripts([{
    name: 'rule',
    matches: ['http://www.foo.com/*'],
    js: { files: ['scriptA.js'] },
    run_at: 'document_start'}]);

// Do something.
webview.src = 'http://www.foo.com/*';
 ...
// Overwrite 'rule' defined before.
webview.addContentScripts([{
    name: 'rule',
    matches: ['http://www.bar.com/*'],
    js: { files: ['scriptB.js'] },
    run_at: 'document_end'}]);

If webview has been naviagted to the origin (e.g., foo.com) and calls webview.addContentScripts to add 'myRule', you need to wait for next navigation to make the scripts injected. If you want immediate injection, executeScript will do the right thing.

Rules are preserved even if the guest process crashes or is killed or even if the webview is reparented.

Refer to the content scripts documentation for more details.

parameters.name: contentScriptList
parameters.description: Details of the content scripts to add.

functions.name: back
functions.description: Navigates backward one history entry if possible. Equivalent to go(-1).

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: Resolves after the navigation has either failed or completed successfully.

parameters.name: success
parameters.description: Indicates whether the navigation was successful.

functions.name: canGoBack
functions.description: Indicates whether or not it is possible to navigate backward through history. The state of this function is cached, and updated before each loadcommit, so the best place to call it is on loadcommit.

functions.name: canGoForward
functions.description: Indicates whether or not it is possible to navigate forward through history. The state of this function is cached, and updated before each loadcommit, so the best place to call it is on loadcommit.

functions.name: clearData
functions.description: Clears browsing data for the webview partition.

parameters.name: options
parameters.description: Options determining which data to clear.

parameters.name: types
parameters.description: The types of data to be cleared.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: Called after the data has been successfully cleared.

functions.name: executeScript
functions.description:
Injects JavaScript code into the guest page.

The following sample code uses script injection to set the guest page's background color to red:

webview.executeScript({ code: "document.body.style.backgroundColor = 'red'" });

parameters.name: details
parameters.description: Details of the script to run.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: Called after all the JavaScript has been executed.

parameters.name: result
parameters.description: The result of the script in every injected frame.

functions.name: find
functions.description: Initiates a find-in-page request.

parameters.name: searchText
parameters.description: The string to find in the page.

parameters.name: options
parameters.description: Options for the find request.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: Called after all find results have been returned for this find request.

parameters.name: results
parameters.description: Contains all of the results of the find request. results can be omitted if it is not utilized in the callback function body; for example, if the callback is only used to discern when the find request has completed.

functions.name: forward
functions.description: Navigates forward one history entry if possible. Equivalent to go(1).

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: Resolves after the navigation has either failed or completed successfully.

parameters.name: success
parameters.description: Indicates whether the navigation was successful.

functions.name: getProcessId
functions.description: Returns Chrome's internal process ID for the guest web page's current process, allowing embedders to know how many guests would be affected by terminating the process. Two guests will share a process only if they belong to the same app and have the same storage partition ID. The call is synchronous and returns the embedder's cached notion of the current process ID. The process ID isn't the same as the operating system's process ID.

functions.name: getUserAgent
functions.description: Returns the user agent string used by the webview for guest page requests.

functions.name: getZoom
functions.description: Gets the current zoom factor.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: Called after the current zoom factor is retrieved.

parameters.name: zoomFactor
parameters.description: The current zoom factor.

functions.name: getZoomMode
functions.description: Gets the current zoom mode.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: Called with the webview's current zoom mode.

parameters.name: ZoomMode
parameters.description: The webview's current zoom mode.

functions.name: go
functions.description: Navigates to a history entry using a history index relative to the current navigation. If the requested navigation is impossible, this method has no effect.

parameters.name: relativeIndex
parameters.description: Relative history index to which the webview should be navigated. For example, a value of 2 will navigate forward 2 history entries if possible; a value of -3 will navigate backward 3 entries.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: Resolves after the navigation has either failed or completed successfully.

parameters.name: success
parameters.description: Indicates whether the navigation was successful.

functions.name: insertCSS
functions.description: Injects CSS into the guest page.

parameters.name: details
parameters.description: Details of the CSS to insert.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: Called after the CSS has been inserted.

functions.name: isUserAgentOverridden
functions.description: Indicates whether or not the webview's user agent string has been overridden by $(ref:webviewTag.setUserAgentOverride).

functions.name: print
functions.description: Prints the contents of the webview. This is equivalent to calling scripted print function from the webview itself.

functions.name: reload
functions.description: Reloads the current top-level page.

functions.name: removeContentScripts
functions.description:
Removes content scripts from a webview.

The following example removes "myRule" which was added before.

webview.removeContentScripts(['myRule']);

You can remove all the rules by calling:

webview.removeContentScripts();

parameters.name: scriptNameList

items.description: The name of a content script that will be removed.

parameters.description: A list of names of content scripts that will be removed. If the list is empty, all the content scripts added to the webview will be removed.

functions.name: setUserAgentOverride
functions.description: Override the user agent string used by the webview for guest page requests. Overriding will cause the User-Agent Client Hint header values and the values returned by navigator.userAgentData to be empty for guest page requests this override is applied to.

parameters.name: userAgent
parameters.description: The user agent string to use.

functions.name: setZoom
functions.description: Changes the zoom factor of the page. The scope and persistence of this change are determined by the webview's current zoom mode (see $(ref:webviewTag.ZoomMode)).

parameters.name: zoomFactor
parameters.description: The new zoom factor.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: Called after the page has been zoomed.

functions.name: setZoomMode
functions.description: Sets the zoom mode of the webview.

parameters.name: ZoomMode
parameters.description: Defines how zooming is handled in the webview.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: Called after the zoom mode has been changed.

functions.name: stop
functions.description: Stops loading the current webview navigation if in progress.

functions.name: stopFinding
functions.description: Ends the current find session (clearing all highlighting) and cancels all find requests in progress.

parameters.name: action
parameters.description: Determines what to do with the active match after the find session has ended. clear will clear the highlighting over the active match; keep will keep the active match highlighted; activate will keep the active match highlighted and simulate a user click on that match. The default action is keep.

functions.name: loadDataWithBaseUrl
functions.description: Loads a data URL with a specified base URL used for relative links. Optionally, a virtual URL can be provided to be shown to the user instead of the data URL.

parameters.name: dataUrl
parameters.description: The data URL to load.

parameters.name: baseUrl
parameters.description: The base URL that will be used for relative links.

parameters.name: virtualUrl
parameters.description: The URL that will be displayed to the user (in the address bar).

functions.name: setSpatialNavigationEnabled
functions.description: Sets spatial navigation state of the webview.

parameters.name: enabled
parameters.description: Spatial navigation state value.

functions.name: isSpatialNavigationEnabled
functions.description: Queries whether spatial navigation is enabled for the webview.

functions.name: terminate
functions.description: Forcibly kills the guest web page's renderer process. This may affect multiple webview tags in the current app if they share the same process, but it will not affect webview tags in other apps.

events.name: close
events.description:
Fired when the guest window attempts to close itself.

The following example code navigates the webview to about:blank when the guest attempts to close itself.

webview.addEventListener('close', function() {
  webview.src = 'about:blank';
});

events.name: consolemessage
events.description:
Fired when the guest window logs a console message.

The following example code forwards all log messages to the embedder's console without regard for log level or other properties.

webview.addEventListener('consolemessage', function(e) {
  console.log('Guest page logged a message: ', e.message);
});

parameters.name: level
parameters.description: The severity level of the log message. Ranges from -1 to 2. LOG_VERBOSE (console.debug) = -1, LOG_INFO (console.log, console.info) = 0, LOG_WARNING (console.warn) = 1, LOG_ERROR (console.error) = 2.

parameters.name: message
parameters.description: The logged message contents.

parameters.name: line
parameters.description: The line number of the message source.

parameters.name: sourceId
parameters.description: A string identifying the resource which logged the message.

events.name: contentload
events.description:
Fired when the guest window fires a load event, i.e., when a new document is loaded. This does not include page navigation within the current document or asynchronous resource loads.

The following example code modifies the default font size of the guest's body element after the page loads:

webview.addEventListener('contentload', function() {
  webview.executeScript({ code: 'document.body.style.fontSize = "42px"' });
});

events.name: dialog
events.description:
Fired when the guest window attempts to open a modal dialog via window.alert, window.confirm, or window.prompt.

Handling this event will block the guest process until each event listener returns or the dialog object becomes unreachable (if preventDefault() was called.)

The default behavior is to cancel the dialog.

parameters.name: messageType
parameters.description: The type of modal dialog requested by the guest.

parameters.name: messageText
parameters.description: The text the guest attempted to display in the modal dialog.

parameters.name: dialog
parameters.description: An interface that can be used to respond to the guest's modal request.

events.name: exit
events.description:
Fired when the process rendering the guest web content has exited.

The following example code will show a farewell message whenever the guest page crashes:

webview.addEventListener('exit', function(e) {
  if (e.reason === 'crash') {
    webview.src = 'data:text/plain,Goodbye, world!';
  }
});

processID.description: Chrome's internal ID of the process that exited.

reason.description: String indicating the reason for the exit.

events.name: findupdate
events.description: Fired when new find results are available for an active find request. This might happen multiple times for a single find request as matches are found.

parameters.name: searchText
parameters.description: The string that is being searched for in the page.

parameters.name: numberOfMatches
parameters.description: The number of matches found for searchText on the page so far.

parameters.name: activeMatchOrdinal
parameters.description: The ordinal number of the current active match, if it has been found. This will be 0 until then.

parameters.name: selectionRect
parameters.description: Describes a rectangle around the active match, if it has been found, in screen coordinates.

parameters.name: canceled
parameters.description: Indicates whether the find request was canceled.

parameters.name: finalUpdate
parameters.description: Indicates that all find requests have completed and that no more findupdate events will be fired until more find requests are made.

events.name: loadabort
events.description:
Fired when a top-level load has aborted without committing. An error message will be printed to the console unless the event is default-prevented.

Note: When a resource load is aborted, a loadabort event will eventually be followed by a loadstop event, even if all committed loads since the last loadstop event (if any) were aborted.

Note: When the load of either an about URL or a JavaScript URL is aborted, loadabort will be fired and then the webview will be navigated to 'about:blank'.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: Requested URL.

parameters.name: isTopLevel
parameters.description: Whether the load was top-level or in a subframe.

parameters.name: code
parameters.description: Unique integer ID for the type of abort. Note that this ID is not guaranteed to remain backwards compatible between releases. You must not act based upon this specific integer.

parameters.name: reason
parameters.description: String indicating what type of abort occurred. This string is not guaranteed to remain backwards compatible between releases. You must not parse and act based upon its content. It is also possible that, in some cases, an error not listed here could be reported.

events.name: loadcommit
events.description: Fired when a load has committed. This includes navigation within the current document as well as subframe document-level loads, but does not include asynchronous resource loads.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: The URL that committed.

parameters.name: isTopLevel
parameters.description: Whether the load is top-level or in a subframe.

events.name: loadredirect
events.description: Fired when a top-level load request has redirected to a different URL.

parameters.name: oldUrl
parameters.description: The requested URL before the redirect.

parameters.name: newUrl
parameters.description: The new URL after the redirect.

parameters.name: isTopLevel
parameters.description: Whether or not the redirect happened at top-level or in a subframe.

events.name: loadstart
events.description: Fired when a load has begun.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: Requested URL.

parameters.name: isTopLevel
parameters.description: Whether the load is top-level or in a subframe.

events.name: loadstop
events.description:
Fired when all frame-level loads in a guest page (including all its subframes) have completed. This includes navigation within the current document as well as subframe document-level loads, but does not include asynchronous resource loads. This event fires every time the number of document-level loads transitions from one (or more) to zero. For example, if a page that has already finished loading (i.e., loadstop already fired once) creates a new iframe which loads a page, then a second loadstop will fire when the iframe page load completes. This pattern is commonly observed on pages that load ads.

Note: When a committed load is aborted, a loadstop event will eventually follow a loadabort event, even if all committed loads since the last loadstop event (if any) were aborted.

events.name: newwindow
events.description:
Fired when the guest page attempts to open a new browser window.

The following example code will create and navigate a new webview in the embedder for each requested new window:

webview.addEventListener('newwindow', function(e) {
  var newWebview = document.createElement('webview');
  document.body.appendChild(newWebview);
  e.window.attach(newWebview);
});

parameters.name: window
parameters.description: An interface that can be used to either attach the requested target page to an existing webview element or explicitly discard the request.

parameters.name: targetUrl
parameters.description: The target URL requested for the new window.

parameters.name: initialWidth
parameters.description: The initial width requested for the new window.

parameters.name: initialHeight
parameters.description: The initial height requested for the new window.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The requested name of the new window.

parameters.name: windowOpenDisposition
parameters.description: The requested disposition of the new window.

events.name: permissionrequest
events.description:
Fired when the guest page needs to request special permission from the embedder.

The following example code will grant the guest page access to the webkitGetUserMedia API. Note that an app using this example code must itself specify audioCapture and/or videoCapture manifest permissions:

webview.addEventListener('permissionrequest', function(e) {
  if (e.permission === 'media') {
    e.request.allow();
  }
});

parameters.name: permission
parameters.description: The type of permission being requested.

parameters.name: request
parameters.description: An object which holds details of the requested permission. Depending on the type of permission requested, this may be a $(ref:webviewTag.MediaPermissionRequest), $(ref:webviewTag.GeolocationPermissionRequest), $(ref:webviewTag.PointerLockPermissionRequest), $(ref:webviewTag.DownloadPermissionRequest), $(ref:webviewTag.LoadPluginPermissionRequest), $(ref:webviewTag.FullscreenPermissionRequest) or $(ref:webviewTag.HidPermissionRequest).

events.name: responsive
events.description:
Fired when the process rendering the guest web content has become responsive again after being unresponsive.

The following example code will fade the webview element in or out as it becomes responsive or unresponsive:

webview.style.webkitTransition = 'opacity 250ms';
webview.addEventListener('unresponsive', function() {
  webview.style.opacity = '0.5';
});
webview.addEventListener('responsive', function() {
  webview.style.opacity = '1';
});

parameters.name: processID
parameters.description: Chrome's internal ID of the process that became responsive.

events.name: sizechanged
events.description: Fired when the embedded web content has been resized via autosize. Only fires if autosize is enabled.

parameters.name: oldWidth
parameters.description: Old width of embedded web content.

parameters.name: oldHeight
parameters.description: Old height of embedded web content.

parameters.name: newWidth
parameters.description: New width of embedded web content.

parameters.name: newHeight
parameters.description: New height of embedded web content.

events.name: unresponsive
events.description: Fired when the process rendering the guest web content has become unresponsive. This event will be generated once with a matching responsive event if the guest begins to respond again.

parameters.name: processID
parameters.description: Chrome's internal ID of the process that has become unresponsive.

events.name: zoomchange
events.description: Fired when the page's zoom changes.

parameters.name: oldZoomFactor
parameters.description: The page's previous zoom factor.

parameters.name: newZoomFactor
parameters.description: The new zoom factor that the page was zoomed to.

contentWindow.description: Object reference which can be used to post messages into the guest page.

request.description: Interface which provides access to webRequest events on the guest page.

contextMenus.description: Similar to chrome's ContextMenus API, but applies to webview instead of browser. Use the webview.contextMenus API to add items to webview's context menu. You can choose what types of objects your context menu additions apply to, such as images, hyperlinks, and pages.

windows.description: Use the chrome.windows API to interact with browser windows. You can use this API to create, modify, and rearrange windows in the browser.

types.description: The type of browser window this is. In some circumstances a window may not be assigned a type property; for example, when querying closed windows from the $(ref:sessions) API.

enum.name: normal
enum.description: A normal browser window.

enum.name: popup
enum.description: A browser popup.

enum.name: panel
enum.description: Deprecated in this API. A Chrome App panel-style window. Extensions can only see their own panel windows.

enum.name: app
enum.description: Deprecated in this API. A Chrome App window. Extensions can only see their app own windows.

enum.name: devtools
enum.description: A Developer Tools window.

types.description: The state of this browser window. In some circumstances a window may not be assigned a state property; for example, when querying closed windows from the $(ref:sessions) API.

enum.name: normal
enum.description: Normal window state (not minimized, maximized, or fullscreen).

enum.name: minimized
enum.description: Minimized window state.

enum.name: maximized
enum.description: Maximized window state.

enum.name: fullscreen
enum.description: Fullscreen window state.

enum.name: locked-fullscreen
enum.description: Locked fullscreen window state. This fullscreen state cannot be exited by user action and is available only to allowlisted extensions on Chrome OS.

id.description: The ID of the window. Window IDs are unique within a browser session. In some circumstances a window may not be assigned an ID property; for example, when querying windows using the $(ref:sessions) API, in which case a session ID may be present.

focused.description: Whether the window is currently the focused window.

top.description: The offset of the window from the top edge of the screen in pixels. In some circumstances a window may not be assigned a top property; for example, when querying closed windows from the $(ref:sessions) API.

left.description: The offset of the window from the left edge of the screen in pixels. In some circumstances a window may not be assigned a left property; for example, when querying closed windows from the $(ref:sessions) API.

width.description: The width of the window, including the frame, in pixels. In some circumstances a window may not be assigned a width property; for example, when querying closed windows from the $(ref:sessions) API.

height.description: The height of the window, including the frame, in pixels. In some circumstances a window may not be assigned a height property; for example, when querying closed windows from the $(ref:sessions) API.

tabs.description: Array of $(ref:tabs.Tab) objects representing the current tabs in the window.

type.description: The type of browser window this is.

state.description: The state of this browser window.

alwaysOnTop.description: Whether the window is set to be always on top.

sessionId.description: The session ID used to uniquely identify a window, obtained from the $(ref:sessions) API.

types.description: Specifies what type of browser window to create. 'panel' is deprecated and is available only to existing allowlisted extensions on Chrome OS.

enum.name: normal
enum.description: Specifies the window as a standard window.

enum.name: popup
enum.description: Specifies the window as a popup window.

enum.name: panel
enum.description: Specifies the window as a panel.

populate.description: If true, the $(ref:windows.Window) object has a tabs property that contains a list of the $(ref:tabs.Tab) objects. The Tab objects only contain the url, pendingUrl, title, and favIconUrl properties if the extension's manifest file includes the "tabs" permission.

windowTypes.description: If set, the $(ref:windows.Window) returned is filtered based on its type. If unset, the default filter is set to ['normal', 'popup'].

WINDOW_ID_NONE.description: The windowId value that represents the absence of a Chrome browser window.

WINDOW_ID_CURRENT.description: The windowId value that represents the current window.

functions.name: get
functions.description: Gets details about a window.

functions.name: getCurrent
functions.description: Gets the current window.

functions.name: getLastFocused
functions.description: Gets the window that was most recently focused — typically the window 'on top'.

functions.name: getAll
functions.description: Gets all windows.

functions.name: create
functions.description: Creates (opens) a new browser window with any optional sizing, position, or default URL provided.

url.description: A URL or array of URLs to open as tabs in the window. Fully-qualified URLs must include a scheme, e.g., 'http://www.google.com', not 'www.google.com'. Non-fully-qualified URLs are considered relative within the extension. Defaults to the New Tab Page.

tabId.description: The ID of the tab to add to the new window.

left.description: The number of pixels to position the new window from the left edge of the screen. If not specified, the new window is offset naturally from the last focused window. This value is ignored for panels.

top.description: The number of pixels to position the new window from the top edge of the screen. If not specified, the new window is offset naturally from the last focused window. This value is ignored for panels.

width.description: The width in pixels of the new window, including the frame. If not specified, defaults to a natural width.

height.description: The height in pixels of the new window, including the frame. If not specified, defaults to a natural height.

focused.description: If true, opens an active window. If false, opens an inactive window.

incognito.description: Whether the new window should be an incognito window.

type.description: Specifies what type of browser window to create.

state.description: The initial state of the window. The minimized, maximized, and fullscreen states cannot be combined with left, top, width, or height.

setSelfAsOpener.description: If true, the newly-created window's 'window.opener' is set to the caller and is in the same unit of related browsing contexts as the caller.

parameters.name: window
parameters.description: Contains details about the created window.

functions.name: update
functions.description: Updates the properties of a window. Specify only the properties that to be changed; unspecified properties are unchanged.

left.description: The offset from the left edge of the screen to move the window to in pixels. This value is ignored for panels.

top.description: The offset from the top edge of the screen to move the window to in pixels. This value is ignored for panels.

width.description: The width to resize the window to in pixels. This value is ignored for panels.

height.description: The height to resize the window to in pixels. This value is ignored for panels.

focused.description: If true, brings the window to the front; cannot be combined with the state 'minimized'. If false, brings the next window in the z-order to the front; cannot be combined with the state 'fullscreen' or 'maximized'.

drawAttention.description: If true, causes the window to be displayed in a manner that draws the user's attention to the window, without changing the focused window. The effect lasts until the user changes focus to the window. This option has no effect if the window already has focus. Set to false to cancel a previous drawAttention request.

state.description: The new state of the window. The 'minimized', 'maximized', and 'fullscreen' states cannot be combined with 'left', 'top', 'width', or 'height'.

functions.name: remove
functions.description: Removes (closes) a window and all the tabs inside it.

events.name: onCreated
events.description: Fired when a window is created.

filters.name: windowTypes
filters.description: Conditions that the window's type being created must satisfy. By default it satisfies ['normal', 'popup'].

parameters.name: window
parameters.description: Details of the created window.

events.name: onRemoved
events.description: Fired when a window is removed (closed).

filters.name: windowTypes
filters.description: Conditions that the window's type being removed must satisfy. By default it satisfies ['normal', 'popup'].

parameters.name: windowId
parameters.description: ID of the removed window.

events.name: onFocusChanged
events.description: Fired when the currently focused window changes. Returns chrome.windows.WINDOW_ID_NONE if all Chrome windows have lost focus. Note: On some Linux window managers, WINDOW_ID_NONE is always sent immediately preceding a switch from one Chrome window to another.

filters.name: windowTypes
filters.description: Conditions that the window's type being removed must satisfy. By default it satisfies ['normal', 'popup'].

parameters.name: windowId
parameters.description: ID of the newly-focused window.

events.name: onBoundsChanged
events.description: Fired when a window has been resized; this event is only dispatched when the new bounds are committed, and not for in-progress changes.

parameters.name: window
parameters.description: Details of the window. The tabs will not be populated for the window.

devtools.network.description: Use the chrome.devtools.network API to retrieve the information about network requests displayed by the Developer Tools in the Network panel.

types.description: Represents a network request for a document resource (script, image and so on). See HAR Specification for reference.

functions.name: getContent
functions.description: Returns content of the response body.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: A function that receives the response body when the request completes.

parameters.name: content
parameters.description: Content of the response body (potentially encoded).

parameters.name: encoding
parameters.description: Empty if content is not encoded, encoding name otherwise. Currently, only base64 is supported.

functions.name: getHAR
functions.description: Returns HAR log that contains all known network requests.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: A function that receives the HAR log when the request completes.

parameters.name: harLog
parameters.description: A HAR log. See HAR specification for details.

events.name: onRequestFinished
events.description: Fired when a network request is finished and all request data are available.

parameters.name: request
parameters.description: Description of a network request in the form of a HAR entry. See HAR specification for details.

events.name: onNavigated
events.description: Fired when the inspected window navigates to a new page.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: URL of the new page.

devtools.inspectedWindow.description: Use the chrome.devtools.inspectedWindow API to interact with the inspected window: obtain the tab ID for the inspected page, evaluate the code in the context of the inspected window, reload the page, or obtain the list of resources within the page.

types.description: A resource within the inspected page, such as a document, a script, or an image.

url.description: The URL of the resource.

functions.name: getContent
functions.description: Gets the content of the resource.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: A function that receives resource content when the request completes.

parameters.name: content
parameters.description: Content of the resource (potentially encoded).

parameters.name: encoding
parameters.description: Empty if the content is not encoded, encoding name otherwise. Currently, only base64 is supported.

functions.name: setContent
functions.description: Sets the content of the resource.

parameters.name: content
parameters.description: New content of the resource. Only resources with the text type are currently supported.

parameters.name: commit
parameters.description: True if the user has finished editing the resource, and the new content of the resource should be persisted; false if this is a minor change sent in progress of the user editing the resource.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: A function called upon request completion.

parameters.name: error
parameters.description: Set to undefined if the resource content was set successfully; describes error otherwise.

tabId.description: The ID of the tab being inspected. This ID may be used with chrome.tabs.* API.

functions.name: eval
functions.description: Evaluates a JavaScript expression in the context of the main frame of the inspected page. The expression must evaluate to a JSON-compliant object, otherwise an exception is thrown. The eval function can report either a DevTools-side error or a JavaScript exception that occurs during evaluation. In either case, the result parameter of the callback is undefined. In the case of a DevTools-side error, the isException parameter is non-null and has isError set to true and code set to an error code. In the case of a JavaScript error, isException is set to true and value is set to the string value of thrown object.

parameters.name: expression
parameters.description: An expression to evaluate.

parameters.name: options
parameters.description: The options parameter can contain one or more options.

frameURL.description: If specified, the expression is evaluated on the iframe whose URL matches the one specified. By default, the expression is evaluated in the top frame of the inspected page.

useContentScriptContext.description: Evaluate the expression in the context of the content script of the calling extension, provided that the content script is already injected into the inspected page. If not, the expression is not evaluated and the callback is invoked with the exception parameter set to an object that has the isError field set to true and the code field set to E_NOTFOUND.

scriptExecutionContext.description: Evaluate the expression in the context of a content script of an extension that matches the specified origin. If given, scriptExecutionContext overrides the 'true' setting on useContentScriptContext.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: A function called when evaluation completes.

parameters.name: result
parameters.description: The result of evaluation.

parameters.name: exceptionInfo
parameters.description: An object providing details if an exception occurred while evaluating the expression.

isError.description: Set if the error occurred on the DevTools side before the expression is evaluated.

code.description: Set if the error occurred on the DevTools side before the expression is evaluated.

description.description: Set if the error occurred on the DevTools side before the expression is evaluated.

details.description: Set if the error occurred on the DevTools side before the expression is evaluated, contains the array of the values that may be substituted into the description string to provide more information about the cause of the error.

isException.description: Set if the evaluated code produces an unhandled exception.

value.description: Set if the evaluated code produces an unhandled exception.

functions.name: reload
functions.description: Reloads the inspected page.

ignoreCache.description: When true, the loader will bypass the cache for all inspected page resources loaded before the load event is fired. The effect is similar to pressing Ctrl+Shift+R in the inspected window or within the Developer Tools window.

userAgent.description: If specified, the string will override the value of the User-Agent HTTP header that's sent while loading the resources of the inspected page. The string will also override the value of the navigator.userAgent property that's returned to any scripts that are running within the inspected page.

injectedScript.description: If specified, the script will be injected into every frame of the inspected page immediately upon load, before any of the frame's scripts. The script will not be injected after subsequent reloads—for example, if the user presses Ctrl+R.

functions.name: getResources
functions.description: Retrieves the list of resources from the inspected page.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: A function that receives the list of resources when the request completes.

parameters.name: resources
parameters.description: The resources within the page.

events.name: onResourceAdded
events.description: Fired when a new resource is added to the inspected page.

events.name: onResourceContentCommitted
events.description: Fired when a new revision of the resource is committed (e.g. user saves an edited version of the resource in the Developer Tools).

parameters.name: content
parameters.description: New content of the resource.

devtools.panels.description: Use the chrome.devtools.panels API to integrate your extension into Developer Tools window UI: create your own panels, access existing panels, and add sidebars.

types.description: Represents the Elements panel.

events.name: onSelectionChanged
events.description: Fired when an object is selected in the panel.

functions.name: createSidebarPane
functions.description: Creates a pane within panel's sidebar.

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: Text that is displayed in sidebar caption.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: A callback invoked when the sidebar is created.

parameters.name: result
parameters.description: An ExtensionSidebarPane object for created sidebar pane.

types.description: Represents the Sources panel.

events.name: onSelectionChanged
events.description: Fired when an object is selected in the panel.

functions.name: createSidebarPane
functions.description: Creates a pane within panel's sidebar.

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: Text that is displayed in sidebar caption.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: A callback invoked when the sidebar is created.

parameters.name: result
parameters.description: An ExtensionSidebarPane object for created sidebar pane.

types.description: Represents a panel created by an extension.

functions.name: createStatusBarButton
functions.description: Appends a button to the status bar of the panel.

parameters.name: iconPath
parameters.description: Path to the icon of the button. The file should contain a 64x24-pixel image composed of two 32x24 icons. The left icon is used when the button is inactive; the right icon is displayed when the button is pressed.

parameters.name: tooltipText
parameters.description: Text shown as a tooltip when user hovers the mouse over the button.

parameters.name: disabled
parameters.description: Whether the button is disabled.

functions.name: show
functions.description: Shows the panel by activating the corresponding tab.

events.name: onSearch
events.description: Fired upon a search action (start of a new search, search result navigation, or search being canceled).

parameters.name: action
parameters.description: Type of search action being performed. One of  'cancelSearch', 'performSearch', 'nextSearchResult', or 'previousSearchResult'.

parameters.name: queryString
parameters.description: Query string (only for 'performSearch').

events.name: onShown
events.description: Fired when the user switches to the panel.

parameters.name: window
parameters.description: The JavaScript window object of panel's page.

events.name: onHidden
events.description: Fired when the user switches away from the panel.

types.description: A sidebar created by the extension.

functions.name: setHeight
functions.description: Sets the height of the sidebar.

parameters.name: height
parameters.description: A CSS-like size specification, such as '100px' or '12ex'.

functions.name: setExpression
functions.description: Sets an expression that is evaluated within the inspected page. The result is displayed in the sidebar pane.

parameters.name: expression
parameters.description: An expression to be evaluated in context of the inspected page. JavaScript objects and DOM nodes are displayed in an expandable tree similar to the console/watch.

parameters.name: rootTitle
parameters.description: An optional title for the root of the expression tree.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: A callback invoked after the sidebar pane is updated with the expression evaluation results.

functions.name: setObject
functions.description: Sets a JSON-compliant object to be displayed in the sidebar pane.

parameters.name: jsonObject
parameters.description: An object to be displayed in context of the inspected page. Evaluated in the context of the caller (API client).

parameters.name: rootTitle
parameters.description: An optional title for the root of the expression tree.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: A callback invoked after the sidebar is updated with the object.

functions.name: setPage
functions.description: Sets an HTML page to be displayed in the sidebar pane.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: Relative path of an extension page to display within the sidebar.

events.name: onShown
events.description: Fired when the sidebar pane becomes visible as a result of user switching to the panel that hosts it.

parameters.name: window
parameters.description: The JavaScript window object of the sidebar page, if one was set with the setPage() method.

events.name: onHidden
events.description: Fired when the sidebar pane becomes hidden as a result of the user switching away from the panel that hosts the sidebar pane.

types.description: A button created by the extension.

functions.name: update
functions.description: Updates the attributes of the button. If some of the arguments are omitted or null, the corresponding attributes are not updated.

parameters.name: iconPath
parameters.description: Path to the new icon of the button.

parameters.name: tooltipText
parameters.description: Text shown as a tooltip when user hovers the mouse over the button.

parameters.name: disabled
parameters.description: Whether the button is disabled.

events.name: onClicked
events.description: Fired when the button is clicked.

types.description: Theme used by DevTools.

enum.name: default
enum.description: Default DevTools theme. This is always the light theme.

enum.name: dark
enum.description: Dark theme.

themeName.description: The name of the color theme set in user's DevTools settings. Possible values: default (the default) and dark.

functions.name: create
functions.description: Creates an extension panel.

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: Title that is displayed next to the extension icon in the Developer Tools toolbar.

parameters.name: iconPath
parameters.description: Path of the panel's icon relative to the extension directory.

parameters.name: pagePath
parameters.description: Path of the panel's HTML page relative to the extension directory.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: A function that is called when the panel is created.

parameters.name: panel
parameters.description: An ExtensionPanel object representing the created panel.

functions.name: setOpenResourceHandler
functions.description: Specifies the function to be called when the user clicks a resource link in the Developer Tools window. To unset the handler, either call the method with no parameters or pass null as the parameter.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: A function that is called when the user clicks on a valid resource link in Developer Tools window. Note that if the user clicks an invalid URL or an XHR, this function is not called.

parameters.name: resource
parameters.description: A $(ref:devtools.inspectedWindow.Resource) object for the resource that was clicked.

parameters.name: lineNumber
parameters.description: Specifies the line number within the resource that was clicked.

functions.name: openResource
functions.description: Requests DevTools to open a URL in a Developer Tools panel.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: The URL of the resource to open.

parameters.name: lineNumber
parameters.description: Specifies the line number to scroll to when the resource is loaded.

parameters.name: columnNumber
parameters.description: Specifies the column number to scroll to when the resource is loaded.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: A function that is called when the resource has been successfully loaded.

functions.name: setThemeChangeHandler
functions.description: Specifies the function to be called when the current theme changes in DevTools. To unset the handler, either call the method with no parameters or pass null as the parameter.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: A function that is called when the current theme changes in DevTools.

parameters.name: theme
parameters.description: Current theme in DevTools.

devtools.performance.description: Use the chrome.devtools.performance API to listen to recording status updates in the Performance panel in DevTools.

events.name: onProfilingStarted
events.description: Fired when the Performance panel starts recording.

events.name: onProfilingStopped
events.description: Fired when the Performance panel stops recording.

devtools.recorder.description: Use the chrome.devtools.recorder API to customize the Recorder panel in DevTools.

types.description: A plugin interface that the Recorder panel invokes to customize the Recorder panel.

functions.name: stringify
functions.description: Converts a recording from the Recorder panel format into a string.

parameters.name: recording
parameters.description: A recording of the user interaction with the page. This should match Puppeteer's recording schema.

functions.name: stringifyStep
functions.description: Converts a step of the recording from the Recorder panel format into a string.

parameters.name: step
parameters.description: A step of the recording of a user interaction with the page. This should match Puppeteer's step schema.

functions.name: replay
functions.description: Allows the extension to implement custom replay functionality.

parameters.name: recording
parameters.description: A recording of the user interaction with the page. This should match Puppeteer's recording schema.

types.description: Represents a view created by extension to be embedded inside the Recorder panel.

functions.name: show
functions.description: Indicates that the extension wants to show this view in the Recorder panel.

events.name: onShown
events.description: Fired when the view is shown.

events.name: onHidden
events.description: Fired when the view is hidden.

functions.name: registerRecorderExtensionPlugin
functions.description: Registers a Recorder extension plugin.

parameters.name: plugin
parameters.description: An instance implementing the RecorderExtensionPlugin interface.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the plugin.

parameters.name: mediaType
parameters.description: The media type of the string content that the plugin produces.

functions.name: createView
functions.description: Creates a view that can handle the replay. This view will be embedded inside the Recorder panel.

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: Title that is displayed next to the extension icon in the Developer Tools toolbar.

parameters.name: pagePath
parameters.description: Path of the panel's HTML page relative to the extension directory.
